MASSEY FERGUSON is an international producer of agricultural machines. These commercial vehicles are available for all agricultural sectors. The history and experience of this company within the sectors of  tractor and commercial vehicle production dates back to the mid 19th century.

MASSEY FERGUSON – A Company History with Many Changes

The beginning of MASSY FERGUSON reaches back to the year 1847, when Daniel Massey founded MASSEY MANUFACTORING COMPANY in the Canadian province of Ontario. At the end of the century, the company merged with A. HARRIS AND SON IMPLEMENT (founded by Alanson Harris) and their name was changed to MASSEY-HARRIS COMPANY LIMITED. In 1929, the company bought a German factory in Cologne, where they produced combined harvesters for the local market.

One of the most influential changes in this company's history was in 1953, when MASSEY-HARRIS COMPANY merged with the HARRY FERGUSON LIMITED. Just before the second world war, Harry Ferguson invented the three-point hydraulics, which is a key component for general tractor development.

Today, the company belongs to the AGCO group, which was founded in 1990 and is now the third biggest manufacturer of  farm equipment. The brand MASEY FERGUSON is still active today and produces and sells:

  • Mid and high-powered tractors
  • Combined harvesters
  • Balers
  • Front loaders
  • Telescopic forklifts
  • Tillers
  • Lawn mowers

DOOSAN is a large corporation that has its main offices in Korea. In addition to many subsidiary companies, including DOOSAN Infracore Construction Equipment, spread out around the world, the organisation also has a branch in Germany. Construction machinery is the aptitude of DOOSAN, as an organization manager, you must be acquainted with this brand. Having a DOOSAN machine at the construction site is very nearly an absolute necessity have. You might likewise realize that purchasing another DOOSAN excavator may be a touch out of achieve cash savvy for most organizations. One extraordinary arrangement is purchasing an second hand DOOSAN loader or some other construction equipment at industrial auctions. you can get an used DOOSAN machine as a part of the portion of the cost and the same solid machine with the statures generation guidelines.

Website: doosan.com/en

DOOSAN Construction Machinery

DOOSAN Corporation was founded in Seoul in 1896 as a retail business. Their success only really started in 1946, when their first department store was opened. Several years later the company had the idea to produce their own products and sell them. In the 1960s, DOOSAN Group engaged in several different sectors, like the food industry, mechanical engineering and construction. The company's multifaceted nature is not only responsible for DOOSAN being the oldest corporation in Korea, but also that it is the leading company in the country. It is one of the 400 biggest companies worldwide.

DOOSAN other Ventures

DOOSAN Infracore Co. Ltd. has about 10 subsidiary companies including: DOOSAN Hydro Technology (formally known as American Engineering Services); DOOSAN Engine Motorenbau; DOOSAN Babcock Energy; and BOBCAT. This corporation is one of the leaders in the area of fresh water treatment plants. DOOSAN Corp. holds second place worldwide in production of large-scale ship engines and copper alloys, which they produce themselves. They have high-reaching future goals, like how the corporation wants to increase their turnover by 30%. This means that they will need to invest more in product development, innovation and technology.

This corporation's most important consumer products

This corporation's product portfolio is very comprehensive, and is reflected in their offer of consumer goods. For example, areas of daily life are covered by:

  • DOOSAN heavy industries and construction equipment
  • Techpack
  • Packaging materials
  • DOOSAN capital and financial services
  • SRS restaurant operators
  • Sales companies

What DOOSAN Germany offers

DOOSAN Germany mainly provides customers with innovative storage technology solutions and equipment. The following types of DOOSAN machines are available:

  • Forklifts (Diesel, LPG, Electric)
  • Excavators
  • Electric lift trucks
  • Pickers
  • Air freight
  • and other DOOSAN machine tools

Further more, special designs of specific auxiliary equipment are also available.

The LINDE Material Handling GmbH is one of the leading manufacturers in Europe within the fields of forklifts and storage technology. Additionally, LINDE construction company is known as one of the most important producers of hydraulic power units that are, for example, used for forklifts.Buying a used LINDE forklift on an order picker for your warehouse can save a business a lot of money. LINDE have the highest quality standards making the machines durable and reliable even when you buy them from a second hand dealer.

LINDE History

In 1904, the Güldner-Motoren-Gesellschaft was founded by Hugo Güldner, Carl von Linde and Georg von Krauss. 25 years later, Carl von Linde bought all shares of the company, which proved to be a good move because that meant that LINDE could enter the tractor and diesel engine sectors. At the end of the 1950s, the company expanded its product range to hydraulic and industrial trucks. Up until the year 1969, LINDE Material Handling Ltd. produced tractors and diesel engines, and afterwards the production was completely set up. In the following decade, LINDE Germany concentrated its business on overtaking the Europe-wide companies who have specialised their production on construction and forklifts. In the middle of the 1980s, a new range of forklifts revolutionised the worldwide production of forklifts; the 351 Range was the best both in terms of design and capacity, and became a successful forklift worldwide. Today, LINDE is a part of the KION group. The former LINDE company produced more than 500,000 forklifts and brought a new storage technology concept vehicle onto the market.

 
  

LINDE Products & Machines

In LINDE's product portfolio, namely LINDE material handling equipment you could find: 

  • LINDE forklifts
  • Electric forklifts 
  • Natural gas forklifts
  • Commissioner – lift trucks

There are also several different solutions available that are orientated towards special customer requirements. From forklifts to lift trucks to combined vehicles, they offer a range of high-quality products. One of the most innovative designs is the rotatable driver's seat, which is featured in the CeMAT 2011. This means that large and bulky loads can be easily driven backwards. This also reduces the health risks (e.g. on the musculoskeletal system) often associated with this work.

In addition to used and rental LINDE equipment, there is a range of services available. A constant maintenance service, 24 hour spare parts delivery service and training services are all part of the offer.

The 50 year old Austrian company, Paul OTT GmbH, is a specialist for edge banding machines and presses. With innovative power and entrepreneurial skill, this entry-level manufacturer of veneer presses transformed itself into an international supplier for the woodworking industry.

The company history

Paul OTT GmbH was founded in 1963, in the Austrian town of Lambach. This company started off by producing veneer presses and in 1980 it expanded its facilities, as a result of demand. Hans Kaser took over the Austrian part of the company in 1984 and since then has been the head of Paul OTT GmbH, which operates successfully internationally. In 2003, the brand CombiMelt and SHARK were introduced and the company decided to buy more land. Edge banding machines were transformed into edging centres, which could be modified to fit customer requirements. Machines for new joining systems and innovation in the area of edge banding were developed between 2008 and 2012. The Paul OTT GmbH has sustainably established itself in the world market for woodworking machines. New designs and machine concepts were developed through its brand StrongEdge, and the TopEdge Machine range.

Areas of operation

The Paul OTT GmbH produces machines and machining centres, which are made to fit custom requirements. These machines process veneer, plastic and massive, solid wood. The company places great value on optimising the entire woodworking production processes in that, for example, further machines or equipment can be optionally combined. Additionally, OTT has robust, hydraulic heated-plate presses available for woodworking.

Product portfolio

  • Machines and machining centres for edge banding
  • Hydraulic heated-plate presses

VOLVO Group is a Swedish corporation (also called as VOLVO AB ) with a focus on producing commercial vehicles. This company has their head office in Gothenburg and is one of the leading suppliers of commercial transportation solutions.

VOLVO Group's history

VOLVO AB was founded as the testing department of the Swedish company, Kugellager-Herstellers SKF, in 1915. The main aim of the company was to build test cars for trying out new bearings. VOLVO became an independent company in 1926-1927. This company's first mass produced vehicle was first driven on Hisingen Island in Gothenburg. Since then, the producer has transformed from a small local industrial facility to one of the largest manufacturers of heavy-duty lorries, construction equipment and buses, worldwide.

The VOLVO Group as an international corporation

VOLVO Corporation has production facilities in 19 countries and employees around 100,000 people. Their products are sold in 180 countries. Since this company was founded, they have included construction equipment, lorries and buses into their product range. Various companies belong to the group including VOVLO Trucks, Mack Trucks Inc., Renault Trucks, VOLVO Buses, VOVLO Penta, VOLVO Financial Services and VOLVO Construction Equipment. VOLVO CE has production facilities in Germany, France, Sweden, Poland, U.S.A., Korea, India, China and Brazil. The German production facilities are located in Hameln, Niedersachsen and Konz, Rhineland-Palatinate.

VOLVO Equipment Product Range

This group offers the following products to their customers:

  • Lorries
  • Buses
  • Construction machinery
  • Engine systems for ships and boats
  • Components for airplane engines
  • Financial services

VOLVO Construction Equipment is one of the market leaders in the area of construction machines. Their most valued customers are those active in heavy-duty and light-weight construction, stone quarries, gravel pits, public utilities, infrastructure products, forestry, pipeline and road construction, disposal and recycling companies, and material handling. Their wide-ranging Volvo heavy equipment products include:

  • Compact loaders
  • Wheel loaders
  • Mini loaders
  • Diggers
  • Mini excavators
  • Demolition excavators
  • Articulated dumpers
  • Motor graders
  • Road milling machines
  • Road machinery
  • Pipe layers
  • Rollers
  • Forestry machines

Used Volvo Machinery for Sale

All their machines are run by efficient, environmentally-friendly VOLVO engines. Additionally, their engines are easy to access, which means they are easy to maintain and are more durable. This makes used Volvo machinery, trucks etc. perfect for second hand use. Bid or buy directly on our website for the best Volvo turcks, loaders, dumpers...

RENAULT is not only a French automobile corporation, which is active worldwide, but it also has a division focusing on  commercial vehicles and farming equipment. The production of RENAULT tractors ended with the acquisition through  CLASS KGaA in 2008 and many patents and successful tractor models fell back onto the French company.

RENAULT AGRICULTURE – Manufacturer of agricultural machines since the beginning

Renault was founded by the French brothers Fernand, Marcel and Louis Renault in 1898. Its success grew quickly and around a decade later, Renault was already producing the first commercial and towing vehicles. This development was halted by World War One, but in 1919 Renault continued with their production of  tractors. RENAULT's tractor success story became more evident after the end of World War Two, even if their first attempt to enter the German market in 1960 failed. In 1985, the corporation split its automotive division and the agricultural sector was re-branded as RENAULT AGRICULTURE S.A. In terms of tractors, RENAULT brought new and technically advanced models onto the market, and the French company was able to expand their agricultural sector to Germany in the mid 1990s. One of the reasons for this was the cooperation contract signed between MASSEY FERGUSON and JOHN DEERE. At the end of the century, RENAULT AGRICULTURE started its Atles range and introduced a high class tractor with over 250 PS. In 2003, the German CLASS KGaA had 51% of RENAULT AGRICULTURE's stocks, which meant that the tractors produced in this time were branded under the name CLASS. In 2008, CLASS KGaA took over the rest of the stock shares from RENAULT AGRICULTURE.

The most well- known tractors from 1990 onwards includes the following types of CLASS tractors:

  • Ceres range
  • Ares range
  • Atles range
  • Cergos range
  • Ergos range
  • Celtis range

GILDEMEISTER has been the DMG Mori Seiki Ltd. since September 2013. It is one of the largest German producers of cutting machine tools, automotores and a worldwide leading manufacturer of CNC lathe and milling machines. buying a new GILDEMEISTER machine is not a cheap venture, thus for we offer a verity in industrial auction that offer a used GILDEMEISTER machine for the fraction of the price. The GILDEMEISTER standards can assure you that you will get the finest quality even when it is a second hand GILDEMEISTER lathe.

The history of GILDEMEISTER

The locksmith master, Friedrich Gildemeister, founded the “Werkzeugmaschinenfabrik Gildemeister & Comp” in Bielefeld (Germany) on October 1, 1870. In the next decade the factory expanded to include more industrial halls and was located where the current city hall is for 100 years. In 1976, the company moved to the Gildemeisterstraße. In March 2009, GILDEMEISTER signed a corporation agreement with the machine tool manufacturer, Mori Seiki Co. Ltd (based in Nagoya, Japan). This was responsible for production, sales, procurement, service, research and development, as well as making customer financing available worldwide. In 2013 MORI SEIKI and GILDEMEISTER signed an agreement to change their names to something more suitable. GILDEMEISTER Aktiengesellschaft became the DMG Mori Seiki Ltd., and since them Mori Seiki has been called DMG Mori Seiki Company Ltd.

Areas of operation of GILDEMEISTER AG

Their area of machine tool production includes the following product lines: milling; turning and ultrasonic/laser technology; the Ecoline; and an electronics series. Further areas of operation like services, automation and energy solutions are labelled under “industrial services”. The DMG Sales and Service Ltd., and their subsidiary company, are responsible for this branch. The production facilities are at DMG Mori Seiki cover all areas (e.g. milling, turning, production and Ecoline) due to their core technological competencies. In their service branch, GILDEMEISTER provides service products and other services around the life cycle of the machine tools and the sales of Mori Seiki's machines. Their energy solutions business branch includes solutions for generation, saving and use in industrial facilities, and large photovoltaic systems for investors.

DMG GILDEMEISTER Product Portfolio

GILDEMEISTER Group provides individual, custom-made solutions in the following areas for example:

  • Lathes (Universal lathes, production lathes, turning and complete milling machining centres, vertical lathes and automatic lathes)
  • Milling machines (Universal milling machines , travelling column machines, vertical and horizontal machining centres, high speed cutting precision centres)
  • Ultrasonic and laser technology
  • Ecoline
  • Software
  • Automation
  • Presetting equipment

• Founded in 1953
  • IFOY Award 2015
  • Based in Hamburg, Germany
     

The machine manufacturer JUNGHEINRICH was founded in 1953 and is one of the three biggest producers of industrial trucks, logistics systems, and shelving and storage systems worldwide. If you own a warehouse a JUNGHEINRICH truck is a must. unfortunately as a world famous manufacturer of forklifts and other material handlers the price is set accordingly (pretty high). One of the best solutions is to buy a used ​JUNGHEINRICH forklift, due to the company's high standards when it comes to quality of manufacturing, even the used JUNGHEINRICH lift trucks can be in very good condition. With the fraction of the price you will receive a good condition forklift and a top brand.

JUNGHEINRICH Forklifts

60 years ago, this company was a small workshop in Hamburg's Barmbeck quarter, with only 30 employees. In 60 years it has transformed itself into a worldwide leading corporation in the industrial track and material flow technology sectors. With over 11,000 employees and its presence on the stock market since 1990, JUNGHEINRICH AG is represented in over 30 sales and service companies and operates in more than 100 countries. JUNGHEINRICH is known for its innovation and continually bettering their technology. The term “Ameise” is not only synonymous for a hand or electric pallet truck, but is also the registered trademark of the company JUNGHEINRICH AG.

JUNGHEINRICH AG is constantly developing the design of their forklifts and lift trucks. They try to reduce human vibration to achieve the most energy efficiency engines. In 2011, JUNGHEINRICH Ltd. presented the first forklift with lithium-ion technology.

The Reason to Buy Used Forklifts from JUNGHEINRICH

Due to such exemplary state of the art technologies, JUNGHEINRICH AG has developed into a leading worldwide corporation within the industrial trucks and logistics system solutions sectors. For all that reasons, used forklift trucks is a very good deal when looking for machines for your business. 

JUNGHEINRICH Product Portfolio:

  • Lift trucks / Forklifts
  • Commissioners
  • Tractors
  • Pallet trucks
  • Forklift control system
  • Driver-less transportation systems
  • Warehouse management systems

HOLZMA Plattenaufteiltechnik GmbH is one of the world's largest manufacturers of panel sizing saws and equipment. The traditional and family-run company is in the position to provide its customers with innovative machines, as well as software and service solutions, which makes processing more efficient. Sometimes all a buisness need is a good beam saw, a HOLZMA beam saw. The problems start when you realize how expansive a CNC machine like that can be. A reasonable solution is to buy a used HOLZMA CNC machine half the price and due to HOLZMA high production standards the machine will most likely be in a very good condition.

Website: holzma.com

HOLZMA Plattenaufteiltechnik GmbH – The history of a family company

In 1966, Erwin Jenkner founded the company and started the brand HOLZMA. Up until this time, the term window manufacturing was just associated with fitting, drilling and milling machines, not with saws. In the mid 1950s, Erwin Jenkner built special HOLZMA machines using his own ideas and plans. He then used these machines to build composite windows. Adding to these models, he expanded the HOLZMA product range to include vertical grinding machines and frame presses. The brand HOLZMA GmbH created the first series machine. In 1967, he followed his goal and along with two co-workers, he built the first horizontal saw with a saw machine, which ran under a table. During the following year, their product range expanded alongside the company itself. Diverse machines were patented, which set worldwide standards. In the middle of the 1970s, HOLZMA entered the North America, Australian and the Far Eastern markets.

Bought by HOMAG Group

In 1987, HOMAG was looking for a specialist in horizontal panel sizing saws, when they found the group HOLZMA. This ensured their continual growth and HOLZMA has now established itself in the European area. In 2005, HOMAG Sawtech was renamed to HOLZMA S.A.

The Comprehensive HOLZMA Products

HOLZMA is in the position to provide its customers with a comprehensive product range. Among others you could find the following:

  • Saws
  • HOLZMA Plastics
  • Optimal financing over HOMAG finance
  • Training with new HOLZMA CNC technology and software
  • Optimising using a universal programme
  • In-house software programmes
  • Service and quick problem solving
  • Individual solutions from HOLZMA / newest product innovation

HOLZKRAFT is one of the “partners of handiwork”. Most machines from the Italian brand HOLZKRAFT are produced by the  SCM Group, that are certified with the DIN ISO 9001. Therefore, they are regarded as one of the world' largest manufacturers of woodworking machines.

The manufacturer HOLZKRAFT

The SCM group in Italy has been producing high-end  woodworking machines for about 50 years. These are made to suit the requirements of professional handiworkers, as well as industry. Due to their DIN ISO 9001 certificate, the SCM group's machines comply with some of the strictest international standards. This means, that they are already conceptualised to ensure maximum safety for operation. 40,000 HOLZKRAFT woodworking machines are produced annually, and they all have to comply with the strictest quality control measures. The well-balanced price/quality ratio means that customers can rely on HOLZKRAFT woodworking machines and their ability to retain their value over decades.

Website: holzkraft-maschinen.de

HOLZKRAFT - STÜRMER Maschinen GmbH Portfolio

The product range of HOLZKRAFT STÜRMER is split between HOLZKRAFT Holzbearbeitungsmaschinen and HOLZKRAFT Brennholzaufbereitung.

The following products are available from HOLZKRAFT:

  • Sliding table saws
  • Panel sizing saws
  • Planers
  • Spindle moulders
  • Feed equipment
  • Extraction machines

Products available from HOLZKRAFT Brennholzaufbereitung include:

  • Wood splitters
  • Fire wood circular saws
  • Accessories

They are all suited for beginners, semi-professionals and professionals. All HOLZKRAFT machines and accessories have the same high quality and orientate themselves towards special customer requirements. The special reserve category provides savings potentials. This includes individual pieces, display machines, model machines, old models and others that can't compete with newly built products.

HOLZKRAFT values good service

The company's woodworking programme is available via a dealer sales network. The customer is directly advised and supervised on site. The HOLZKRAFT company also provides after-sales service, which is available for any problems that may occur. The products from HOLZKRAFT Maschinen are characterised as machines that are comfortable to operate, with innovative technology and outstanding equipment.

HOMAG is seen as the international market leader when it comes to edge banding and formatting in the woodworking industries. The HOMAG Group provides its customers with a programme for woodworking, which is optimally fitting. Used HOMAG machinery is the answer to every business owner who needs to add important and well built machines and dont have a large cash flow. Buying a used HOMAG machining centre can reduce the expenses but still get the advantages of a world famous HOMAG machine.

website: homag-group.com

An impressive company history - HOMAG

In 1960, Eugen Hornberger, Gerhard Schuler and a blacksmith lay the foundation for the company HOMAG Holzbearbeitungssysteme GmbH. In 1962, HOMAG was already a sensation in the woodworking industry, as they presented their innovative edge banding machine at a convention in Hamburg. This was patented with a hot-cold process. Five years later, HOMAG AG introduced their next revolutionary piece: a combined format and edge banding machine. Within the next year, the company's story follows a number of more state of the art inventions. These machines are an important part of HOMAG's success. Today the company has more than 800 industrial property rights. Additionally, targeted corporate investments and acquisitions were largely responsible for their growth. This is how the current HOMAG Group AG is in the position to provide a unique product range, which covers the entire product chain of its customers. Furthermore, in the 1970s HOMAG Group Germany developed a strategy to secure the international market, by building tight networks and connections worldwide. Furthermore, almost 80% of the company's turnover comes from oversees; equipment and machines are exported to more than 100 countries. This is how HOMAG was able to establish itself as the world market leader.

Examples for HOMAG Product Portfolio

The comprehensive product range includes:

  • Saws
  • Composite and lightweight panel systems
  • HOMAG CNC machining centres
  • Through-feed machines
  • Software for CNC machining centres and through-feed machines
  • Individual sector solutions using systemb technology

All the HOMAG machines and solutions are characterised through their extraordinary quality. They can be used to produce high-end and precise furniture. This secures a high level of customer satisfaction on all sides.

Additionally, HOMAG is characterised by their high quality service. In addition to customer service, financing, consulting, training and documentation are also available.

GEHL is one of the leading producers of compact  construction machines. The company provides its customers with a comprehensive range of machines for  lifting, moving dirt and for laying asphalt.

GEHL MANITOU AMERICAS, Inc. History

In 1859, the GEHL Company began its production of capital goods for the industrial and agricultural sectors. This company has been successful on the international market for more than 15 years. A milestone in the companies history was in 1973, when GEHL Europe GmbH was founded in Neuenkirchen, North Rhine-Westphalia, as a 100% subsidiary company. This maintains a broad inventory of machines, accessories and spare parts, thanks to the comprehensive service that GEHL Company provides its customers. Since the end of the 1970s, GEHL was mainly working in the construction machine sector. Today, the company produces complete product ranges, that are tailored to the individual needs of the market. This also includes niche products like track dumpers and compact articulated loaders.

Used GHEL Loaders for Sale are a Good Deal

GHEL tracked loaders, compact excavators, telescopic handlers and many more, are being manufactured with the most strict standards. Each of these machines can endure long hours and heavy duty work space, they are build especially for that reason. Thus making used GEHL machines a valuable purchase. Usually these machine cost a lot of money and for small business it might be out of reach. Finding on the second hand market used GEHL loaders can be a very good business opportunity that is might worth your while to consider. 

Website: gehl.com

GEHL product portfolio

The range of products that the GEHL Equipment Produces includes a wide range of compact construction machines for the industrial and agricultural sectors. The most important products include:

  • Compact loaders with various cutting tools, a dust pan and broom and hydraulic hammers 
  • Chain systems for compact loaders
  • Articulated loaders
  • Telescopic forklifts
  • Compact mini diggers
  • Track dumpers
  • Track compact loaders
  • All-wheel drive systems
  • Asphalt millers
  • Demolition hammers

The focus of KUKA Robotics is to produce robots with various designs that can be used in many different areas of industry. KUKA Robotic works alongside KUKA Systems, which both belong to the KUKA AG in Augsburg. When looking on buying a robot are for you plant, it could be a very costly affair. Getting a used KUKA robotics arm can save your plant a lot of money with the same productivity that a new machine will give you. KUKA robotics is one of the leading firms in robotics, thus making it very reliable robotic arms manufacturer.

Website: kuka-robotics.com/en/

KUKA Robotics' company history

The founders, Johann Josef Keller and Jakob Knappich, opened a acetylene plant in 1898 in Ausburg. At first, they focussed on producing affordable house and street lighting. After seven years, the focus of the business moved towards autogenous and resistance welding. The first spot welding guns were produced by this company, whose corporate name (KUKA) is an acronym for “Keller and Knappich Augsburg”. In addition to their success, KUKA Roboter GmbH started building bodies for  automobiles, developing their welding equipment technology, and in 1973 the first KUKA Roboter GmbH industrial welding robot was brought onto the market. After around 10 years of corporation with the family Quandt and restructuring, in 1995 KUKA Robotics was created along with KUKA Systems GmbH, which focused on welding technology.

In 2014, the company gained a high level of recognition with the "Man Vs. Machine Tabe Tennis game" when they let one of their machines play against the table tennis professional, Timo Boll.

Main activities

KUKA AG's industrial robots have a variety of different carrying capacities and special designs and automation, so that they can be used in a large variety of ways. They are not only used in the automobile industry, but can also be used in production, storage or delivery, loading or unloading and for direct use in various different branches of industry. Additionally, KUKA Robotics creates the necessary steering and software solutions needed to fit any requirements. With sophisticated robot systems, like Milling 8 KW, Occubot or Robocoaster, the company has created lots of solutions for
special tasks.

KUKA Systems GmbH Product Portfolio

  • Various industrial robots
  • Steering
  • Software
  • Robotic systems
  • Linear systems
  • Energy supply
  • Positioners

DEUTZ is a well-established traditional company,
that has specialised in producing engines for various sectors. Since
it was founded, this company's name has stood for innovative and
high-end, market-driven technologies.

DEUTZ AG – A company with a long tradition

Nicolaus Eugen Otto and Eugen Langen founded the
first engine factory in 1864 and named it “N.A. Otto & Cie”.
This small facility was located in the old city of Cologne can be

BOMAG GmbH was founded in 1957 in Boppard and quickly specialized their production in earthwork and street construction. The company produces machines for compacting dirt, asphalt and rubbish, as well as milling machines, finishers, stabilizers and recyclers.

BOMAG & It's History

The BOPPARDER MASCHINENBAU GESELLSCHAFT revolutionized compacting technology worldwide by developing the first double vibratory rollers with an all-drum drive. After 13 years it was already available in numerous international locations. Their success increased in 1962 through the production of the first self-driven BOMAG GmbH tandem roller. The acquisition of the KOEHRING Company, Milwaukee/WI in 1970 was an important step in their further expansion on the US-American market (BOMAG Americas). Their comprehensive research and development work paid off with the launch of their Terrameters BTM 01. This machine proved that they were a leading innovator in the field of compacting control systems. BOMAG Germany Company entrance into the Chinese market in the 1980s was a new milestone, which was followed by their ISO 9001 certification in 1997. BOMAG's development of the ASPHALT MANAGER in 2001 was another huge leap for compression and compaction control. Since the acquisition of the FAYAT group in 2005, BOMAG FAYAT Group has continued its innovative and successful history.

BOMAG GmbH Areas of Expertise

As the world market leader for earth and asphalt compacting machines, BOMAG GmbH  joined the FAYAT Group, who take in leading positions in the area of asphalt machines and road maintenance machines on the trade name FAYAT BOMAG Group The connection was a great foundation for further innovation. The company proved itself again as the market leader through its development of the BW 332 DEEP IMPACT, which could reach a compression depth of up to 4 metres, which had never been met before.

The STARRAG Group is a manufacturer of precision machine tools, which have some of the most leading technology found worldwide. These machines are used for turning, milling, grinding and drilling, and are used to process both small and large workpieces made out of metal and composite materials.

Website: starrag.com

The history of a traditional company

The Swiss company, STARRAG, was founded in 1898 in Rorschach. This original independent company specialised its production on threading machines, for use in the textile industry. A textile crisis occurred after the start of the World War One in 1914, which meant that the MECHANISCHE WERKSTATT (what it was called at this time) had to switch its production to suit the war economy. After the end of the war, they produced the first rigid milling machine with a closed frame. After the company was renamed to STARRFRÄSMASCHINEN AG, it brought milling machines onto the market that could be used in a variety of different areas. In 1990, Treuhand Anstalt Berlin founded the HECKER CHEMNITZER WERKZEUGMASCHINEN GmbH. This company was taken over by STARRAG in 1997, so that the Germany company could also start operating in Switzerland. Today the STARRAG Group is one of the leading manufacturers of long-life and highly-productive complete solutions.

STARRAG Group's product range

Their complex machining technology falls under the following product categories

  • HECKERT
  • STARRAG
  • DÖRRIES
  • SCHARMANN
  • BERTHIEZ
  • BUMOTEC

and more. What is special with these machine technologies, is that their categories are named after their original manufacturers. This is an advantage for all organisations because they would not have to then switch their production to a foreign machine.

STARRAG Group's service

STARRAG Group's services are also split up like this. This has the advantage for customers, in that there is always a specialised worker available for the specific machine in question. In addition to a comprehensive spare parts service, there is also maintenance, reparation services and geometric arrangement available. Additionally, the STARRAG group offers a training programme for all machine operators, so that they can benefit from the machine's highest level of productivity.

The IMA Industries is the world market leader in developing and producing automatic machines for processing and packaging tee, coffee, cosmetics, food stuffs and pharmaceuticals. The main brands of this company are IMA Industries and IMA Pharma.

The history of the IMA GROUP

The company, “I.M.A. Industria Macchine Automatiche”, was founded in 1961 in Bologna. The company's first machine was used to package powered products into folded envelopes. In 1963, IMA transformed into a limited company. In 1967, the production of automatic tea packaging machines started. A few years later, the C20 was developed to fill tea into filter bags, which introduced this company into the international market. Over time, the IMA expanded within Europe and founded foreign branches in the USA, China, Japan, Madeira, Brazil and Thailand. In 2008, the organisational structure of the corporation was split into four sectors, which reflected its main business areas.

Facts and figures of the IMA Industries

IMA S.p.A has been on the Milan Stock Exchange since 1995. In 2013, the corporation had a turnover of 734.3 million euros. 93% of the company's products are exported. IMA has around 3,600 employees, and about 1,600 of them work abroad. Their products are manufactured in 25 different countries including Italy, Germany, Switzerland, U.K., U.S.A., India and China. The worldwide sales network of the IMA GROUP stretches over 70 countries.

The product portfolio of the IMA GROUP

The product range of IMA Industries includes machines that are used to package:

  • Tea bags
  • Coffee pads
  • Capsules
  • Tablets
  • Cosmetics etc.

Their machines' processes include:

  • Cutting
  • Fixing
  • Emulsifying
  • Direct or indirect warming
  • Cooking
  • Indirect cooling
  • Flash cooling
  • Dispersing
  • Suspending
  • Crushing and chopping
  • Coating

In the last few years, the company has registered more than 1,200 patents and invented many new machine models. Over 400 of IMA's 3,600 employees are responsible for production innovation and design.

YALE Material Handling is focused on the traditional development and production of industrial trucks in a variety of sizes and designs. As a subsidiary company of the Hyster-YALE AG, this manufacturer's core competences are innovation, quality and efficiency. YALE produce high quality warehouse machinery and that shows in the price. To get a good  used YALE machine, we offer a wide verity of used YALE forklifts. That way you can save money and buy the best forklift that you can get at industrial auctions. You can find a used YALE forklift in a very good condition due to the high quality standards of the YALE corporation.

YALE Forklift Company History

This globally-operating corporation dates back to the year 1844, when Linus Yale Jr invented (among other things) the pin tumbler lock in Connecticut, U.S.A. He founded the YALE Lock manufacturing Company with Henry Towne, which transformed into the YALE and Towne Manufacturing Co. This company expanded its product range to include industrial trucks in 1875. In 1920, this company brought an electric low-platform truck onto the market, which was followed by tractors and stackers with forks. The 1930s saw their international breakthrough, when YALE established itself in England, took over the German company “BKS Forklifts”, and expanded their facilities to Japan. YALE Materials Handling expanded their product range significantly in the following years through various forms of innovation e.g. power steering and the use of heat isolation for electric motors. Their merge with Eaton Manufacturing in 1963 turned into the Industrial Truck Division of Eaton, Yale & Towne Inc. which was later re-branded as the Eaton Corporation and was very successful internationally. Further strategic acquisitions, excellent research and development, and its global network puts this company in the leading position for producing industrial and commercial trucks and vehicles. In 2012, a spin-off company, NACCO Industries Inc. was formed from the Hyster YALE AG, was listed in the U.S. stock market and became a parent company of the YALE Materials Handling Corporation.

YALE Forklifts is The Focus of The Business

As an excellent specialist for forklifts , the YALE Materials Handling Corporation focuses on the development and manufacturing of forklifts and lift trucks of various dimensions and for different applications. They are available with electric, gas or diesel motors. Commissioners and tractors round off their product range. YALE Forklift also manufactures different kind of attachments and spear parts such as battery, hydraulic fluids and more.

YALE Product portfolio

  • Tow Tractors
  • Commissioners
  • Tractors

DEUTZ FAHR – Tractors

Nicolaus August Otto founded the engine factory, N.A. Otto & Cie, in Cologne in 1864. In 1937, it turned into the Klöckner-Humboldt-Deutz AG. In 1890, they produced the first threshing device and four years later they produced the first Deutz tractor. The mass production of  agricultural machines was introduced by this company in 1927. From then on, more and more farmers were using these high-quality tractors for their daily work. The merging with Klöckner resulted in re-branding the company as a much bigger company that not only specialised in agriculture but all kinds of other divisions of the automobile industry. The first 60 years of CESAB's 70 year history has focused on the development and production of forklifts. The CESAB Material Handling Europe has their head offices in Brussels and Bologna, and supply their network of exclusive distributors in 23 countries.

Website: cesab-forklifts.eu

CESAB History - Carrellificio Emiliano S.p.A. Bologna

CESAB SpA was founded in 1942 in Bologna by the Maccaferri family. At first the company produced components for railways and conveyor technology. In 1951, CESAB developed the first electric forklift. Their first contracted sales person was Mario Marabini. In 1953, the CESAB contract was handed down to the next generation of the Marabini brothers, which set up the company in Bergamo, where it has been located until today. In 1954, the diesel forklift was produced, along with the first high pickers and tractors, which were produced in the 1960s. The 1970s were characterised by further developments including electronic steering for the electric forklift, the first off-road forklift and the new reach truck. When CESAB GmbH was founded in Germany in 1982, they were able to expand across Europe. This was initiated through the development of CESAB's heavy duty electric forklift and their storage forklift range. Further branches in Great Britain and France followed. The Blitz and Drago models were introduced and immediately given awards. In 2000, CESAB became part of the Toyota Industries Group and was made stronger through their acquisition of LTE, a manufacturer of lifting equipment.

Areas of operation

In addition to the development and production of forklifts with various engines, CESAB also produces storage technology.

Product portfolio

  • Forklifts
  • Manual lift trucks
  • Electric elevating transporters
  • Electric platform stackers
  • Reach trucks

YANMAR Co. Ltd. is a globally-active manufacturer of agricultural and construction machines, engines and generators. It's head office and numerous enterprises in Japan are accompanied by foreign branches in Europe, Asia, and North and South America.

YANMAR Company History

The development of YANMAR into a global player started in 1912 when YAMAOKA Hatsudoki Kosakusho took up the production of gas-fuelled engines. In 1921, the brand YANMAR was created and it brought horizontal and vertical oil engines onto the market. The following years saw the development of the diesel engine, which was first used in fisheries. In 1936, another factory was opened in Japan, whose main aim was to use fuel economically. YANMAR was very successful in the research and development of combustion engines. The war damaged their production facilities, but this didn't stop the company's success. Yanmar built a name for themselves through the production of ship engines and fuel injections for diesel engines in the years following the war. In the 1950s, diesel engine technologies were constantly developed and also awarded by the German Investors Association. YANMAR's international award meant that in the following years it founded more facilities in Asia, Europe, China and America (YANMAR America Corporation).

Areas of Operation

Over the years, YANMAR has developed excellent expertise in the field of diesel engines for various branches of industry. It has expanded its product portfolio to include air-conditioners and agricultural machines. In addition to tractors, combine harvesters and rice planting machines, they have also developed motorised hoes and milling machines. YANMAR Co Ltd also supplies engines to private boat manufacturers, the merchant navy, and air-conditioning, generator and construction machines (e.g. diggers, wheel loaders and carriers) manufacturers. These products all belong to YANMAR Holdings Co. Ltd. and its various international subsidiary companies.

Product portfolio

  • Combine harvesters
  • Rice planting machines
  • Motorised
    hoes and milling machines
  • Diggers
  • Wheel loaders
  • Carriers
  • Diesel engines for marine sectors
  • Generators
  • Air-conditioners

The company ALZMETALL GmbH, from Altenmarkt, has been a leading company in the fields of drilling, milling and casting for a decade. Their products are used in general machine construction, the automobile industry and in medium-sized manufacturing companies.

The history of ALZMETALL

The company ALZMETALL was founded in 1945. Casting production started in 1946 and the production of drilling machines began in 1947. In 1971, the company started producing special machines. In 1980, the AX range of drilling machines was developed, which was followed by the development of the CNC machining centre (ABOMAT) in 1984. In 1990, ALZMETAL acquired the majority of stocks for the established company, BLUTHARDT AG, based in Nürtingen. 2008 saw the acquisition of “DONAU Werkzeugmaschinen GmbH & Co. KG” in Ulm/Ehingen, and the founding of “DONAU Werkzeugmaschinen GmbH” in Altenmarkt/Alz, which is a 100% subsidiary company of ALZMETALL .

ALZMETALL's areas of operation

ALZMETALL is the market leader of drilling machines. Up until now, more than 190,000 of their machines were known worldwide for their capacity and high quality. Additionally, ALZMETALL developed, produced and sold vertical machining centres, which generally had a drive with steering along three and five-axes. Due to special customer requirements in terms of powerful, automatic drilling and milling machines, the company also produces special machines. ALZMETALL produces foundry and casting technology with a wide range of capacities. These include cast iron with spheroidal or lamellar graphite from raw castings, to partly-processed cast pieces, to ground, lacquered and finished end products.

A look into ALZMETALL's product range

ALZMETALL has the following products on offer within the field of drilling machines:

  • ALZTRONIC – quick, precise small drilling machines
  • ALZSTAR – start up range
  • AX – drilling with all options
  • AB – precise trend setter with pro-formance drilling
  • AC – high-end CNC drilling machines with flexible, automatic operation
  • ALZFLOW and AB-Flow – column and half column drilling machines for flow drilling
  • Radiale – model for heavy, long and bulky workpieces
  • RFT – line drilling machine with two to six drilling stations

Founded in 1974 and known for being the largest manufacturer of engine driven welders and generating sets, GENSET S.p.A. can be found in over 1,200 retailers in 60 countries around the world.

GENSET’s production facilities are in Villanova d’Ardenghi, a municipality in Northern Italy’s province of Pavia. Along with producing engine driven welders and generating sets, the factory manufactures asynchronous alternators that attach to the welders and sets. GENSET manufacturers power generation equipment for the construction, agricultural, electrical, rail, pipeline, quarry and MOD industries. Petrol generators, such as the MG 3000 use a petrol engine with an electric generator to produce electrical energy. A power generator is useful as a source for an emergency power-supply if a power grid happened to fail. GENSET reached a critical milestone in 2005, when Mase Generators SpA, a manufacturerer and seller of generators, acquired GENSET. With the acquisition and combination of the two companies, GENSET became the largest producer of its kind in its respective industry.

Product portfolio

  • Lighting towers

EINHELL Tools is the leading German manufacturer of garden products, chainsaws and tools for home and professional use. EINHELL Germany AG is based in Landau an der Isar, Bavaria (Germany) and operates worldwide with numerous subsidiaries and a network of sales representatives.

The history of the EINHELL company

When EINHELL first joined the market in 1964, its founder Hans Einhell focused on the production of built-to-order electrical engineering, especially transformers. It was only in the years to follow that the company also manufactured tools and garden products, such as battery chargers and welding equipment. In the mid-1970s, EINHELL Bavaria extended its production to a plant in Spain and in 1987 it was listed at the Frankfurt Stock Exchange under the name Hans EINHELL AG. The advancing globalization allowed EINHELL to further expand its production to Asia. This is also the reason why EINHELL can provide high-quality tools with an effective price advantage of 30 – 50 percent compared to other high-quality producers in the same sector. The successful development and distribution of its products continuously allows the formation of increasing numbers of subsidiaries in other countries. Since 2008 the company is registered as EINHELL Germany AG and it celebrated its 50th anniversary in 2014 with the introduction of the innovative product range Power X-Change, a one-battery-fits all system for power tools and garden products.

EINHELL Tools & Products

EINHELL has more than 1,400 employees worldwide working with a product range of approximately 3,500 items of high quality at affordable prices. The production range is divided into two business segments - tools and garden – and also includes a wide variety of car accessories and components.

AGCO FENDT, a German manufacturer has been producing agricultural related products for over 75 years. Family and tradition have stuck with FENDT since the first product, the ‘Dieselross’ (Diesel Horse). Since then, FENDT AGCO has grown into a worldwide giant in the agricultural manufacturing industry.

About FENDT: Tractors and Agricultural Machinery

For the better part of the 20th century, FENDT was developing and reshaping the way tractors were created, by increasing the horsepower and all around vision. One of their most notable tractors, the 926 Vario, was released in 1995 and was the first high-horsepower tractor with step less Vario transmission.

In 1997, FENDT reached a critical turning point, which solidified it’s standing as one of the leading agricultural manufacturers when the US agricultural equipment corporation, AGCO acquired the German company. The acquisition by AGCO allowed the company to expand beyond Europe and sell its product to more than 3,000 independent dealers and distributors AGCO works with in over 140 countries. FENDT has five of their own factories across Bavaria, including locations in Breganze and Hohenmolsen. The United States corporation, based in Duluth, Georgia, formed in 1990 after the acquisition of DEUTZ ALLIS Corporation from the Kloeckner-Humboldt-DEUTZ AG based in Germany. Today, AGCO FENDT Corpoation is a worldwide leader in manufacturing agricultural equipment, such as tractors, combines, sprayers, harvesters, balers, tillage equipment and hay tools. AGCO is located all across the world, in locations such as, Hesston, Kansas in the United States, Queretaro, Bajio in Mexico, Roasario, Argentina, Santa Rosa, Brazil, Randers, Denmark, Breganze, Italy, Coventry, United Kingdom, Constantine, Algeria, Jinan China and Dindigul, India. 2012 was a significant year for AGCO FENDT. The company released the 300 Vario Series with SCR technology, and it opened a facility in Marktoberdorf/Baumenheim, which is considered to be one of the world’s most modern factories for tractors in the world.

DYNAPAC, a Sweden based manufacturing company specializes in compaction, milling and paving equipment. The company reached a global scale in 1946 when it opened its production plant in the United States in Stanhope, New Jersey. Since then it has opened plants in Brazil, China and India. It has also acquired asphalt paver companies from Germany and Japan.

Website: dynapac.com

With the acquisition of companies in Germany and Japan, DYNAPAC became the leader in asphalt and applications in its market. DYNAPACK also has headquarters in Wardenburg, Germany.  In 1970, DYNAPAC introduced the CA 25 Road Roller, it quickly became the world’s leading compaction roller. During it’s growth, in 1973, the company changed it’s name to what it is now, DYNAPAC Compaction Equipment AB. DYNA PAC has around 2,100 employees worldwide.

DYNAPAC is part of the  ATLAS COPCO group, which is a Swedish industrial company that manufacturers tools and equipment. ATLAS COPCO employs over 40,000 people worldwide. In Sweden alone, ATLAS COPCO has 27,000 employees. The company is truly a global company as it provides its product in over 150 markets. ATLAS COPCO is the world leader in the production of air compressors. ATLAS COPCO has three sectors: the Compressor Technique, Construction and Mining Technique, and Industrial Technique sectors. 

Atlas Copco DYNAPAC products include equipment for the road construction industry such as single drum vibratory rollers, combi rollers, tracked pavers, wheeled pavers, mobile feeders and high capacity planners.

Based out of Bologna, Italy, GIBEN International S.p.A. has operated as a manufacturer in the woodworking industry, offering wooden panel sizing, beam saws, panel saws, angular saws and panel sizing systems since 1947.

Website: giben.com

About GIBEN

GIBEN International is divided into five divisions: Sizing Division, CNC Division, Edge Division, Special Project Division and Graphic Division. 
The Sizing Division manufactures panel saws for woodworking as well as panel sizing machines, angular systems and cutting centers. One of their most popular products is the GP 305, a sliding table saw. The CNC Division manufactures CNC machines, which are used for woodworking. The Edge Division produces machines used to edge out angles on woodworking projects. 
The Special Projects Division specializes in the design of “ready to use” solutions for the cutting industry. It also specializes in solutions in the storage systems and the integration of information for the production process.
Finally, GIBEN’s Graphic Division produces amongst others cutting systems and industrial ink-jet printers. These are printing machines used to enable the customer to put his idea into a clear-cut design.
GIBEN is partners with Anderson Group America, a global enterprise that is the leading supplier of industrial CNC Routers for the woodworking, plastics, graphic and sign and composite materials sectors. 

GIBEN Product Portfolio

  • CNC machining centres
  • Edge banding machines
  • Sliding table saws
  • Ink-jet printers

GIBEN has several companies it has developed including GIBEN America Inc. Based un Georgia, GIBEN America specializes in panel sizing equipment and serves clients in the USA, Canada and Mexico.

CARER is a developer, producer and distributor of moving and handling equipment. The company is based in Cotignola (RA), Italy and is a leading innovator of electric forklift trucks with a loading capacity between 800 – 25,000 kg.

The history of the company CARER

In 1976 CARER Srl was created in Northern Italy with the purpose of providing goods-handling solutions for the global industry. Its first forklift trucks (P Series) were qualified for use in foundries. In 1977 the company already produced the Three-Wheel forklift 1200/3 – 1500/3 and the Four-Wheel forklift C150, C180, C200 and C250. Three years into production CARER was already known for the fastest forklifts on the market and CARER was the first Italian company to use electronics with energy reclamation. Introducing CARER forklift models with a loading capacity of 8500 kg in the late 1980s contributed to its secure market position. In 1997 CARER received the certification UNI EN ISO 9001 and in 2003 the certification UNI EN ISO 9001:2000. Their high productivity and stability ensure storage of goods at maximum heights.

Main products

The production plant in Cotignola covers 5000 m² with an additional 2000 m², where 300 forklift trucks are being produced every year. CARER excels in the quality of its products, providing compact, reliable and long-lasting forklift trucks. The production range covers 46 different models with a load-bearing capacity between 800 – 25,000 kg. CARER forklifts are perfectly suited for application in a variety of industries, like the iron, steel and automobile industries; the paper and wood industries; the radioactive waste and beverages industries and at ports and logistics centers. Not only do the machines simplify heavy loading, but they also create less irritating smoke and exhaust gases.

Production Portfolio

  • F Series: 1600 – 8000 kg (very compact)
  • Z Series: 2500 – 15,000 kg (shortest forklift truck with a high seat position)
  • K Series: 4500 – 12,000 kg (most comprehensive product range for inside use)
  • R Series: 4500 – 16,000 kg (for use inside and outside)
  • Special Trucks - 18,000 kg + (for specific handling needs)

FLADDER Danmark A/S is based in Ansager (Denmark) and is a manufacturer and exporter of wood and metal forming machinery. The company is well known as the inventor of the FLADDER® Finishing System and belongs to the Hansen & Hundebøl group.

The history of the company FLADDER

In the early 1970's the company Hansen & Hundebøl was established as a development center. The task was to develop applications for the automation and rationalization of production processes. It was in this regard that at the end of that same decade the FLADDER® Sanding System was introduced, followed by innovative abrasive blades. It was an innovation in the sector providing a grinding quality that had never before been achieved. From then on FLADDER continued to patent its innovations and quickly became a global leader in sanding and deburring systems. The 1980's brought the beginning of automation which greatly contributed to sales and the growth of the company. As FLADDER gains more and more renown on the global market, a new word begins to describe plate deburring among technicians and engineers: Fladdering. Patenting its innovations serves a twofold purpose, on the one hand patents can protect the idea and further improvements and on the other hand they spur on developments in new application fields. Today, FLADDER Danmark does not only work with wood but also produces machines for deburring, brushfinishing and polishing in the metal working industry.

FLADDER Machines

FLADDER excels as a company due to its durable, strong and compact automatic, manual and finishing machines. With as little extra components as possible the company manages to provide previously unachieved quality in  sanding and deburring.

The Canadian firm URBAN MACHINERY manufactures cutting and handling centres for the production of strong vinyl windows. The firm installs full production solutions and operates across North America.

Website: u-r-b-a-n.com

Manufacturers of vinyl window production equipment

URBAN MACHINERY is a firm that manufactures equipment specifically suited to the production of vinyl windows and their product range includes cutting machinery, welders, assembly units and corner cleaning machines. The firm was founded in 1987 in the Canadian city of Waterloo, Ontario. By 1992 the company had expanded so quickly that another manufacturing plant was required in the city of Fredericton, New Brunswick. This was followed by the opening of a major sales and service centre in Cambridge, Ontario as URBAN MACHINERY began to supply customers across North America. In 1996, the firm made a huge step forward by opening a subsidiary in the state of Oregon in the United States, and the factories in Canada were steadily expanded to meet constant demand. By the year 2000, URBAN MACHINERY's window manufacturing machinery was regularly winning industry awards such as the Crystal Achievement Award for the firm's corner cleaning machinery and its automated welding lines. In 2007, after 20 years of operation, URBAN MACHINERY had opened new factories in Canada and Washington State, and had also started an operation in the Texan city of Dallas. With its broad range of assembly and production machinery, the firm can offer clients a full suite of production equipment, allowing them to start production of windows almost immediately after installation. This includes a number of innovative automation solutions, such as automatic screw feed units and automatic screwing machines, which have been making window production cheaper and safer since their introduction. URBAN Memmingen has also focused on developing computer controlled CNC machining centres for corner cutting and welding, providing total flexibility to all of its clients.

TOS Varnsdorf is a machine tool production company based in the town of Varnsdorf in the Czech Republic. TOS says "high performance, progressive design and reliability" are at the core of all that it does.

A history of TOS

The company that is TOS Varnsdorf a.s. today can trace its history back to 1903, when it was founded as with German backing as an Austro-Hungarian business. From the start, TOS was making versions of the machines it still makes to this day, meaning that there is more than a century of experience and knowledge built into every TOS machine tools it produces. TOS Group has been through the experience of operating under in the Second World War under the Nazis, and of being nationalised under the Soviet control of what was then Czechoslovakia. Throughout, it retained its status of being a leader in its field of machine tool manufacture. After the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989, the TOS company began a period of reconstruction in what become the Czech Republic. TOS a.s. developed a table type milling and boring machine that received a gold medal at an International Engineering Fair. By 1995, TOS Varnsdorf was once again in private hands, bought by Czech investors. Expansion followed with a new generation of machines entering production in 2002. Subsidiaries have been established in China, Canada and the United States through TOS America. In 2007, a new heavy machinery hall was put into operation, and three years later TOS was able to announce a milestone when the company introduced a prototype of a table type milling and boring machine which, TOS Varnsdorf a.s. says, is the largest machine produced in the recent history of the company.

TOS Machine Tools

  • Horizontal boring and milling machines
  • Floor type horizontal boring mills
  • Machining centers
  • Portal type machining centers

TRUMPF Machine Tools is a subsidiary of the German TRUMPF Group, based near Stuttgart, and which is a family-owned concern that prides itself on being a world leader. TRUMPF is a high-tech company which specialises in laser technology, manufacturing technology and medical technology, in the fields of laser-based production processes, hospital equipment and electronic applications. TRUMPF is well known for high standards in manufacturing machine tools. If you are in need of a TRUMPF machine its is recommended to buy a used TRUMPF laser machine. That way you can save money and still get all the benefits of a TRUMPF machine, even if it's a second-hand machine.

Website: trumpf-machines.com

A history of TRUMPF Machine Tools

Christian TRUMPF founded the company in 1923 in Stuttgart to produce flexible shafts. In the 1930s, its product portfolio expanded to include the first motor-driven sheet metal shears. By 1950, production had exceeded one-million units and its products were available around the world. TRUMPF's second factory was opened later in the decade and a key patent followed in 1957: a coordinate guidance system for metal sheets. Expansion in the use of TRUMPF laser technology came with a shareholding in the Haas-Laser company. A decade later came another important advance when the world's first sheet metal fabrication machine with a numerical control system was unveiled at the European Machine Tool Exhibition in Paris, causing a sensation because of its pioneering computerised operation, which set the stage for the TRUMPF machinery makes today. TRUMPF's research into lasers led it to produce the company's first punching-laser machine in 1979, and it was an immediate success. A specialist laser factory is now part of the TRUMPF factory campus at Ditzingen near Stuttgart, and there are subsidiaries around the world, including in Japan and the United States. The TRUMPF company says it is a company whose history proves that it stands for continuing innovation.

TRAUB is a manufacturer of turning machines based in the German town of Reichenbach. TRAUB GmbH has established a reputation as a global leader in making CNC turning centres and machining centres with an extensive service network throughout the world. TRAUB machine manufacturer is an important in every metal processing plant. A history of the TRAUB GmbH Manufacturer 

TRAUB Drehmaschinen GmbH & Co. KG manufacturer  is part of the Index group of companies, which can trace its history back to 1914 as a leading maker of turning machines. The acquisition of TRAUB by Index in 1997 has sealed the combined companies' reputation as a global leader in their market. TRAUB's main customers are from the automotive sector. It also serves the electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and electronics sectors. TRAUB's unique selling point, the company believes, is its close contact with its customers, designing bespoke solutions to whatever specification that the client requires. TRAUB's production process allows this complex machinery to be produced in the most cost-effective way possible. The engineering, research and development department of the combined INDEX TRAUB comprises ten percent of the staff, indicating the importance that the TRAUB company attaches to finding the right solutions for each client's needs. The idea, TRAUB   says, is to give all of its customers, wherever they are in the world, "a competitive advantage". TRAUB GmbH is today based, as it has always been, in Reichenbach, and the company makes all of its products in Germany, believing it to be the best source of the highly educated employees that its demanding production techniques demand. TCM Corporation is a multi-national manufacturer of forklift trucks, rated as the eighth largest lift truck manufacturer in the world, with its headquarters in Japan, where the TCM story began. Its wide range, constant history of innovation and reputation for toughness, build quality, safety and reliability has given it a global market.

A history of TCM Corporation

TCM Corp. was founded as post-war Japan reconstructed and in 1949 it built Japan's first forklift truck. TCM began exports just a year later and in 1952 it established its plant in the city of Ryugasaki, which remains one of its prime production plants today. In 1960, TCM made the first Japanese wheel loader and then expansion began worldwide. First came offices in Germany, and in 1976, a sales and distribution company was established in the United States. This was so successful that TCM began production in the US in 1988. Other production plants followed, in Belgium and, later, in China. In addition to the plant in Ryugasaki, TCM has a second Japanese production plant at Shiga, which received a certificate of excellence in 1996. Other awards have come for its innovative FTB-7 and iNOMA forklift trucks, which won awards for good design. TCM Corporation says one of the reasons for its continued success is its focus on making its forklifts and other construction equipment the favourite of drivers. TCM Corporation says in terms of respecting the environment, it prides itself on all of its products meeting international emissions regulations.

TCM Products & Machines

  • Gas Forklifts
  • Electric Forklifts
  • High reach forklifts
  • Pedestrian forklifts
  • Warehouse powered pallets

ROCLA specializes in the manufacturing of electric vehicles that are used in warehousing operations. Its flagship range is its selection of Automated Guide Vehicles.

Global leaders in warehouse vehicles with a strong focus on automation

ROCLA OY is a Finnish company specializing in the manufacture of products that are used in materials processing. This includes warehouse equipment, forklift vehicles and automated guide vehicles. The company was founded by Evert Stigzelius in 1942 and initially focused on building lifting equipment. The 1960s saw ROCLA begin producing its trademark electric vehicles, while automated guide systems followed in the 1980s. During the late 1980s and into the 1990s, ROCLA became a global company, starting partnerships with Caterpillar and Mitsubishi which would see their products marketed across North America and Asia. The firm also began acquiring strategic facilities in Scandinavia, as well as the Russian city of St. Petersburg and then Moscow in 2008. The 2000s saw ROCLA win a series of prestigious industry awards, including a Red Dot Design Award and a Grand Prix in the Fenia Prize as it expanded its range of automated industrial trucks. The company also laid out its environmental credentials, making it easier to recycle vehicle batteries and limiting the amount of packaging used by the firm's manufacturing processes. ROCLA is a world-leader in automated guide vehicles, and has sold more than 7,000 AGVs since beginning their production in 1983. With its strategic partnerships in place, the firm's AGVs are marketed under the Caterpillar and Mitsubishi brands in foreign markets. Its clients include businesses which produce food and drinks, the paper industry and any light industrial firm that requires advanced warehousing solutions.

The ROCLA product portfolio

  • Reach trucks

  • Manually operated trucks

  • Automated Guide Vehicles (AGVs)

ROCLA's products are used in many industries. Any business which operates a large warehouse or requires extensive material transfer would be a suitable partner. This might include paper manufacturers, food producers, packaging companies and retailers.

SDMO Industries is a world leader in the manufacture of generating sets, based in the French city of Brest. Company sales figures show that it is the largest manufacturer of generating sets in the European market, and, globally, the third largest.

A history of SDMO Industries

SMDO Industries was founded in the port city of Brest in 1966, specialising initially in the manufacture of marine engines. Three years on, the company phased out marine engine manufacture and began manufacturing generating sets. Changes in the way electricity was charged for in France meant that these generators gained an immediate market and SDMO Industries prospered. Its  generators were finding an immediate market and SDMO responded by rapidly expanding, setting up its first sales markets in Africa by 1985. More rapid expansion followed, first to the rest of Europe. By 1995, this increased demand enabled SDMO to set up a new 15,000 square metre facility near Brest. Over the next ten years further rapid expansion followed with subsidiaries set up in the United States, Argentina, Belgium, Nigeria, Brazil and Algeria among others. Today SDMO has three production units set up separately near Brest as well as a plant it has acquired in Macquigeral near Sao Paulo in Brazil. SDMO Industries prides itself on its extensive research and development facility, established so that SDMO can remain ahead of international competitors in its market. SDMO had always been a family-owned concern, and in 2005 it was sold to the Kohler Group. SDMO Machinery says that its extensive worldwide network, coupled now to the strength it has as being part of the Kohler Group, allows it further to add to its international sales and to make sure of further development.

SDMO Industries Product Portfolio

  • Portable power generators 
  • Domestic power generators 
  • Professional portable power generators
  • Electrical pumps 
  • Welding sets
  • Rental power generators 
  • Industrial generators

STANKO Maschinenhandels GmbH is a German machine tools trading and servicing company based in the town of Bergisch Gladbach near Cologne. STANKO offers the sale of new, used and refurbished machine tools and related equipment manufactured by its partners the former Soviet Union, as well providing help with trading links with countries in the Russian Federation.

A history of STANKO Maschinenhandels GmbH

STANKO Maschinenhandels GmbH can trace its roots back to the pre-war years of the Soviet Union, when all industry was nationalised by the Soviet state. In 1930, Stankoimport Moscow was established, a foreign trade company which was a large import and export association. Stankoimport didn't manufacture machine tools, but served solely as the trading arm for machine tool factories in the Soviet Union. This machinery was regarded as a combination of well-specified and competitively priced, so gained popularity in the West. Post-war, this led to the formation of the branch of Stankoimport in West Germany, in the town of Bergisch Gladbach, where it remains today. Now renamed STANKO Maschinenhandels GmbH it is, as its name implies, a private company. It markets machine tools, branded STANKO, made by manufacturers in Russia, Ukraine, Belarus and the Baltic States. STANKO also facilitates trade with Russia and several European companies. In addition to offering the very latest in machine tools, both new and used, from stock, it offers state-of-the-art service, overhaul and maintenance facilities in a 10,000 square metre site.

Product portfolio

MAGGI Engineering is an Italian manufacturer of woodworking machinery and accessories with its headquarters in the town of Certaldo in Tuscany, some 40km from Florence. MAGGI Engineering places great importance on the Italian heritage of arts and crafts and says that the continued success of the company lies in drawing on a combination of creativity and experience.

A history of MAGGI Engineering Srl

MAGGI Engineering was founded in 1963 in the same Tuscan town where it retains its headquarters and manufacturing facility today. The first equipment it made was a specialist range of automatic feeders. From the start, MAGGI Company placed great emphasis on the high quality of its machines, produced by a team of expert staff and technicians. The main markets for MAGGI Engineering's products are in both the handcraft and industrial industries. The initial range gradually expanded over the decades from the original line of automatic feeders and included first radial arm saws and later the latest line of multiple boring machines. MAGGI Engineering believes now that it is one of the leading producers of boring machines in the world. Some 85% of the output of the MAGGI Products factory in Tuscany is exported, with markets in some 80 countries. The staff is a closely-knit unit of 60 people and MAGGI Engineering says its future expansion lies in further development of its range of high-tech products, while concentrating on the market sectors where it has gained such an enviable reputation worldwide.

The machine tools manufacturer HILTI produces cordless drills and screwdrivers, combihammers, demolition equipment and façade mounting systems that are widely used in many engineering sectors.

Website: hilti.com

HILTI AG - Cordless Machine Tools

Maschinenbau HILTI AG is a manufacturer of power tools which originates from the Duchy of Liechtenstein. The firm was founded by brothers Eugen and Martin HILTI in 1941, when wartime requirements meant that power tools were in high demand. In the first ten years of its operation, the firm made a name by supplying tools for the textile industry and car manufacturing operations in nearby Germany, but it was in the 1950s that HILTI hit its stride, introducing its signature range of high-velocity tools. At this stage, the firm expanded into the Italian market and rebuilt its workshop into a modern factory in the town of Schaan. New products followed during the 1960s, including rotary hammer drills, and the firm began investing consistently in research and development. HILTI also continued to specialize in powder-actuated tools (PAT), an area that it was steadily taking as its own. Success continued into the 1970s, when plants were opened in Austria and Germany, and the 80s saw even more new products, including chisel hammers and diamond drilling systems, as well as a new manufacturing facility in Hungary.

HILTI AG New Areas of Technology

HILTI became a true global corporation in the 1990s with the establishment of a factory in China and investment in state of the art technology such as laser positioning systems. The firm's equipment started to be used widely in the woodworking industry, and HILTI also became one of the first power tools manufacturers to experiment with web-based sales and service. This growth and development continued during the 2000s, with more plants opening in Mexico and China, as well as beneficial deals with firms like Panasonic to produce cordless screwdrivers. HILTI also developed new heavy duty technology, such as heavy demolition breakers and combihammers, and the firm also began investing in renewable energy technologies with a move into solar mounting platforms in 2010. Within this impressive story of development, HILTI has remained anchored in family traditions and the community of Schaan, although it has created a workforce some 21,000 strong across the world. Sales and research are effectively globalised, with technicians providing support and selling HILTI products on all continents.

Used HILTI Power Tools

HILTI's power tools are used across the world by large engineering companies in sectors such as construction, furniture making, aerospace, automobile manufacturing and ship-building, but are also popular with small tradesmen and workshops.
