EUREKA Machinery Imp. & Exp., Ltd is a Chinese company which specializes in paper manipulation and printing technologies such as screen printing and guillotines. The firm is made up of three companies, Guowang Printing Machinery, Jinbao Screen Printing Machinery and CHM, which allows it to manufacture a wide range of printing equipment for professional clients. The oldest of these firms, Guowang, was founded in 1993, but all three have rapidly developed expertise in the printing field. Their specialities are also slightly different. CHM, specializes in manufacturing paper packaging, while Guowang manufactures high quality guillotine cutting machinery and Jinbao is China's foremost screen printing firm. All of these subsidiaries invest heavily in the latest automation and computer controlled operation systems, making their products competitive with similar printing machinery produced in other markets. EUREKA Machinery is geared to export the machinery produced by these subsidiaries, and has a range of specific areas of expertise, which include ice cream cone manufacturing, laminating machines, plastic packaging machines and die-cutting machines. The firm seeks to offer the highest quality Chinese printing equipment to export markets, drawing on the country's long history of printing expertise.

Suppliers of automated solutions to the publishing industry

EUREKA Machinery is a global company, with sales representatives stationed on all continents. More than half of its global sales are made in Europe, and around a fifth in the Americas, meaning that the firm concentrates heavily on satisfying European clients. It operates a full customer engagement process, from identifying the right equipment through to advising on project implementation, product delivery and installation, staff training and maintenance, so that printing companies can benefit as much as possible from EUREKA Machines. Their clients include major publishing companies, educational institutions, magazines and newspapers, food processors who require high quality paper packaging and marketing companies. Any organization that requires precision processing of paper or card would be a suitable partner for EUREKA's services.

The EUREKA Machines Portfolio

The range of printing equipment manufactured by EUREKA Machinery Imp & Exp Ltd includes:

  • Screen printing machinery (Auto and semi-auto)
  • Drying tunnels for use in screen printing
  • Guillotines for paper cutting
  • Binder machinery (One, three and four clamps)
  • Sewing and stitching machines
  • Wire binding machines
  • Narrow printing machines
  • Book cover makers
  • Sheeter cutters
  • Plastic and paper bag makers
  • Small format offset presses
  • Folding machines
  • Packaging machines
  • Digit binders, cutters, folders and coaters
  • UV coaters
  • Laminaters
  • Label die cutters

EUREKA Machinery products are used in many different applications. Their screen printing machinery may be used by magazine printers, marketing firms and textile manufacturers while their binding equipment is used by publishers. The firm's specialist bag makers may be used by retailers, while their folding and cutting machines could be suitable for large administrative organizations.

The Danish firm DAL-BO AS design and manufacture agricultural machinery, including seed drills, harrows, cultivators and rollers. Their products are mainly targeted at arable farmers across the world, but are also used by organizations as diverse as city parks and golf courses.

European leaders in the design of precision agricultural machinery

DAL-BO AS is a Danish firm which manufactures agricultural machinery. The firm was founded by Henry Pedersen in 1948, and expanded rapidly during the 1950s. At first the company manufactured only tractor trailers, but started producing agricultural rollers in the late 1950s. These core products were developed, and export markets were opened up during the 1960s and 70s, and in 1990 a completely new product was introduced, the DAL-BO stubble cultivator. This proved a huge international success, with its adaptable design which can include harrows, cultivators and rollers all-in-one. With changes in European agriculture, came changes in the DAL-BO AS range. For example, increasing adoption of low-impact, low soil preparation agriculture stimulated the firm to introduce new sowing machinery in the 1990s.

Delivering energy efficient agricultural solutions

DAL-BO continues to be based in the Danish town of Bindeballe, where it employs around 50 people in its research and production facilities. Despite this commitment to the local community, the company is an international exporter, with around 70 percent of its goods being sent to foreign markets and particularly strong growth being experienced in sales to Eastern European markets. DAL-BO seeks to move with trends in agricultural production, introducing low impact machinery like its Maxiroll Greenline rollers and hydraulic rollers which operate while tractors remain stationary, making it easier to be precise when preparing soils. The company also specializes in designing products which have low running costs and deliver a high degree of energy efficiency, as well as well-balanced rollers which are easy to handle and safe to use. DAL-BO also manufactures precision machinery, such as the firm's seed drills which can be minutely adjusted to deliver seeds at exactly the correct soil depth. Their rollers and cultivators are also designed to avoid soil compaction wherever possible.

DAL-BO AS Product Portfolio

The range of agricultural products manufactured by DAL-BO includes:

  • Maxiroll rollers
  • Maxicut knife rollers
  • One-pass cultivators
  • Tractor-pulled harrows
  • Hydraulic disc harrows
  • Stubble cultivators
  • Seed bed cultivators
  • Front and back-mounted packers
  • Double furrow presses

The range of products manufactured by DAL-BO is intended primarily for use by agricultural businesses, both in arable and livestock sectors. However, their rollers and harrows are also used by land management and horticultural firms, vineyards and leisure businesses such as golf courses and parks.

HUSQVARNA AB is a Swedish manufacturer of construction and domestic machinery with head or regional offices in Sweden, Belgium, the USA and Japan. Long acknowledged as a world leader in its field, HUSQVARNA Sweden manufactures its products in nine factories globally, with sales in more than 70 countries and 2,000 employees worldwide and complements its highly regarded construction range with its outdoor products, of which it is the world's largest producer, as well as a long-standing range of motorcycles.

HUSQVARNA AB - Manufacturer's History

With its headquarters in Stockholm, HUSQVARNA AB has a long, proud and extraordinary history of making a wide range of fine heavy duty products which integrate the traditions of Swedish design with engineering excellence and precision. Founded in 1689, HUSQVARNA started out manufacturing what are now regarded as some of the finest muskets available at the time. HUSQVARNA's logo today still incorporates the sight over the barrel of a musket. Rifle production continued alongside HUSQVARNA's other activities for 300 years, only ending in 1989. Throughout the 1800s, the company expanded, first making sewing machines and later kitchen equipment and bicycles. HUSQVARNA's renowned motorcycle range made its debute with the first machine in 1903, and the first HUSQVARNA Lawn Equipment is a lawnmower followed in 1919. More rapid expansion came in the decades that followed and by the 1960s, HUSQVARNA had moved into chainsaws and power cutters. Such was the attraction of the brand that in 1978 HUSQVARNA was acquired by Electrolux, only to be sold by the Swedish giant in 2006. Since then there have been acquisitions to strengthen the company and the HUSQVARNA brand, along with an expanded presence in China and constant innovation, such as the introduction of its first demolition robot in 2009. HUSQVARNA Power Equipment prides itself on its research and development facilities, to make sure that it remains ahead of its competitors in all the fields in which it manufactures and sells products and HUSQVARNA has established dedicated large research and development centers in both Sweden and in Belgium. HUSQVARNA says its aim is always to offer the world's best engineering expertise while, as a company with a strong ethical base, ensuring that the highest environmental standards are upheld.

Product portfolio 

The HUSQVARNA Products range includes:

  • Wall saws
  • Drilling equipment
  • Floor sawing machines
  • Handheld power cutting machines
  • Remote demolition
  • Wire sawing machines
  • Early entry sawing machines
  • Surface preparation machinery
  • Masonry and tile saws
  • Diamond tools
  • Protective equipment

DONAU is a German manufacturer of CNC drilling centres and rapid radial drilling equipment which supplies firms in the engineering sector. It operates a worldwide sales and support system.

Manufacturers of high performance rapid radial drilling machinery

DONAU Werkzeugmaschinen GmbH is a German firm which specializes in the manufacturing of radial drilling machinery, and has delivered 14,000 such machines to clients located around the world. DONAU was founded as Alzemetall in the town of Altenmarkt in 1945, and has consistently focused on the production of drilling machinery. Initially, this entailed the production of work-table based drills and column or box drills, but during the post-war period, DONAU developed expertise in the manufacture of CNC machining centres. These machining centres represented a combination of automation, safety and high performance, and incorporated the latest computer technology to allow users to customize their operations. As the 1970s and 80s progressed, DONAU introduced state of the art 3, 4 and then 5 axis machining centres, including vertical drilling and vertical turning technologies to provide customers with total flexibility during their own production processes. Nowadays, the firm carries out a great deal of specialist work on multi-spindle drilling projects as well as rotary and linear transfer machines - which means working closely with engineering clients to ensure that their needs are met.

Providing drilling expertise across the engineering world

As the firm's technological achievements developed and sales rose, DONAU established an international network of both distributors and customer support staff, and it now has a presence in countries as distant as China, the United States and the Russian Federation. However, the firm will also seek to fulfil orders from all areas of the world via the nearest available distributor. The firm concentrates on providing a comprehensive service to its clients, from initial consultancy to after-purchase training for users of DONAU machinery. The company operates a service hot-line as well as full maintenance and spare parts provisioning service. DONAU will also assist in retro-fitting older machines with elements of the latest technology available. When being used, the firm's machines are designed to be easy to use, with ergonomic "no fatigue" features which limit tiredness and seek to avoid accidents, making DONAU drills some of the safest on the market.

The DONAU product portfolio

The range of drilling products manufactured by DONAU includes:

  • Donaualpha rapid radial drilling centres
  • Donauflex manual operation radial drilling machines
  • Donaumeric and Donauport CNC controlled rapid radial drilling centres

The machining centres and rapid radial drills manufactured by DONAU are used in engineering workshops and factories in the metal working sector. Firms partnering with DONAU could include car manufacturers, boat builders and electrical appliance makers.

GÜNZBURGER STEIGTECHNIK is a German firm which specializes in manufacturing access products. These may include specialist walkways, working platforms, scaffolding or high-grip ladders.

Manufacturing access products in Bavaria for over a century

GÜNZBURGER STEIGTECHNIK is a company which manufactures ladders, scaffolding and other construction equipment. The firm originated from Germany, in the Bavarian town of Günzburg where it was founded in the early twentieth century. Today, GÜNZBURGER STEIGTECHNIK has grown to encompass 200 workers at its corporate headquarters, and manufactures access equipment that is exported around Europe and the wider world. Applying a "made in Germany" philosophy which prizes reliability and quality, the company produces access equipment that is intelligently designed to save labour and be as safe as possible. It also remains a family-held business, with a focus on values such as sustainability and customer service, despite experiencing rapid growth in international sales.

Allowing access safely and ensuring that emergency escapes are easy

GÜNZBURGER STEIGTECHNIK's products are widely used in high-tech engineering sectors where it is vital that ladders have effective grip and are strong enough to prevent any falls. The aerospace industry is a major client, which uses the firm's engineering platforms, ladders and mobile scaffolding solutions on its complex production projects. Construction companies working on projects like tower blocks, sporting stadia and transport infrastructure also use GÜNZBURGER STEIGTECHNIK scaffolding to create bespoke access solutions, where a premium is placed on safety and the ease of use of the design. GÜNZBURGER STEIGTECHNIK will lead clients through every part of the design process, using the expertise of its workforce to provide consultation services. They seek to implement their access projects in conjunction with clients, and offer full support and training to ensure that their products are used effectively and safely. Their products are also widely used by public bodies and firms as emergency escape facilities, and the firm will produce a detailed "map" of every system they install so that clients are aware of how to use their access products. Additionally, GÜNZBURGER STEIGTECHNIK offers a 15 year guarantee on all products, and promises a rapid on-site reaction should any problems arise.

The GÜNZBURGER STEIGTECHNIK product portfolio

Products manufactured by GÜNZBURGER STEIGTECHNIK include:

  • High-grip ladders
  • Mobile scaffolding
  • Fixed scaffolding
  • Working platforms
  • Emergency escape ladders and stairs
  • Fuel truck ladders
  • Slewing platforms
  • Walkway systems
  • Aircraft docking systems
  • Foldable service ladders

GÜNZBURGER STEIGTECHNIK access products are widely used by construction firms on complex projects, because the firm provides a full suite of ladders, work platforms and scaffolding. They also provide specialist products for the aerospace and ship-building industries, as well as emergency escape routes for private homes and businesses.

The American firm FORMAX is one of the leading administrative supplies companies in the United States. The firm manufactures  print finishing equipment, data destruction devices such as shredders, as well as specialist pressure sealing equipment to be used in mass mailing operations.

Providing paper manipulation equipment since 1987

FORMAX is an American firm which focuses on the manufacturing of tools for mass-mailing, data protection and digital print finishing. The firm was founded in 1987 in the state of New Hampshire, where it remains headquartered, as well as managing a production facility in California. The company initially prospered by developing efficient and popular pressure sealing machinery, allowing mass-mailing firms to seal thousands of letters at once. During the 1990s FORMAX moved on from pressure sealing, adding data destruction, mailing and digital printing products, which positioned the firm as one of America's leading suppliers of administrative equipment. The introduction of equipment like FORMAX pressure sealers has radically reduced labour times for administrative tasks like the completion of legal forms and tax returns, while the firm's digital printing systems have enabled small magazines and brochure producers to compete with larger print-shops and publishers.

Pressure sealing, data destruction and print finishing expertise

FORMAX now operates a worldwide distribution network, although most of its business still takes place within the United States. The firm's range of print finishing systems includes a wide range of different capabilities, from cutting and folding to laminating, UV coating, and collating. The firm also provides machinery to assist with different binding techniques as well as organizing documents into binders. FORMAX data destruction machines are a reliable means of disposing of sensitive print material such as personal records or bank information, and are widely used by health care and administrative organizations across the United States. They are complemented by the company's flagship selection of pressure sealing machinery, which enables customers who need to send out large volumes of standardised mail with a way to do so reliably and automatically, saving both money, time and energy in the process.

The FORMAX product portfolio

The range of administrative equipment manufactured by FORMAX includes:

  • Data destruction equipment
  • Pressure sealing equipment
  • Print finishing devices (cutters, laminators, binders, folders, collators)

The product manufactured by FORMAX are used primarily by office based organizations which deal with high volumes of paper correspondence, and are particularly popular with public bodies and accountancy firms. Their data destruction equipment is suitable for any firm which deals in sensitive information, while their print finishing products are aimed at the printing and publishing sectors.

BENQ Corporation is a Taiwanese based company, which has made its mark in over one hundred countries all over the world in computing, communication and consumer electronics. BENQ's services, solutions and products are widely used in education, business, healthcare and lifestyle sectors.

Global leader in the field of in computing, communication and consumer electronics

With its main base in Taipei, BENQ started out as a spin-off from another global leader in computers, ACER in 2001. BENQ, which stands for "Bringing Enjoyment N Quality to life" was ranked number thirteenth in "Global Top 100 IT Companies" list by BusinessWeek in 2002. In the year 2008, BENQ ventured into the medical field, setting up its very first medical centre in its neighbouring country, China. Because of its very lead to support green technologies, the British Standards Institution awarded BENQ with PAS 2050 International Carbon-footprint certification. The year 2011 marked BENQ's entry further into the  medical field with the acquisition of Acquired Trident Technology.

The BENQ service, solution and product portfolio

The range of services, solutions and products offered by BENQ includes:

  • Professional monitors including gaming monitors
  • Imaging solutions such as digital cameras and camcorders
  • Digital projectors
  • LED lighting solutions
  • Interactive large-format displays such as digital signage
  • Mobile computing devices such as smartphones

The various solutions, services and products offered by BENQ are used in different types of environment. BENQ's partners comprise of various business organisation, education specialists, lifestyle experts and healthcare specialists among others.

The Italian company TECNA manufactures welding equipment for industrial and professional uses, both small and large, as well as balancing devices.

Website: tecnamachines.com

Internationally known manufacturers of welding machinery

TECNA SpA. is an Italian firm which specializes in the manufacture of products used in resistance welding applications. Founded in the early 1970s in the town of Castel S. Pietro Terme, TECNA has established an international reputation as a manufacturer of spot and projection welding equipment, which have been particularly popular with car manufacturers. TECNA states that it seeks to ensure that clients are catered for at every stage, from initial project explorations to consulting, design, engineering, assembly, delivery, installation and use. TECNA trains the staff at client firms, providing them with the welding skills that they will need to get the most out of their spot and projection welding equipment, and also offers a high level of service and support to all clients, wherever in the world they are. Because of the popularity of the firms welding machinery, TECNA has created a distribution network formed of commercial partners in Africa, Asia, Europe, North America, Oceania and South America. The firm has also invested heavily in ensuring that all of its equipment is engineered to a high degree of quality control, having obtained the internationally known ISO 9001 certificate. Along with catering for major industrial partners, TECNA SpA have also chosen to launch a "professional" range of smaller welding machinery for small workshops and mechanics who need to work on projects such as remodelling car bodies. It has also developed a selection of robust balancing equipment to assist clients with their welding challenges.

TECNA Product Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by TECNA includes:

  • Inox rope balancers
  • Nylon rope balancers
  • ATEX rope balancers
  • Hose balancers
  • Portable spot welders
  • Suspended guns
  • Rocker arm spot welders
  • Linear action welders
  • Bench welders
  • Three phase DC current welders
  • MF inverter welders
  • Welding accessories
  • Components for TECNA welding equipment
  • Control units
  • Spotters
  • Car body repair spot welders

The machinery manufactured by TECNA SpA is often used in the car manufacturing and repair industries where clients need to carry out delicate welding operations to a high degree of accuracy. Their balancers may be used in moving any heavy items such as piping or motors, and could be used in the energy sector

The Czech firm ZETOR Tractors A.S. has a long history of manufacturing advanced tractors and now offers a broad selection of robust  tractors for agricultural applications. ZETOR also operates a global system for providing spare parts and maintenance.

A Czech Tractor Brand With a Global Distribution Network

ZETOR Tractors A.S. is a Czech firm which manufactures tractors for the  agricultural and industrial sectors. The firm started out being based in its own factory in Zbrojovka Brno, and launched its first tractors in 1945. During the 1950s, ZETOR introduced ever more efficient tractors, incorporating four stroke diesel engines and advanced mechanical fuel injection to aid performance. Coupled with their robust design and affordable price, these features made ZETOR Tractors a common sight on agricultural projects across the world from the early 1960s. The firm then moved on to create standardised assembly systems for its next range of tractors, driving down the cost of production and making their products easier to customize at the same time. By 2000, ZETOR Tractors had been sold in 43 countries and had created a sales network which spanned 5 continents. The firm has modernized and steadily improved the output of its tractors, gaining the internationally respected ISO 9001 certification for quality control. ZETOR has also invested in reducing emissions, installing new drive units and engineering cooling systems that use recycled exhaust gases. ZETOR remain registered in the city of Brno in the Czech Republic, but have struck affiliation agreements with firms across the world to distribute ZETOR tractor and other products. The firm also operates a global system of spare parts provisioning and undertake to deliver the required supplies between 1 and 2 days after the order has been placed. Clients can make sure they order the right parts by requesting a spare parts consultation, which ZETOR Tractor AS are happy to provide. Additionally, it supports the after market sales with used zetor for sale section as a service for customers to buy certified  used zetor tractors, front loaders and attachments.

The ZETOR Product Portfolio

The range of agricultural vehicles manufactured by ZETOR Tractors includes:

Agricultural tractors (from 65 hp to 147 hp and many different sizes)

  • Specialist ZETOR Engines for tractors
  • Front loaders
  • Accessories for ZETOR Tractors

The vehicles manufactured by ZETOR are primarily used by arable and livestock farmers across the world for moving materials. However, ZETOR Tractors are also adaptable, with a range of attachments which may make them suitable for use in  construction projects and urban landscaping uses.

SAMSUNG is a leading name in consumer electronics, and the South Korean company produce a wide range of smartphones, notebook computers and home appliances for the international market.

From humble beginnings

Founded as a small trading company in the 1930's, SAMSUNG now design and manufacture iconic products like the Galaxy Note and ecobubble washer and dryer systems. Little could founding chairman Byung-Chull Lee have known on March 1st 1938 when he began his small trading company in Daegu, Korea to export Korean dried fish, fruit and vegetables to Beijing and Manchuria just how successful it would become. SAMSUNG means 'three stars' in Korean, and this international corporation is now a star of international proportions.

Growth and progress

SAMSUNG was quick to capitalise on business acumen of its founder and acquired other companies which it re-branded with the SAMSUNG name. SAMSUNG established its Samsung-Sanyo Electronics branch in 1969, its first electronic products for the international market appeared in the early 1970's. Strategic investment in the petrochemical and chemical industries laid important foundations for future growth, while by the the 1980's SAMSUNG was an international household name, selling its 20 millionth colour television in 1989.

A highly respected global giant

Advances in technology and the dawn of the digital age saw SAMSUNG's video and computer sector grow and it developed its first mobile phone in 1992. In 2000 SAMSUNG developed the first HD TV, and formed an important alliance with Yahoo! Business Week rated SAMSUNG No. 1 in the world's 100 top electronics companies and by 2013 SAMSUNG recorded 1 billion of its iconic Galaxy smartphone series shipped on the global market. Other notable landmarks include the 2010 opening of the tallest building in the world, Burj Khalifa by SAMSUNG C&T, and the sponsorship of the 2012 Paralympic Games by SAMSUNG Electronics.

SAMSUNG Product Portfolio

Today the company is a leading name in  construction, electronics, biopharmaceuticals and is a Top 10 global brand. Some of its most popular products include:

  • Smartphones - SAMSUMG Galaxy series, including Galaxy Note
  • Notebooks and Tablets - ATIV notebook series, ATIV tablets inc. smartpen
  • Home Appliances - ecobubble washing machines and dryers, SOLO microwave ovens
  • TV - Curved series smart HD TV
  • Printers and Computer monitors

COMPAQ was formed in 1981, by entrepreneurs and former TEXAS INSTRUMENTS (TI) employees, Joseph R. Canion, James M. Harris and William H. Murto. These business partners had very humble beginnings, armed with a mere $1,000 each, to invest into the business and a plan, to produce a clone IBM personal computer.

COMPAQ specialise in marketing and also supply PC's. 

They produce, design and manufacture a range of quality products, including laptops, desktops and workstations, while providing solutions and services for customers.

The outstanding expertise COMPAQ demonstrated, caught the attention of INTEL, who, in 1985, commissioned them to correct imperfections in their own 80386 microprocessor. INTEL redesigned the features on their microprocessor, to meet with COMPAQ's standards. This led to the introduction of COMPAQ's 1987 DESKPRO 386 personal computer, which contained the new chip, making it more than 3 times faster than IBM's fastest PC. The partnership between COMPAQ and INTEL propelled them forward in the idustry.

In 1986 COMPAQ made Fortune 500 status. They had been in business less than 4 years, so this was a great accomplishment. Their business revenue increased significantly, between 1986 and 1989. In 1989 COMPAQ introduced the SYSTEMPRO personal computer and COMPAQ DESKPRO 486. Both used cutting-edge Extended Industry Standard Architecture (EISA) technology. In 1991 COMPAQ introduced a range of computers, utilising upgradable technology, called Intelligent Modularity. They brought 16 new products to the market in 1992, including a line of affordable desktop and notebook models. In the mid 90's COMPAQ moved into the arena of consumer and home office markets, leading with their Presario line. In 1994 they exceeded IBM, becoming the world's main seller of PC's.

COMPAQ Product Portfolio

  • Laptops and Mini Notebooks
  • Desktop and All in Ones
  • Monitors and Accessories
  • Printers
  • Software
  • Scanners
  • Ink and Toners

COMPAQ sell a range of high performance laptops, mini notebooks, tablets and all-in-one printers, scanners and a selection of up to date software. Desktop towers are upgradable, operating with cutting-edge processing power systems. Quality ink and toners are also available, while monitors and accessories serve home office needs.

Bayerische Motoren Werke, or abbreviated to BMW, are a German automobile and motorcycle manufacturer which was founded during World War II. This prestigious brand is synonymous with the taste of the middle classes and of sports stars and other celebrities.

A brief history

The BMW brand was founded in 1916 and within two years, had seized the responsibility of aircraft production throughout the country. Once the Versailles Armistice Treaty began to settle in 1923, BMW started to concentrate its efforts on the production of motorcycles. Six years later in 1929, this brand also started producing automobiles. The first BMW car to hit the road was the Dixi, which was inspired by the British Austin 7 automobile. By the late 1950s, BMW started experiencing some financial difficulties and found itself in a conundrum. After much deliberation, this company decided to persist instead of folding and subsequently went on to purchase the manufacturing rights of the Italian brand Iso Isetta. By the early 1990s, BMW bought the British company Rover, however sold these assets six years later, just before Rover went into liquidation. By 2012, BMW was officially named as the world's most reputable car company by Forbes.com and this was primarily based upon people's desire to recommend, buy from, work for, or invest in them.

What accolades BMW can still boast today

Today, BMW sells more than one and a half million products annually and the popularity of this company has even resulted in a number of slang terms such as 'beamer' and 'be-M'. In 2013, BMW announced that they would be releasing their first electric car, which is due to hit the road at the end of 2014. 

The Product Portfolio of BMW is basically cars. A brief history-portfolio of BMW's products.

  • 3/15 Saloon
  • 328 Roadster
  • 340 Sedan
  • Isetta 300
  • E3 Saloon
  • M1 Supercar
  • Z1 Roadster
  • Z3 Coupe
  • X3 Crossover
  • X4

WÜRTH Group refers to a German group of companies, which are the world's market frontrunner of fastening and assembly materials. The group's products are used by various industrial and trading companies.

Global leader in the field of fastening and assembly technology

With headquarters in Kunzelsau in southern Germany, WÜRTH Group is a global leader in the field of fastening and assembly technology. Beginning from a humble background of a two-man business, which was founded by Adolf Wurth in 1945, the company has expanded over the years to be a global player. Ever since Adolf Wurth's son, Professor Reinhold took over the company's reins in 1954, the small company grew to become a group of companies with subsidiaries located in over 80 countries. The company's new headquarters was officially opened in Kunzelsau-Gaisbach in 1992. WURTH Group is not merely a business company but also one that gives back to society. This is evidenced in the setting of the WÜRTH Foundation in 1987. This foundation promotes science, research, education, art and culture.

The WÜRTH product portfolio

The scope of products that are manufactured or traded by WÜRTH includes:

  • Occupational Safety and Health products including fire protection
  • Construction equipment and furniture supplies
  • Chemical-technical products
  • Hand Tools
  • Automobile parts
  • Agricultural products
  • Soldering and welding materials
  • Machinery
  • Fasteners
  • Screws and screw accessories
  • Dowels
  • Inventory management

Products, which are manufactured or traded by WÜRTH Group, are used in various kinds of environments. WÜRTH's partners include traders and automobile, metal, construction, wood and other industry players.

HOFFMANN is a Germany based company, which has expertise in making high quality  woodworking machines. HOFFMANN GmbH 's  parts, accessories and products are used all over the world by hobbyists, woodworking shops, DIY enthusiasts and industrial companies.

Global leader in the field of woodworking 

HOFFMANN MACHINE COMPANY INC. was first established in Long Island, New York in 1990. But later due to expansion and lack of space, this company was set up in Valdese, North Carolina in the year 2005. This branch's parent company, HOFFMANN GmbH is in Bruchsal, Germany. HOFFMANN GmbH is a global leader in the design, development and manufacture of woodworking machines. It was established in 1990.  HOFFMANN MACHINE COMPANY is the branch of this German parent company is family-owned and acts mainly as a sales, distribution and service centre of woodworking machines and related parts and accessories, catering mainly for the North American market. This centre also has a huge warehouse, which stores standard HOFFMANN machines, spare parts and accessories among others.

The HOFFMANN product portfolio

The range of parts, accessories and products that are manufactured by HOFFMANN includes:

  • Double miter saws, parts and accessories
  • OMGA production miter saws
  • Dovetail joining machines
  • Dovetail routing machines, parts and accessories
  • Dovetail keys with and without flange (made of plastic, hardwood and others)
  • Flexible decking keys
  • Edge lipping planer
  • MOBIL edgebanding press
  • Beaded face-frame equipment

The products that are manufactured by HOFFMANN GmbH are used by individuals and small, medium and large enterprises involved in woodworking and other fields. Partners include individuals who love woodworking, woodworking shops and industrial companies especially those involved in joining and cutting solutions.

Founded in 1936 GOEDHART develops and manufactures heat exchange systems, air coolers and air cooled condensers for a semi industrial market. GOEDHART supply customers for which high quality refrigeration systems are a vital part of their operations for example, the food industry, storage and distribution agencies and the leisure sector.

GOEDHART's Philosophy

GOEDHART have been producing custom built applications for refrigeration systems for over 75 years. Working closely with their customers, GOEDHART can offer bespoke solutions for large scale projects within the industrial market for freezing and cooling applications. Their philosophy of designing to order, coupled with efficient and flexible production lines, means that the company is a market leader in their field. With the majority of its customers in western Europe, GOEDHART will expand its market to Eastern Europe and Asia. GOEDHART take their social responsibility seriously and are developing energy efficient, sustainable methods of productions and manufacture.

GOEDHART product portfolio

GOEDHART develop, manufacture and supply the following products

Air Coolers

  • Standard
  • Agricultural
  • Industrial
  • Engineered to order

Condensers

  • Air cooled condensers
  • Dry coolers

GOEDHART's product portfolio provides customer driven solutions to all aspects of the refrigeration and cooling market, with the assurance of high quality design, development and manufacture.

The German brand WEINIG manufactures different types of saws, scanner systems, tool grinding machines and more.

Website: weinig.com

Company History & Technology Advancement

Michael WEINIG AG is not only the leading manufacturer in the solid wood processing industry, but also offers comprehensive system solutions and ideas to help its clients focus on flexible and lucrative production only. Founded in 1905 as a commercial and production company for agricultural machines, WEINIG has expanded its product range and line over decades.

In 1974, WEINIG Japan was established, followed by WEINIG USA in 1976, two years later. The company started manufacturing window machines in 1979, and IN 1980, opened a branch in Switzerland in 1980, and after two year, in U.K. in 1982. In 1983, the company converted into WEINIG GmbH (Limited Liability Company) and sold to Kuwaiti investors.

Again in 1985, WEINIG Asia was founded, and the company converted into a stock corporation and gone public. In 1995, the company opened branches in Australia and China. For more than 60 years, RECKERMANN MASCHINENBAU GmbH has been developing and manufacturing powerful vertical & horizontal milling machines, also for the heavy-duty machining sector. High-quality bed-type milling machines with two separately driven milling spindles enjoy world-renowned fame and work with high precision.

RECKERMANN MASCHINENBAU GmbH – Professional milling machines for continuous operation

The experience of five generations allows RRECKERMANN Fräsmaschinen to develop milling machines with high efficiency, variability, precision and ultimate reliability. Technically detailed solutions are also available. The machines can be controlled either conventionally or through contouring control and they possess outstanding torques already at low engine speed. Even though the machines are massive cast constructions made of high-quality material, they provide high-precision working even when heavy-duty machining. The company's milling machines are leading the market in regards to compact constructions with simultaneously high output reserves. In addition, compact machines such as the horizonal & vertical bed-type milling machines are very versatile and extremely torsion-resistant. Because of solid and well-engineered constructions as well as material profiles it is possible to achieve highest precision. One milling spindle generates 7.5 to 25 kilowatt power. The vertical movement of the bed-type milling machine - carried out by the milling unit and the machine post - produces a high resilience of the router table for machining of even very large items. Since bed-type milling machines at RECKERMANN Fräsmaschinen possess two separately driven milling spindles it is not necessary to rechuck the workpiece, an otherwise time-consuming aspect of working with common milling machines. All bed-type milling machines as well as the technology of the other machines, such as the console milling machine or CNC machining centers possess a durable geometry and high positioning accuracy.

RECKERMANN Fräsmaschinen Service plus – Restoration on the highest level

The company develops not only new milling machines, it also repairs old machines and – if requested – includes extensive automation. At the same time, RECKERMANN MASCHINENBAU GmbH offers contract works and assembly service as well as a comprehensive maintenance and spare parts service.

BUSCH is a German brand that produces a range of vacuum pumps, compressors, combination pumps, lobe boosters, side channel blowers, and more.

Company History & Growth

BUSCH GmbH is a one of the largest manufacturers of vacuum pumps, blowers and compressors in the world. With over 50 years of experience and qualified team, Busch has been constantly looking at developing innovative technology, products and more to define the vacuum world of the future.

Dr.-Ing. Karl Busch and his wife Ayhan Busch founded the Dr.-Ing. Busch GmbH Company in Schopfheim, Germany in 1963. Busch had designed, built, tested and sold the first vacuum pump in the basement of his house for record time. Over decades, company achieved significant success and growth.

Its manufacturing plants employ advanced and modern manufacturing techniques, machinery and equipment under strict quality control guidelines. BUSCH company is DIN EN ISO 9001 certified.

As of now, the company features the largest section of vacuum pumps for the industrial usage worldwide. Due to its huge lime of vacuum pumps, expertise and experience in building vacuum systems, BUSCH equipment is capable of providing cutting-edge industry solutions. With 57 companies in 39 countries and sales agents in more than 30 countries, it is strategically positioned across the globe with terrific success.

BUSCH always aims to provide customers with absolute value for money. Apart from high quality pumps and automated systems, the company offers innovative solutions and prompts customer service on site. The headquarter is located in Maulburg, Germany, but the product plants are situated in Switzerland, Great Britain, Czech republic, Korea and the USA.

The company PULSFORT

More than 100 years ago, Waltraud and Josef Pulsfort founded the mid-size company PULSFORT. Today, it is still a family business dealing with the development of innovative conveyor systems. In order to optimize industrial production processes with conveyor systems the company PULSFORT reacts to a great variety of customer wishes with adequate flexibility and focus. Manufacturing products at PULSFORT

Partner for B2B-trade

The British brand, Jaguar is a renowned multinational car manufacturer, and owned by Tata Motors since 2008

Jaguar: Company Background

Jaguar Cars is a premium brand of Jaguar Land Rover, which is a U.K. multinational car manufacturer. The headquarter is located in Whitley, Coventry, England and now, owned by Tata Motors since 2008.

The company was established initially as the Swallow Sidecar Company in 1922. They started manufacturing motorcycle sidecars at beginning, and later switched to produce passenger cars. It has changed name to Jaguar after World War II to avoid the unfavorable connotations of the SS initials.

Jaguar merged with Leyland Motor Corporation in 1968 and became British Leyland, but in 1984, it de-merged and was listed on the London Stock Exchange until Ford acquired it in 1990. The company has manufactured cars for the British prime Minister, and most recent delivery was an XJ model in 2010. Jaguar also holds royal warrants from queen Elizabeth II and Prince Charles. In 2013, Jaguar Land Rover announced plans to open a 100 million GBP R & D center in the University of Warwick, Coventry to invest new vehicle technologies.

The company is continuing the tradition and has launched new F-Type sports cars recently. This two-seater sports car will succeed the performance that began with the C, D and E-type. The F-type is undoubtedly an icon, and considered as the most beautiful car in the world.

Beauty, style and performance can be seen across all models of the brand. All are agile, powerful, sleek, confident and unique. The company plays a vital role in the global and British economies, as it has created thousands of jobs in automotive industry worldwide and in Britain. Visionary entrepreneurs have driven Jaguar since inception.

  • XJ Models
  • XK Models
  • XE Models
  • F-Type Models
  • R-Performance

The Japanese firm KOBELCO is a large manufacturer of metals which include steel, aluminium, copper and titanium. Along with its metals business, the firm produces machinery and vehicles and delivers environmental and welding services.

A Century of Metal Manufacturing and Industrial Expansion

KOBELCO was founded in 1905 through the merger of the trading company Suzkuki Shoten with steel firm Kobayashi Seikosho. Initially the firm focused on steel production, but the 1930s saw KOBELCO launch cement manufacturing operations, and the production of electric mining shovels. Metal production continued after the war, and KOBELCO pioneered the production of titanium in Japan. During this period, he firm became an industrial giant with interests in steel and non-ferrous metals production as well as industrial machinery. International expansion followed, with an American subsidiary KOBELCO USA opening in 1960 and the opening of a fertiliser plant in Bangladesh. By 1980, the firm had operations across Asia, the Middle East and North America. The 1995 Kobe earthquake set the firm back, but it responded by expanding into power production and focusing on international production, meaning that by the firm's centenary celebrations, the future looked bright. Nowadays, KOBELCO's major industrial activities involve steel production, where the firm seeks to drive up productivity in line with global competition. But the firm also offers a thriving welding service and manufactures aluminium and copper products as well. Meanwhile, the machinery sector of the firm has become a leading supplier to power generators, while KOBELCO Eco-Solutions deals with environmental areas such as sewage processing and waste disposal.

The KOBELCO product portfolio

KOBELCO's range of products includes:

  • Steel products - including rods, wires, beams and tubes
  • Titanium products
  • Steel powder
  • Wholesale electricity
  • Welding materials
  • Gas and air compressors
  • Heat pumps
  • Plastic processing machinery
  • Rolling mills
  • Ultra high-pressure equipment
  • Waste incineration plants
  • Methane fermentation systems
  • Cranes
  • Construction machinery
  • Urban transit systems

KOBELCO is a large industrial concern which provides products to a wide range of industrial customers. It serves everything from municipal governments (in waste processing and transport) to militaries and industrial manufacturers.

The British company KONECRANES is a leading firm in the heavy lifting sector, and manufacturers a wide variety of cranes that are used in the industrial and transportation sectors.

Providing expertise in the lifting industry since 1910

KONECRANES UK is a British firm which manufacturers and distributes lifting machinery. It works with a broad range of sectors, which include manufacturing industry, ship building, militaries and ports. KONECRANES was founded in the 1910s, and has ever since been based in the Scottish town of East Kilbride. From the 1970s, KONE CRANES began to expand internationally, with ventures in Norway, the USA and France being established. From its main factory in Scotland, the firm produces reliable overhead lifting cranes of more than 1,000 tonnes, as well as workstation lifting systems, jib cranes and electric crane hoists. With this capacity, the firm claims that it can deliver "any lifting application to any industry." KONE Cranes company has a workforce of 240 technicians located in different parts of the UK, and these technicians can help to maintain both KONE CRANES products as well as other makes of crane. They also support a global network of more than 500 service depots, which allows them to maintain more lifting equipment worldwide than any of their competitors. Servicing their cranes is handled by a UK Parts Centre in the Midlands which offers a 24 hours per day service. KONECRANES Inc also provides specialist training for third party employees in lifting techniques from a training centre in Loughborough. KONECRANE also offers a service specific to the nuclear industry, having been active in the sector for more than 50 years.

MOSA is based in Cusago, a suburb of Milan, Italy and has been in the business of producing professional and high quality generating sets and engine driven welders and generating sets since 1963. During this period, MOSA Italy has delivered hundreds of thousands of engine driven welders to satisfied clients around the world.

About MOSA & Its History

MOSA was founded in Cusago in 1963 by the BCS Group, which specializes in manufacturing mowers and tractors. BCS SpA was founded 20 years earlier in a tiny workshop, supplying the needs of local farmers, and found immediate success. The aim with MOSA was to build on the BCS SpA reputation for excellence in the agricultural sector, and to take that ethos into the field of motor-welding equipment, industrial machines, as well as generating sets. Today MOSA Italy is the industrial division of the BCS-Ferrari Group, after further acquisitions by BCS in the 1980s. MOSA products are manufactured in a high-tech environment covering some 75,000sqm. An engineering department develops new ideas and tests new products to make sure that they comply with the latest CE regulations on noise, while still providing sufficient cooling for engines. Production facilities at the plant employ highly qualified personnel dedicated to MOSA aims of ensuring high quality and reliable products. The plant is a full production facility, with sheet metal parts produced in house. Quality control is conducted under rigorous conditions and each machine is bench tested for between one and two hours. Together, the BCS-Ferrari group, which incorporates MOSA, is a trusted, well-established giant in Italian industrial and agricultural machinery.

  • Generating sets

KUBOTA is a world-leading heavy machinery and tractor company, based in Japan, which employs more than 34,000 people globally. KUBOTA is the German market-leader in compact and zero tail excavators. The famous Japanese manufacturer is well known for it's accuracy and high end production value. If you are looking for a used Kubota machine, you can be assured that the machine you will buy used will be probably in the best of condition.

The History of KUBOTA Corporation 

KUBOTA was founded in 1890 in Osaka, the city where it still has its headquarters today. Gonshiro Kubota started the company to make cast iron waterpipes.

Early in the 20th century, KUBOTA began to specialise in powered machinery, the field in which it has excelled in ever since, with an emphasis on the heavy machinery sector. KUBOTA's main market is the construction industry, where its range of excavators of all sizes and capabilities is recognised as a high quality choice. KUBOTA also manufactures for agriculture, with the first of its tractors exported to the United States in 1969.

Over time, KUBOTA has constructed several manufacturing facilities in the US. Overall, KUBOTA Corporation is now the largest manufacturer of diesel engines under 100HP in the world. The company says that it is more flexible, modern and successful now than at any point in its long history.

Kubota Main Products: from Mowers to Tractors to Excavators

Working in markets around the world, KUBOTA has its products on thousands of construction sites, providing essential service to their operators. Its tractors are the choice of farmers in many parts of the globe, while its utility vehicles are relied on by the armed forces of several countries. The wide range of KUBOTA mowers for both domestic and commercial users are known for their reliability and the company's reputation for innovation. KUBOTA's mission statement is 'for earth, for life', emphasising its commitment to minimise the impact on the environment of every one of the products that it produces.

KNUTH is one of the leading manufacturers of "all in one" metal working machinery, which combines various functions such as cutting, sanding, milling and drilling. Based in Germany, it has an international presence with offices in more than 40 countries.

Specializing in Metalworking Since 1923

Since its founding in the German city of Konigsberg in 1923, KNUTH GmbH has become one of Europe's leading manufacturers of metal working machinery, with a workforce of more than 400 and a presence on 40 countries across the world. KNUTH works across a wide spectrum of metal working processes, providing machinery designed for process as varied as milling, drilling, turning, cutting, sawing and sanding, and also provides integrated packages which combine a number of these tasks.

The modern day corporate HQ is in the German town of Neumünster, but KNUTH also has German facilities in Denkendorf, Neuenhagen and Bocholt. It also has offices in international locations like Estonia, Brazil, Russia, Poland, the Czech Republic and the United States. This means that its machinery and service functions have a worldwide reach, and are used by factories across the world. Recently, KNUTH Machine Tools has sought to follow an "everything under one roof" approach to metalworking. Under this line of practice, the firm manufactures metalworking centres which can combine different technologies such as laser, hydro and plasma cutting within one location. And using advanced controls produced in collaboration with Siemens, KNUTH Machine Tools clients can modulate their production to improve efficiency and safety.
