In more than 100 years of operation, the German firm KLOPP has become a leading European milling company. It specializes in building integrated milling centres for industrial clients, providing a high level of service and the ability to overhaul existing milling systems.

One of Germany's leading names in industrial milling 

The German company KLOPP Werkzeugmaschinen is a leading manufacturer of machine tools, having sold more than 100,000 products across the world to industrial customers. The firm was founded back in the late nineteenth century as the Industrial Revolution took hold in Germany, and it swiftly developed a reputation for manufacturing milling equipment. Recently, it has developed integrated milling systems which combine the experience gathered from a century of manufacturing with computerized technology. These systems take the form of one-piece machines which deliver stability to the user, and allows KLOPP customers to ensure precision in their milling operations. KLOPP Werkzeugmaschinen focuses on delivering "modular" solutions for milling challenges. Its products can work on up to 10 (or more) axes, and are specially adapted via consultation to the needs of clients. The company also offers an overhaul service to modernize and refit ageing equipment. This can take the shape of drive or control overhauls, even of third party brands. But the firm's own products can also be purchased as bespoke milling centres. These centres come with a range of accessories and features, such as swivelling milling heads, computerized monitoring devices, work-area enclosures to guarantee safety and advanced cooling agents. KLOPP Werkzeugmaschinen also operates a 24-hours a day service centre (for customers in Europe). The company is based in the German town of Solingen, and operates across all European nations, with sales and servicing assistance in the major European languages.

KLOPP Werkzeugmaschinen Product Portfolio

The firm manufactures the following milling products:

  • Combines horizontal and vertical knee milling systems
  • Universal production and tool milling machines
  • Bed-type milling machines
  • Mobile floor-type milling machines
  • Heavy-duty hydraulic traversing high speed shaping machines

KLOPP's products are used in any industrial setting where metals require shaping and boring. They provide services to everything from vehicle manufacturers to tool makers, but focus on larger-scale clients who require integrated milling solutions.

Mecalac France produces a wide range of equipment aimed primarily at utility construction sites and urban-railway sites. Founded in France and incorporating Ahlmann, an important German company in the same field, MECALAC produces a class-leading range of compact and full-size wheel loaders, including swing loaders, and a full range of mobile, heavy duty and crawler excavators.

The history of MECALAC S.A. 

MECALAC was founded in 1974 and made its name with a range of loaders, excavators, forklifts and tool holders from its headquarters in Annecy, France. In 2002 MECALAC merged with the leading German company Ahlmann, a pioneer in the field of swivel loaders, founded in 1952 by Josef-Severin Ahlmann. Ahlmann products already had a world-wide reputation for innovation, producing the first loaders that could tip their load off their side, a special range for the German military and, in 1979, the world's most compact swing loader. Together the combined companies, known in Germany as MECALAC Baumaschinen GmbH, have become a force to be reckoned with.

In addition to the manufacturing facilities in Büdelsdorf, Germany and Annecy, France, there are factories in Albens, France, a sales headquarters in Paris and a manufacturing facility in Turkey. MECALAC's awards include the Demopark Innovation gold medal and Observeur du Design star for the 8MCR rapid crawler excavator. In 2013, MECALAC rebranded all Ahlmann products with the MECALAC name. MECALAC says its principles are an unswerving devotion to attention to detail, innovation and performance.

MECALAC France Production portfolio 

  • Wheel loaders 
  • Swing loaders 
  • Telescopic handlers
  • Mobile excavators
  • Crawler excavators
  • Track construction

The Italian company PRAMAC (PR Industrial S.r.l.) is a world (uk, america) leader in the fields of electric generator production, materials handling and components for photovoltaic plants. With its headquarters in Siena, Italy, where the company was founded, and listed on the Italian stock exchange, PRAMAC GmbH is also well-known for its ownership of a Moto-GP team.

The history of PRAMAC SpA

The origins of PRAMAC date back to 1966 when one of its constituent companies L'Europea S.r.l. was founded by Mario Campinoti and Spartaco Benini. After a series of mergers and acquisitions, PR Industrial S.r.l. emerged in 1994. PRAMAC's focus throughout this time, with main offices still in Siena and with a presence in dozens more countries, including the US and China, has always been on producing high quality heavy duty generators, aimed primarily at industrial, telecommunications, agricultural and residential businesses. PRAMAC's portable range of generators brings these exacting standards to the user with more modest needs such as powering motor pumps, high pressure washers or as welder generators. The extensive Powermate range, a trademark acquired in 2008, offers more alternatives with outputs ranging from 3000 to 12500 watts. PR Industrial S.r.l. compact stackers, through its Lifter S.r.l. division, are part of an innovative material handling equipment range aimed at warehouse usage. In 2007, the company formed Proit and Solar Express, two companies dedicated to the renewable energies sector, which along with another new subsidiary, PRAMAC Swiss S.A., develops panels and components for photovoltaic systems. The company's Moto-GP team made its debut in 2002 and races in association with Ducati.

PRAMAC Product Portfolio

  • Stationery generator sets 
  • Portable generator sets 
  • Portable generators aimed at the retail market 
  • Lifter handling systems 
  • Photovoltaic systems

The German firm ALCO manufactures high quality, reliable food processing equipment and covers a wide range of different equipment classes, from cookers to conveyors, tenderisers and slicers.

One of Europe's leading manufacturers of food processing machinery

ALCO is a German company that manufactures equipment and machinery for use in the food processing industry. The firm was founded in 1977 by Heinz and Gertrud Agra. ALCO-food-machines GmbH rapidly expanded during the 1980s, selling high quality catering equipment to distributors across the world. In the process, the firm attracted high profile clients such as Keystone, Coburger, Heidemark and Stefri, who introduced the company's selection of grinders, forming machines, tenderisers, pasteurization systems and coolant machinery into their production lines. ALCO currently operates a broad network of distributors, which allows them to sell their products on every continent. Although their distributors are clustered in Europe, the firm has outlets in South Africa, the United States and Asia. Along with this extensive distribution network ALCO also operates a comprehensive service and training wing. Clients can receive full training using the firm's food processing equipment, and ALCO also ensure that all purchases include full maintenance contracts, to ensure that purchasers get the most out of their packages.

Offering the full range of food processing machinery

Since the 1980s, ALCO have been at the forefront of the industrial food processing industry, allowing clients to achieve new levels of quality in their products, while increasing efficiency and revenues. The firm caters for all kinds of food manufacturer. Their battering and coating machines are used extensively in the pasta preparation sector, as well as by firms who need to coat meat in breadcrumbs before preservation. ALCO's continuous fryer units have also helped potato chip manufacturers and cooked meat producers to perfect their products. Their forming machines are also used extensively in the manufacturing of common foodstuffs like potato croquettes, hamburgers and cheeses. All of the firm's products are designed to cut down on labour, improve safety and allow for customization, with high-tech IT systems integrated into each unit. This reflects ALCO's constant search for innovative new ways of food processing, and has helped to cement its position as a European leader in its field.

The ALCO product portfolio

The range of food processing equipment manufactured by ALCO includes:

  • Frozen meat and combined grinders
  • HotCook mixers
  • Forming machines
  • Flattening machines
  • Tenderisers
  • Cordon bleu slicing machines
  • Preduster coating machines
  • Contact cookers
  • Spiral freezers
  • Conveyor heaters
  • Conveyor belts
  • Flavour application machines

The range of products manufactured by ALCO are generally used in food processing plants. Many different types of food are made using the firm's equipment, from cheeses and potato products to processed meats and pastries. Their cookers and freezers may also be appropriate for larger catering establishments such as hotels and conference centres.

ATIKA GmbH is a German company based in the town of Ahlen, which manufactures gardening, construction and woodworking machinery.

Supplying gardening and construction machinery since 1949

ATIKA is a German firm which specializes in the manufacture of gardening and construction machinery. The company was founded in 1949, and expanded throughout the post-war period, capitalizing on rising demand for gardening equipment and machinery for use in house-building. This led to ATIKA products being adopted by customers as far afield as Portugal and Scandinavia, as the firm became one of Europe's leading machinery manufacturers. The company bases its strategy around customer satisfaction, and being able to deliver a service which stretches from consultation about customer needs, through to production, delivery and maintenance.

Production takes place at the ATIKA factory in the German town of Ahlen, where the firm has constructed a 40,000 square metre facility, and where they also invest heavily in research and development in order to bring new products to market. The firm's current portfolio of products spans a number of machining sectors. The firm's core range remains in supplying gardening and land management companies and public bodies. It manufacturers advanced equipment such as tillers, brush cutters and blowers that assist with land maintenance both for businesses and private clients. However, ATIKA has also branched out into the production of woodworking equipment, specializing in light machining centres for craftsmen and small companies. The firm also supplies a suite of construction equipment that includes technologies such as cement mixers and de-humidifiers. This allows ATIKA to supply comprehensive solutions to house-builders or those renovating existing properties, where a variety of machining tasks are required.

The ATIKA product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by ATIKA includes:

  • Construction circular saws
  • Concrete mixers
  • Radial tile cutters
  • De-humidifiers
  • Handheld agitators
  • Earth augers
  • Brush cutters
  • Garden shredders
  • Hedge trimmers
  • Power pruners
  • Chain saws
  • Vacuum blowers
  • Tillers and motor hoes
  • Lawn trimmers
  • Sawhorses
  • Patio heaters
  • Scarifiers
  • Log splitters
  • Planing machines

The products manufactured by ATIKA are used by many different kinds of client. However, their products are mainly purchased by gardening, land management and construction companies. However, the firm also supplies individuals requiring high performance gardening machinery.

The German firm BÄUERLE manufactures advanced paper manipulation machinery which includes paper insertion, folding and creasing devices for use in the administrative and printing sectors.

MB BÄUERLE Leads in Professional Paper Processing

MB BÄUERLE was founded by German clockmaker Matthais BÄUERLE in 1863, but became the paper processing company that it is today in the 1950s. As post-war Germany took off economically, the firm began producing efficient paper-manipulation machinery that became popular in factories and offices across the country. During the 1970s, BÄUERLE pioneered automated folding machinery, and further developed its sophisticated paper folding technology with the introduction of computer controlled buckle folding equipment in 1990. The 1990s saw the firm introduce more new techniques, such as compute controlled folder production, and the company continued to innovate, creating multi-purpose paper manipulation systems which can handle many different formats of paper. During the 2000s, BÄUERLE pushed forward the limits of paper processing, developing devices that can process 23,000 documents per hour, pitching them at large administrative organizations, and introduced products which made mass mailings increasingly efficient. This cemented BÄUERLE's position as one of the most forward-thinking firms in the world of paper processing technology.

MB BÄUERLE- custom-built paper processing equipment

The firm concentrates on making post-press paper handling as simple as possible for operators to manage. This means concentrating closely on ensuring that processes are as automated as possible, are easy to set up and maintain, and require as little staff training as possible. Modular design techniques are also used by BÄUERLE to produce custom-built paper processing centres which precisely meet the needs of their clients. The firm has expanded across the world, with sales outlets operating in 60 countries. These representatives work hand in hand with clients to ensure that every aspect of their paper processing needs is met. Along with its current range of machines, BÄUERLE also offers a huge selection of second hand machines, as well as devices produced by other manufacturers. The firm has also created effective partnerships with global electronics giants such as Canon and Xerox, ensuring that BÄUERLE's technology is an instrumental part of offices and factories across the world, even if the company itself is not a household name.

Used BÄUERLE Processing Machines

Used BÄUERLE folding and paper processing machines are a valuable solution for starting business. If you want to provide mailing or paper processing, this service then BÄUERLE machines are for you. As a world renowned manufacturer of this type of machines they are expensive. Used BÄUERLE machines can give you the cheap solution for paper processing machines. Due to top quality of machines buy BÄUERLE, even used machines are good to be used for a long time. 

The BÄUERLE product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by BÄUERLE is wide and includes among others:

  • Automated paper insertion machines
  • Automated paper folding machines
  • Mass mailing machinery
  • Creasing machinery
  • Flat pile feeders
  • Conveyor belts for paper delivery
  • Knife fold units
  • Gluing equipment
  • Remote maintenance modules

The products manufactured by BÄUERLE are used by organizations that require large amounts of paper processing, using techniques like folding and professional creasing. Their partners could include corporate offices, communication firms and printers as well as public bodies.

A subsidiary of the BAUER Group of companies, BAUER AG manufactures heavy equipment including drills, cranes and piling hammers that is used by the oil and gas, mining and construction sectors.

One of the world's major players in drilling and foundation technology

German firm BAUER AG manufactures equipment for use in the construction of foundations, as well as drilling machinery for use in mining and oil and gas extraction. BAUER Germany traces its origins to 1970, when as a construction firm, BAUER realized that there was a lack of high quality pile driving and anchor drilling machinery available, so they decided to produce their own. By 1976, BAUR AG has produced superior models of both anchor drills and pile driving machinery for use on their own products, but word spread and soon BAUER machinery was on demand in construction projects across Europe. The firm also realised that the only way to continue to build equipment in-house was to produce in bulk and sell to other construction firms, which they began to do with great success in the 1980s. The 1990s BAUER AG saw focus totally on foundation drilling and pile driving, making several strategic acquisitions as they sought to cover every size of drill. In so doing, BAUER established a position at the head of the marketplace, not just within Europe, but worldwide.

Experts in Drilling in Extreme Conditions

Nowadays, the firm is known for being able to manufacture drilling rigs with high tolerance of extreme conditions. Their oil and gas rigs, for example, can weigh up to 500 tonnes and can be customized with features such as mud handling systems and hydraulic roughnecks. BAUER has also taken advantage of the drive towards renewable energy sources, providing maritime drilling solutions for constructors of wind turbines and those seeking access to marine gas hydrate reservoirs. BAUER is also extremely customer-centred, and offers a range of services to new and existing clients such as a comprehensive used parts provisioning service and an online customer centre which supplies support and consultancy services. The firm also sells used BAUER machines, clearly specifying their age and the number of hours that they have been used for. This transparency is in keeping with the stated company ethic, to prioritise safety, efficiency, reliability, environmental protection and quality. BAUER makes a point of sending German employees to sites across the world to the company's production locations in the Americas, Africa and Asia where they can provide advice and supervision regarding these core principles.

Website: bauer.de/en

The BAUER Machine Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by BAUER includes:

  • Diaphragm-wall rigs
  • Slurry treatment equipment
  • Depth vibrators
  • Foundation cranes
  • Hydraulic power packs
  • Universal-piling and anchor-drilling  rigs
  • Piling hammers
  • Exploration-water and geothermal drilling rigs
  • Blasthole drills

BAUER Machinery is used in a range of economic sectors, but the firm's major partners are in the oil and gas, renewable energy, mining and construction industries. The firm has particular expertise in maritime energy exploration and the foundation stage of urban construction projects.

BELL EQUIPMENT Company specializes in the manufacturing of rugged articulated dump trucks and custom modules for use with these trucks. The firm is a German subsidiary of the South African firm BELL EQUIPMENT.

Website: bellequipment.com

The European branch of a leading South African vehicle manufacturer

BELL EQUIPMENT GmbH was founded in 2000 as one of the European subsidiaries of African firm BELL EQUIPMENT SOUTH AFRICA. The firm manufactures machinery for the construction industry with a focus upon the production of sturdy dump trucks for demanding conditions. Based in the town of Alsfeld, the firm also runs a factory in Eisenach and acts as the central hub for Bell's European operations. Components manufactured in South Africa are transported to Europe for assembly at BELL EQUIPMENT's factories, before being conveyed to clients across the continent from the logistics centre, which stores almost 9000 spare parts and components for the firm's construction equipment.

Creators of some of the world's most popular dump trucks

The firm's parent company has its origins in 1958, when Irvine Bell began manufacturing loaders targeted at South Africa's farmers and industrial businesses. The 1970s saw BELLEQUIPMENT move into other areas of industrial vehicles, manufacturing a popular range of earth movers and tractors and opening a huge production centre in the town of Richards Bay. However, the firm struck gold in the 1980s with its line of dump trucks, produced in partnership with Mercedes Benz, Bosch and Rexroth. These high quality, rugged vehicles acquired a following across Africa and soon, the rest of the world as well. During the 1990s, BELL Construction Equipment continued to perfect its dump truck range, introducing 40 and 50 tonne models and making their vehicles as efficient as possible. By 2000, the firm had grown to employ over 2000 people, but remained family owned. With the success of their vehicles range, the German subsidiary BELL Equipment GmbH was initiated to provide marketing support and high quality maintenance to customers. BELL Earthmoving Equipment company also set up its manufacturing facility in Eisenach, which operates an advanced production line, turning out as many as 17 vehicles per week to exacting customer specifications. By 2006, this production line had produced 1000 vehicles, proving the wisdom of the choice to expand into Europe.

The BELL EQUIPMENT product portfolio

Customised modules for the firm's dump trucks including:

  • Articulated semi-trailers
  • Rubber truck undercarriages
  • Large volume transportation bins
  • Water or fuel tanks
  • Timber transportation trailers
  • Tunnelling modules
  • Articulated dump trucks (payloads from 24,000 kg to 45,000 kg)
  • Fleet management systems Industrial lubricants for BELL EQUIPMENT products

The products manufactured by BELL EQUIPMENT are generally articulated dump trucks. These trucks are used in many different settings, from forestry to oil transportation, construction and mining. Any industrial situation where material transportation in demanding conditions is needed would be appropriate.

ALLMATIC-Jacob Spannsysteme GmbH is a Swiss manufacturer of industrial vices and clamps, which specializes in producing modular clamps which can be used in complex, custom built industrial machining centres.

A leading manufacturer of high quality industrial clamps

ALLMATIC is a firm which operates in the materials processing sector, producing milling, clamping and drilling machinery for industrial uses. The company was founded in Switzerland in 1973 as a subsidiary of the larger Saurer Group. The idea was that ALLMATIC would be a dedicated manufacturer of a dependable clamping system for the use in textile processing plants. The firm soon realised that its high pressure, high efficiency clamps could find uses in other sectors and during the 1970s, became one of Switzerland's most successful machinery manufacturers. During the 1980s, the company kept pace with the fashion for installing CNC machining centres, creating IT-enhanced clamping systems, while the 1990s saw even further technological developments with ALLMATIC introducing an 8-way clamping system as well as modular designs that could be totally customized according to the needs of customers. Organizational changes followed in 2001 when Saurer sold off ALLMATIC, and the firm was rechristened ALLMATIC-Jakob Spannsysteme GmbH within the Jacob group of companies. However, these changes did not prevent further innovation, and in 2004, the firm introduced its radical GRIPP clamping system, which allows for even greater efficiency when machining wood, plastics or metals.

A locally based company with a global sales network

ALLMATIC's company philosophy revolves around ensuring that staff are appropriately skilled to meet the needs of customers, so that they can provide the right advice and support during the purchasing process. This is coupled with a commitment to high quality products via process optimization techniques. Despite its success, the firm remains based firmly in the community of Unterthingau, where the firm issues a number of traineeships every year, and is a mainstay of the local economy. The company's factory in Unterthingau manufactures the firm's range of power intensifiers. These products are engineered to be both efficient and durable, due to the "lifetime lubrication" that is built into their design. Additionally, ALLMATIC seeks to reduce the cost of production by including standardised components, while ensuring that they can be easily customized at the point of use. This combination of adaptable design, low cost and high quality customer support has allowed ALLMATIC to build a network of sales representatives across all continents of the globe. This includes the provision of spare parts, and online support via CAD designs and operating instructions, ensuring that ALLMATIC clamping systems can be used to their full potential.

ALLMATIC Product Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by ALLMATIC includes:

  • ALLMATIC basic clamps
  • ALLMATIC HD heavy machining clamps
  • ALLMATIC NC horizontal machining clamps
  • GRIPP series clamps for multiple axes machining
  • Tower systems featuring multiple attachments
  • Pictographs for use with ALLMATIC systems

The products manufactured by ALLMATIC are industrial clamps and vices for use in basic and complex machining tasks. Clients might include any industrial organization that needs to manipulate and process materials like wood, metals, plastic and cardboard.

AEG Electric Tools is a German power tools manufacturer which offers a very wide selection of high-performance tools that are aimed at professional clients. The firm has its origins in the well-known German manufacturer, AEG.

A world-leading power tools manufacturer with an illustrious history

AEG Electric Tools GmbH is the part of the (now dissolved) manufacturing firm AEG which produces tools for metalworking, drilling and woodworking. AEG (Allgemeine Elektricitäts-Gesellschaft) first started producing electric tools in 1898, when the firm created the first mobile drilling device. However, the firm has its roots in its parent company, which was formed by Emil Rathenau in 1883. Under Rathenau's stewardship, AEG became one of the world's largest manufacturers of electric tools and one of Europe's great engineering firms, building everything from ocean liners to planes and railways. The challenges posed by taking on such tasks meant that AEG developed its own tool manufacturing subsidiary. Initially designed for in-house use, products like the mobile drill became global best-sellers for their adaptability and quality.

From in-house workshop to world-class tool manufacturer

During the twentieth century, AEG marched on, introducing radical new ways of manufacturing its tools and bringing together the world of modernist art with the factory. The firm's beautiful, effective tools and factories became symbols of industrial progress. With tool manufacturing booming, the 1930s saw AEG set up a dedicated tool factory in the German town of Winnenden, and the company rapidly expanded its portfolio of products, introducing innovations like insulated drills and straight grinders. By the 1960s, the Winnenden plant allowed AEG Electric Tools to manufacture 20,000 tools per day, supplying the booming German economy. Technologies continued to be introduced as well, with AEG pioneering the production of micro-chip enhanced tools. In the 1980s, the firm expanded into the American market, with a modern production facility in the state of Connecticut. The tools branch also gained fame by producing a cordless screwdriver that was used by NASA astronauts, a sign of how forward-thinking AEG Electric Tools had become. During the 1990s, with AEG in general struggling, the tools manufacturing branch was sold to Swedish firm Copco, and then to TTI. Despite the problems of its parent company, AEG Electric Tools remains a success story, supplying advanced machining solutions to professional and private clients alike.

The AEG Electric Tools product portfolio

 The range of products manufactured by AEG Electric Tools includes:

  • Drills
  • Rotary and combi hammers
  • Large demolition hammers
  • Impact wrenches
  • Reciprocating saws
  • Circular saws
  • Heavy duty jigsaws
  • Angle and die grinders
  • Polishers
  • Metal chopsaws
  • Tablesaws
  • Dust extractors
  • Heat guns
  • Right angle, palm, belt and random orbit sanders
  • Wall chasers
  • Combo routers
  • Bodygrip, tophandle and palm jigsaws
  • Plungesaws
  • Percussion drills
  • Dry diamond drills
  • Lithium batteries for cordless appliances
  • Flashlights

The products manufactured by AEG Electric Tools are used in a huge variety of industries, from energy, automobile construction, boat-building and house-building to metal-working and wood-working.

Based in Nagoya, Japan, AICHIKIKAI has gained success by manufacturing high performance engines and engine parts for car manufacturers. The firm also manufactures automated industrial vehicles for use on factory production lines.

Supplying engines for Nissan cars and spare parts since the 1950s

AICHIKIKAI is a Japanese firm which focuses on the manufacturing of industrial vehicles and vehicle engines. Initially founded as a clock-making company in the city of Nagoya, AICHIKIKAI started manufacturing vehicles after World War Two, producing light three wheeled vehicles for commercial use. During the 1960s, the firm expanded through a partnership with car maker Nissan, and AICHIKIKAI produced engines for many popular consumer cars during the 1970s and 80s, making over 5 million by 1976. By the late 1980s, AICHIKIKAI had manufactured 15 million engines and over a million vehicles, expanding its production facilities constantly to meet demand. The firm opened an American subsidiary in 2001, and continued to be the major supplier of engines to Nissan.

From supplying Nissan to pioneering automated factory vehicles

Nowadays, AICHIKIKAI operates four factories in Japan, as well as two corporate offices, but delivers engines to clients across the world. Along with Nissan, their corporate partners have include Renault and Suzuki, as clients have been attracted by the firm's reputation for reliability. The firm now supplies both fully functional engines and manual transmissions, as well as automobile parts that can be easily shipped to clients across the world. AICHIKIKAI can manufacture custom made cylinder blocks, head covers, oil pans and water outlets, allowing customers to custom-build their engines from scratch. Customers can also benefit from expert support provided by AICHIKIKAI technicians from the Nagoya corporate headquarters. The company has begun to focus closely on supplying industrial organizations with multi-functional vehicles, introducing ground-breaking models of automated guided vehicles that are designed to link together production lines in factories. These have been particularly successful within the automobile industry, but can be adapted to other production environments as well, and can be remotely controlled via multifunctional motor sensors. Another aspect of automobile technology that AICHIKIKAI has been involved in is the development of electric vehicles, and the firm supplies parts for Nissan's increasingly popular range of fuel cell hybrid vehicles.

The AICHIKIKAI product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by AICHIKIKAI includes:

  • Automobile engines
  • Manual transmissions
  • Cylinder blocks
  • Cylinder heads
  • Oil pans
  • Water outlets
  • Bearing caps and cylinder liners
  • Crankshafts, connecting rods and camshafts
  • Transmission cases
  • Shift forks
  • Transmission gears
  • Clutch gears
  • Automated guided vehicles
  • Multifunctional motor sensors
  • Reduction gear for electric vehicles

The range of products manufactured by AICHIKIKAI is mainly intended for use in the automobile manufacturing sector, although their industrial vehicles could find uses in many factory settings. Their clients have included Suzuki, Renault and Nissan, their major corporate partner.

These products are intended to be used for soil preparation before planting, managing lawns and maintaining paths. They are suited to farms, smallholdings, parks departments, corporate clients and private homes.

The German firm AWS SCHÄFER have been manufacturing high quality piping and pipe manufacturing equipment since the 1950s. They supply engineering systems and piping to clients in the oil and gas, energy and manufacturing sectors.

Global experts in the provision of pipe-lines and pipe manufacturing machinery

AWS SCHÄFER Technologie GmbH is a German firm which specializes in the manufacture of machinery for pipe-forming and processing. Founded in the 1950s, AWS SCHÄFER supplies advanced piping solutions to clients in a wide variety of sectors, from the oil and gas industry, to food manufacturing and energy generation. The company remains a family-owned concern, and continues to be anchored in the community of Wilnsdorf, where it was founded. But it has expanded greatly since being founded, rising to become a world-leading supplier of piping products to industrial projects around the world. The firm works with a diverse number of materials, including steel, plastics, aluminium, copper and custom made alloys for specific applications. This expertise allows AWS SCHÄFER to supply any clients who require high quality, dependable piping to be installed, whatever materials this piping will be handling.

At the forefront of pipe manufacturing across the world

The firm manufacturers many different kinds of product, all of them related to piping. For example, AWS SCHÄFER are specialists in induction bending, which allows them to form metal piping into intricate shapes without compromising the integrity of the materials being used. Other areas of expertise include pipeline calibration - which ensures that the finished product will be properly installed and safe. AWS SCHÄFER also offer other piping solutions as well, such as t-fitting and hydro-forming for tasks which require a particularly high level of complexity and attention to detail. The firm's hydro-forming equipment is shipped to companies across the world in fields as varied as automobile manufacture, aircraft construction and high-end product design. These products place AWS SCHÄFER in the vanguard of modern pipeline construction, and allow the firm to design bespoke solutions for different customers. The firm promises customers that it will assist with every stage of the process, from designing an appropriate piping product, optimizing the product for cost, training staff to use the firm's IT systems and maintaining equipment after delivery. AWS SCHÄFER will also recondition older systems if they require updating, and can advise on how clients can best organize their manufacturing systems to improve efficiency.

The AWS SCHÄFER product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by AWS SCHÄFER includes:

  • Induction bending machines
  • Hydro forming machines
  • Pipe calibration machines
  • Hydro formed piping
  • T-fittings
  • Pipe and manufacturing tools
  • Custom built piping equipment

The range of products offered by AWS SCHÄFER is purchased by many different kinds of manufacturer. Clients include aircraft and automobile manufacturers, energy generators, oil and gas companies, food processors and public bodies such as sewage purification organizations.

The German firm PRESSTA EISELE GmbH are specialists in manufacturing equipment that is used in the aluminium processing sector. Their products are often used in manufacturing cars and planes, as well as the construction and energy sectors.

From manufacturing window frames to supplying major car makers

PRESSTA EISELE manufacture milling and cutting equipment for the aluminium processing industry. PRESSTA EISELE GmbH are based in the German town of Bullay, the company started out manufacturing equipment that was used to shape door-ways and window frames in the booming 1980s German economy. However, demand for PRESSTA's products rose rapidly as clients saw the potential for precision aluminium processing, and the firm acquired major clients in the aerospace and automobile manufacturing sectors. As firms started to use light-weight but strong materials like aluminium, they began to require the most precise processing equipment available, and only experience firms like PRESSTA EISELE could supply their needs.

Expanding overseas and keeping the industrial organization as efficient as possible

The firm also began its international expansion at an early stage, recognising that a large proportion of its revenues would come from exports. In the early 1990s, subsidiaries were opened across Eastern Europe in nations such as Slovakia, Poland and the Czech Republic as well as an Asian sales hub in Singapore and offices in Indonesia and China. Despite this, because of its high level of efficiency, PRESSTA EISELE employ a small workforce of 80 people at its factory in Bullay, and are still able to support clients on an international basis, wherever there is a need for precision aluminium processing. Their products are widely used in industrial environments which now stretch well beyond window manufacturing. For example, PRESSTA's milling equipment is often used in power plants - a sign of how reliable the firm's machinery is seen to be by its international partners.

PRESSTA EISELE Product Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by PRESSTA EISELE includes:

  • Automatic and manual circular saws
  • Loading magazines
  • Roller conveyors
  • Measuring systems
  • Double head mitre saws
  • Machining centres
  • Swarf extractors
  • Corner crimping machines
  • Punching machines
  • End milling machines
  • Notching saws
  • V-notch saws
  • Copy routers
  • Drilling machinery
  • Solar processing machinery

PRESSTA's equipment could be used by any organization that requires the precise processing of aluminium for industrial uses. This may include car makers, aerospace companies, power plants and house builders.

RITTAL manufacture containers, enclosures and casings for power cables, manufacturing processes and IT systems.

Specialists in manufacturing containers and enclosures for industrial applications

RITTAL GmbH & Co. KG is a German firm which focuses on the manufacture of enclosures, casings and containers for industrial and IT applications. The RITTAL story begins in 1961 when the firm introduced its very first enclosure product, but international expansion really took off in the 1970s. With manufacturing firms introducing expensive computerised technology, RITTAL began manufacturing systems for keeping IT products safe and separated from workspaces. These enclosures became a Europe-wide success, with the firm opening subsidiaries in Sweden and the Netherlands and relocating to larger premises in the town of Herborn. The firm made a major shift in 1982 when it decided to add power distribution to its area of operations, and the firm began producing secure units for cabling and power generation systems.

Becoming an international firm and developing the RITTAL "system"

Production also grew outside Germany, with factories opening in the UK and United States during the 1980s. In 1983, the company also made another big step forward with the establishment of its climate control division, which deals with self-contained air conditioning and heating systems. By the 1990s, RITTAL had started to sell large amounts of its technology to Asia and continued to introduce innovative, user-friendly forms of enclosure. In 2008, this was complemented by the creation of a comprehensive consulting service, which seeks to spread the gospel of the "RITTAL system" across the world. This system is the firm's core product - involving physical products such as containers and power enclosures, as well as a global system of service and support and complete engineering systems. This has been rolled out in a number of major industrial sectors, including car manufacturing, plant engineering and complex IT projects. It has also led to the firm expanding to include more than 10,000 employees, with 11 production facilities across the globe.

The RITTAL product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by RITTAL includes:

  • Small and compact enclosures
  • Specialist enclosures for IT systems

  • Power distribution systems
  • Air cooling units
  • IT cooling systems
  • Liquid cooling systems
  • IT data centres
  • Planning and project management software

The products manufactured by RITTAL can be used in many different settings, from the food industry to power plants and major data processing centres. Major clients come from industrial sectors such as car production, as well as large IT-based organizations.

The German company SATA manufactures paint guns, air filtration equipment and accessories for use in industrial applications such as car and plane production and advanced carpentry.

One of Europe's leading manufacturers of industrial painting equipment

The German firm SATA manufactures equipment for the paint application industry. The company was founded by Arthur Haeberle and August Drehmann in 1906 and initially manufactured surgical instruments. The firm changed focus in the 1920s, introducing the first of its spray guns in 1926, and SATA steadily became one of the leading firms in the field. By the 1960s, the company had set up a network of sales operatives that was active across Europe and was a major supplier of equipment to the booming automotive sector. In the 1980s, the firm expanded still further, opening a new manufacturing facility in the town of Kornwestheim and taking on a new name - SATA Farbspritztechnik GmbH and Co. The 2000s saw SATA improving its logistics performance with the creation of a new dedicated logistics centre, as the company scored regularly among the 100 most innovative firms in Germany. 2006 found SATA in an even stronger position, with the opening of the firm's UK subsidiary in the town of Newmarket, and continuing introduction of new technologies courtesy of the company's research and development centre. This has led to some exciting breakthroughs in paint application, such as the SATAjet 4000 B which allows for photorealistic imaging on metals and plastics. Nowadays, SATA has over 250 employees and is heavily export oriented, with over 70 percent of sales taking place overseas. The company has achieved such success by working closely with clients from the beginning of their purchase process to completion, as well as in supporting existing clients via training and the maintenance of SATA products.

The SATA product portfolio

The range of paint-related products manufactured by SATA includes:

  • Car refinishing products
  • Specialist painting systems for high viscosity materials
  • HVLP spray guns
  • RP spray guns
  • High pressure and airbrush guns
  • Automatic paint guns
  • Spray bottles and cleaning bottles
  • Sieves
  • Breathing protection equipment
  • Air filtration equipment

The products manufactured by SATA are used in many industrial situations, but their major clients are in the aerospace and automotive sectors. Clients could also include carpentry firms and printing companies.

BÜRKLE manufacture equipment that is used in lamination and lacquering processes. Clients include electronics firms, house builders, car companies and banks.

Worldwide suppliers of lacquering and laminating systems

Robert BÜRKLE GmbH Freudenstadt is a German firm which manufactures lacquering and laminating systems for the electronics, construction, carpentry, automotive and energy sectors. BÜRKLE has two major manufacturing facilities in the German towns of Freudenstadt and Rietberg-Mastholte where the firm manufactures advanced materials processing machinery. The company has a strong focus on providing total production solutions for their clients, with all of the different parts of the production process brought into one system. Their success has led to BÜRKLE GmbH operating subsidiaries across the world in countries as diverse as the United States, China and Germany. Initially, the firm started as a supplier of lacquering products to the furniture industry.

Website: buerkle-gmbh.de

Supplying lamination solutions to the European economy

As Germany boomed after the Second World War, firms like BÜRKLE stepped in to supply efficient machinery that firms needed to build new offices and homes. This soon developed into a much larger lacquering and laminating operation as the demand grew for products like car interiors and electronic circuit boards. Robert BÜRKLE GmbH became experts in supplying laminated circuit boards for computer manufacturers, as well as the magnetised plastic cards used by credit card companies and banks. More recently, the company has also been a market leader in supplying the solar photovoltaic industry with specialist laminating equipment that is used to supply renewable energy across the world. The firm has also developed innovative home insulation materials as well as new ways to coat brake pads and gaskets in automobiles.

BÜRKLE Product Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by Robert BÜRKLE GmbH includes:

  • Coating systems for car components
  • Systems for profiling and packing insulation boards
  • Lamination equipment of the solar industry
  • Plastic card manufacturing systems
  • Circuit board laminators
  • Flooring, furniture and wood panel laminators

The lacquering and laminating products manufactured by BÜRKLE are used in many different applications from the production of computers to manufacturing credit cards and renewable energy solutions.

The German company REMS is a leading manufacturer of specialist tools for use in pipe cutting and forming, such as saws, jointing tools and soldering irons. Their products are widely used in sewage, sanitation and heating systems.

A world-leading manufacturer of pipe cutting and forming equipment

REMS GmbH & Co. KG is a German firm which specializes in manufacturing tools used in making piping for heating and sanitation applications. Founded in 1909, REMS began life as a hand tool manufacturer, but swiftly expanded into electrical tools and heavy machinery. The firm has a strict adherence to quality guidelines and carries out most of its component manufacturing in-house, including its own heat treatment shop. Through rigorous quality control, REMS manages to create cutting blades and tools that are durable and strong - being adapted to cleanly cut through all forms of metal piping. Along with its manufacturing facilities, REMS also invests in the skills of both its own employees and those of its clients.

Investing in automation and skills at their factory in Waiblingen

The company runs a 1,600 square metre training centre, where clients are introduced to the range of REMS metal cutting machinery available. And REMS GmbH also provides bespoke consultancy packages to ensure that the right tools are provided for each project. Another aspect of REMS which differs from competitors is the firm's use of a dedicated service and sales teams, with support staff tasked with carrying out on-site demonstrations of the firm's equipment. This equipment is all manufactured in the town of Waiblingen near Stuttgart, where the highly skilled workforce operates flexible production lines, allowing the company to adapt its production systems to the needs of major clients. REMS has also invested fully in the installation of CNC machining centres, bringing a high level of automation to its production processes, and driving up efficiency, and also operates a thorough process of product testing throughout the process to ensure safety and reliability.

The REMS product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by REMS GmbH & Co. KG includes:

  • Threading machines and REMS pipe threading tools
  • Reciprocating saws
  • Circular saws
  • Pipe cutting machines
  • Electric pipe cutters
  • Pipe bending machines
  • Press jointing tools
  • Soldering guns and irons
  • Freezing units
  • Pipe inspection cameras and cleaning kits
  • Plastic pipe welders
  • Diamond drills

The products manufactured by REMS are used in factories and plants across the world, wherever high quality metal or plastic piping is required. They are particularly common in the food processing industry and energy, where fluids need to be transported securely, but are also used in sanitation applications across a broad spectrum of public and private bodies.

RUPES SpA is an Italian firm based near Milan that manufactures dust extraction machinery and power tools such as polishers, grinders, drills and sanders.

One of Europe's largest manufacturers of power tools and dust extraction machinery

The Italian company RUPES manufactures power tools and dust extraction machinery for industrial clients. RUPES SpA was founded in Milan in 1947 and initially found fame as a manufacturer of some of Italy's finest electrical sanders. The firm then introduced their innovative range of light-weight electrical drills with polymer casings instead of bulky metal. This innovation continued with the introduction of a revolutionary new orbital sander in 1968 and the production of industrial dust extractors from 1969. During the 1970s, RUPES Tools opted to focus on making their tools as easy to use as possible, creating popular models such as their electric palm orbital sander which could be easily operated with one hand alone. In the late 1970s and 80s, RUPES SpA focused closely on building some of the most effective dust extraction systems yet seen, introducing innovations such as centralized vacuum extraction systems and mobile trolleys that could be used anywhere in the workplace.

Continual innovation and collaboration to drive changes

The pace of technological change did not decelerate in the 1990s, with new compact models of polisher and improvements to the firm's renowned electrical motors. The firm's factory facilities became almost wholly automated, improving efficiency, and RUPES entered new areas such as the production of modular container systems for workshops and factories. Tools were also introduced specifically for the construction and masonry trades, as well as fully customizable, portable orbital sanders. Because of its success, RUPES Tools has acquired a huge network of distributors with sales taking place across the world. The firm has also chosen to partner with major industrial firms such as 3M in developing research facilities, and has also chosen to maintain a rigorous system of checks before any RUPES SpA product enters the marketplace.

RUPES tools Product Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by RUPES SpA is as follows:

  • Grinders
  • Sanders
  • Polishers
  • Cordless and drills
  • Woodworking tools
  • Heat guns
  • Glazing machines
  • Masonry milling machines
  • Infrared dryers
  • Dust extraction systems
  • Specialist low voltage systems

RUPES tools are used in a number of industrial sectors including the automobile manufacturing sector, shipping and boat-building, and the construction sector - with a focus on masonry.

Based in the Spanish city of Almeria, PIQUERSA is a firm that manufactures street sweeping and cleaning vehicles, as well as  forklift trucks and earth-moving equipment.

One of Europe's leading manufacturers of cleaning and earth moving vehicles

PIQUERSA MAQUINARIA SA. is a Spanish firm which manufactures industrial vehicles, including earth movers, dumper trucks, beach cleaning vehicles and  street sweepers. The firm's expertise generally lies in the field of environmental management, but it was originally founded in the late 1980s as a producer of earth moving equipment alone. The firm was born from Piquer Hermanos, S.A, which has a history of manufacturing dumpsters which stretches back to 1955. Nowadays, PIQUERSA operates a 10,000 square metre factory facility, which also includes an extensive exhibition hall, and also runs sales operations in different regions of Spain and Portugal. The firm was founded in Almeria on Spain's southern coast, and swiftly decided that there was a need for simpler, easier to use industrial vehicles across a wide variety of different markets.

Partnering with major manufacturers and retaining their roots

From their roots in earth moving equipment, PIQUERSA MAQUINARIA expanded rapidly, introducing concrete mixers, and then a broad selection of  cleaning machinery. This has been combined with creating a wide distribution network, which allows the company to distribute industrial vehicles manufactured by international partners such as Applied Sweepers and Cherrington beach cleaners. The modern firm emphasizes the important of investing in staff skills, and focuses on ensuring that its products are of a high quality and sustainably produced. Despite becoming a supplier of cleaning and earth moving equipment to customers in the private and public sector across Europe, the company remains rooted in the community of Almeria, where it runs social and environmental projects.

PIQUERSA MAQUINARIA Product Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by PIQUERSA MAQUINARIA SA includes:

  • Dumper trucks (1750 to 4000 kg)
  • Dragging and aspiration street sweepers
  • Concrete mixers
  • Forklifts
  • Beach cleaners

The products manufactured by PIQUERSA MAQUINARIA SA are used in a variety of contexts. Their earth moving vehicles are appropriate for construction projects and mining or agricultural companies, while their cleaning equipment is used widely by municipalities in ensuring that public spaces are kept clean.

PORSCHE is a world-famous manufacturer of sports cars and everyday personal vehicles, but has also manufactured high performance diesel tractors and continues to manufacture vehicles that are used in a commercial capacity.

Manufacturing high performance cars and commercial vehicles

German firm PORSCHE is world-famous for the production of high-performance sports cars, but the firm also has a proud history of manufacturing effective and popular commercial vehicles as well. Although the world may be more familiar with PORSCHE sports cars, in the agricultural sector, the firm is more famous for its rugged vintage tractors, that have been produced for almost 80 years. The firm itself was founded in 1931 by Ferdinand PORSCHE as Dr. Ing. H.C.F. Porsche GmbH. However, the firm gained its independence when it was spun off from parent firm Vokswagen after World War Two. The firm used its expertise in manufacturing high-performance diesel engines to perfect both sports cars and tractors as demand for both forms of vehicle surged in the post-war boom.

PORSCHE tractors - a classic design 

Between 1956 and 1963, the firm manufactured over 100,000 tractors, sending them across the world to fuel agricultural modernization programmes, but production was discontinued after 1964. Despite this, thousands of the diesel tractors continued to be used for decades. The firm then switched from tractors to industrial vehicles. Since the 1960s, PORSCHE Engineering have manufactured forklifts and production machinery that is used in the automobile industry, building on the experience that the firm has gained in its consumer vehicles business. The company also manufactures a range of SUVs and cabriolet models that are suitable for use as commercial vehicles and cabs, and are widely used by major corporations for their reliability and speed. However, PORSCHE remains primarily a manufacturer of performance sports cars, and its commercial side is far smaller, although the firm does provide consulting services to industrial clients.

The PORSCHE product portfolio

The range of PORSCHE products for commercial and industrial uses includes:

  • PORSCHE Macan and Cayenne commercial vehicles
  • Industrial vehicles
  • Consulting services for the automobile manufacturing sector

PORSCHE partners with major manufacturers who require assistance in making their production processes leaner and more modern, but have particular expertise in the automobile industry. The firm's vehicles are commonly used as courtesy cars and cabs by major corporations when dealing with clients.

NERAK is a German based company, which is one of the world's most advanced manufacturers of vertical conveyors and elevators. The company's services and products are used by airports, manufacturers, warehouses, postal service agencies and packaging companies globally.

Global Frontrunner in the Field of Vertical Conveyor System & Elevating system

NERAK GmbH Fördertechnik or NERAK for short is a global leader in the field of vertical conveying and elevating systems. Using most advanced technologies for making its products, NERAK serves various industries like manufacturing, packaging, airport, agriculture and warehousing besides offering solutions to scores of companies including the postal service worldwide. Manufacturers of bulk and powder materials, packagers of items and handlers of unit loads use NERAK's advanced vertical conveying system and elevating system for material handling. This is hardly surprising considering how NERAK uses its very own unique rubber chain that has features like lubrication free, abrasion resistant, stretch free and corrosion resistant in addition to operating in a hygiene and quiet manner. NERAK GmbH is headquartered in Hambühren, a municipality that is west of Celle in Germany. NERAK fame as one of the world's most advanced manufacturers of vertical conveyors and elevators is hardly surprising. The company was founded by German engineers, Heinrich Neddermeyer and Manfred Dworak. This happened on 1 April, 1987. NERAK had various offices and operations scattered all over before finally deciding to make its headquarters along Brigitta Street in Hambühren in 1997. Use of advanced technology and a great deal of research, which resulted in the rubber chain system, is the key reason why NERAK managed to make its mark on the world within a short period of time, a span of over two decades.

Based in the Netherlands, BRABANTIA is a global leader in the production of housewares, utensils and storage solutions for the domestic market. The company's products are known for their toughness and durability.

About BRABANTIA

BRABANTIA was founded in the Dutch town of Aalst in 1919 and was initially known as VAN ELDEREN & CO. The company began by manufacturing milk cans, jugs and funnels but began to diversify as it expanded. In 1955, BRABANTIA produced its first range of pedal bins, a product for which it is probably most well-known for today. During its lifetime, BRABANTIA has always been known for its innovation and in 1999 produced a range of waste bins which featured pioneering Touch Bin technology. In 2006, the company introduced solar panels to all of its production facilities.

Although its main headquarters remain in the Netherlands, BRABANTIA also has production facilities in Belgium, Latvia and China and employs over 1,000 people worldwide. Through an extensive network of wholly-owned subsidiaries, BRABANTIA enjoys a strong presence in more than 85 countries around the world.

  • Postal storage

WINTERHALTER GmbH is a German based group of companies, which is one of the world's top manufacturers of warewashing systems and commercial dishwashing systems. WINTERHALTER's products are extensively used by bakeries, eateries, caterers, bars, airlines, hotels and households all over the globe.

Global Leader in the Field of Warewashing and Commercial Dishwashing Systems

The ever expanding and award winning history of WINTERHALTER began with one man, Karl Winterhalter. He established the company in 1947 but with the lengthy name, "Karl Winterhalter Ing. Haushaltsgegenstände und Elektrogerät" in Friedrichshafen, a city in the southern region of Germany. The initial sales of WINTERHALTER were actually household items that were made from debris. The very first WINTERHALTER commercial dishwasher, GS60 was released into the market in 1957. And there has been no turning back ever since, only tremendous expansion of company and innovation of new products. In 1998, WINTERHALTER GmbH won the FCSI Award for its new WKTS rack conveyor dishwashing system. The pass-through dishwasher GS502 was introduced into the world market in 1999. But only a year later, GS502 won the Foodservice Consultants Society International or FCSI Award. In 2003, GS315 won the Innovation Award during the Sirha Trade Fair in Lyon, France. The year 2010 saw the UC Series winning a number of prestigious awards including the Innovations Award during the Europain Exhibition in France, Paris. It was also the year when under counter warewasher UC Series were introduced into the market. In 2011, WINTERHALTER GmbH was marked as "BestMarke" in dishwashing technology by the Industry Magazine AHGZ in Germany. The year 2011 also marked the year when Karl Winterhalter reached the ripe old age of 100 years. But the following year, he died. WINTERHALTER has its headquarters in Meckenbeuren, which is on Lake Constance in Germany. It is the one of the world's leading designer and manufacturer of  warewashing and commercial dishwashing systems.

KONICA, a company founded in Japan, is one of the foremost leaders of printer solutions in the world. KONICA's products and solutions are widely used in various industries like textile printing, electronics manufacturing and display manufacturing.

Global leader in the field of printer solutions

KONICA MINOLTA HOLDINGS, Inc. or KONICA for short is actually a merger of two reputable and vastly experienced companies, KONICA CORPORATION and Minolta Co., Ltd. This happened in August, 2003. The merger brought about great expansion over the years, resulting in KONICA becoming a global leader in the field of printer solutions. KONICA CORPORATION started with the initiative of Rokusaburo Sugiura. He was a pharmacist who decided to venture into selling lithographic and photographic materials via his company, Konishiya Rokubeiten. This was in 1873. But in August 2003, the decision was made to merge with Minolta Co., Ltd. The headquarters was transferred from Shinjuku-ku to Chiyoda, both in Tokyo, Japan. In 2003, the multifunctional peripheral or MFP colour printer 8050 was released into the market. This was followed by light production printing system, bizhub PRO1050 in 2004. KONICA came up with the word, bizhub, which is a combination of biz for business with hub or centre. The world's reception of KONICA's MFPs and production printing systems were highly positive. This resulted in a series of printers with improved features being released over the years not just for the office but also for various industries including textile printing. The year 2014 marked the entry of the world's fastest ever printer, Nassenger PRO 1000 with a printing speed of 1000 square meter per hour into the market. This inkjet textile printer was first introduced in June, 2014 by KONICA with benefits like being environmentally friendly and lower consumption compared to traditional printing method for textiles using screen.

Located in the United States, FADAL Machine is one of the world's leading producers of industrial machining tools, specialising in the manufacture of CNC vertical machining centres.

About FADAL

FADAL was founded in 1961 by the de Caussin family in North Hollywood, California, the company's name being an amalgam of the four family members involved - Francis, Adrian, Dave and Larry. From the beginning, the company was dedicated to producing machines which were faster and of a higher quality than those currently on the market and soon won contracts for work within the aviation and space industries. In 1974, FADAL CNC introduced the automated tool changer to the market, a milestone event which gave the company the capital to start manufacturing its first CNC machining centres.

In 1995, FADAL Machine was purchased by corporate giant GIDDINGS & LEWIS. After closing for business in 2008, FADAL made a comeback in 2014, partnering with the MERRILL TECHNOLOGIES GROUP to produce a new range of CNC machining centres.

SCHREYER GmbH is a German based company, which has much expertise in producing line systems and machines for various industries. The company's machines and line systems are used by world class food and beverage manufacturers like Nestle, Unilever and Dr.Oetker.

Global leader in line systems and machines

SCHREYER Sondermaschinen GmbH or SCHREYER was first set up in 1969, over four decades ago. The purpose was to produce line systems and machines for the food industry. Now part of the CONSTRUCTOR GROUP, DEXION limited is a world leader in the provision of storage and logistics solutions to the industrial and commercial sectors.

DEXION was first established in London, England by Demetrious Comino in 1937. About ALTREX B.V.

First formed in 1950, ALTREX is one of the most respected brand names in the access equipment industry. CFS is a Dutch based company, which is one of the world's most multifaceted leaders in the packaging and food processing field. CFS' food processing machinery and packaging systems are used by various food industries like Kraft Foods Inc.

Global leader in packaging and food processing technology

CONVENIENCE FOOD SYSTEMS or CFS for short was a company of its own that was managed by AEA Investors LP, a private investment company until December 2010. Founded in 1997, CFS was bought over by GEA Group Aktiengesellschaft or GEA for short as part of its food processing technology expansion plan. GEA was already a global leader in equipment lines related to producing beer, instant coffee and milk. The purchase of CFS, which was a global leader in packaging and food processing technology especially for fish, cheese and meat, was to firmly establish itself as a world leader in food processing and packaging technology of a wider scope of food and beverage products. GEA has its main base in Bakel, located east of Helmond in the Netherlands.

HANDTMANN manufactures both equipment and materials that are used in a diverse range of industrial settings. It produces complete plant installations, machining centres, cast metals, plastics and individual components.

Website: handtmann.de

A manufacturer of high-tech processing and machining equipment

Albert HANDTMANN Holding GmbH & Co. KG was founded in Germany in 1873, and is a leading engineering firm, which manufacturers machinery for plastics and metal working operations. HANDTMANN GmbH remains a family firm, with a strong sense of corporate social responsibility, and a workforce of over 1,500 people. HANDTMANN started life as a bell foundry, but quickly branched out into manufacturing equipment for the brewing industry. The post-war period saw the firm become established as a manufacturer of machinery for the food production sector, as well as becoming experts in aluminium casting, as well as plastics moulding. The 1980s saw HANDTMANN expand across borders, opening a British subsidiary for selling the company's meat processing equipment. This was followed in 2005 by the opening of a foundry in Kosice, Slovakia, making HANDTMANN a firm which operates across Europe. Later HANDTMANN CNC Technologies Inc. get opened in North America making it truelz global companz. However, the company remains anchored in the German town of Biberach, where it was founded. It also retains a focus on the environment, with detailed policies regarding waste disposal, emissions and the hazardous materials. HANDTMANN machines have a global interest as well, with sales subsidiaries in the Americas, Europe, South Africa, Australia and Asia. This reflects the emphasis that the firm places upon securing export markets for its machinery in a competitive global economy.

AMADA is a globally active metal working machinery manufacturer with its roots in Japan. It focuses on sheet metal machinery, and has a strong focus on sustainability and client support.

A Japanese firm supplying sheet metalworking solutions worldwide

AMADA co. ltd. specializes in the production of machine tools for manufacturing industry and has been active in the sector for more than 60 years. The firm was founded in Japan by Isamu Amada in 1945, who began by manufacturing band saw blades that were in demand during Japan's post-war reconstruction. This basic Amada machines production expanded over the next fifty years, encompassing technological change such as bending machines, turret punch presses and laser-based cutting systems, placing AMADA JAPAN at the forefront of industrial production. By the 2000s, the company had a workforce of 6400 and had accumulated over 3000 patents for its equipment. AMADA Tooling had also become a global operation, with arms in America (AMADA Amercica), Asia, Europe (AMADA UK) and Africa, supplying sheet metal solutions wherever they were required. More recently, the firm has adopted an aggressive approach towards environmental sustainability, renovating its production processes to eliminate waste and carbon emissions wherever possible. It sees itself as a path-breaking engineering firm that can supply environmental solutions via innovation. AMADA Company also retains a close focus on customer service, with technical service facilities in Kidderminster, England, as well as North America. The British centre includes a large workspace for testing new and existing equipment to ensure that it is running correctly, and that clients are trained to use it effectively.

Based in the American state of Maryland, EVAPCO Inc. manufactures cooling machinery and air conditioners for both home and industrial use. It continually innovates and researches new approaches to its core business.

A global name in the air conditioning and cooling industry

The American firm EVAPCO manufactures evaporated cooling products that are used in air conditioners and industrial cooling across the globe. An employee owned company, EVAPCO Inc. was founded in 1976 and is based in Taneytown, Maryland where it operates a 60,000 square feet innovation centre. This centre has six specially calibrated test chambers, where the firm researches new approaches to cooling technology, a focus that has led to EVAPCO securing 29 patents in the USA. The company has experienced huge growth since its foundation, expanding into markets across the world. It maintains facilities in nations as disparate as China,  Egypt and South Africa and Europe locations such as Denmark and Belgium with 17 manufacturing plants. Alongside this manufacturing capacity, EVAPCO also operates a sales team which supplies businesses in 42 countries across the world from more than 170 sales offices. The firm specializes in innovation, constantly bringing onto the market new products that have been thoroughly tested by the technicians at Taneytown. Along with its core products, EVAPCO also operates a system of spare parts provision and maintenance under the Mr Goodtower label and provides full support for anyone seeking to replace their existing cooling units.

The American firm JLG Industries, Inc. is a world leader in the production of boom lifts, telehandlers and scissor lifts. It has a strong focus on providing expert support to clients across the world.

JLG - Lifting Equipment

Based in the American town of Oshkosh, JLG has been manufacturing access devices and lifting equipment since 1969. The firm was started by John L. Grove, who saw that there was a need for safe, reliable lifting equipment to be used by the emergency services and construction industry. The workshop that Grove founded in the Pennsylvania town of McConnellsburg has now become the world's leading manufacturer of lifting equipment, including aerial platforms, scissor lifts and boom lifts. It has also expanded across the world, with JLG subsidiaries in Australia and the UK opening during the 1970s and 80s. Throughout its history, JLG has made the running in advancing the lifting industry, introducing the first 45 metre boom lifter in 1991 and launching its 50,000 scissor lift in 1998.

It has also pioneered sustainable machinery, with lifts that run off fuel cell technology, and lifts which run exclusively from electric power sources without sacrificing performance. The firm has also made strategic partnerships such as an agreement with Caterpillar to manufacture its telehandler vehicles and it has continued to forge a global presence, with manufacturing facilities in Belgium and China and developing a strong rental side to its business operations. JLG has also focused on staff and client training, opening a "university" which provides instruction in nine languages, and it has been an innovator in digital technology too, launching support and maintenance apps to link up with clients easily.

REISHAUER is a firm that specializes in the manufacture of precision grinding machinery and components for use in precision grinding. It is based in Switzerland, and has a history stretching back over 200 years.

Website: reishauer.com

A global leader in the manufacturing of gear grinding machinery

The Swiss firm REISHAUER AG was founded in Zurich way back in 1788 by Hans Jakob Däniker as a tool and instrument manufacturer. Nowadays, REISHAUER manufacturers advanced grinding machinery for the production of gears, and has a global reach, with its products in use by corporations across the world. The firm's expansion took off after 1952, when it moved into a massive factory in the town of Wallisellen. During the 1970s, it developed innovative electronically modulated grinding machines and continuous form grinding which allowed for vastly increased production efficiency. CNC controls were introduced to all models in the 1980s as REISHAUER sought to increase the level of
automation in its gear grinding machines, further driving up performance. The 90s saw the firm continuing to develop new techniques such as advanced diamond grinding, as well as finding new ways to provide flexibility for all clients when using REISHAUER machine. The modern firm focuses closely on quality management when manufacturing its equipment, investing in both advanced measuring tools and an army of inspectors who continually assess its production lines. The firm also specializes in environmentally sustainable, low-waste and low-emission production, using innovations such as environmentally cleaning solvents whenever possible. While the firm remains based in Wallisellen, it also has international arms in China, Germany, France, the USA, Argentina, Japan, Australia, Brazil, Spain, Finland, India, Italy, Korea, Pakistan, Poland, Russia, Sweden, Turkey, Taiwan and South Africa.

The REISHAUER product portfolio

The range of REISHAUER products includes:

  • RZ 260 gear grinding machine
  • RZ 550 gear grinder
  • RZ 1000 gear grinding work stations
  • Diamond and CBN grinding tools
  • Nanotechnology products
  • Software for use with REISHAUER grinding machines

REISHAUER AG partners with companies across the world who require precision grinding of small components such as gears. This could include anything from car manufacturers to aviation or toy production.

The German company HERMLE manufactures advanced milling machinery that is used in the manipulation of metals. It partners with a diverse spectrum of clients, supplying full training and support for all users of its equipment.

Pioneering precision milling machinery since 1938

Maschinenfabrik Berthold HERMLE AG is a manufacturer of milling machines, with a policy of focusing on high performance, innovative installations. Berthold HERMLE AG was founded in 1938 by Berthold Hermle as a manufacturer of bolt and screw machinery, but soon branched out into other areas. The production of milling machines commenced in 1957, and by 1972, HERMLE had perfected its popular universal tool milling machine. Since then, the firm has built new factories, opened worldwide subsidiaries and pioneered flexible working to counteract economic downturns without cutting jobs. The firm's flexible approach, based around the idea of a "breathing enterprise" then allowed it to weather the economic problems after 2008 with ease. Its general success is shown by the fact that 22,000 HERMLE milling machines have been installed across the world. The firm employs 800 people at its major manufacturing facility in the German town of Gosheim, and has operations across the world, with a training and servicing facility in Franklin, Wisconsin that supplies American customers. The firm's products are used in a wide variety of fields, including the  medical sector, motor racing, model-making and light industry. At their headquarters, HERMLE AG also provides full support for users of its milling machinery, with CNC training as well as a comprehensive maintenance and support service.

Website: hermlemachine.com

HERMLE Machines

The range of products manufactured by HERMLE machine company includes:

  • C12 cubic parts manufacturing centres
  • C22 4-side machining centres
  • C32, C42, C50, C60, C400 5-side machining centres
  • Automated machining installations
  • Integrated milling and turning machines
  • Control units

HERMLE AG works with many different kinds of company and organization. It partners with everything from automobile and motor racing firms to medical equipment manufacturers. Any organization that requires precision milling and turning of metals would be a suitable client.

HURCO is a German company which focuses on the manufacture of turning centres and technologically advanced lathes. It combines an emphasis on the reliability of its machines with the deployment of software to give clients added control over manufacturing processes.

Manufacturing advanced lathes and turning centres since the 1960s

Based in the German town of Pliening, HURCO GmbH is a firm that manufactures machining centres and lathes. The company specializes in producing high quality, advanced HURCO CNC machining tools which combine ease of use with high performance. It is active across Europe, although seeks to retain its individuality and the sense of being a small, responsive firm which caters for the needs of clients. HURCO lathes are set up to reduce the time taken to process materials and to give clients greater control over their operations, particularly for smaller companies working on tight profit margins. HURCO GmbH has been working to improve its lathes since the late 1960s, and has gathered over 80 unique patents in the field, a sign of continual research and innovation. From the start, HURCO Companies Inc. founder Gerald Roch sought to blend the advances in computing with mechanical lathes, introducing programmed workstations. HURCO CNC manufactures lathes for a variety of sectors, including aviation and energy companies, with a particular focus on its range of 3-axis CNC machining centres, although HURCO also produces a range of high performance turning centres as well. The company offers a full service for clients, including constant support, training and spare parts, and also operates used HURCO for Sale machining centers to market past products.
