  • Refuse and recycling containers 
  • Specialized waste containers

SSI SCHÄFER deals with a wide range of clients in the public and private sectors. schaeffer picking technology is used by companies such as tobacco or pharmaceutical manufacturers, while its logistics and workstation arm supplies products and services to office and workshop based businesses around the world.

Austrian firm AMANN GIRRBACH manufactures both dental prosthetics and machinery which assists in their manufacture. It specializes in adapting high technology to medical design.

A world leading firm in the dental prosthetics market

AMANN GIRRBACH is one of the world's foremost manufacturers of dental prosthetics. Originating in the town of Vorarlberg in Austria, the firm has become a specialist in applying CAD digital design techniques to dental prosthetics, and now operates in 90 countries across the world. AMANN GIRRBACH has used the development of digital technology to pioneer customer based design, allowing it to deliver flexible, high quality solutions at lower prices. Although based in Austria, the company is a global player, and has facilities in Pforzheim, Germany; Charlotte, USA; Curitiba, Brazil; Singapore and the Chinese capital Beijing. It is a regular award winner, and is an accredited member of industry and regional bodies such as VDDI, and TUV. The AMANN GIRRBACH product range includes a variety of dental prosthetics, as well as machinery used in the manufacturing of dental products, including drills, ceramic moulds and CAD design packages. Along with its products, the firm provides bespoke training for clients so that their equipment is used as effectively as possible. They also provide a fully staffed helpdesk and online support for all AMANN GIRRBACH products. Along with training and support, the company also provides its Ceramill M-Centre, which manufactures digital constructions for dental firms in specialized laboratories. The firm aims to provide increased capability for even small laboratories by harnessing the power of digital technology.

The AMANN GIRRBACH product portfolio

The selection of products offered by AMANN GIRRBACH includes:

  • Articulators for dental prosthetic construction
  • Modelling equipment
  • Dental scanners
  • CAD dental design software
  • Milling equipment
  • Sintering furnaces for zirconium frameworks
  • Custom materials for prosthetics
  • Training packages
  • Electric Bunsen burners

AMANN GIRRBACH is a specialist dental firm whose products are tailored to the use of medical specialists and other dental companies. Its clients include private companies and publicly owned medical services as well as individuals.

The renowned German firm SCHAUDT MIKROSA GmbH, based in Leipzig, Germany, is a world-leader in the manufacture of machine tools for the precision grinding of camshafts and axes for the motor industry and for the supply of  grinding machinery for the printing industry and other sectors requiring large machine construction.

Website: schaudt.com/en

A brief history of SCHAUDT MIKROSA GmbH 

SCHAUDTMIKROSA has a distinguished history of manufacturing machine tools dating back more than 100 years. The company was founded as the Carl Unger Machine Tools Factory in Stuttgart in 1906. After the construction of grinding machines began in 1911, the first high performance grinding machines were developed in 1930. When Gerhard Schaudt became Managing Director in 1943, the company's name was changed to SCHAUDT Maschinenbau GmbH. In 1983, the company was taken over by the Hamburg firm Hauni-Werke and other innovations followed, such as the introduction of the CF series designed for non-circular and  cylindrical grinding with both CNC control and a double-slide system. In 1995 came the introduction of the CF41, a high-performance cam form grinding machine with innovative grinding wheel technology. The Zeus M series, introduced as a modular system with broad applications in 2002 has been continuously developed since then, becoming the CamGrind series in 2008. In 2009 the company merged with Studer Mikrosa GmbH to become SCHAUDT MIKROSA GmbH. All production plants, and the registered office, were transferred from the old factory in Stuttgart to a new facility in Leipzig, boasting the very newest in production techniques, in 2009.

Main Products

  • Camshaft grinding machines 
  • Roll grinding machines 
  • Production grinding machines

The Swiss firm GEORG FISCHER AG is a globally active company in the  metalworking and plastics sector, which produces piping, automotive and machine products for a wide variety of clients.

Experts in materials manufacturing and manipulation

Metalworking and plastics company GEORG FISCHER AG has a long history of developing innovative processes and products, having been formed in 1802. Initially, the firm specialized in copper smelting in Switzerland's Mühlental valley, but rapidly branched out into steel. During the nineteenth century, GEORG FISCHER GmbH was also established and opened factories in Austria and Germany, and pioneered services for employees at the company's facilities such as workers pensions, housing and canteens. During the twentieth century the firm expanded into other metal-related fields and into other countries, such as the UK, where it started GEORG FISCHER Ltd, and even ventured into high strength plastics such as PVC. By the 1990s, GEORG FISCHER had a number of core areas, which included plastic piping, manufacturing technology and plant engineering as it moved away from older operations like steel production, but especially famous for GF pipping systems. It also focused more closely on ensuring that its products were produced in a sustainable manner, winning industry prizes for the environmental qualities of its foundry buildings. It has also become a truly global company, with manufacturing and sales facilities on almost every continent, developing a particularly key role in the supply of automobile parts to firms such as Peugeot. GEORGE FISCHER has also become closely involved in global philanthropy programs such as the Clean Water Foundation, which seeks to ensure that people around the world have access to safe, sustainably sourced drinking water.

The GEORG FISCHER product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by GEORG FISCHER Pipping Systems Ltd includes:

  • Sustainable piping systems
  • Valves
  • Flow measurement tools
  • Sealed containment zones for fluids
  • Automotive parts requiring specialist casting such as control arms and wheel carriers
  • Laser texturing machines
  • High speed milling machines
  • Electric discharge machines

GEORG FISCHER piping systems (GFPS) are used in a huge number of industries in the manufacture of consumer products. Major partners include car manufacturers, drinking water suppliers, chemical processors, energy firms, ship builders and aviation companies.

ARBURG has come a long way since its founding as a medical equipment manufacturer. Nowadays, ARBURG GmbH is a global leader in plastic injection moulding, delivering customized high tech solutions to industrial partners in a wide variety of sectors.

World experts in plastic injection molding

ARBURG GmbH + Co. KG is one of the world's leading manufacturers of plastic injection moulding technology. The firm was founded by Arthur Hehl in 1923 in the German town of Lossburg, and started out as a manufacturer of medical instruments. However, the firm really began to expand after the War, as it began to benefit from the post-war consumer boom, manufacturing essential like hairpins and wire baskets. The 1950s saw ARBURG producing components for flash cameras, while the leap into plastic manufacture occurred after 1954. From then on, ARBURG GmbH + Co. KG became an innovator in injection molding, creating designs which far superseded older machinery in terms of efficiency and ease of use. In 1973, the firm hit a milestone with more than 10,000 injection moulding machines having been sold. The firm continued to innovate, installing the first computer software into injection moulding machinery in 1975, while the 1980s saw progress made in the automation of the plastic moulding process. This period also saw ARBURG GmbH become a European - ARBURG UK & Germany -, then a global leader - ARBURG USA - in the plastics industry, and the firm currently has a presence in more than 100 nations. It also employs almost 2,000 people in its German operations. Recent developments have seen ARBURG Inc. specializing in making their injection moulding machines as energy efficient as possible, as well as the opening of a state of the art production and customer demonstration centre in Lossburg. All of this expansion has occurred without compromising the family run nature of the firm.

ARBURG Product Portfolio

ARBURG GmbH manufactures products in the following categories:

  • Hydraulic injection molding machines 
  • Electric injection molding machines 
  • Hybrid systems 
  • Solutions for the automotive sector
  • Packaging production equipment 
  • Micro-injection moulding equipment
  • Flat drippers injection moulding software

ARBURG works with clients in many industrial fields, from vehicle production to medical equipment manufacturing, camera manufactures and the production of food packaging. Any firm which requires plastic injection moulding would be a suitable client.

SCHUKO is a well-known German family-owned company which specialises in high quality surface, exhaust and filter technology. SHUKO is a leader in its field in Europe and the company says that it prides itself in offering a combination of performance, reliability and a long product life, along with first-class service and the easy availability of spare parts.

The history of SCHUKO 

SCHUKO H. Schulte-Südhoff GmbH SHUKO was founded in 1967 as Heinz Schulte-Südhoff Lufttechnik based in the German town of Müschen which is near Bad Laer in Germany, with its first production facility in what was once a hen house. It remains a family concern, owner-managed, specialising as it always has done, in the field of dust extraction and filter technology. Since its founding, the story of the firm is one of continuous growth and innovation. SHUKO says its focus is always on providing changes that are to the benefit of its customers. In 1981 the firm became schuko h. schulte-südhoff gmbh and Company KG, based in Bad Saulgau, and from 1988 to 1992 there were further production halls added in Knetzgau and Bad Saulgau. Industrial SHUKO fans are designed in particular to deal with dust and shavings in the wood and plastics industry. SCHUKO says its filter systems, another speciality, "comply with state-of-the-art technology" and it says "their versatility and efficiency are unbeatable". Dust extractors are designed for small and medium-sized workshops and waste disposal systems are designed to transport, process and press waste for recycling. The company continues to expand with a factory in Trebbin, near Berlin, in Kirchberg, near Koblenz and with the takeover in 2007 of Werner Schulz GmbH based in Quickborn near Hamburg. Expansions of existing production facilities have followed along with the formation of a separate Polish company, SHUKO Polska Sp. z o.o. with a factory in Slésin, Poland.

SCHUKO Product portfolio

  • Fans
  • Filters 
  • Dust extractors
  • Waste disposal 
  • Surface treatment
  • Parts and components

The German firm HERAEUS specializes in the manufacture of products containing precious metals such as platinum. Its products appear in equipment such as photovoltaic cells and catalytic converters.

Innovating in precious metals manufacturing since 1851

The metal-working company HERAEUS was founded in 1851 by Wilhelm Carl Heraeus in the German city of Hanau and was initially a path-breaking platinum manufacturer. Innovation continued into the twentieth century, with the firm developing revolutionary techniques for creating quartz rock glass, and the development of vacuum smelting techniques during the 1920s. After the war, HERAEUS became a global company, with subsidiaries in the UK, Japan and the USA. It also expanded its areas of expertise to include dental and medical equipment, quartz glass, precious metals smelting, electro-lite sensors and speciality lighting. Nowadays, the company has 13,000 employees across the world, but remains family owned, allowing it to balance stability with the need to compete internationally. It partners with firms in a wide range of sectors, from medical organizations to the environment, communications and energy and consciously seeks to promote continual innovation in all of its product lines. Although HERAEUS remains anchored in Germany, it earns most of its revenue in Asia, a sign of how globally it operates. It also continues to break ground in many fields, including new UV light based malaria treatments and organic solar energy cells. This reflects the company's core principles, which include innovating in a sustainable manner, and focusing on staff development at all levels.

The HERAEUS product portfolio

HERAEUS manufactures the following products:

  • Precious metals
  • Chemical air purifiers
  • Solar photovoltaics 
  • Lamps and lighting technology
  • Chemical and homogenous catalysts
  • Chemical compounds and solutions
  • Clevios polymers
  • Medical components
  • Electronic materials

The products manufactured by HERAEUS are used in a wide range of industries. Clients working with HERAEUS include energy, environmental, medical, automotive, electronics, aeronautical and military firms.

Based in France, HURON has been manufacturing high quality machining centers for more than a century. Today, they occupy a position as one of the leading machine manufacturers in Europe.

About HURON

From humble beginnings in the year 1857, HURON has grown into a truly global organisation and now boasts facilities in locations such as India, Canada, Germany and Portugal, in addition to their home base in the Alsace region of France. Due to a high-volume of orders for large-sized machines, HURON opened a brand new manufacturing facility in Alsace in 2012, just a few miles from its original base. Building a reputation for innovation and technological advancement, the HURON strategy is simple - to produce innovative, high-performance products for the mechanical engineering industry. The majority of the company's manufacturing output is put to use in the automotive, aeronautic and intermediate goods sectors. HURON CNC extends the production of cnc machining cneteres for metalworking processes.

HURON Product Portfolio

HURON machine production range is varied and diverse in their applications. The company's machining centre's portfolio include:

  • Turn Mill centres 
  • Twin spindle turning centres 
  • Oval turning centres
  • Vertical turning centres
  • Vertical milling centres

The range of standard turning centres consists of various models within the DX series. From the DX 100 to the top of the range DX 500, the turning centres produced by HURON all benefit from the implementation of the very latest technology and the expertise of their experienced engineers.

Based in the small community of Westerheim, Germany, MEBA ranks as one of the world's leading manufacturers of metal bandsaw machines. The company was one of the very first manufacturers to specialise in metal bandsaw production.

About MEBA

First established in the early sixties, MEBA has a long-standing reputation as a pioneer in band saw technology. A family-run business from the outset, MEBA today retains the philosophies and ideals of those early days, despite its expansion from a small regional company to a major international organisation. Continually looking to evolve, MEBA moved all of its production and administration facilities from Esslingen am Neckar to its current base of Westerheim in 1982, marking the beginning of the company's growth as an international presence.

MEBA employs state-of the-art engineering processes in the manufacture of its bandsaw machines and is continually adapting its production techniques to further improve the already high quality of its manufacturing output.

MEBA Product Portfolio

MEBA is a world-leading specialist in the manufacture of bandsaws. The company's output includes:

  • Mitre bandsaws
  • Straight cutting bandsaws
  • Automatic machines

MEBA machines are put to use in a variety of industries including the steel trade, metalworking industry, locksmiths and tool manufacture. From the production of stair rails to the building of ships, the MEBA range of bandsaws is highly regarded across all industries.

In addition to the bandsaw machines themselves, MEBA produce a range of accessories and spare parts including the highest quality sawblades.

METTLER TOLEDO is a Swiss firm which is one of the largest manufacturers of precision engineered weighing and measuring equipment. Their products are used worldwide in scientific research and retail operations.

Global leaders in the field of weights and measures

Headquartered in the Swiss town of Greifensee, METTLER TOLEDO International Inc. is a global leader in the field of precision instruments, which was formed in 1989 when Swiss firm Mettler merged with the American firm Toledo Scale. The firm manufactures instruments that are used in laboratories and production operations in sectors as varying as pharmaceuticals, academic research and food production. The firm first came to prominence as a manufacturer of advanced weighing equipment, but has diversified into many other fields so that, nowadays, METTLER TOLEDO's products include advanced equipment such as particle analysis machinery, precision weighing scales, process analysers and pipettes. It's equipment is used in robotics, optics and telecommunications - areas where precision and accuracy are essential. For example, METTLER TOLEDO was one of the first firms to offer touch screen operated laboratory equipment, and it has developed this technology to make it as user friendly and efficient as possible. The firm's dose measurement machinery also replaces the arduous task of filling containers via pipettes, and precisely measures out the quantity of medicines to be administered. Along with its product portfolio, METTLE TOLEDO also offers seminar training regarding the use of its products, as well as an international support network to assist with maintenance and replacement issues. The company also focuses on sustainability, with its measuring devices finding many uses in the task of reducing emissions and all of its products being redesigned constantly to achieve higher energy efficiency.

METTLER TOLEDO Products

The range of products manufactured by METTLER TOLEDO Inc. includes:

  • Laboratory weighing equipment
  • Precision balances
  • METTLER TOLEDO scales
  • Load cells
  • X-ray inspection machines
  • Metal detectors
  • Rainin, manual and electrical pipettes
  • Process analysing software
  • Truck and railway scales
  • Titration equipment
  • Thermal analysers
  • Particle analysers
  • Retail weighing scales

The products manufactured by METTLER TOLEDO International are used in many different environments. Partners include scientific research organizations,  corporate laboratories, retailers, airports and railways, food and pharmaceutical companies.

Based in Italy OMG Machines are global specialists in the production of forklift trucks industry. They manufacture a variety of forklifts, as well as order picking vehicles, side loaders and pallet stackers.

Providing high quality forklift trucks since 1968

OMG Spa (Officine Meccaniche Gonzaga) is an Italian firm which manufactures forklift vehicles and other forms of indoor transportation for warehouses, factories and retailers. The company started life back in 1968 as a steel-working firm for agricultural clients. This soon changed, as the firm expanded its ambitions, opening a large new factory in the town of Gonzaga in 1975. By the 1980s, OMG Machines would be producing lift trucks at its own factory, and selling their advanced vehicles across the European continent. A breakthrough came in 1998, when OMG SRL began selling its popular electric forklifts, while counterbalanced forklifts were added in 2005, rounding off the firm's product portfolio of indoor vehicles industry. At this time, OMG SRL also started to conclude agreements with distributors around the world, expanding its operations to Japan and the Americas, and the company also started to work closely with universities to find skilled talent for its research and development efforts. New products also started to roll off the production line, including a range of industrial doors, which debuted in 2013. OMG Machines remains a medium sized firm with just over 100 employees, and is anchored in the Italian town of Gonzaga, yet has developed a truly global scope via commercial partnerships, and its membership of the larger Group HdC. It has certified dealers who operate on all continents, providing sales advice and maintenance support when needed.

OMG Machines Products Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by OMG SRL includes:

  • Hand pallet trucks
  • Electric pallet trucks
  • Pedestrian power pallet trucks
  • Pedestrian controlled pallet stackers
  • Low lift pallet stackers
  • Horizontal and vertical order picking trucks
  • VNA trucks
  • Reach trucks
  • Side loaders
  • Electric tractors
  • Industrial cleaning machines
  • Electric fork lift trucks
  • Counterbalanced fork lift trucks
  • Rough terrain forklift trucks

OMG SpA's products are used by organizations with complex logistical challenges and large warehouses. The kind of firms that OMG Machines partners with include paper and packaging manufacturers, construction firms, large retailers and storage companies.

GRUNDFOS Holding AS is a Danish manufacturer of pumps of all types, for many industries and for multiple domestic purposes. With more than 18,000 employees worldwide and producing some 16 million pump units a year, GRUNDFOS is one of the largest manufacturer of pumps in the world.

A History of GRUNDFOS Holding A/S 

The history of GRUNDFOS Holding A/S dates back to 1945 when it was founded by Poul Due Jensen, in the Danish town of Bjerringbro. The town gave the company its first name, which translates from the Danish as Bjerringbro Die-Casting and Machine Factory. The company went through a variety of changes of name until 1967, when it finally became known as GRUNDFOS. The company retains its headquarters in Bjerringbo, where it was founded, and in addition it has facilities in the Danish towns of Årslev, Aalestrup, Årslev, Farum and Brøndby. In more than 50 countries, there are GRUNDFOS distributors. Throughout the history of GRUNDFOS, the focus of the company has been on making pumps which utilise the very latest available technology and for which GRUNDFOS established the Grundfos Technology Centre in 1990, focusing on research and development. GRUNDFOS pumps catalogue can be found in countries all over the world, ranging from countries rich in minerals, such as Australia, where GRUNDFOS pumps are used in the oil, mining and gas industries, to circulator pumps used in domestic and commercial air conditioning. From applications in irrigation to pumps for sewage, GRUNDFOS pump catalogue is often regarded as the industry standard. The company is now owned by a foundation named after the company's founder. The Poul Due Jensen Foundation reinvests all its profits back into the company.

Grundfos Pumps Corporation Product Portfolio:

  • Agricultural water distribution, intake and treatment pumps
  • Automotive pumps
  • Pumps for the beverage industry
  • Biofuel pumps
  • Pumps for commercial and domestic buildings
  • Fire Protection pumps
  • Pumps for the food industry
  • Industrial boilers
  • Pumps for the machining and manufacturing industries
  • Marine pumps
  • Mining pumps
  • Washing and cleaning pumps
  • Pumps for general wastewater transport and distribution
  • Pumps for general water intake and treatment

MULTIVAC Sepp Haggenmüller GmbH & Co. KG is one of the world's leading high-tech packaging companies. It manufactures machinery that can produce precision engineered packaging for demanding clients, which include medicine manufacturers and food processors.

A leading company in the world of packaging and quality control

MULTIVAC GmbH is a global leader in the packaging sector, with a particular focus on the manufacture of thermo-forming machines. However, the firm has a broad portfolio of products, which also include vacuum chamber equipment, labellers and quality control mechanisms. Their products are widely used in food production and retail, as well as in the production of pharmaceuticals. MULTIVAC is a German company, and is based in the town of Wolfertschwenden, where it employs over 4,000 people. The firm has grown quickly since being founded by Sepp Haggenmüller in 1961. The small vacuum chamber workshop that Haggenmüller set up has become a global packaging giant with 65 subsidiaries. MULTIVAC was quick to see the potential gains from globalization, and is active in more than 140 nations, providing a combined service and sales operation. This means that the 900 consultants employed by the company can assist clients during the ordering process and afterwards, ensuring a seamless customer service experience. MULTIVAC also pioneered quality control systems for packaging operations, allowing for food production to be easily standardised and made more efficient. Its labelling solutions are commonly used by pharmaceutical firms to ensure that their products are safe and effectively used. The firm also prides itself on operating high-tech centres of production, and it operates two factories. One of these is at the corporate headquarters in Wolfertschwenden, while MULTIVAC also has a facility in Lechaschau.

The MULTIVAC product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by MULTIVAC includes:

  • Thermoformers
  • Handling modules
  • Chamber machines
  • Tray sealers
  • HPP high pressure preservation machines
  • Labelling equipment
  • Printing equipment
  • Convergers
  • Shrink equipment
  • Drying tunnels
  • Quality control and inspection systems
  • Integrated packaging centres
  • Individual components for MULTIVAC equipment

MULTIVAC products can be used by any organization that needs to package mass-produced items. Its major partners are in the food processing and retail sectors, as well as the pharmaceutical industry.

Based in Germany, DIOSNA is a global name in the production of mixing equipment. Their products are widely used in food processing, medicine production and chemical industries.

Manufacturing mixing equipment for over a century

DIOSNA GmbH is a firm which manufactures specialist mixing equipment. The firm was founded by Friedrich Dierks in the German city of Osnabrück in 1885, and initially manufactured machinery for dairies and creameries. This changed in the early twentieth century when DIOSNA introduced new mixing technology for thermoplastics and pharmaceutical applications. The firm expanded into the food processing sector as well, manufacturing integrated baking equipment and pioneering new mixing technologies such as the fluid bed system and developing new beating machines for food mixtures. DIOSNA has been responsible for many innovations in the world of mixing, including the first vertically rotating film coater in the world, which has found many applications in the medicine production field. The firm constantly seeks to introduce skilled technicians into its manufacturing arm, and has fostered links with German universities to propel its research forward. DIOSA has also expanded overseas, with offices as far afield as Hong Kong, Russia and Italy, providing it with global sales reach and the ability to support clients on all continents. The company's core areas remain ones that it has worked in for over a century - baking and pharmaceuticals. DIOSNA mechanisms have helped to make industrial dough kneading more efficient and have also assisted in making life-saving medicines available.

The DIOSNA product portfolio

DIOSNA manufactures the following range of products:

  • Kneading machines
  • Mixing plants (bakery)
  • High-pressure pre-mixers
  • Stirring and beating machines
  • Elevator tippers
  • Universal mixers and blenders
  • Fluid bed processors
  • Single pot processors (pharmaceuticals)
  • Granulating-drying machinery
  • Coating machinery

DIOSNA products are used in three major sectors of the economy. The majority of the firm's partners are in the food processing sector (primarily baking),  pharmaceuticals or chemical processing.

Based in Germany, ITT BORNEMANN GmbH corporation is a world leader in the manufacture of pumping systems, with most of its clients in the oil and gas extraction sector. The main area of expertise of he firm lies in producing reliable two-screw pumps.

Website: bornemann.com

World leaders in advanced pumping systems for the oil and gas industry

ITT BORNEMANN is a German firm which specializes in the manufacturing of industrial pumps, and has been doing so since the 1850s. Based in the town of Obernkirchen, ITT BORNEMANN made a huge breakthrough in 1934 when the firm was the first in the world to patent a twin screw pump. This innovation was built upon in the 1950s and 60s when the company introduced three screw pumps and progressive cavity pumps, which were instantly popular with chemical manufacturers and oil and gas firms across Europe. Despite this international success, the company has a strong sense of tradition and continues to be family owned. This is demonstrated by the BORNEMANN GmbH museum, a reconstruction of the locksmith's shop owned by the family from 1816.

An oil and gas supplier with a strong focus on environmental protection

The modern company is far removed from its ancestors, however, and manufactures its pumping products at a state of the art facility in the town of Gelldorf where it employs 400 people and records annual turnover of around 100 million Euros. ITT BORNEMANN Inc. has become a world leader in twin screw pumps, and expanded during the twentieth century in step with the growth of the fossil fuels industry. Wherever oil and gas was extracted from the earth's crust, BORNEMANN ITT pumping systems were employed to ensure that the process was achieved efficiently and safely. This led the firm to operate across the world, with subsidiaries in the USA, Europe and east and central Asia. Recent years have seen significant changes in the company's philosophy and operations, with a closer focus on environmental sustainability. The firm has also kept to a rigorous code of conduct in dealing with overseas clients, including a close attention to ensuring that corrupt practices are avoided. This has helped to position ITT BORNEMANN as a leading supplier to new oil and gas provinces, as well as the renewable energy industry.

ITT BORNEMANN GmbH Product Portfolio

The range of pumping products manufactured by ITT BORNEMANN includes:

  • Twin screw pumps (80 different sizes available)
  • Multiphase boosting technology
  • Progressive cavity pumps
  • Subsea boosting technology

The pumping technology manufactured by ITT BORNEMANN Inc is mainly provided to clients in the oil and gas extraction sector. Their pumps are used in land-based and undersea environments to ensure that fossil fuel extraction occurs safely and reliably. Their products are also used in shipping (engine room pumps), the  chemical industry and food processing plants.

GF AGIECHARMILLES/GF MACHINING SOLUTIONS is one of the world's leading suppliers of advanced milling and texturing machinery. GF AGIE specializes in high speed milling for industrial applications and laser texturing for advanced materials.

Innovative tool-making specialists from Switzerland

GF MACHINING SOLUTIONS Ltd is a world-leading supplier of machinery in the fields of mold and tool-making. The firm focuses on manufacturing precision engineering machinery such as electric discharge machines and high speed milling equipment, along with laser surface texturing devices, and also specializes in providing integrated automation solutions incorporating its range of products.

GF MACHINING SOLUTIONS has its origins in the mid nineteenth century when the firm Charmilles was founded in Switzerland under the name Staib & Cie. The organization began building cars in the 1900s, but its modern range of materials manipulation equipment really took off after 1954 when Agie was founded in Basel. Charmilles and Agie were merged in 1996 creating GF Agie Charmilles, which commenced a period of corporate expansion, as the firm moved into areas like high speed milling and automation. In 2009, GF AGIE started a new era with the announcement of a new range of laser texturing processes, which allow for techniques such as laser labelling and precision engraving.

GF MACHINING SOLUTIONS Ltd aims to operate a "customer-centric" support system, and also markets its equipment as uniquely reliable. The company also has a long-standing public commitment to sustainability, and sets itself ambitious economic, environmental and social targets to meet in this regard.

The GF MACHINING SOLUTIONS product portfolio

The range of precision engineering products manufactured by GF AGIECHARMILLES/GF MACHINING SOLUTIONS include:

  • High speed milling machines
  • Standard machining centres
  • Die sinking EDMs
  • Hold drilling EDMs
  • Wire cut EDMs
  • Laser texturing equipment
  • Automation systems for machining equipment

The products manufactured by GF MACHINING SOLUTIONS are used in a variety of different applications. Partners of the firm may include specialist texturing of advanced materials for medical uses. Their milling machines and EDMs are used in factories and workshops around the world, wherever precision cutting of materials is required.

SOCO SYSTEMS are based in Denmark and manufacture  packaging equipment. Their speciality is the design and implementation of all-in-one packaging centres, with a variety of advanced machinery integrated into a total solution.

Danish packaging experts, who specialize in total solutions

SOCO SYSTEM A/S is a multi-national firm which specializes in the manufacturing of packaging equipment, and is based in the Danish town of Taastrup. The firm was founded in 1961, and now operates two factories in Denmark, as well as six subsidiaries across the world, in countries as diverse as the UK, France, the USA and Germany, where it employs a network of fifty sales agents. Back at its manufacturing facility, SOCO SYSTEMS has 180 employees, where the firm researches new approaches to packaging and pallet loading. A sign of the firm's success is that over 600 of its specialist pallet loaders and pallet loading robots have been installed across the world. SOCO SYSTEMS has a philosophy based around looking at clients' needs holistically, so that all stages of the production process are taken into account. Using this technique, the firm produces packaging solutions involving everything from cartons and trays through to plastic crates and pallets, depending upon the specific needs of each customer. The processes that they deal with extend from case erecting, to conveying and sealing packaging, as well as palletisation - meaning that all stages of the production process can be optimized. The firm also has a comprehensive environmental policy, and seeks to limit the amount of resources that it uses. 

SOCO SYSTEM Product Portfolio

The range of packaging products manufactured by SOCO SYSTEM AS includes:

  • Case erectors
  • Roller conveyors
  • Belt conveyors
  • Flexi conveyors
  • Conveyor belt controllers
  • Packing tables
  • Side pushers
  • Tilt tables
  • Case sealers and flap closers
  • Pallet roller conveyors
  • Transfer trucks
  • Rotary tables
  • Palletising robots
  • Stretch wrappers

SOCO SYSTEMS products are used by manufacturing firms across the world, wherever complex packaging tasks need to be organized and automated to the highest degree. Clients may also include retailers and warehouse operators.

Based in the German town of Balingen, IDEAL is the world's leading manufacturer of advanced shredders and paper cutting equipment for use in offices and workshops.

Producing paper shredders and cutting equipment since the 1950s

IDEAL, also known as Krug & Priester GmbH & Co. KG, are a globally known firm which specializes in the manufacture of office equipment. The firm was founded in Germany in 1951 by Wilhelm Krug and Ludwig Priester, and prospered throughout the 1950s by producing paper cutters and trimmers, spray guns and duplicators. As the number of office workers grew in the 1960s, IDEAL positioned itself as one of the world's leading manufacturers of paper shredding and cutting machinery, opening up operations in the United States in 1959. By the 1990s, IDEAL had struck partnerships with French and American companies, further expanding its international reach, all the while adding production facilities at its German base. Turnover also grew, and the firm became the world's leading producer of paper shredders in 1998. However, although IDEAL operates across the world, it remains firmly anchored in the community of Balingen, where it first started, and the company is a major local employer, with over 400 workers. The company has also invested heavily in making its production operations as environmentally sustainable as possible. It also offers a comprehensive customer support service, including a spare parts delivery service (although the firm claims that its machinery is guaranteed to last for a decade, making spare parts less relevant). For clients who need to improve their equipment, IDEAL also offers a trade-in service via their website.

The IDEAL product portfolio

The range of office equipment manufactured by IDEAL includes:

  • Desk side shredders
  • Office shredders
  • High capacity shredders
  • Rotary trimmers
  • Paper guillotines
  • Electronic staplers
  • Hole punches
  • Folding machines
  • Plastic bags for use with the firm's shredders


IDEAL is primarily on office products manufacturer, and its clients are almost all firms or other organizations with large administration needs. Suitable partners are any companies who handle large amounts of paper.

MKF GmbH is based in Germany and manufactures a selection of industrial vehicles, with a focus on compact forklift trucks. The company offers customers a wide choice of custom features, and provides full servicing packages as well.

Manufactures of compact forklifts and other industrial vehicles

MKF GmbH is a German firm which manufactures compact forklift trucks and other specialist materials handling vehicles for industrial and warehouse environments. A relatively young company, MKF's rise to prominence has been swift, having only been founded by Klaus Müller in 1999. Initially, the firm was actually intended to specialize in the renovation and retrofitting of older forklifts so that they could be returned to industrial uses. However, Müller noted that there was scope to improve the performance of the forklifts that the company was dealing with, and in 2007 he chose to form a manufacturing company that would sell its own vehicles with enhanced specifications - MKF GmbH & Co. KG.

Maintaining a family-run philosophy and meeting the needs of customers

Because it is a family-run firm, and the founder remains firmly in control, the vehicles manufactured by MKF GmbH are crafted instead of being mass produced. Each vehicle is designed with meticulous care, keeping in mind the needs of the client, and incorporating high quality components such as Deutz diesel engines. Parts of MKF forklifts are also engineered to a high level, such as the 100mm thick steel housings and the ability to fit them with super elastic tyres to ensure comfort and a smooth ride. MKF GmbH focuses on providing high performance vehicles with little fuss and a simplified design, stating that their motto is "as much as necessary, as little as possible." This means designing cabs and navigation consoles that are easy to use and uncluttered, with frames that provide an excellent level of visibility and seats that are designed to be ergonomic. MKF GmbH also assures clients that its technicians will be able to supply spare parts within 24 hours, and also commits to carrying out annual safety checks, while vehicles can be taken back to the MKF factory for alterations should the need arise as well.

Website: mkf-kompaktstapler.de

The MKF product portfolio

The range of industrial vehicles manufactured by MKF includes:

  • Customizable compact forklifts - diesel, electric and gas lift varieties
  • Telescopic cranes
  • Platform lift trucks
  • Heavy duty trailers
  • Heavy load haulers - gas, electric and diesel varieties

The vehicles manufactured by MKF GmbH will generally be used in factory or warehouse settings, but may also be used by construction companies, road builders, civil engineering firms and in agriculture.

The German company METABO are experts in manufacturing power tools, and produce everything from drills to glue guns, pumps and band saws. They specialize in manufacturing powerful cordless tools.

One of the largest power tool manufacturers in the world

METABO is a German firm which manufactures power tools for light and heavy engineering organizations. The company has its origins in 1924, when Albrecht Schnizler and Julian Closs jointly founded a company to manufacture high quality power tools. By 1929, the company had acquired a new name - Metabowerke GmbH - and the firm had begun to sell its signature hand drills by the thousand. From the start, METABO AG had to export its tools owing to the large demand for high quality tools from British steel-working companies, and foreign sales made up 80 percent of all sales by 1930, a sign of how forward thinking and technically successful METABO had become. After World War Two, the company flourished, and increased employee numbers from around 150 in the 1930s to over 1,000 by 1960.

Creating one of the world's largest portfolios of power tools

The product range also began to expand rapidly, with METABO introducing popular models of sander, electric hand grinders, and automatically controlled drills during the 1950s and 1960s. In 1969, the company had to expand into a new manufacturing facility in the town of Steinachwiesen, and international operations continued to expand as well. By 2010, METABO Group had created 24 overseas sales teams operating in 120 countries. The firm had also expanded to include 2,000 workers, with two production sites - one in Germany (at Nürtingen) and another in China. This growth was fuelled by constant demand for METABO's advanced power tools, which continued to innovate. In 2005, the firm introduced a light-weight and ultra-efficient range of lithium ion powered hand drills, while it consistently updated its cordless power tools to ensure that their mobility and ease of use was combined with power. The firm continues to place an emphasis on quality and manufacturing all components in-house. This ensures that METABO tools are durable and easily maintained should a new component be required.

METABO Products

The range of power tools manufactured by METABO company includes:

  • Angle polishers
  • Band files
  • Belt sanders
  • Bench grinders
  • Burnishing machines
  • Chipping, rotary and combination hammers
  • Circular saws
  • Compact angle grinders
  • Cartridge guns
  • Drills and screwdrivers
  • Fillet weld drivers
  • Impact drivers
  • Sabre saws
  • Magnetic core drills
  • Curve shears
  • Die grinders
  • Hedge trimmers
  • Glue guns
  • Hot air guns
  • Jigsaws
  • Paint removers
  • Planers
  • Wet polishers
  • Half-stationary band saws
  • Chip and dust extraction units
  • Immersion pumps
  • Compressed air guns, drills, grinders, files and sanders

The products manufactured by METABO are used in a huge variety of applications, from light engineering to home construction and DIY, as well as automobile mechanics, gardening and land management. Most METABO power tools can be purchased in cabled and cordless variants.

MITUTOYO is one of the leading international manufacturers of measuring equipment. The firm manufactures a wide range of metrological devices, from coordinate measuring machines to gages and callipers.

Manufacturing precision measuring equipment since the 1930s

MITUTOYO Corporation is a Japanese firm which is one of the world's foremost manufacturers of measuring and monitoring equipment. MITUTOYO Japan was founded in 1934 by Yehan Numata and initially specialized in the production of micrometers (which is still a key product area). The firm soon moved into other areas of measurement, supplying affordable and accurate gages and dials to industrial customers. By the 1960s and 70s, MITUTOYO had embraced the electronics revolution, and began manufacturing some of the first electronic measuring devices. It also moved into more specialized and ambitious areas of measurement such as optical comparators and coordinate measuring machines, which have been used widely in quality control systems. Along with more sensitive devices, MITUTOYO also started to develop software and interfaces to allow for more complex data collection and analysis, giving customers more power when making their measurements.

Becoming a Global Provider of Measuring Solutions

At the same time, the company chose to expand overseas at an early stage, opening its American branch in 1963 - MITUTOYO America Corporation. All of the time, MITUTOYO's technicians pushed the boundaries of measurement, delivering more accuracy with every year and, by 2000, the firm could offer over 6,000 different measuring products. With expansion, the company has opted to focus on providing bespoke measuring solutions for its clients. MITUTOYO runs an advanced metrological laboratory in the United States which specializes in delivering in-line measurement for manufacturing processes. This allows the firm's clients to make sure that their products are completely uniform and that any irregularities are rapidly detected. Additionally, the company also provides comprehensive client education from a number of centres across the world, covering aspects of using their products - including how to use their software. This ensures that their products can be used as effectively as possible.

The MITUTOYO Products Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by  MITUYOTO includes:

  • Coordinate measuring machines
  • Vision measuring systems
  • Contracers
  • Linear gages
  • Laser scanning micrometers
  • Digital scale and DRO systems
  • Optical measuring systems
  • Hardness testing machines
  • Micrometers and micrometer heads
  • Data management solutions
  • Calipers
  • Height and depth gages
  • Gage blocks
  • Indicators
  • Granite surface plates

The measuring equipment manufactured by MITUTOYO is designed to be used in a wide range of applications. They may be used to assess the regularity and strength of industrial products such as car bodies, or the shape of foodstuffs, while they also have important medical applications.

NORTON Saint-Gobain is based in Luxembourg and is one of the world's leading manufacturers of powerful diamond cutting blades and cutting machinery. Major clients include the construction industry, engineering firms and energy companies.

Website: nortonindustrial.com

International specialists in diamond cutting technology

NORTON Saint-Gobain is a company which manufactures specialist diamond cutting machinery for use in the construction and engineering sectors. The firm's origins lie in Worcester, Massachusetts where Franklin B. NORTON Saint-Gobain set up his workshop in 1858. The firm's initial success was in the manufacture of grinding wheels, and made some important advances in the production of vitrified wheels before the turn of the century. International expansion followed, with Saint Gobain NORTON Industrial opening subsidiaries in Germany in 1910 and then France, Italy and the United Kingdom before World War Two. After the War, Brazil and Japan were added to what had become a global distribution network for NORTON Saint-Gobain grinding equipment.

Relocating to Europe and meeting customer demands

In 1990, a key change occurred when the company was bought by the St Gobain group, where it remains. It's current market position is based upon the firm's ability to manufacture high quality diamond cutting equipment, which have delivered ever more effective blades and efficient machinery for users around the world. The company has also relocated from the United States to its current home in Luxembourg, where it can easily link up with its European client base. NORTON st Gobain maintains a comprehensive stock facility in Luxembourg, as well as a research and development facility. Additionally, it has created a support service which covers clients across the world, ensuring that after their purchase they are able to use NORTON cutting equipment effectively and safely. Safety is a crucial aspect of the firm's work, both for its own employees and those of its clients, and the firm's factory in Luxembourg has been fitted with advanced automation systems to enhance safety on the assembly lines. The company is also able to source spare parts and carry out repairs to existing NORTON machinery from its main factory, with an online parts search covering all areas of its product line.

NORTON Saint-Gobain Product Portfolio

The range of machinery manufactured by NORTON Industrial includes:

  • Handheld drilling motors
  • Handheld cut-off saws
  • Low-noise diamond blades
  • Specialist diamond blades for metals, ceramics, asphalt and bricks
  • Floor saws
  • Drill rigs
  • NORTON Grinding and polishing machines
  • Masonry saws
  • Power floats
  • Wall chasers
  • Dust extractors

The products manufactured by Saint Gobain NORTON  are used by organizations that need to cut through materials safely and with precision. Common clients include construction companies, engineering firms and vehicle manufacturers.

Based in Japan, MIKASA is a world-leader in the field of earth compaction, managing a wide range of rammers, rollers and vibrators for industrial clients.

Website: www.mikasas.com

MIKASA Manufacters Rammers and Other Earth Compaction Tools

MIKASA Sangyo Co., Ltd is a Japanese company which manufactures mobile earth compaction equipment for land management, construction and horticultural applications. The firm was founded in 1937 and immediately began to develop a reputation for producing light-weight construction machinery. The product range expanded during the post-war period, tamping rammers, forward compactors and specialist hand-guided rollers being included, allowing MIKASA Sangyo to offer a wide range of machinery options for construction projects involving the compaction of areas of land. The company remains anchored in Japan, with two factories in the towns of Kasukabe and Tatebayashi, along with a specialized research and development centre where the next generation of engineers designs up and coming models of MIKASA compaction equipment.

MIKASA Sales Strategy

However, although based in Japan, the company has acquired a global customer base, and exports a large proportion of its equipment via a global network of distribution partners. In fact, MIKASA realized early in its history that exporting would be the future, opening subsidiaries in Australia and New Zealand, Europe and North America in the late 1960s to handle overseas sales. MIKASA also supports its customers on a global basis, operating a comprehensive spare parts provisioning system that was set up in 1987. It also exhibits its products at international exhibitions, constantly trying to reach clients on every continent. MIKASA compactors has proved particularly popular with smaller construction firms and road building companies laying down flat asphalt surfaces, but its larger compaction equipment has also found uses in managing backfill operations at sewage works. Wherever land needs to be flattened for surfacing, MIKASA compaction equipment will find a use.

MIKASA Products

The range of construction products manufactured by MIKASA company includes:

  • Tamping rammers
  • Plate compactors
  • Reversible compactors
  • Vibration rollers
  • Concrete cutters
  • Concrete vibrators
  • Submersible pumps

MIKASA equipment is widely used by construction firms and road builders, where specific areas require compaction before surfacing. It also useful for gardening and land management tasks, as well as in industries such as sewage processing.

The Italian firm MOTOVARIO S.p.A. designs and manufactures gear systems and motors for use in industrial applications.

Website: motovario.com

Manufacturing transmission products and motors since the 1960s

MOTOVARIO is a company which manufactures transmission systems and different forms of motor for industrial uses. The company was founded in the Italian town of Formigine in 1965 and rapidly came to be the country's leading manufacturer of gear units for industrial clients. This position was cemented in 1998 when MOTOVARIO Group purchased the manufacturer Spaggiari Trasmissioni, adding transmission systems to its gear units and motors. Most of the company's manufacturing operations still take place in Formigine, but the firm has also opened a factory in the town of Ubersetto. In all, the company maintains factories with a floor space of 50,000 square metres and has 500 employees assembling its motors and gear units. In the recent past, MOTOVARIO has adapted to rapid technological changes by innovating and introducing new products. This has led them to offer a broad product portfolio which includes products such as mechanical speed variators and worm gear reducers.

Embracing automated production and ensuring quality control

Another aspect of the MOTOVARIO business has been the embrace of automated production, and its factories include numerous examples of robotized assembly lines, as well as quality assurance systems which make sure that every motor or gear unit meets the MOTOVARIO Italy quality specifications. Along with technical development, the firm also committed to supplying customers across the world and has opened sales subsidiaries in countries as disparate as China, the United Kingdom, India and the United States. This allows the service staff and sales teams of MOTOVARIO Corporation to reach clients almost anywhere in the key markets of the world. This could include a huge variety of clients, so staff need to be skilled in adapting MOTOVARIO's products to each niche. Clients have included ceramics producers, mining firms, and engineering companies - all attracted by the reliability offered by the firms motors and transmission systems.

The MOTOVARIO product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by MOTOVARIO includes:

  • Worm gear reducers
  • Helical gear reducers
  • Helical bevel gear reducers
  • Shaft mounted gear reducers
  • Motor variators
  • Electric motors
  • Inverter motors

MOTOVARIO SpA Italy motors and gear reducers are used in any industrial organization where power needs to be converted into motion. In practice, this could be anything from a ceramics plant to a power station, a coal mine, woodworking workshop or printing company.

MÜLLER WEINGARTEN are based in the German city of Weingarten and manufacture presses that have been used by some of the world's largest automobile manufacturers.

Website: schulergroup.com

Manufacturers of pressing equipment that is used by vehicle manufacturers

MÜLLER WEINGARTEN AG (also known as Schuler Pressen GmbH) is part of the Schuler Group of companies and is a German firm which manufactures gears and drives for its parent company as well as smaller presses that are used in industries such as automobile manufacturing. The firm was founded in 1866 by Johannes Michael Schatz in the town of Weingarten and within six years, MÜLLER WEINGARTEN had commenced production of metal working machinery including piercing punches and circular cutting shears. In the 1920s, the company moved into newer areas with production of its first large mechanical pressing units, specifically to serve Germany's thriving automobile sector. Seventy years later, the Schuler MÜLLER WEINGARTEN had grown to become a manufacturing concern with more than 2,500 employees and was still moving the design of industrial presses forwards from its manufacturing centre in Weingarten.

Developing advanced presses and merging with the Schuler Group

Innovations pioneered by MUELLER WEINGARTEN since the 1980s have included 3-axis gripper transfer presses, as well as some of the highest capacity transfer presses ever designed. Since 2007, the company has been part of the Schuler Group and its advanced presses have often been used by its parent company in supplying major corporations such as General Motors. The experience gained by MÜLLER WEINGARTEN over 140 years of operation is still being put to use in demanding industrial contexts where precision metal working is required. During its operation as an independent company, the firm expanded to acquire manufacturing facilities in Mexico and China, and these international links have been incorporated into the Schuler Group, giving MÜLLER WEINGARTEN sales potential across the world.

MÜLLER WEINGARTEN Machine Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by MÜLLER WEINGARTEN includes:

  • Small and medium sized screw presses
  • Slide pressure point and adjustment units
  • Gearing and drive systems for industrial presses
  • Notchers and notching cells

The products manufactured by MÜLLER WEINGARTEN are used primarily by the subsidiaries of the Schuler Group in supplying clients in various industries. Clients could include automobile manufacturers and ship builders, or any other firm which requires precision pressing capabilities.

The Swiss company MIKRON manufactures automated machining solutions for manufacturing companies. Typical clients would include electronics firms where complex assembly processes are involved.

Manufacturing machining and automation solutions for clients around the world

MIKRON Holding AG is a Swiss firm which manufactures machining and automation solutions that are used by industrial organizations to make their production processes more efficient. Maschinenfabrik MIKRON AG has its roots in 1908 when the company was founded in the town of Biel. Initially, MIKRON supplied watch-makers with machine tools and systems to allow them to increase production. At this stage, the firm specialized in gear cutting equipment, but the product range soon began to widen as the Swiss economy became more sophisticated. From the 1940s onwards, MIKRON CNC added products such as milling machines and plastic cutting devices to its portfolio, and also made strategic acquisitions to expand its product range - such as the firm Albe which manufactured ball-point pens. This acquisition brought MIKRON the ability to manufacture rotary transfer units. Steadily, the company brought together a collection of products and skills which allowed it to manufacture advanced machining centres for manufacturers with a high degree of automation.

Becoming a Global Automation Supplier

Overseas expansion also followed, with the founding of an American subsidiary in 1978 and a German factory as well. This was accompanied by further innovation, with MIKRON introducing game-changing technologies such as its Multistar machining systems and robotic assembly cells. In the 2000s, MIKRON brought to market the first linear assembly system to allow speeds of greater than 100 cycles per minute as well as advanced drills with interior cooling mechanisms to enhance efficiency and safety. During this period, the company also continued to acquire firms which specialized in automation, adding computer systems to its portfolio and mixing the machining expertise of MIKRON with its new partners. This means that the modern company with Mikron AUTOMATION can offer full consulting and installation services to industrial clients around the world, providing client-based automation solutions.

The MIKRON product portfolio

The MIKRON Machine portfolio includes:

  • Automation platforms
  • Tray handlers
  • Flexible feeding systems
  • Customized automation and feeding systems
  • CrazyDrill cutting tools
  • Loading and unloading systems
  • Pre-processing systems
  • Machining software

The Mikron machinery and systems are designed to allow manufacturers to automate and enhance their production processes. Any firms which assemble products from a complex range of components may be a suitable client, which would include electronics firms. Other clients include engineering firms that need to cut materials such as metals and plastics precisely.

French giant MICHELIN manufactures vehicle tyres. The firm is best known for its pneumatic car tyres, but the company also manufactures many different kinds of specialist tyre for use in industrial environments.

World leaders in the manufacture of high performance tyres

French firm MICHELIN is a multi-national manufacturer of vehicle tyres, and offers a range of different tyre-related products for commercial and industrial clients. The company was founded in 1889 by Edouard and Andre MICHELIN in the French city of Clermont-Ferrand. The company's big innovation came when they developed the world's first pneumatic tyre, allowing cyclists and, soon, motorists to swap tyres when they burst or wore out. As cars developed, so did MICHELIN's product range, with the company becoming one of a few suppliers of high performance tyres to automobile manufacturers around the world. Technological highlights included the introduction of the revolutionary radial tyre in 1946, which was developed to suit the product range of Citroen - which MICHELIN had taken over a few years before. The company also continued to supply tyres for industrial vehicles, not just private cars, introducing the first radial tyre for earth-movers in 1959.

Expanding overseas and introducing radial tyres for all applications

The firm also decided to push forward its tyre technology by creating one of the world's most advanced vehicle testing centres at Ladoux, which opened in 1965 and still ensures that MICHELIN tyres are adapted for tough conditions. Radial tyres for agricultural vehicles followed in the late 1970s, and then radial tyres for aviation uses - as MICHELIN also became a leading supplier of high performance tyres for Formula 1 racing teams. The 1990s saw the firm's research become focused on ensuring energy efficiency, and MICHELIN rolled out its ground-breaking range of low rolling resistance tyres in 1992. Alongside this commitment to efficiency, the company continued to supply even the most challenging industrial clients, creating the world's largest earth-mover tyres in 2001. The company also continued to expand abroad, opening massive manufacturing plants in Brazil and China in 2012, where the next generation of MICHELIN tyres will be produced to ensure that industrial vehicles run even more efficiently and reliably.

The MICHELIN product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by MICHELIN includes:

  • Earthmover tyres
  • Compact industrial tyres
  • Tyres for quarrying vehicles
  • Car, SUV and truck tyres
  • Specialist tyres for port vehicles

The tyres manufactured by MICHELIN are used in vehicles in a huge number of economic sectors. The firm's core range is designed for cars and SUVs, vans, trucks and motorcycles but specialist tyres are available for industrial vehicles such as earthmovers and mining lorries. MICHELIN can manufacture tyres for different weather conditions and grip requirements, meaning that it supplies most industries that require vehicle tyres.

The swiss company TRIMOS specializes in the manufacture of height gauges, horizontal measuring equipment and surface measuring tools, with a focus on precision measurement.

Manufacturing high quality measuring equipment since 1972

TRIMOS SA is a Swiss firm which manufactures precision measuring instruments that are used in areas such as the medical sector. TRIMOS  was founded in 1972 and since then has expanded to have three main business areas: height gauges, horizontal measuring equipment and surface analysing tools. These instruments are delivered to customers across the world via TRIMOS SA' 40 national agents, through which the company also offers a comprehensive technical support service, training for users of their measuring equipment and information about new products. TRIMOS places a strong emphasis on ensuring that each measuring tool is quality controlled to a high degree, and has achieved an ISO 9001 certification. This is coupled with a tradition of high quality production drawn from the values of Swiss manufacturing, as well as a high level of technical proficiency among the staff at TRIMOS. All measuring solutions are arrived at in full cooperation with clients, allowing the firm to create bespoke packages for different measuring needs. Whether the partner is in the food production sector, manufactures industrial vehicles or operates energy plants where temperature needs to be controlled, TRIMOS will work with clients to meet their needs. They also undertake to replace outdated equipment when renewal is needed, and provide a full range of software and drivers for use with their equipment, allowing clients to get the most out of their measuring tools.

TRIMOS Product Portfolio

The range of measuring tools manufactured by TRIMOS SA includes:

  • Height gauges
  • Horizontal measuring instruments for industrial workshops
  • Horizontal measuring instruments for laboratory use
  • Surface measuring instruments

The products manufactured by TRIMOS are used in a wide range of industrial and scientific applications. TRIMOS SA surface measuring tools are used to ensure that vehicle bodies are properly engineered, and their laboratory tools are widely used by pharmaceutical companies when developing drugs.

FLEX-Elektrowerkzeuge GmbH is one of the world's foremost manufacturers of hand-held power tools. The company is a member of the European Power Tool Association.

About FLEX

Founded in Germany in 1922, FLEX was originally known as Ackermann and Schmitt. The company was formed by Hermann Ackermann and Hermann Schmitt in order to manufacture and sell their new invention, the MS 6 hand-held grinding machine. The MS 6 featured an innovative flexible shaft driven by an electric motor and this inspired the tool's name of the Flex. In 1996, the company changed its name from Ackermann and Schmitt to FLEX.

Over the years, FLEX has cultivated a reputation for quality and innovation. The basic principles of the original Flex grinding tool are still in use today, although the product output continues to adapt, evolve and improve. In 2002, the company introduced 8 new technically advanced angle grinder models which included new features such as microprocessor controlled electronics. Long regarded as an innovator in the power tool equipment manufacturing industry, FLEX works with official dealers across Europe, Asia, Africa, North America, South America and Australia.

Top FLEX Products

  • L3709/115 750 Watt Angle Grinder
  • LE 9-10 125 Universal 900 Watt Angle Grinder
  • Giraffe GE 5 Wall and Ceiling Sander
  • LP 1503 VR Burnishing Machine

FLEX Product Portfolio

The FLEX product portfolio consists of a wide range of power tools. Although they specialise in angle grinders, FLEX also manufacture:

  • Sanders
  • Surfacing machines
  • Saws
  • Screwdrivers
  • Drills
  • Single-gear mixers
  • Polishers

All FLEX power tools and other products conform to CE standards and undergo rigorous quality checks.

WAGNER EQUIPMENT Co. is a firm which manufactures vehicles, work tools, as well as energy generation and distribution systems. It is part of the multinational firm Caterpillar.

An industrial vehicles manufacturer within the Caterpillar company

WAGNER is an American company which manufactures industrial vehicles, agricultural vehicles and power sources for industrial applications. WAGNER Equipment Co. has been a subsidiary of the multinational firm Caterpillar since 1976, when it began producing and distributing many of Caterpillar's heavy construction, mining, agricultural and infrastructure vehicles. Since then, the firm has developed a wide range of different kinds of vehicle and other products that allows it to supply custom built fleets of diggers, loaders, forklifts and trucks to major construction and mining projects across the world. The firm operates according to a set of principles which foregrounds teamwork, high quality and reliability, which is why WAGNER vehicles have become the mainstay of bridge and building construction operations on all continents. The firm has separated its core operations into several smaller organizations. One arm of WAGNER deals in the firm's respected Challenger tractors, while another specializes in manufacturing compact vehicles such as telehandlers. Another deals with the firm's power systems, providing electricity generators to mining and construction operations, as well as delivering energy transportation systems and industrial crushing services. WAGNER was one of the first firms in its area of expertise to invest heavily in online retailing, and it operates a full spare parts provisioning service via its online portal, as well as providing technical support via its over 100 field technicians. As well as selling industrial vehicles, WAGNER also runs a flexible rental operation that can supply all sizes of project for limited periods.

The WAGNER product portfolio

The full range of industrial products manufactured by WAGNER includes:

  • Articulated Trucks
  • Backhoe Loaders
  • Pavers and Planers
  • Dozers
  • Compactors
  • Excavators
  • Forestry machinery
  • Harvesters
  • Challenger Tractors
  • Hydraulic Mining Shovels
  • Material Handlers
  • Skid Steer Loaders
  • Pipelayers
  • Telehandlers
  • Tunnelling Equipment
  • Energy Pipelines
  • Electricity Generators
  • Vocational Trucks
  • Industrial Tools

The products manufactured by WAGNER are used in a huge variety of different industrial sectors. Their energy systems may be used by oil and gas companies, while their vehicles are used in agriculture, mining and construction and their vocational trucks are used in haulage.

The German firm LOGOPAK Systeme GmbH & Co. KG manufactures a wide variety of labelling equipment and tracking devices that are used in mail order retail and sectors such as the food processing industry.

Manufacturers of advanced labelling and tracking systems

LOGOPACK Systeme GmbH & Co. KG is an industrial company which manufactures advanced labelling systems and equipment. The firm has been manufacturing labelling equipment since 1978, and has progressed to become a world-leading producer of integrated labelling systems for industries such as the food processing sector and medical applications - where precise labelling it vital. The company is based near Hamburg in the town of Hartenholm, but has two other offices in Germany, as well as a widespread international organization - with sales agents in France, the Netherlands, the UK, Poland, Sweden, Denmark and the United States. Across the world, the firm employs more than 250 people, including technicians, researchers and sales representatives. From the early 1990s, LOGOPACK became a pioneer in the use of advanced firmware to control labelling machinery, which established its position as a major innovator in the labelling sector. This was followed by the introduction of RFID identification systems from 1999, as LOGOPACK sought to be a technology leader in its chosen field. This has been assisted by the formation of a RFID research centre in partnership with Metro Group, where the company seeks to create more efficient labelling and tracking systems. The company has sought to form partnerships with firms in a wide variety of industries, from food manufacturers to car makers, the paper industry and even the tobacco industry, where LOGOPACK machines apply 140 labels per minute to branded cigarette packs. And the firm has also played a leading role in the expansion of online mail order, with the use of its tracking systems being widely used by online retailers.

The LOGOPACK product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by LOGOPACK includes:

  • Pallet labellers
  • Tray, shipping and box labellers

GARDENA is a German firm which manufactures equipment that is used in the horticulture and land management sector across the world. Based in the city of Ulm, GARDENA was founded in 1961 as a manufacturer of basic garden tools. As German householders and municipalities focused on improving the quality of their environment, the company prospered during the 1960s, supplying more sophisticated equipment to meet the nation's horticultural challenges. Instead of focusing on individual tools, GARDENA products decided to focus on creating integrated gardening systems that would increase efficiency and make land management much easier. This resulted in innovations like the firm's Micro-Drip system and advanced sprinkler systems, which cut back on water wastage and ensured that plants received a better standard of hydration. The success of GARDENA products prompted the Swedish multinational Husqvarna to acquire the firm in 2007, and further expansion and innovation has followed the takeover. The Italian firm MOTO GUZZI is one of the world's leading manufacturers of motorcycles. The company supplies commercial and public sector clients, including police forces, emergency services and delivery companies.

Europe's oldest continuous manufacturer of motorcycles

MOTO GUZZI S.p.A. is an Italian firm which manufacturers motorcycles and motorcycle engines, with a focus on producing fast, reliable and high quality machines. Their range includes models that are widely used in police and other emergency services work, as well as courier delivery services. Founded in the Italian town of Mandello del Lario in 1921, MOTO GUZZI is the oldest continuous manufacturer of motorcycles still operating on the European continent. During this time, it has introduced several innovations that changed the face of motorcycling across the world, including the first 8 cylinder engine and pioneering the use of wind tunnel testing for all vehicles. The success of the firm in producing robust, popular motorcycles prompted the Italian vehicle manufacturer Piaggio to buy the firm in 2004, which has enabled MOTO GUZZI to expand its presence in key international markets such as the United States. Throughout its history, MOTO GUZZI has not just focused on manufacturing consumer vehicles, but has also manufactured several variants of commercial models as well. For example, the firm was one of the first companies to market a "truck-motor cycle hybrid" which could transport loads of over 350 kilograms. The firm's ability to produce reliable, stable and easy to maintain utility bikes has meant that their vehicles are widely used in American and Italian police fleets, along with city fleets such as those used by emergency services in Berlin. Currently MOTO GUZZI has a workforce of 300 people at its factory in Mandello, and produces more than 10,000 bikes per year for a variety of different kinds of client.

The MOTO GUZZI product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by MOTO GUZZI includes:

  • Motorcycles adapted for medical courier uses
  • General courier vehicles

The motorcycles manufactured by MOTO GUZZI are mainly sold to private individuals, but the firm also supplies public sector clients in bulk, such as police forces, emergency services and health organizations. Private delivery firms are also major clients.

Based in Germany, WANZL Metallwarenfabrik GmbH is a leading manufacturer of products for use within the retail industry. The company also provides innovative solutions for the logistics and hospitality sectors.

About WANZL

Now one of the leading partners of the global commerce industry, WANZL was founded in the town of Leipheim, Germany in 1947. When the very first self-service supermarket opened in Hamburg in 1949, WANZL supplied both the shopping baskets and shopping trolleys. Over the company's lifetime, WANZL has patented a number of retail industry products, including the stack-able shopping trolley in 1950 and the first fixed basket trolley in 1951. In 2003, the company launched its first plastic shopping trolley.

As the company grew, it began to expand into international markets and now has branches all over the world including the United Kingdom ( Wanzl UK Ltd ), Italy, Austria, Poland, Belgium, China, South Korea and Australia. At the beginning of the twentieth century, WANZL created two new divisions - Airport and Security Solutions and Logistics and Industry - to sit alongside its existing Shop Solutions division. In 2012, the company acquired TECHNIBILT, the leading manufacturer of shopping trolleys in North America.
