The company has been under the control of the same family since its inauguration in 1869, and has managed to balance being a traditional family run concern, with expanding its operations across the world. The company now controls over 20 separate firms under the AMMANN umbrella from its Swiss headquarters. While it has been expanding into countries such as India and Brazil, its key production sites are in Europe. Based in Langenthal, Switzerland, the firm has factories in the German towns of Hennef, Ettlingen and Alfeld as well as a facility in Bussolengo, Italy and Nove Mesto, Czech Republic. There are also concrete mixing plants in Shanghai, Ahmedabad, India as well as Gravetai, Brazil.

AMMANN Equipment Ltd. is a go-to firm for many international construction projects because of its reputation for reliability and its global reach. Its manufacturing plants produce machinery as diverse as industrial compactors, hand held rammers, mobile and semi-mobile asphalt mixing plants as well as concrete mixing plants of all sizes. The firm works to deliver the right size of plant for any organization's needs and offers 24 hour support for customers, helping to get the most out of their products. AMMANN also operates an efficient spare parts delivery service which spans the globe.

Website: ammann-group.com

AMMANN Product Portfolio

  • Hand held rammers
  • Single drum rollers
  • Pneumatic tyred rollers
  • Asphalt and concrete mixing plants
  • Tracked and wheeled road pavers
  • Software solutions to use with AMMANN equipment

AMMANN Group works with clients to produce bespoke solutions to their construction challenges. AMMANN rollers and compactors are designed for use by large corporate clients, public bodies working on large infrastructure projects and smaller firms or private clients.

One of the world's foremost producers of motor vehicle components and garden equipment, AL-KO has been in existence since 1931. Their core value has always been Quality for Life.

About AL-KO

From humble origins in the small village of Großkötz in Günzburg, Germany, AL-KO GmbH has grown to become a world leader in the components industry. Locksmith Alois Kober was just 23 years old when he founded the company in 1931 as a metalworking shop. It wasn't long before Kober moved into engineering, laying the foundations for the company's future reputation as a quality manufacturer of hand brake levers, frame chassis for caravans and lawnmowers.

In 1975, AL-KO added air conditioning technology to a product portfolio which already included the manufacture of a wide variety of motor vehicle components and products for the home garden including  lawn mowers and water pumps. Today, the company is a world-wide concern with over 50 sites located across the globe including its native Germany, the UK, France, Italy and Australia, employing in excess of 4,000 thousand people in the process.

AL-KO Product Portfolio

AL-KO is divided into three distinct areas, each producing technology for separate industries - automotive, air-conditioning and garden.

Vehicle technology has long been at the forefront of AL-KO activities. Their products in this area include:

  • Shock absorbers 
  • Gas springs 
  • Chassis for caravans and motorhomes
  • Anti-skid systems

Much of AL-KO's international business lies within the manufacture of garden machinery. Their portfolio in this area includes a variety of lawnmowers such as electric, petrol and robotic models, in addition to lawn tractors. Other garden-related tools produced by AL-KO include:

  • Cultivators
  • Hedge trimmers
  • Electric chainsaws

Still run by the Kober family, AL-KO products remain a leading force in industrial technology and engineering.

A world leader in the manufacture of overhead cranes and hoists, ABUS is a German company with a Europe-wide reach. Values of authenticity, skill, innovation, and scrupulous attention to detail make ABUS Crane Systems a smart choice when it comes to sourcing industrial cranes.

Company development and values

ABUS Crane Systems Ltd was founded in Wetter, Germany, in 1965 by Werner Bühne. It quickly made a name for itself with its highly reliable wire hoists, and by 1994 it has a strong customer base in not only Germany but Sweden, Spain, and the UK. ABUS is emphatically a family run and customer led business, which leads to a very personal sense of commitment to every customer's individual needs and aspirations.

Being passed down through the generations has enabled ABUS Cranes to maintain a continuous, and continuously successful, business strategy as well as providing scope for innovation and creativity. For example, whilst continuing to expand, in the early part of the twenty first century (2002-5), ABUS introduced its compact modular chain hoist. Similar interventions in the market have characterised the progress of ABUS over the years; for example in 2006-7, it launched its modular generation of end carriages to further enhance the strength and efficiency of its cranes and hoists. ABUS Cranes Germany brings not only half a century of experience to the industry, but also personal dedication and care.

  ABUS Products

  • Jib cranes
  • Electric chain hoists 
  • Lightweight mobile gantries
  • HB-systems 
  • Overhead travelling cranes

The machines from the brand BOXER, that are made by MERTZ MANUFACTURE, Oklahoma, and COMPACT POWER EQUIPMENT, South Carolina, follow the moto, "Big Power in all Places", in order to determine the best relationship between weight and power.

The history of BOXER's products

The history of Mertz Manufacture starts in 1927, when it was founded. Traditionally, the company grew with their development, production and international sales of machines for heavy industry, particularly the mining industry. MERTZ are specialists for hydraulic machines, and they worked together with COMPACT POWER EQUIPMENT, a specialist for light industry, to tap into a new market with their BOXER-range in 2000. The differently dimensioned and robust wheel loaders are particularly suited for heavy-duty work in restricted spaces.

Range of products

In addition to large machines, equipment for mining and hydraulic machines, the compact wheel loaders in the various BOXER ranges conquer the international market. Their product ranges are optimally constructed to create a lot of power, even though they are relatively light. This means that, for example, the model 322D (weighing only 860kg) can move 600kg around. The BOXER wheel loader is particularly easy to use, because if the driver leaves the machine, the machine stops. The turning, the rubber track chassis and its light weight, means that the BOXER is applicable in a variety of areas and is a particularly economic wheel loader.

Product portfolio

  • Small wheel loaders with a rubber track chassis

Grupo Electrógenos GESAN S.A. is a multinational leader in the manufacture, distribution and marketing of  power generators. The company belongs to the Atlas Copco Group and is located in Muel, Zaragoza (Spain).

The history of the company GESAN

GESAN was founded in 1986 by Luis San Gil. The original philosophy, which still holds true today, read as: "To offer a wide range of generating sets of outstanding quality and which would meet the client’s needs." From the onset, GESAN focused on the design and manufacture of a wide variety of  generators and its global approach quickly made it a pioneering company in Spain. Already in 1992, GESAN began what can only be described as a global conquering expedition. GESAN has a well established distribution network in more than 85 countries, with the biggest markets in Africa, Russia and Europe. GESAN gets the majority of its turnover from the international market. With 160 employees its production and assembly facility has always been in Muel, Zaragoza, east of Madrid and it covers 94,000 m2. In response to climate change and as part of its global approach, GESAN strives to implement environment-friendly processes. As of July 2011 GESAN is a subsidiary of the Atlas Copco Group.

Website: gesan.com/en

Main Products

GESAN Atlas Copco manufactures state-of-the-art technology and its facilities in Zaragoza have several production lines. All products receive the ISO 9001 and ISO 14001 Certificates to guarantee the high quality of the wide range of generator sets from 2 – 3,100 KVA. Its main products are diesel and petrol generators that are used for primary power supply as well as standby purposes. The diesel generator sets are air cooled or water cooled.

Production Portfolio

  • Stationary E & D (a wide range of generators for emergency and continuous power requirements, divided according to their kVA-capacity)
  • Mobile Power (Tractor driven units, portable and rentable for temporary or continuous power requirements)
  • Light Towers (a lightweight with a long-lasting light and easy maintenance; perfect for use in mining, construction or emergencies)
  • Solutions (a team of engineers will find efficient solutions for unique requirements)

The Arnz FLOTT GmbH is located in Remscheid, NRW (Germany) and manufactures drilling equipment and breast drills for the German market.

The history of the FLOTT GmbH

In 1854, Friedrich August Arnz founded the Arnz FLOTT GmbH Werkzeugmaschinen with the purpose of manufacturing high-quality machine tools for the drilling industry. Since then it has become a “pioneer” of innovative design. The headquarters of FLOTT in Remscheid are connected with a production site and combine accounting, purchasing, sales and marketing with construction. After the economic crisis hit FLOTT in 2009, when the company had to file for bankruptcy, FLOTT GmbH managed to work its way out of the red and in July 2013 not only added another service facility in Radebeul but also received an innovation award. Internationally, FLOTT has further production sites in Central Europe and is represented in numerous countries, such as the United States. For many years the bestselling product was the bench drilling machine FLOTT Alpha, which was discontinued only after the introduction of the new bench drilling generation TB 13 Plus. In 2012, for the first time, FLOTT participated very successfully in the IMTS Show in Chicago. In 2013, Arnz FLOTT GmbH took over the delivery and service for the English XYZ Machine Tools in Germany.

Main products

FLOTT is a leading manufacturer of products in the drilling industry, especially of drill presses, drilling machines, sawing machines and grinding machines. All its machinery is typically equipped with digital depth and speed indicating displays as well as continuously variable electronic drives. With numerous patents and trademarks Arnz FLOTT GmbH is generally considered a market leader in regards to technology and modern ergonomic design. The certificate DIN EN ISO 9001:2008 guarantees the high quality and longevity of its products. Drilling machines made by FLOTT come in three variations: Column drilling machines, bench drilling machines with a table and bench drilling machines without a table but with a rack.

Website: flott.de/en

´

FLOTT Machines

  • Drilling Machinery (E-, M-, P-Series and Single / Three Phase 230V AC)
  • Grinding Machinery (Belt Grinding, Foot Standing with Dust Extraction, Bench Grinding, Deburring, Pipe Notcher)
  • Sawing Machinery (Metal Band Saws, Portable Metal Band Saws, Metal Circular Saw)
  • Special Machinery (A variety of different products for numerous needs)

ESAB is based in Karben, Hesse (Germany) and is a developer, manufacturer and distributor of fully automated CNC shape cutting machines and programming systems for machines. It provides machines for all thermal cutting processes and all common marking processes.

The history of the company ESAB

In 1904 Oscar Kjellberg founded the company Elektriska Svetsnings Aktiebolaget (ESAB) in Gothenburg, Sweden. At the beginning ESAB was focused on repair in the shipbuilding sector and only twenty years later, in 1921, a German subsidiary was founded in Berlin focusing on electrodes and machines. Before the Second World War, ESAV Cutting Systems GmbH introduced submerged-arc welding processes and in 1953 the company had already found its top priority to be welding machines. In 1968 ESAB presented the A20, one of the first orbital welding plants for recuperators and Karben has been the manufacturing base for the company's cutting sector since 1975. The ESAB Group exists since 1989 when the industry leaders L-TEC Welding & Cutting Systems, Alloy Rods Corporation, All-State Welding Products, ESAB Automation and ESAB Welding Products all teamed up. Over the years, ESAB also merged with Hancock and took over Filarc Deutschland and the German Software developer Atas. The ESAB Group belongs to the Colfax Corporation and employs more than 8,400 people globally and more than 190 people in Germany.

ESAB Welding & Cutting Products

ESAB produces mainly filler metals and welding equipment for use in the oil, gas and steel industry, metalworking and in engineering. ESAB welding and cutting products are being used in shipbuilding, civil construction, pipe mills, energy generation, marine equipment, process industry and vehicle construction. The products are being developed and manufactured according to constant, market-driven enhancements in order to improve the cutting processes of flat plates and panels made of metal, steel and titanium. Center stage products at ESAB are CNC plasma cutting systems with the patented precision hole technology.

Production Portfolio

  • ESAB Cutting Systems (plasma cutting, oxy-fuel cutting, laser cutting, waterjet cutting, plate marking, bevel cutting)
  • ESAB Cutting Machines (straight line cutters, shipyard panel lines, single torch pattern cutter, CNC, shape cutting, precision plasma cutting and others)
  • Controls
  • Software Systems (two types, for programming, nesting and managing production data)
  • Components (cutting and marking tools)

HAMM specialize in manufacturing rollers and other forms of soil compaction equipment. Their major client base is private companies and public bodies across the world who are engaged in road-building or the construction of other flat hard surfaces.

HAMM AG - World Leaders in Soil Compaction & Road Construction Equipment

HAMM Germany is a specialist in manufacturing compaction equipment for use on road construction projects. HAMM AG History stretches back to 1878 when two brothers, Franz and Anton HAMM decided to start a machinery business in the town of Tirschenreuth. Although they started off producing agricultural equipment, the HAMM brothers soon found that their speciality was in crafting heavy rollers for road-building projects. As the road system developed in Germany, their rollers became a common sight on construction projects, supplying the compaction that civil engineers required. Exports to other markets began to take off in the 1950s, with the post-war economic expansion, and customers from across the world sought out HAMM rollers, with their excellent handling and aesthetic appeal. As road technology changed, HAMM AG adapted newest technologies in the industry, bringing in oscillating rollers in the 1980s which could process more sensitive road materials. The firm even moved into new areas of production, launching a popular soil stabilizer in 1992 and merging with the larger Wirtgen Group of companies, giving HAMM market reach across the world. In the 2000s, HAMM Deutschland continued to innovate, developing new production facilities such as Europe's best equipped drum manufacturing plant, and their rollers continued to attract international awards for their quality. HAMM AG expanded to include tandem rollers, rubber wheel rollers and compact rollers, and the firm established itself as a world leader in its field. HAMM also invested heavily in new technologies, introducing the Hammtronic system into its rollers, which allows users to automate key functions, saving time and fuel in the process. HAMM has also perfected a range of different compaction techniques, such as vibrating and oscillation. It has also created a suite of tools for clients to use when measuring the quality of compaction - bundled up in what the company calls "HAMM Compaction Quality."

The HAMM Equipment Portfolio

HAMM Machine Portfolio includes the following product categories:

  • Padfoot compactors
  • Vibratory compactors
  • Tandem rollers
  • Static rollers
  • Rubber wheeled rollers
  • Soil stabilizers
  • HAMM compaction meters
  • Temperature meters
  • Navigation and monitoring software for a fleet of rollers

HAMM Machinery is designed for clients who require soil and asphalt compaction, meaning that they are widely used in road construction, but they are also used in the laying down of flat asphalt surfaces in other contexts such as airports.

FANUC EDM and Robotics was founded in 1956, as a subdivision of Fujitsu that developed numerical controls. Two years later, the first commercial numerical control of the company was shipped to Makino Milling Machine Co., Ltd. In 1972 the company was outsourced from Fujitsu and renamed to Fujitsu Fanuc Ltd. It still remained part of the Furukawa Group. In 1974 the company developed the first industrial robot of Japan. In 1984 the first fully automatic injection molding machine for plastic, the “Fanuc Roboshot”, was developed and produced by FANUC Corporation Fanuc Japan has the headquarters of the company in the Japanese village of Oshino which is situated in the district of Minamitsuru. The subdivision Fanuc USA Corporation was founded in 1977 (the name was changed to Fanuc America Corporation in 2013), in 1978 the Fanuc Europe S.A. was founded, since 2012 its name is Fanuc Europe Corporation. In 1982 the name of the parent company was changed to FANUC which is an acronym for “Factory automation numerical control“. Between 2003 and 2007 ten more affiliated companies were founded, some of them are operated as joint ventures. FANUC runs over 200 branches in more than 40 countries in the world and has about 6,500 employees.

FANUC Main Products

FANUC is the biggest producer of factory automation systems in the world. Also, it is one of the biggest producers of industrial robots and computer numerical controls worldwide. Many Japanese and American carmakers and manufacturers of electronics use the products of the company to increase their production capacities.

Production portfolio Examples

  • Industrial robots
  • Servomotors
  • Injection molding machines
  • Wire cutting machines (EDM Machines)
  • Milling cutters
  • Machine tools for nano-processing
  • Carbon dioxide lasers

ELB Schliff Werkzeugmaschinen GmbH is located in Babenhausen, Hesse (Germany) and is one of the market leaders in manufacturing high-precision surface and profile grinding machines and products. It is part of the Autania Group, and therefore also belongs to the Dr. Helmut Rothenberger group of companies.

The history of the company ELB Schliff

In 1948 ELB Schliff was founded by Edmund Lang in Babenhausen, near Darmstadt. The initials of the founder's name and of the founding location served as inspiration for the name of the new company. The second part of the name “Schliff” refers to the manufacture of modern CNC-controlled grinding machines for the industry. As a global player, ELB established numerous subsidiaries all over the world. In 1982 it founded ELB America, Inc. serving the market of the United States, Mexico and Canada. A year later ELB Schliff (India) was incorporated and serving the South Asian Market. With approximately 150 employees ELB was able to celebrate the delivery of 3,000 machines by 2007. For more than 60 years ELB Schliff has its manufacturing base in Babenhausen and in 2012, together with aba grinding technologies GmbH, it opened a second base in Aschaffenburg.

Main products

ELB works solution-oriented in the field of processing tasks, manufacturing high-precision surface, profile and creep feed grinding machines as well as highly effective production systems. ELB applies complete machining processes with geometrically defined blades - as in lathing, cutting and drilling - in addition to machines with flexible traveling tables and traveling columns. Future oriented as ELB has always been, its main products contain many elements made of resin based concrete. ELB produces for the tool and die making industry as well as for engineers and the metal industry. Its focus lies with the manufacture of components for turbines and other applications in the hydraulic industry, as well as in solar and wind energy. One of its most prominent clients is the Chinese turbine manufacturer HTC.

ELB Schliff Werkzeugmaschinen GmbH Production Portfolio

  • Cylindrical Grinding Machines (with CNC controls, with positioning stage and movable columns like SmartLine, Plan-Master)
  • Creep-feed Grinding Machines (MicroCut, FutureLine)
  • Speed-Stroke Grinding Machines (JuwelLine)
  • High Precision Profile and Surface Grinding Machines (with PLC or CNC controls)
  • Precision Surface Grinding Machines (microprocessor controlled)
  • Rotary Table Machines

ABA Grinding Technologies GmbH ist located in Aschaffenburg, Bavaria (Germany) and produces high-precision profile, full face and flat grinding machines. Belonging to Autania Grinding Technologies, which in turn belongs to the Dr. Helmut Rothenberger Group, ABA is a leader in the CNC profile grinding technology.

The history of the company ABA grinding technologies GmbH

Established in 1898, the initial company was named Messwerkzeugfabrik Alig & Baumgärtel Aschaffenburg (ABA). The company's focus was the production of thread rolling dies and measuring tools and soon it added the manufacture of grinding machines for high-precision to its portfolio. Since 1933 ABA has concerned itself primarily with advancements in the manufacture of high-precision surface and profile grinding machines which led to a change in its name to Schleifmaschinenfabrik ABA GmbH. In 2002 the company merged with z&b Werkzeugmaschinenfabrik GmbH to form the collective ABA z&b Schleifmaschinen GmbH. As part of the development following this merger ABA was absorbed by the Autania group in August 2010 and its name changed at that point to ABA grinding technologies GmbH. When the Autania group took over ABA, the company had 50 experienced employees. With its long tradition in grinding technology ABA does not only serve a variety of different industry sectors, but also has sales offices all around the world.

Main Products

ABA produces approximately 100 machines every year and provides its customers with an extensive product range. Its main products are bridge style grinding machines and rotary table grinding machines. As a manufacturer of high-precision machines for demanding tool making and for the engineering industry ABA produces cost-effective base models as well as complex machines and custom made products. Among others, ABA products are used in the molding industry, the aerospace industry and the automobile industry.

Production Portfolio

  • Surface and Profile Grinding Machines (universal surface grinders like the easy Grinder 5 and the gantry Line RT)
  • Special-purpose and Project Machinery (High Speed Grinding machines)
  • Automatic Grinders with loading and unloading systems
  • Cylindrical Grinders
  • Rotary Table Grinders
  • Horizontal and Vertical Rotary Table Surface Grinders
  • Horizontal Spindle Surface Grinders
  • Swing Frame Grinding Machines
  • Internal Grinders
  • Controllers for Grinding

GREIF Robot Schleifsystem GmbH is based in Grevelsberg, NRW (Germany) and manufactures machines for mechanical surface refinement of metal workpieces. The family-business is a global trademark for polishing machines, buffing machines and grinding machines.

The history of the company GREIF Robot Schleifsystem GmbH

In 1923 GREIF first appeared on the market with the task of producing high-quality machines for grinding and polishing. Today's high loading capacity of GREIF motors is a result of its long-standing experience, since GREIF focused from the beginning on enhancing the quality of its motors for better quality. In 1996 the company received a “make over” which leads many newcomers to the sector to believe that GREIF is relatively new to the market. In fact, it's been around for more than 90 years and contributes with its small but skilled team of experts to the know-how in the metal sector. The family-business has always been small and works with approximately 30 devoted employees, among them engineers for the application analysis, the development as well as the mechanical and the electrical design of all GREIF machines. As a registered trademark GREIF serves the industry as well as workshops. Following the trend, GREIF extended its national and European business relations to many Asian and African markets, to which it ships via Hamburg. As a future-oriented company GREIF aims at exploring further innovative methods to enhance the capacity and quality of its products. The company is considered a mid-size business and a leading producer in the market's metal sector.

Main Products

As a manufacturer for surface refinement machinery of metallic pieces GREIF offers a wide range of products. Its specialty lies in abrasive belt grinding, buffing and polishing machines. The company divides its products into manually operated machines and automatic machines.

Production portfolio

  • Workshop Grinding Machines
  • Industrial Polishing and Buffing Machines
  • Industrial Abrasive Belt Grinding Machines
  • High Speed Rough Grinding Machines
  • Round Abrasive Belt Grinding, Polishing, Buffing Machines (For tubes and bars)
  • Flat Abrasive Belt Grinding, Polishing, Buffing Machines
  • Rotary Table Grinding, Polishing, Buffing Machines
  • Robot Aided Grinding, Polishing, Buffing Machines

FRIZ Kaschiertechnik GmbH is located in Weinsberg, Baden-Wuerttemberg (Germany) and is a manufacturer of wrapping machines. The company belongs to the Homag group.

The history of the company FRIZ Kaschiertechnik GmbH

In 1906 FRIZ was founded by its name giver Adolf Friz. The goal was the manufacture of machines for surface lamination of wood and wood derivatives. From the beginning the company included departments for production, administration, development and service in Weinsberg. Among its most innovative developments are the profile wrapping machine in 1936, the membrane press in 1937 and the line for surface lamination in 1960. In 1978 the first hydraulic membrane press hit the market and initiated the beginning of plastic profile wrapping as part of the company's production. A member of the Homag Group since 1980, FRIZ continuously introduces new machines, such as for the lamination of thick veneer in 2007 and the Urea based laminating system for thin boards in 2008.

Main Products

The manufacture includes individual machines as well as production lines. The main products include machines and lines for surface lamination, such as laminating machines, glue spreading machines and profile wrapping machines that can work with wood, metal, plastic, papers, veneers, PVC and a lot more. The high-precision work of the individual FRIZ unit is based on important applications, such as the hot melt gluing unit and the slot nozzle application. FRIZ also offers custom-built machines and solutions for costly and slow profile changeovers. Customers are found in a variety of market segments, especially in the furniture and structural elements industry.

Product Portfolio

  • Profile Wrapping Machines

J.G. WEISSER Söhne GmbH & Co. KG is based in Germany's Black Forest and manufacturers turning machinery for industrial clients. The firm specializes in innovative, advanced machinery with a focus on energy efficiency.

Website: weisser.de/en

One of the World's Leading Manufacturers of Energy Efficient Precision Lathes

WEISSER is one of the most well known manufacturers of precision  turning machinery in the world. The firm is based in the town of St Georgen, which is located in Germany's Black Forest region, where it has manufactured machinery since the 1830. WEISSER machinery has become a common sight in automobile factories, and are widely used in the metallurgical sector across the globe. Founded by Jacob WEISSER, the firm began as a producer of lathes for local workshops which supplied the clock making industry. As the industrial revolution took hold, JG WEISSER expanded its operations, developing single spindle machines and supplying German factories as heavy manufacturing grew. The 1950s saw further expansion and change, as the firm developed grinding and turning centres with exceptional stability and precision. Waste was further eliminated in the metal working process during the 2000s, as WEISSER introduced path-breaking new techniques such as magnetic spindle turning and rotational turning, allowing for increased production and simplified work processes. J.G. WEISSER also worked to introduce turning machines with far greater energy efficiency and lower carbon emissions than conventional models, in keeping with WEISSER's commitment to sustainability. Nowadays, the firm aims to deliver high productivity via rapid production processes while delivering a reliable service from its new factory in the Black Forest.

The WEISSER Product Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by WEISSER includes:

  • UNIVERTOR Single-spindle pick-up precision lathes
  • UNIVERTOR Twin spindle pick-up precision lathes
  • VERTOR Single-spindle vertical lathes
  • MULTICELL turning centres
  • Electric precision lathes
  • GREENPLUS control and monitoring systems

WEISSER turning machines are used by any industrial organization that requires the manufacturing of precision parts. This may include vehicle, appliance and machinery manufacturers as well as energy companies.

AYEN is a firm that is based in Germany and specialized in manufacturing equipment for the woodworking industry. It focuses on boring and milling machinery, with an emphasis on reliability and quality.

Website: ayen.com

Specialists in wood milling, drilling, glueing and dowel insertion

Karl AYEN Maschinenfabrik GmbH has been manufacturing high quality machinery for the woodworking industry since 1946. AYEN are based in the German town of Mössingen, where its factory manufactures precision tools that are exported across the world, with a particularly large export operation in Russia. AYEN's range includes hole boring machines, boom drills, specialist milling machines, wood repairing stations, lathes as well as machines that are used to insert dowels. These products are also sold as integrated machining solutions to clients who require a range of tasks in their production processes, and AYEN provides a full training and installation service to ensure that these processes are fitted properly. Another service that the firm provides is the provision of used equipment, and older models of its range can be ordered from its central factory. AYEN's machines are sold across the world, and have a reputation for being long-lasting, precise and reliable. They are particularly common in workshops which require the insertion of dowels for complex joinery, and for production processes which require precise glue injection. Its drilling machines are known for their flexibility, with vertical and horizontal capabilities present on the same machines, and they are noted for the ease with which they can be maintained. This makes them popular amongst woodworking firms wherever precision and ease of use is required.

The AYEN product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by AYEN includes:

  • Magnum glue and dowel insertion machines
  • Dowel boring machines
  • Vertical and horizontal drilling centres
  • Line boring machines
  • Spindle tilting boring machines
  • Boom drills

AYEN's products are suitable for all woodworking firms and workshops. They are particularly applicable to furniture manufacturers and joinery workshops where precision is required and are suited to mass production processes as much as bespoke woodworking.

The Danish firm SABROE is part of the Johnson Controls Denmark ApS corporate structure, but retains its separate identity as a leading manufacturer of  air compression and cooling machinery.

Website: sabroe.com

A Danish firm specialized in Refrigeration, Compression and Air Conditioning

Having been producing air compression machinery for over one hundred years, SABROE Denmark is one of the most experienced names in their field. They market themselves as offering flexible, technologically advanced solutions that can be customized, upgraded and replaced with ease. Projects that the firm works on include refrigeration plants, air conditioning units, heat pumps and industrial coolants - always with a focus on achieving maximum energy efficiency for the project at hand. SABROE also have a history of environmental achievement, and their thermal transfer systems are used in many sustainable energy set ups where energy conservation is vital. This may include biogas generation, passive and photovoltaic solar electricity or wind power. Another aspect of the firm's environmental credentials is their commitment to using natural refrigerants whenever possible, and SABROE complies with all Danish regulations on emissions and energy consumption. The company has mechanisms in place to supply spare parts to all clients and also offers a thorough remanufacturing service to allow for client upgrades and to maximize sustainability across the firm's operations. SABROE is a Danish firm, with its main factory in the town of Hoejbjerg. It is also part of the broader Johnson Controls corporate structure, through which it has access to markets on all continents.

SABROE Products

SABROE manufactures the following products:

  • Packaged ammonia chillers
  • Carbon dioxide compressors
  • Reciprocating compressors
  • Screw compressors
  • Controls for compressor units
  • Remote monitoring systems
  • Parts for SABROE compressor

SABROE manufactures cooling and air conditioning equipment, and their products are used across a wide spectrum of firms. Chemical manufacturers, pharmaceutical firms, energy companies and food and drink producers are all major clients. SABROE also supplies homes and offices.

ABB Asea Brown Boveri Ltd. is a Swiss based firm which deals with electricity generation, transmission and storage, supplying customers with high-tech solutions to complex energy needs.

A global company focusing on electricity generation, transmission and storage

ABB is based in Switzerland which specializes in manufacturing products used by the electricity generating industry. The origins of the modern firm lie in the nineteenth century, when Ludvig Fredholm started a company in Stockholm which supplied electricity generators for the new municipal lighting system. At the same time, in Switzerland Brown, Boveri began to create high voltage power networks. The two firms developed separately, breaking new ground in power generation and transmission and pioneering technologies like nuclear power. They came together in 1988, when ABB Group was formed with headquarters in Zurich. At this stage, the group had a workforce of 160,000 people spread all over the world. Since then, ABB Limited has continually innovated, producing new designs for electric propulsion systems for ships, robots and automated power generation technologies. It has assisted in projects such as supplying electricity to berthed cruise liners, across the Australian continent and to oil rigs in the North Sea, specializing in complex high voltage power lines and grids. With its most recent innovation, ABB hopes to have solved the "war of currents" allowing large scale DC networks to be created. All of this research feeds into the firm's mission statement, which is to provide reliable, efficient energy solutions in a sustainable manner. With its expertise in energy efficiency and storage, ABB is well placed to deliver sustainable solutions in future markets of robotics.

The ABB product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by ABB includes:

  • Low and medium voltage AC and DC drives
  • Switchgears (air insulated, hybrid and gas insulated)
  • Generator circuit breakers
  • Disconnectors
  • Instrument transformers
  • Surge arresters
  • Capacitors and filters
  • Monitoring equipment
  • Laminates
  • Machine parts and fastenings
  • Low voltage circuit breakers
  • Door entry systems
  • Enclosed switches
  • Electromagnetic materials
  • Motors and generators

ABB Inc. manufactures products that are used in a huge range of situations and by many different clients. They have installed grids in cities, laid power lines across continents and supplied cruise lines with transmission solutions.

MAKA specializes in the manufacturing of CNC machining centers with a high level of automation. MAKA machines are designed to work with wood, plastics and metals, and cover large and small industrial processes.

Experts in CNC machining of plastics, metals and wood

MAKA Systems GmbH is a German manufacturer of CNC machining centers which supplies industrial partners in the automotive, aviation, carpentry and ship building sectors. Founded in 1952, MAKA operates a factory with more than 160 employees in the Bavarian town of Nersingen, where their experts manufacture machinery that is used in the processing of metals, plastics, wood and composites. After its foundation, MAKA became leaders in the field of automated CNC manufacturing, developing trademark products such as the firms automatic tool changer and high speed routing spindles. It also expanded during the 1980s, opening north German operations in Herford and organizing an American branch which commenced operation in 1997. MAKA GmbH also created a Europe-wide distribution network, which was completed by the formation of a British subsidiary in 1998, and continued to embrace new technologies, becoming a pioneer in robotic production methods. MAKA also started to accumulate environmental awards due to its sustainable production techniques. The firm has a philosophy that is centred around providing "everything from one source" - meaning that support is available all the time, wherever it is needed. It also guarantees the provision of spare parts for a decade after purchase and provides CNC experts for the use of clients when they encounter challenges. Clients can also attend the firm's innovation centre in Nersingen, where MAKA Systems GmbH provides specialist consulting services and exhibits new products.

MAKA Machines

The range of products manufactured by MAKA Systems includes:

  • Stationary CNC woodworking machines
  • 5-axis universal machining centers
  • CNC aluminium machining centers 
  • High speed aluminium cutting machines 
  • Plastic cutting machines 
  • Moulding centres 
  • Spare parts for all MAKA products

MAKA machines are purchased by a number of different types of industrial clients. Partners include furniture makers, vehicle manufacturers, ship-builders, aviation firms, house builders, railways and model making companies.

The German company SCHULER has a long history of manufacturing presses for metals and plastics, manufacturing a wide variety of products for industrial applications. It currently focuses on energy efficient, automated presses and forming devices.

One of the world's largest manufacturers of presses and forming machines

SCHULER AG is one of the world's leading manufacturer of metal and plastic forming machinery. Its major products include presses - such as SCHULER hydraulic press and stamping press -, automated equipment and dyeing systems, while it has a particular speciality in coin minting techniques and supplies many products to automobile manufacturers. The firm was founded by Louis SCHULER in 1839, but machine tool manufacturing began in the 1850s after the founder visited the Great Exhibition in London. By 1895, SCHULER AG was exporting presses from Germany to China, pioneering globalization in the process. Nowadays, the company has a focus on panel pressing and laser technology and is just as forward thinking as ever, creating new processes such as the first compact crossbar press. SCHULER operates plants across the world, in locations as different as Brazil, China, Germany, France, the UK, India and Thailand. It also seeks to partner with suppliers across the world in the search for greater reliability and efficiency when serving its clients. SCHULER has adopted a wide ranging corporate social responsibility plan, investing in education and the environment on a global basis, and seeking to recruit skilled young technicians into the firm via the Schuler Academy. The firm also provides a comprehensive support network and spare parts for all of its equipment, and provides tailored customer training for clients when this is required, so that they can get the most out of their SCHULER press.

SCHULER Machines

The range of products manufactured by SCHULER AG includes:

  • Automotive presses
  • Stamping and cutting systems
  • Coin minting technology
  • Hydraulic presses
  • Cold, warm and hot forging systems
  • SCHULER Presses for the packaging industry
  • Drives and generators
  • Automated production lines

SCHULER Germany partners with organizations in many different industries. This includes the packaging industry, coin production, automobile makers, the energy sector, railways and aviation companies.

THWAITES is a British specialist manufacturer of on-site dumpers. THWAITES has been in business since the 1950s and is based in the city of Birmingham. The company prides itself on providing strength, safety and serviceability in every dumper that it manufactures. THWAITES Dumpers says that it regards itself as being at the forefront of advanced design and innovation in the field.

Website: thwaitesdumpers.co.uk

History of THWAITES

THWAITES has always been based in Birmingham, a city renowned for its expertise in heavy manufacturing. From the very beginning, this family-run firm has specialised in dumpers aimed at the construction industry, and it is this focus that gives it its strength in the market today. In the 1970s, the best-selling THWAITES Ltd model was the 2 tonne four wheel drive model, while today its most popular machine is the advanced 6 tonne, fitted with the company's power swivel, which allows the operator to tip a load to either side, allowing for maximum flexibility on site. Over the years, THWAITES has expanded its manufacturing facilities, allowing for computerised design and an advanced production line to allow for maximum quality. The use of low emission Yanmar diesel engines gives the dumper range power, economy and meets environmental requirements. Operator ergonomics are key to the THWAITES Ltd philosophy, with reduced sound levels and improved control and pedal layout. Electrical components are water resistant, to allow THWAITES dumpers to operate in all conditions.

THWAITES Product Portfolio

  • Dumper
  • Micro Dumper

VEM Motors GmbH is a leading engineering firm which focuses on the manufacture of drive systems and motors for industrial purposes. It is based in Germany but operates a sales and support network with global reach.

A global manufacturer of drive systems and motors for a wide range of clients

German firm VEM is a specialist motor and drive system manufacturer which runs factories in Berlin, Dresden, Wernigerode, Zwickau and Krauschwitz. It was formed in 1997 from the firm Horst Plaschna Management und Co. KG which was rolled into the VEM group of corporations. The first decade of its existence saw VEM expand rapidly, particularly capitalizing on the growing demand for wind generators and energy efficient motors. The core of the firm has remained the manufacturing of precision engineered drive systems for industrial organizations, which are designed and built at the firm's test facilities in Germany. Its drive equipment includes a range of different products, which stretch from transformers to motors and frequency converters. VEM also constantly invests in technological progress, modernizing its tube rolling facilities at every opportunity. Although production is centred in Germany, VEM operates a global marketing and support network, and promises to provide a staff member wherever in the world a client is located. They also seek to ensure that all projects are completed with regard to core principles of reliability, honesty and competence. VEM's research centre is located in Berlin, where technicians work to create user-specific solutions using a wide variety of test bays. The firm also seeks to provide one stop solutions which take in a number of different challenges, partnering with firms as diverse as energy producers and mining companies.

The VEM product portfolio

VEM's product portfolio includes the following products:

  • VEMoDrive controlled drive systems
  • Low voltage motors
  • Explosion proof motors
  • Marine propulsion motors
  • Water cooled motors
  • Slow running motors for heavy industry
  • Frequency converters

    • VEM partners with a variety of different clients, depending upon the job required. Partners include mining, energy, cement manufacturing, transport, shipbuilding, construction, water, steel and chemical industries across the world.

The German company BLOHM JUNG GmbH is one of Europe's leading manufacturers of grinding machines. Its range of grinders supplies clients in many industrial settings, from car production to turbine manufacturing.

Expert grinders that have been based in Hamburg since 1924

BLOHM JUNG GmbH is a German company which manufactures grinding machines for industrial applications. The company was founded in 1924, and since that point over 15,000 grinding machines have been delivered to clients across the world. BLOHM JUNG GmbH started life as a maker of measuring equipment in Hamburg but during the post-war period, it developed a speciality for producing flat grinding machines that use ball guides. The 1970s and 80s saw the firm introducing advanced CNC technology in the quest for precision and efficiency, as well as designing larger integrated grinding centres. In the 1990s this technological advancement was matched by a thorough emphasis on "lean production" methods, further improving productivity at BLOHM's plants. More recently, BLOHM JUNG has continued to introduce new products such as its 3-spindle guideway grinding machines and new methods of machining exotic materials for applications in the aviation sector. The company also expanded into Chinese markets by striking up a partnership with Körber Schleifring China. BLOHM JUNG's major area of activity is now in supplying mass production grinding equipment to the automotive sector, with a focus on ensuring that all processes benefit from automation as much as possible. However, the firm partners with many different clients, from vehicle manufacturers to packaging companies and turbine makers.

BLOHM JUNG GmbH Product Portfolio

The selection of products manufactured by BLOHM JUNG includes:

  • ORBIT medium sized profile grinding machines
  • PLANOMAT 3-point profile grinding centres
  • PROFIMAT mass production grinding centres
  • PROKOS high speed grinding machines
  • Integrated machining solutions
  • Software packages for use with BLOHM products

BLOHM JUNG GmbH partners with many different kinds of firm, although its major clients are in the vehicle manufacturing centre. The company also sells its products to energy and turbine firms, packaging companies and metallurgical firms.

DAF Trucks is a Dutch company which is one of the world's leading manufacturers of long-distance haulage vehicles. The firm also supplies specialist  vehicles for mining and forestry applications.

Manufacturing high quality long-distance haulage trucks since 1928

DAF Trucks N.V. is a Dutch company which specializes in the manufacture of heavy trucks for the long-distance haulage industry. The firm was founded in 1928 by Hub van Doorne as an engineering and repair shop, but the firm quickly switched to concentrating on the production of sturdy freight trailers during the 1930s. The firm then gained success, delivering reliable vehicles to the Dutch army, before changing its name in 1948 to Van Doorne's Automobiel Fabriek. DAF was one of the most innovative manufacturers of buses and trucks in post-war Europe, pioneering slide-out engines, which made maintenance much easier. The firm focused on truck production from 1950, opening new production facilities and supplying armed forces across Europe with multi-purpose vehicles. This strategy was so successful that, by 1955, DAF Trucks had turned out its 10,000th chassis, and continued to innovate, introducing trucks with the highest load capacity available at that time. This resulted in some ground-breaking vehicles, such as the 2600 haulage truck, which has been dubbed the "mother of international road haulage" as well as new departures for the firm such as tipper chassis designs and cement mixers. During the 1970s, DAF Trucks introduced light-weight trucks, as well as diesel models, including the popular "Supercontinental" truck, which became a common vehicle on long-distance haulage routes.

Winning rallies and developing sustainable haulage systems

During the 1980s, DAF pushed the boundaries further, and regularly won the Paris-Dakar rally with its reliable trucks that could perform in even the most demanding situations. Its trucks continued to become more spacious, more powerful and remained as lightweight as possible, driving up efficiency. New models came on the market, such as the "Euromaster" in 1990. However, during the 1990s, the haulage market suffered, and DAF TRUCKS was acquired by haulage group PACCAR in 1996, securing its future. The firm weathered the storm and brought out new trucks as the 2000s arrived, with the LF class of truck winning the Truck of the Year award in 2002, while a new test centre was opened in 2008. 2010 saw DAF TRUCKS launching another first, with its range of hybrid trucks, and the firm expanded overseas, opening a Brazilian factory in 2013.

The DAF Trucks product portfolio

The range of industrial vehicles manufactured by DAF Trucks includes:

  • The Euro 6 range of haulage trucks (XF, CF and LF models)
  • The Euro 5 range of haulage trucks (XF and CF models)
  • Specialist trucks for the forestry and mining sectors
  • PACCAR MX-11 and MX-13 engines
  • Components for trucks, specialist vehicles and buses/coaches

Thee product manufactured by DAF Trucks are mainly used by long-distance haulage firms, but their specialist vehicles are also purchased by forestry,  construction and mining companies, while their engines are used in buses, coaches and military vehicles.

The German firm BEMA is a family-run firm based in Saxony which manufactures robust sweeping and ploughing attachments for cleaning vehicles such as tractors, industrial vehicles and loaders.

Manufacturing sweeping and snow plough attachments since the 1980s

BEMA GmbH Maschinenfabrik is a leading manufacturer of street sweepers and snow ploughs, and supplies environmental management organizations across Europe. The firm's history began in the 1940s, when it was founded by Heinrich Berens. At first, BEMA was manufactured horseshoes for the agricultural sector in Saxony, but branched out during the 1950s and 60s into agricultural machinery. However, the firm changed direction in the 80s and 90s, when the next generation of the Berens family took charge, and BEMA became known for their sweeping and ploughing machinery. Because of its roots in agriculture and the Berens family, the company seeks to blend a commitment to innovation and quality with respect for tradition, and it continues to invest generously in its home community of Voltlage. From small beginnings with an ironmonger's workshop, BEMA has opened a state of the art manufacturing facility in Voltlage, which employs the latest in sustainable, environmentally sound coating techniques.

Harnessing technology to make cleaning environmentally friendly and convenient

The popularity of BEMA's ploughs and sweepers has meant that the firm has needed to expand its focus across the world, and it has a well developed network of distributors and technicians on all continents. The firm also ensures that research carried out in Voltlage is efficiently disseminated to the firm's agents across the world for use in marketing and support seminars, helping to make the customer experience as smooth as possible. The firm also focuses on quality, producing sweepers that are designed to be used continuously over large areas that can also be used over rough terrain. BEMA also manufactures a range of different sizes of cleaning vehicles, depending upon the context, so public bodies can purchase a fleet of light-weight and compact sweepers for urban road cleaning, while industrial organizations can find something more robust. The firm has also pioneered to use of a special polyurethane coating on its snow ploughs which protects the road surface against abrasion during cleaning, making them popular in Alpine towns and North America alike.

The BEMA product portfolio

The range of cleaning attachments manufactured by BEMA includes:

  • "Snow champion" plough attachments
  • Heavy-duty "Titan" industrial sweeping attachments
  • "Power master" roller brush sweepers
  • Robust sweepers for construction sites
  • "Kommunal" compact urban sweepers
  • Dust-free industrial sweepers

The products manufactured by BEMA GmbH are used in a diverse range of applications. Their cleaning attachments may be used on construction sites, factory floors and warehouses, workshops where dust is a problem and on city streets and pavements.

The German firm BITO Lagertechnik manufactures storage bins, order picking systems and materials handling equipment that seeks to rationalize the processes used by warehouses and manufacturing companies.

Leading the way in materials handling and storage since the 1950s

BITO-Lagertechnik Bittmann GmbH is a German firm which operates across Europe, manufacturing innovative storage systems and waste disposal units for warehouses, workshops and factories. The company specializes in delivering automated order picking solutions, allowing clients to make their manufacturing processes as efficient as possible. BITO was founded by Leopold Bittmann in 1845, but was initially a manufacturer of metal accessories used as decorations in the German leather industry. The firm changed dramatically from 1959 when Fritz-August Bittmann took over. He saw a huge opportunity in the production of dynamic storage systems and materials handling, which could allow manufacturers to make huge improvements to their production processes. In the 1970s, the firm took a huge step forward with the introduction of "live storage", and backed this up with the opening of an enormous steel manufacturing facility in 1978 in the firm's home town of Meisenheim. The 1990s and 2000s saw BITO expanding rapidly, opening a host of European subsidiaries, as well as an Indian production centre in 2007 and one in Dubai in 2008. This made BITO storage systems one of the world's market leaders in automated materials handling, advising and improving production process across the world.

Streamlining efficiency for manufacturers and storage firms

The company has divided its production sites into different facilities for steel shelf manufacturing (Meisenheim) and plastic bin production (Lauterecken), as well as a specialist pallet racking centre in India. BITO has also pioneered customer experience strategies, allowing prospective clients to visit their experience centre to see the firm's products in action, and ask questions about how they could be applied to the client's own business operations. BITO also tries to ensure that clients' needs are met by using trial processes so that the right materials handling solution can be found for each challenge. Technicians will also provide a full consultation package, from project planning through to production, delivery and maintenance. The company is also committed to ecological production processes, and offers a wide range of storage products that are made from 100 percent recycled materials, and delivering financial savings to customers.

The BITO product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by BITO includes:

  • Storage bins
  • Stacking containers
  • Nesting and folding containers
  • Plastic trays and pallets
  • Transport trolleys and table trolleys
  • Boltless shelving
  • Pallet racking
  • Cantilever racking
  • Impact barriers
  • Safety markings
  • Labels and document pockets
  • Steps & ladders
  • Workstation systems

BITO's products are used in organizations that involve large amounts of materials handling. Any firm which uses small components such as engineering, electrical or furniture makers may benefit from their storage and handling systems.

BRIDGESTONE is a Japanese manufacturing company that is famous for the production of vehicle tires. However, the company also produces other rubber products such as noise-reduction materials and electro-materials.

World leaders in rubber tire manufacturing and other industrial materials

BRIDGESTONE is a Japanese manufacturer of tires for personal, commercial and competitive uses. BRIDGESTONE Tire Co., Ltd. Was formed in 1931 by Shojiro Ishibashi, who translated his own name into English to come up with the company name. With vehicle sales booming in Japan, the firm quickly assumed a position as the country's leading tire manufacturer, and introduced innovations such as nylon and rayon tires during the 1950s. Further developments followed during the 1960s, with the opening of a new factory and research centre in Tokyo, as well as a corporate museum. The firm also opened international subsidiaries, with an operation in Thailand commencing in 1969 and an American arm opening in 1967. American expansion really accelerated when the company acquired American tire producer Firestone in 1988, which also brought BRIDGESTONE new production centres in South America and Europe, making the company a global player in the automotive industry. The 1990s saw BRIDGESTONE become a household name as the company began a well-known association with the Indianapolis 500 and Formula One racing. Then, the 2000s witnessed another key development, when BRIDGESTONE acquired the firm Bandag, which brought with it a tire retreading business and the capability to manufacture high quality products for industrial trucks and buses across the world.

A product range that goes beyond vehicle tires

BRIDGESTONE operates plants across the world, on every continent, with 14 alone in the United States and 11 dotted around Europe. The firm has even globalized its research and development efforts, opening research centres in Japan, the United States, Italy, China and Thailand, alongside testing tracks to ensure that the company's tires are as durable and effective as possible. The company straddles the divide between consumer products and industrial tires, providing equipment for factories and mining companies in the form of treaded vehicle tires. BRIDGESTONE can provide spare tires and servicing for industrial vehicles like dump trucks and loaders, as well as treaded diggers, with the ability to rapidly deliver spares on all continents due to its global distribution network. With its expertise in rubber manufacturing, BRIDGESTONE also offers industrial products such as insulating materials and electro-materials that are incorporated into factories and high-tech laboratories across the world.

The BRIDGESTONE product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by BRIDGESTONE includes:

  • Vehicle tires for trucks, cars and buses
  • Tires for construction and mining vehicles
  • Specialist aircraft tires
  • Anti-vibration and noise reducing materials
  • Polyurethane foam products
  • Belts
  • Hoses
  • Electro-materials
  • Commercial roofing materials

The products manufactured by BRIDGESTONE are predominantly rubber products and are used in many different industries. Noise reduction materials could be used in the audio recording industry, as well as heavy plants, while electro-materials could find applications in the health care sector. The firm's tires are widely used in industrial vehicles in the mining and construction sectors.

CEBORA SpA is an Italian firm which has two areas of expertise. The firm manufactures both plasma cutting and welding equipment, as well as castors and wheels for use with heavy loads.

Website: cebora.it

An Italian leader in the plasma cutting and portable welding field

CEBORA SpA is an Italian company which specializes in the manufacturing of welding and plasma cutting equipment. The company was founded by Emiliano Generali in 1954 as "Costruzioni Elettromeccaniche Bolognesi", which was later shortened to CEBORA SpA. Initially, the firm manufactured battery chargers and portable welding kits, but quickly developed the capability to manufacture more complex welding machinery. At the same time, CEBORA SpA branched out into a different line of work, which the firm still maintains. In 1958, it formed a subsidiary called Officina Ruote & Affini, which became one of Italy's leading manufacturers of wheels and castors for office use. However, the firm's core operations have been in welding, and CEBORA Italy expanded into markets as far afield as Latin America and Asia during the 1960s, developing new models of powerful and portable welding machines. However, the firm received an even greater boost when it became one of the first companies in the world to develop effective plasma welding products. In 1986, it introduced the "Plasma Pocket", which instantly attracted buyers around the world. The 1990s saw the firm's welding technology improved by new power sources, which increased energy efficiency and made their products more convenient by extending their batter life. CEBORA SpA also embraced global trends towards robotics and automation, manufacturing welding products which took their place on production lines in a number of manufacturing fields.

Manufacturing castors and wheels for materials handling challenges

The success of CEBORA has been accompanied by a strong focus in research and development, and the firm has enjoyed a particularly fruitful relationship with the University of Bologna. This has helped CEBORA Italy to extend the power sources used by its welding equipment, and to boost the strength of their welding capabilities at the same time. The firm's industrial wheels and castor business has also not stood still, producing plastic castors with impressive load capacity, as well as the stainless steel "X-Line" range of castors, which have become a vital part of many factories and warehousing operations due to their lightweight and great strength. Due to these developments, in total CEBORA SpA now employs more than 150 skilled employees, and has become an exporting success story, with 70 percent of its products heading to overseas markets.

CEBORA SpA Product Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by CEBORA SpA includes:

  • MIG welding machinery
  • Plasma cutting machinery
  • Specialist power sources for Plasma and MIG welding in industrial settings
  • Automated and robotic welding solutions
  • Wheels and castors for warehouse, industrial and office use

The products manufactured by CEBORA SpA come in two categories. The welding and cutting equipment that the firm manufactures is used by metal working, automobile and aircraft manufacturers, construction firms - any organization that works with metals. The firm's castors and wheels are used in warehouse and industrial settings where heavy loads are involved, as well as office environments.

C. & E. Fein GmbH have been manufacturing compact, easy to use power tools and machines since the 1860s, and continue to produce a range of tools that are used by metal working, construction and vehicle manufacturers, amongst many other clients.

One of Germany's leading power tool manufacturing companies

C. & E. FEIN GmbH is a German manufacturer of power tools for professional uses. FEIN was founded in 1867 by Wilhelm Emil Fein as a manufacturer of electrical tools, and received a boost when Wilhelm's son, Emil, invented the world's first electrical hand drill in 1895. This launched the company into the first rank of German tool manufacturers, with products such as power drills and jigsaws equipped with movable shafts revolutionizing the way that professional craftsmen operated. The post-war period saw further innovations, with C. & E. Fein GmbH leading the way in some of the most advanced sectors of the economy, such as underwater drilling and the development of oscillating cutting tools. The 1990s and 2000s saw the firm developing more compact, increasingly efficient and portable drills, screwdrivers and hammers which delivered the same power but with more convenience and energy efficiency, reflecting the firm's continuing drive for technological development.

Made in Germany, sold across the world

All of FEIN's production remains in Germany, but the company has expanded across the world, with 20 subsidiaries and 50 distributors ensuring that the company's products will be accessible on all continents. The company is a major employer, with more than 900 employees, and is also a prolific accumulator of industrial patents, a product of its extensive research and development efforts. FEIN positions itself as a reliable manufacturer of efficient and lightweight power tools for industries as diverse as metal working, automobile construction and home-building, and is committed to working as closely as possible with its customers too ensure that they achieve the results that they desire. Some of the firm's flagship products include elegantly made cordless drills as well as adaptable "multi-master" tools which can be enhanced with a variety of attachments, and features the firm's advanced oscillation reduction technology. These kind of products reflect FEIN machine's stated goal to make their power tools as user-friendly and precise as possible, goals that the company says are drawn from their experience and German roots.

C. & E. Fein GmbH Product Portfolio

The range of tools and accessories produced by FEIN includes:

  • Cordless drills
  • Multi-master versatile tools
  • Rotary drills
  • Tappers
  • Metal core drills
  • Tek screwdrivers
  • Drywall/deck screwdrivers
  • Impact wrenches
  • Compact, angle and die angle grinders
  • Polishers
  • Dust extractors
  • Pipe milling machines
  • Slitting and sheet metal sheers
  • Surface finishing tools

The products manufactured by C. & E. Fein GmbH are diverse and suited to many different applications. Many of the firm's clients are metal-working firms, but construction and automobile manufacturing companies are also major partners. Practical applications also include ship-building and dry-wall installation in new homes.

The American firm BLACK & DECKER is one of the world's leading manufacturers of portable power tools and other appliances. Products range from hammers and drills to lawn mowers and flashlights.

Global pioneers in the manufacturing of portable power tools

BLACK & DECKER Corporation is a multi-national manufacturer of powertools and other industrial and crafts machinery. The firm was formed from two firms in 2010. The first was engineering and boat building company founded by Frederick Stanley in Connecticut, United States in 1843. The second was founded in 1910 in Baltimore by Alonzo Decker and Duncan Black, and became the world's first power tool manufacturer in 1916 when they secured a patent for a portable drill, revolutionizing the world of production and construction. After supplying a large amount of tools to the United States Army during World War Two, BLACK & DECKER expanded rapidly in the economic "golden age" of both Europe and America, supplying many of the hammers and drills that helped to reconstruct societies after the war. The firm continually added more products and made strategic acquisitions, further broadening its range, producing one of the most broadly based tools manufacturing companies in the world. Although the company expanded across the world, it has retained its roots in Maryland, where it was founded and its corporate headquarters remains, in the small town of Towson.

Suppliers of everything from lawn mowers to air compressors

Nowadays, BLACK & DECKER supply both high performance industrial tools and a selection of consumer power tools for the mass market, but is great strength remains in portable equipment, the area where it made its major breakthrough. The range of products is wide, with BLACK & DECKER manufacturing everything from air compressors to electric portable screwdrivers, and the firm claims to be able to solve almost any "do it yourself" challenge faced by consumers. The firm also manufactures many industrial products such as grinders, hammer drills and heavy planers, that are designed for use in professional workshops and factories. Customers are supported by a multi-national network of support technicians, with support centres located on every continent, and a spare parts service ready to supply replacement components whenever they are needed. Along with the production of reliable power tools, BLACK & DECKER is also positioning itself as a sustainable company, and prioritises the recycling of batteries for its products, which can be simply arranged via the corporate website.

The BLACK & DECKER product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by BLACK & DECKER includes:

  • Air compressors
  • Batteries and chargers
  • Circular saws, jigsaws, reciprocating saws
  • Drills
  • Grinders
  • Hammer drills
  • Nailers
  • Planers
  • Rotary tools
  • Routers
  • Sanders
  • Screwdrivers
  • Work benches
  • Lawn mowers
  • Lawn strimmers and edgers
  • Leaf blowers

BLACK & DECKER products are mainly aimed at individual consumers and small businesses which rely upon high quality, portable power tools - such as builders, technicians and engineers. They may also be supplied to larger industrial firms and workshops, while their garden maintenance equipment is suitable for horticulture and land management companies.

The CONSTRUCTOR Group AS includes a variety of companies, all of which are active in the storage sector, and their products include shelving, automated order picking systems and cabinets.

Experts in storage, materials handling and order picking

CONSTRUCTOR Group AS is a Norwegian firm that manufactures warehousing solutions, from order picking systems to automated shelving. Although the firm has its origins in the nineteenth century, CONSTRUCTOR Group was founded in 1996 in norway when the firms Electrolux Constructor and Kasten Høvik merged. Since that time, the firm has assembled a consolidated group of companies which also includes Bruynzeel, Dexion and PSS, representing one of Europe's leading suppliers of warehouse machinery. The different subsidiaries of the group have different capabilities and expertise. For example Bruynzeel supplies specialist storage solutions for institutions like universities, libraries and archives, as well as government bodies. The firm also provides efficient ways for hospitals and other health care institutions to store and locate medicines securely. CONSTRUCTOR Group adds expertise in warehouse organization, with products available that can assist with pallet handling and the storage of small parts that are used in industrial assembly processes. The group added Dexion as well, which pioneered adjustable storage systems, along with Finnish firm Kasten, which has a long history of manufacturing steel shelving and automated order picking products.

Finding client based storage solutions across Europe

The CONSTRUCTOR Group AS can provide a wide range of different products due to its collection of different subsidiaries. Areas of expertise extend from health care through to archiving, warehousing and office storage. Wherever small parts and papers are stored and manipulated, the firm will have a solution to meet the needs of clients. The firm seeks to be the leading European provider of  storage systems, and specializes in tailoring custom installations to the needs of each client, as well as offering full consultancy services before purchase. CONSTRUCTOR Group has also invested in sustainable production, seeking to ensure that as much steel as possible is reprocessed, and encouraging the limitation of waste throughout its production cycles. Although the group remains based in Norway, it has ambitions and a sales network that extends across the continent, and has factories in Romania, Germany, Holland, Russia and Finland.

The CONSTRUCTOR Group AS product portfolio

The range of storage and order picking products manufactured by the CONSTRUCTOR Group includes:

  • Small parts shelving
  • Health care product storage and delivery systems
  • Automatic storage machines
  • Pallet handling machines
  • Mobile office cabinets
  • Cantilever racking
  • Pigeon-hole racks
  • Timber lockers
  • A-frame racks
  • Mezzanine floor systems
  • Lockers and cabinets for warehouses
  • C-WIS (Constructor Warehouse Intelligence System)

About STIHL Chainsaw Manufacturer

Andreas STIHL AG & Co. KG was founded in Germany by Andreas Stihl in 1926. It was in this year that Andreas built the very first electrically powered chainsaw. Right from the very beginning, STIHL has been renowned for its pioneering innovation, advanced technology and the high quality of its production output.

With its main headquarters based in the German town of Waiblingen, STIHL employs in excess of 12,000 people worldwide. ZAYER is a Spanish firm that manufactures specialist CNC milling machinery for the metal working sector. DELL is an American company, which is one of the world's biggest manufacturers of computers and computer related products. The company's products are used worldwide by individuals and organisations for personal and business purposes.

Global leaders in the field of computers and computer related products

With headquarters in Round Rock, a city in the United States, DELL is a global leader in the field of computers and computer related products. Starting from a humble background in a university dorm in 1984 with the name, PC's Limited, the vision of one man, Michael Dell changed it all. From the time the very first computer system, Turbo PC was developed in 1985, DELL has grown over the years. Being the very first company to offer next day home product assistance and risk-free returns made DELL stand out as a personal computer maker in the world. From there, the company expanded over the years to include its very first laptop, 316LT, network server, DELL PowerEdge, network switches, printers and blade server, PowerEdge 1655MC. By the end of 1999, DELL was ranked the world's number one PC maker for businesses and world's number one in workstation shipments worldwide. The acquisition of Perot Systems in 2009 marks DELL's entry into the IT market. The same year, DELL with the introduction of China Mobile's Mini 3i entered into the smartphone market. The company stands out as the world's first user of Lithium-ion battery, which gave longer life for laptops, the very first company to provide free product recycling to all its customers and introduce the world's thinnest laptops, Adamo and Latitude Z laptops. Founded in the USA, SKIL is one of the world's leading names in the field of power tool manufacture. Part of the BOSCH concern.

About SKIL

In 1923, inventor Edmond Michel developed the world's very first electric handsaw. After Michel partnered with land developer Joseph W. Sullivan, the Michel Electric Handsaw Company was born in the city of Chicago in 1924. Just two years later, the company was producing over 2000 circular saws annually and changed its name to SKILSAW, which eventually shortened to SKIL.

Over the company's lifetime, SKIL has always been renowned for its innovation, both in its manufacturing output and the way the company is run. In 1936, SKIL became one of the first organisations in the USA to offer its employees an insurance and pension scheme. After introducing the very first portable electric circular saw to the market in 1928, SKIL expanded its production output over the ensuing years to include electric drills, hedge trimmers, electric screwdrivers and grinding machines.

The three main principles employed by SKIL in the manufacture of its products are innovation, quality and convenience. Over the years, SKIL has patented a number of innovations including the RBR reversing mechanism for drills in 1983 and a dual laser circular saw in 2005. Acquired by BOSCH in 1996, the SKIL brand is highly regarded in countries across the world and expanded into the Asian market at the beginning of the 21st century.

  • Rotary hammers
  • Rotation tools

LAMBORGHINI is not only a brand that is associated with luxury cars; LAMBORGHINI Tractors (or LAMBORGHINI Trattori) also produces high-quality  tractors for agriculture and farm equipment. This car brand has been producing tractors for a much longer time than it has been producing cars.

The history of a legendary tradition

The company LAMBORGHINI Trattori was founded in 1948 in Italy, in Cento, Ferrara. After World War Two, tractors were in high demand and manufacturers were building them out of old military vehicles. Three years later this company developed its first tractors, which were then mass produced. The vaporiser model was developed and patented by LAMBORGHINI Tractor. Other tractors with diesel engines were developed, like off-road crawlers. More factories were opened in 1956, which meant that their product range could easily be developed and expanded. In 1966, LAMBORGHINI Tractor was the first manufacturer that mass produced its tractors with a DC circuit. In the 1980s, the company introduced a new range of tractors with innovative characteristics, like a water-cooled engine. At the end of the 1980s, they introduced a new steering device and an electrically controlled injection engine. Until today, LAMBORGHINI Tractors strives to develop state of the art agricultural tractors.

LAMBORGHINI Tractor Product portfolio

  • Crawler tractors
  • Small tractors
  • Front loaders

LAMBORGHINI Tractor can differentiate themselves from the conventional tractor manufacturers, because of their special solutions and products.

Service

LAMBORGHINI Tractors offer their customers a comprehensive service. They do not only focus on finances within the realm of their distribution network; their customer service is available to help with all kinds of problems. Furthermore, the company has a spare parts storage unit with all the original spare parts, as well as lubricants, in order to guarantee consistent good performance. LAMBORGHINI Tractor also has its own agricultural centre, which has a large range of spare parts, components and accessories.
