HITACHI - A tradition over 100 years old

In 1910, the Japanese company HITACHI was founded by Namihei Odaira. Their goal was to bring new technology to Japan. The so-called “founding spirit of HITACHI" is still an important legacy in the company today, and sincerity, harmony and a pioneering spirit are also enormously important. At the beginning, Odaira had a repair workshop for electric equipment, and just after that he produced the first three electric 5 PS-engines. HITACHI's goal in the next decade was to produce goods for all sectors: the first nuclear reactor; online banking; the mass production of televisions; colour cameras; computer hardware; and mobile telephone technology. There are hardly any sectors, where one wouldn't find the brand name HITACHI. The American company, HYSTER, has production factilities worldwide for manufacturing robust forklifts, which can be used for very demanding tasks. The Formation of the Company, HYSTER

The two corporations, Electric Steel Foundry and Willamette Iron & Steel Works, merged in the 1920s to form the Willamette Hyster Company. At the beginning, as the raw timber industry was growing in northwest America, their goal was to produce lifting devices. In 1934, the first portal stacker with a fork was produced. Only a year later, they introduced a forklift with a cable lifting system for very heavy loads. This is what made HYSTER a pioneer in history. Over the years, they conceptualised more innovative forklift solutions, which were developed to deal with specific demands within industry. In the 1940s, HYSTER Company (how it was called back them), decided to expand their market outside of the Americas. Nijmegen (in the Netherlands) was one of their first manufacturing plants made for the European market. In the following decade, their business expanded, as well as their product range. Today, HYSTER is one of the leading producers in the world. The European factory in Nijmegen is 60 years old and has beat a lot of records for large forklifts and container forklifts.

The comprehensive product portfolio of HYSTER

HYSTER Equipment has the largest range of industry-specific
forklifts available, which are suited to carry loads from 1 to 48
tonnes. Their product range includes:

  • Forklifts with combustion engines
  • Compact forklifts with combustion engines
  • Heavy-duty forklifts
  • Container handlers 
  • Lift trucks 
  • Haulers 
  • Commissioners 
  • Narrow aisle forklift trucks

All HYSTER forklifts are characterized by their ability to to move loads, but not only on pallets or containers.

HYSTER provides a comprehensive service

This company not only has a comprehensive product range, but also excellent service. This includes spare parts, accessories, maintenance, safety and training.

DEMAG Cranes AG is one of the leading suppliers of of harbour and crane technology, and since 2011 it has been part of the TEREX Corporation. This international company sells their products under the brands GOTTWALD and DEMAG.

DEMAG TEREX History

The history of DEMAG Cranes began in the year 1819 when the mechanical workshop Harkort & Co was founded in Wetter (Ruhr). 21 years later, the first overhead travelling crane was produced. Since then the company has specialised in producing cranes and components for cranes. In 1910, the product range was expanded to include electric lifting devices. In the same year, the mechanical workshop in Harkort was added to DEMAG (“Deutsche Maschinenbau-Aktiengesellschaft”). In 1973, MANNESMANN took over DEMAG, and in 2006 TEREX Material Handling & Port Solutions AG took over. Five years later, the majority of the corporation belonged to the Terex Group. Today, the company under the brand name TEREX DEMAG has production facilities in 16 countries and is one of the leading suppliers of crane and harbour technology. The company has a worldwide sales and service network through its representative and subsidiary companies.

Individual Branches

DEMAG Cranes offers companies of all sizes innovative and sector specific solutions for logistics, drive mechanisms and material flow. They have a lot of requirements for safety, quality and capacity. For this reason, all their products are being constantly developed.

DEMAG Cranes - Portfolio

DEMAG product portfolio provides a comprehensive range of choice including:

  • Cranes
  • Lifting devices
  • Light crane systems
  • Drive technology
  • Load handling and lifting
  • Components

Within these product categories there are not only complete solutions but also additional models and spare parts, which ensure functionality.

Service is Important

TEREX DEMAG offers numerous services, that span over the entire product's life from the commissioning phase to modifying the machines. Companies can chose from individual service packs or installation services.

Komatsu HANOMAG is a German traditional company, which goes by the name HANOMAG. Today, the name is associated with high-quality construction machines.

The HANOMAG - Yesterday and Today

In 1835, the "Maschinenfabrik und Eisengießerei Georg Egestorff" was founded in Hanover and specialized in producing machine tools and steam engines. Ten years later, their production was expanded to include the locomotive. In 1871, the company HANOMAG Hannover was renamed, "Hannoversche Maschinenbau-Aktien-Gesellschaft", in short: HANOMAG. In 1924 to 1959, the company mainly produced haulers, lorries and automobiles. At the end of the 1950s, HANOMAG introduced the first wheel loader. Over the following years, HANOMAG was shaken by several economic crises, which meant that it was bought out several times. In 1989, KOMATSU Ltd. took over this company from Hamburg, and started producing wheel loaders. Several years later, the company name was changed to KOMATSU HANOMAG. It's product range includes wheel loaders and other construction machines. In 2004 and 2005, The European Technology Center and the development and production of mobile excavators took place in Hannover.

Their Product Portfolio

High-end, quality products for construction and industrial branches, with an above-average level of robustness and reliability are produced in the German city of Hanover. Hannomag product portfolio includes:

  • Wheel loaders
  • Small wheel loaders
  • Mobile excavators

Their products are constantly being developed in order to ensure that their machines are all considered new technology. Ergonomics and environmental production are always in the foreground. Additionally, Komatsu HANOMAG also provides a large offer of original attachments that can be used in every industrial sector. The “Working Gear” department meets special requirements and develops custom made machines and attachments, that can withstand all types of conditions. Just like all other machines, these are very reliable when operating at their highest capacity.

DECKEL MAHO Pfronten GmbH operates under the name “DMG MORI SEIKI AG”, who is the parent company. This company specialises in the production of highly technical products and CNC-controlled drilling and milling machines.

DEKEL MAHO - Precision and High Tech Machine Manufacturer

DMG MORI SEIKI AG is associated with the Japanese company MORI SEIKI, that signed a corporation agreement in 2009 with the traditional German company GILDEMEISTER. It has been an established worldwide corporation since that time. GILDEMEISTER itself is a German machine tool manufacturer that is over 140 years old. In the mid-1990s, it took over the financially unstable DECKEL MAHO AG and drove forward the concept of the milling machine. The company was transformed into a limited company and today DEKEL MAHO Pfronten is one of the world's biggest manufacturers of CNC controlled lathes and milling machines. DMG MORI SEIKI AG's individual subsidiary companies are all associated with one another, depending on their competencies. This company is in the same milling group as SAUER and specialises in producing in milling, ultrasonic and laser technology.

DECKEL MAHO GmbH Machines Portfolio Examples:

  • Universal lathes
  • Vertical lathes
  • Vending machines
  • Lathes
  • Universal milling machines
  • Travelling column machines
  • Machines
  • High speed cutting precision centres

Additionally, this DEKEL MAHO also has “Measuring and Monitoring” products including balancing and shrinking devices, as well as measuring equipment for immediately checking manufactured products.

MAX HOLLAND Europe is an American company based in the Netherlands. Since 2006, it has worked with the Chinese to  produce  forklifts, reach trucks and storage technology.

MAX HOLLAND – The partner of MAXIMAL Forklift Co., Ltd.

The company MAX HOLLAND has been around since 1951 and started off as a machines sales and manufacturing company. In 2006, MAX HOLLAND started a corporation with the Chinese forklift manufacturer, MAXIMAL Forklift Co., Ltd.

The aim of this corporation was to produce high-quality, but affordable and competitive, forklifts for the European market. In the mean time, MAX HOLLAND Europe built a European network of around 40 distributors and sales partners, that worked in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Poland, Belgium, Italy and the Netherlands. MAX HOLLAND wants to offer their customers the best possible, high-quality and affordable service, which is possible if there is a contact person in the customer's region. This is why the network was built.

The carrying capacity of MAX HOLLAND's diesel forklifts is 1-3.5 tonnes. They have the Euro 3 certificate, which means that they meet the emissions requirements. The following forklifts are also available from MAX HOLLAND Europe:

  • Diesel forklifts with a carrying capacity of 1-7 tonnes
  • Gas forklifts with a carrying capacity of 2-3.5 tonnes
  • Electric three-wheeled forklifts
  • Electric forklifts
  • Reach trucks
  • Storage technology (lift trucks and pallet stackers)

BÖLLHOFF GmbH is a German company which produces joining and assembly technologies for industrial clients. It is based in Bielefeld, but has a worldwide presence, offering consultancy services alongside its core manufacturing operations.

Producing fastening and assembly solutions since 1877

BÖLLHOF is a family run multinational firm which specializes in the manufacturing and implementation of fastening and assembly technology. It operates through a network of 41 companies, across 37 sites in over 20 countries across the world, and has more than 2,000 employees within its ranks. BÖLLHOFF Group was founded in 1877 by Wilhelm Böllhoff in the German town of Herdecke. It soon moved to a new headquarters in Bielefeld, where it worked to establish itself as a leading supplier of fastening products to blacksmiths and engineering workshops.

After World War Two, the company remained in family ownership, and expanded its operations into the Americas, Australia and Asia. Nowadays, it offers consultancy services for any firms requiring fastening and assembly solutions, with a focus on industrial processes of all kinds. It does so by carrying out research into modern materials and production processes, driving down the costs of procurement and reducing assembly times - all in the name of raising efficiency. With its global reach, BÖLLHOFF GmbH seeks to provide local knowledge to its clients, and it has a broad product range with more than 100,000 joining and assembly products to be used in finding the correct solution to the challenges faced by its clients. BÖLLHOFF Group also operates a "zero defects" policy across all products, carefully testing its joining systems to ensure reliability.

Website: boellhoff.com

BÖLLHOFF Product Portfolio

  • Screws
  • Nuts
  • Washers
  • Plugs
  • Rivets
  • Pins
  • Screw Locks
  • Antiseize cold resistant nuts

All BÖLLHOFF equipment is suitable for a wide range of industrial applications. The firm's clients include companies in the aeronautic, automotive, medical, railway, energy, agriculture and construction sectors, wherever precision joining is required.

ARGO Tractors is one of the world's leading manufacturers of tractors for the agricultural sector. The firm brings under its umbrella world-famous brands and has a world-wide distribution network, although it remains a proudly Italian company.

Website: argotractors.com

ARGO SpA - An Italian Tractor Manufacturing Business with Global ambitions

ARGO Tractors SPA is an Italian agricultural machinery manufacturer that focuses on producing tractors under the McCormick, Landini and Valpadana brands. The firm is based in the town of Fabbrico, in the Reggio-Emilia region, where it manufacturers a wide range of tractors, from smaller 22 horsepower models to 200 horsepower giants. The company aims to become the world's leading tractor manufacturer, and has accumulate decades worth of experience which is helping to reach this goal. Their efforts are based around several key values, ranging from a focus on innovation and technology to ensuring competitiveness, creating a wide distribution network and providing an excellent level of customer service.

Having brought together three iconic tractor brands, ARGO Tractors seeks to exploit the benefits of manufacturing these high quality brands within one firm. With their Landini range, ARGO SPA reaches vineyards and orchards across Europe, while McCormick is a world-famous player in open field agriculture across the world. All of their tractors are manufactured in Italy as plants in Fabbrico, San Martino and Luzzara, but the company has established a worldwide distribution system. From their equipment hub in the French town of Saint Dizier, ARGO SPA can ensure that vital tractor parts are sent around the world to wherever they are needed. This is achieved via 130 specialist import partners, and over 170 dealers, all of them checked by ARGO for their reliability. Despite its global ambitions, ARGO Tractors SPA is very much an Italian firm, and operates all of its manufacturing processes within Italian borders. But it has a global ethical perspective, seeking to contribute to sustainable agricultural systems.

ARGO Tractors Product Portfolio

  • Landini Tractors
  • McCormick Tractors
  • Valpadana Tractors

ARGO Tractors range includes tractors from 22 HP to 232 HP, which are used for tasks as diverse as standard soil preparation and crop protection measures, construction work and urban land management.

Based in Monza, Italy, BREVETTI STENDALTO is a leader in the field of cable protection, producing cable chains and sheaths for use all around the world.

About BREVETTI STENDALTO

As manufacturing processes began to evolve in the sixties, so too did the requirement for better protection for machine cables. Founded by Giovanni Mauri, BREVETTI  STENDALTO Spa pioneered the use of nylon cable chains, which were lighter and more cost effective than the old style steel cable chains in use at the time.

This pioneering vision has seen BREVETTI, also known as BREVETTI STENDALTO, continue to come up with new innovations over the years, including the international patent for Robot circular chains in 1988 which brought the company recognition on a world-wide scale. The Robot series of cable chains are an integral part of many large telescopes at astronomical observatories in locations such as Chile. The company is now also heavily involved in large cable chain projects concerning offshore platforms and harbour crane equipment.

 

Website: brevettistendalto.it

BREVETTI STENDALTO Product Portfolio

BREVETTI STENDALTO manufacture a wide range of cable chains to suit a variety of applications. These include:

  • Nylon chains
  • Steel chains
  • Flexible sheaths

In addition to various forms of cable protection, BREVETTI STENDALTO also produce a total chain system. In this instance, the chain is pre-assembled with both cables and connectors and is ready to install immediately, therefore meaning less installation time for the end user.

AUSA is a Spanish firm which produces industrial vehicles, as well as equipment for agriculture and municipal uses. It has a worldwide presence and is an industry leader in dumper and forklift vehicles.

A leading industrial vehicle manufacturer which focuses on people

AUSA is a Spanish multinational company which manufactures vehicles for use by industrial clients, agricultural purposes or construction projects. The company was founded in 1956, and began life as a manufacturer of small cars for personal use. However, in the 1960s, AUSA branched out into producing compact industrial vehicles, with their range of dumper trucks rapidly becoming popular across Europe. After 1973, the firm moved to a giant manufacturing facility in the Spanish city of Manresa, building high quality dumpers, trucks, forklifts and multifunctional vehicles for many different economic sectors. The firm also became a global organization, with manufacturing facilities in the UK and partnerships with factories in China. This has led to the firm nowadays being an industry leader, with a solid reputation for quality and reliability. Their forklifts and dumpers regularly win industry accolades, while the firm has also won international recognition for its workplaces practices and employee satisfaction.

The modern AUSA firm is one of the world's major manufacturers of dumper trucks, with 25 percent market share, and operates from UAE to Brazil, selling their vehicles through a network of over 480 distributors. The company makes a point of constantly seeking to innovate, with a guaranteed spend of 3 percent of turnover on research and development. And it also innovates by building strong relationships within the AUSA team. This also means that the firm specializes in forming working relationships with clients and providing excellent customer support.

The AUSA Product Portfolio

  • Dumpers
  • Forklift trucks
  • Mixers
  • Taurulifts
  • Cleaning Vehicles
  • Multifunctional Light Vehicles

These products are all vehicles that are intended for industrial uses, but they are also purchased by local governments to assist with essential services such as street cleaning, as well as agricultural firms and construction companies.

Part of the HOMAG Group, BRANDT has been a leading specialist in the production of edging machines for well over half a century. A worldwide operation, they work with customers in over 90 countries.

About BRANDT

A global corporation today, BRANDT has humble origins as a small craftsman shop founded by Leopold Brandt in 1932. The company steadily grew until, in 1955, it began to supply machinery to the manufacturing industry as HEINRICH BRANDT Maschinenbau. The sixties decade saw the company produce their first self-designed edge-banding model and then expand their product range to include double-sided edge-banding machines. BRANDT was incorporated into the HOMAG Group in 1976.

Today, BRANDT employs over 5,000 people and is one of the world's leading manufacturers of wood processing machines, enjoying a global market share of almost 30%. The machines manufactured by BRANDT are used to produce a variety of products including home and office furniture, laminate flooring, windows, doors and stairs.

BRANDT Equipment Portfolio

BRANDT produces machines for all levels of use, from one-man operations to full scale production facilities. These include through-feed edge banding machines and table-top varieties.

The table-top machines include:

  • KTD 720 model
  • FTK 130 Model

While the KTD 720 is ideal for straight parts, the FTK 130 has been designed for producing shaped pieces.

BRANDT through-feed machines come in a variety of models.

  • Ambition series 
  • Highflex series 
  • profiLine series

The Ambition series comprises of a range of machines classes, from 1100 up to 1800. The 1100 series has been produced with beginners in mind, while the 1800 is the top of the range. The Highflex machines offer a great amount of flexibility, while the profiLine is customisable to suit individual needs.

BARGSTEDT is a German company which manufactures industrial machinery, focusing on providing efficient, durable solutions to the challenges faced by its clients. It focuses on organizing complex machinery for modern manufacturing, applying systems analysis to optimize efficiency. Getting a used BARGSTEDT machinery can help efficiency with well built machine from BARGSTEDT while saving money and making it available for other sources. Used BARGSTEDT is considered a very popular in the second hand market. 

Website: bargstedt.com

BARGSTEDT - Stacking and Transportation Solutions

BARGSTEDT Handlingsysteme GmbH is based in the German city of Hemmor and caters for a wide variety of industrial challenges. It provides intelligent solutions to problems such as feeding and stacking, moving products by conveyor belt, sorting and storage as well as transportation of products within large-scale plants. The firm seeks to partner with companies across the world who require detailed, precision organized handling systems. It began life in 1972 by manufacturing suction cups, which allowed for easy handling of metal, wood and plastic sheets. It quickly branched out into more complicated transport areas, such as manufacturing chutes for processed timber. Nowadays, BARGSTEDT specializes in moving wood and other raw materials as efficiently as possible by employing sophisticated electronic monitoring and control systems. This has been accompanied by a strong focus on human capital, with long-standing apprenticeship schemes for skilled employees, as well as investment in research and development. At the same time, BARGSTEDT Homag has tried to perfect its Hemmor facility, using flow analysis and building 9000 square metres of production space. All of this has made the firm a world leader in transportation, sorting and stacking systems, enabling its partners to raise their efficiency. Their advanced systems also help manufacturers to limit any damage to materials used during their production processes, and to reduce waste at all stages.

BARGSTEDT Product Portfolio Examples

  • Conveyor belts
  • Functional transport devices 
  • Buffer systems
  • Materials storage systems
  • Feeder and stackers

These products are used by clients to ensure that raw materials and finished products are moved through the manufacturing process without damage and at a high level of efficiency. Clients include manufacturers in a wide variety of sectors, from timber processors to electronics and food producers.

BARFORD was a British engineering firm, which specialized in making high quality dumper trucks and heavy rollers. The firm no longer trades as an independent entity, but thousands of their trucks are still in use, and there have been regular plans to restart manufacturing around the world.

A Heritage of Manufacturing High Quality Dump Trucks and Rollers

AVELING BARFORD began manufacturing trucks in 1934, when Edward and William Barford opened a major factory in the city of Grantham, England. It swiftly became one of the leading manufacturers of heavy mechanical rollers, used in road building and grounds-keeping, and expanded into the ground moving sector after World War II by developing a popular range of dump trucks, which are still widely used around the world. Ownership of BARFORD was held by RUSTON and HORNSBY until 1967, before the company was purchased by vehicle manufacturer BRITISH LEYLAND. The Grantham factory continued to build high quality heavy vehicles until it eventually closed in 1988. After that, the BARFORD brand and its products line were bought by WORDSWORTH HOLDINGS, which built their trucks and rollers until they in turn went out of business in 2010. Despite the instability of their parent company, AVELING BARFORD dump trucks and rollers remain common and finding parts for them is not difficult. This has meant that construction equipment is widely used in construction projects in the developing world, where they are prized for their high quality workmanship and reliable performance. Their dump trucks can be found in a range of sizes, from lightweight 0.75 tonne models to industrial-scale 10 tonne vehicles.

BARFORD Product Portfolio

  • Heavy Rollers
  • Loading Shovels
  • Motor Graders
  • Bulldozers

The vehicles manufactured by BARFORD have been used for decades in heavy construction and industrial projects, and are used in tasks such as road building, building construction and demolition. Their clients included municipal bodies, private companies and individuals.

BITELLI SPA was a Italian construction firm which focused on producing heavy machinery for infrastructure and major construction projects. It disappeared as an independent firm in 2000 when it was bought by Caterpillar, but many of its models remain available.

A proud history of delivering road building solutions

BITELLI SPA was founded in the 1930s by Beppino Bitelli in italy, who established a manufacturing facility in the Italian city of Bologna. It began producing three wheeled heavy roller in 1933, but expansion really began after World War Two, when the firm became a world-famous brand in the road construction sector. It expanded quickly, adding models of tandem and single drum rollers to its range. By the 1980s, BITELLI SPA was producing every kind of heavy vehicle used in road construction, from pavers to rollers, and from road profilers to soil stabilizers. When the firm was bought by Caterpillar, this did not mean that the vehicles themselves were discontinued, and many of the firm's products continued to be manufactured, just with a different brand name attached. However, some vehicles were abandoned, such as some rollers and paving equipment. During its lifespan, BITELLI Italy built up a formidable collection of heavy road construction machinery, much of which is still in use across the world. It produced pavers and rollers of all sizes, with both tracked and wheeled varieties, and its products were commonly used in large-scale infrastructure projects from the 1960s to the 1990s. Because of their worldwide spread, BITELLI SPA vehicles are relatively easy to source parts for, with many available on the used market.

BITELLI SPA  Product Portfolio

  • Heavy road pavers
  • Road profilers
  • Single drum rollers
  • Three point rollers
  • Soil stabilizers

BITELLI SPA's products were commonly used in road and rail construction projects, where soil stabilization and grading was essential. They remain commonly used in road building across the world and were commonly purchased by public bodies.

CASADEI BUSELLATO is one of the leading suppliers of machinery for the wood, plastic and non-ferrous metal industries. Their customers range from small workshops to global organisations.

About CASADEI BUSELLATO

First founded in Italy in 1945, the initial machines produced by CASADEI Macchine were marketed under the brand name L'Artigiana. Manufacturing traditional woodworking machines, the company rapidly grew and quickly acquired a reputation for quality and high innovation.

The seventies saw CASADEI BUSSELATO expand into the international market, while the following decades saw products such as automatic panel saws, wide belt sanders, edgebanding machines and throughfeed moulders added to their manufacturing portfolio.

Now a fully global concern, one of the company's biggest sites is located in the USA. The premises in Concord, North Carolina offer one of the largest ranges of woodworking machinery in the industry. Part of the SCM Group, CASADEI merged with another SCM company, BUSELLATO, in 2011 to become CASADEI BUSELLATO.

CASADEI BUSELLATO Product Portfolio

Using cutting-edge technology and utilising the expertise of its experienced workforce, CASADEI BUSELLATO specialises in the production of a variety of machinery for the woodworking industry, although they also manufacture machines for the plastic and metal sectors.

The main product portfolio for CASADEI BUSELLATO is comprised of

  • CNC wood routers
  • Edge banding machines
  • Wide belt sanders
  • CNC machining centres
  • Moulders
  • Planers
  • Jointers
  • Sliding table saws

CASADEI produce edgebanders for small to medium sized workshops and for full-scale production facilities. They also provide a range of advanced software for machine control and the transfer of information from CAD programmes to the CASADEI machines themselves.

The German company REICHENBACHER is a world leader in machining technology, with its roots in providing machines for the woodworking industry. Today this innovative high quality concern also provides CNC machinery for leading companies in the automotive, aerospace and plastics industries. REICHENBACHER are world leaders in developing the advanced software necessary to drive the latest technology and the company says today that it continues to innovate in everything that it sets out to do.

The history of REICHENBACHER Hamuel GmbH

Engineer Hermann REICHENBACHER founded his company in August of 1954 with just six staff members initially. His first machines, which where carving and copying machines, made the company's name globally, and completely changed the way woodcarving was practiced internationally. Multi-spindle drilling machines followed, as did copy milling machines, used largely in the 1970s clog-making industry. The company branched out into making special machines for making kitchen furniture as well as doors and specialised machines for making upholstered furniture. One of REICHENBACHER's proudest landmarks came in 1999 when, using the very latest technology, the ECO model was developed, used in one application, to make fibre-reinforced boards for the aeroplane industry. Corporate restructuring followed commercial success as the company became REICHENBACHER Hamuel GmbH, which then became part of the powerful Scherdel Group allowing it further resources for research, development and customer service. Clients now include some of the biggest names in the aviation and motor industries.

Website: reichenbacher.com/en


REICHENBACHER Hamuel Product Portfolio

  • REICHENBACHER CNC machining centres
  • Multi-spindle drilling machines 
  • Top-spindle milling machines
  • Automatic carving machines
  • Saw and boring combination machines 
  • Eight-spindle copy milling machines

OKUMA is a Japanese corporation whose focus is on manufacturing precision tools such as OKUMA lathes and grinders, along with high-tech controls and software for these equipment and machine tools.

A Japanese firm which manufactures machine tools and controls

The Japanese firm OKUMA was founded in the town of Nagoya in 1898 and specializes in the manufacture of machine tools, CNC controls and motors. Since its foundation, OKUMA Corporation has become a globally active corporation, with bases in the USA - OKUMA America -, Singapore, Taiwan, Europe, Australia, Thailand, Indonesia, India and a strong presence in the Chinese cities of Beijing and Shanghai. OKUMA Corp has its origins in the production of noodle-making machines, but it quickly found a niche as a machine tools manufacturer, with an early focus on machine lathes. By 1937, it was Japan's largest machine tools manufacturer, and it took this dominance into the post-war era. The 1950s and 60s saw OKUMA Group developing precision controlled lathes, and by 1976 the firm had branched out into the USA and Europe through OKUMA America Corporation and OKUMA Europe GmbH. Nowadays, the firm has production and sales operations on almost every continent and is a leading supplier of machine tools to industries across the globe. Recent years have also seen the OKUMA company beginning to focus closely on sustainability, and has been seeking to manufacture products with the maximum lifespan and productivity, so that material wastage is minimized. The company has also focused on building a global support network to back-up customers with advice and maintenance. This all ties in with the vision of OKUMA's CEO, who seeks to combine high quality tools with customer satisfaction, so that the firm becomes the "single source for machines and controls."

OKUMA Machines & Machine Tools

OKUMA's range of products includes:

  • Saddle CNC lathes
  • Vertical CNC lathes
  • Horizontal twin-spindle CNC lathes
  • Intelligent multi-tasking machines
  • Machining centres
  • Twin-spindle turning centres
  • Cylandrical grinders
  • Internal grinders
  • CAD packages
  • OSP control units 

OKUMA machinery is used in many different fields of industry. Its primary clients are heavy and light industrial manufacturers who need to manipulate metals. However, its controls are also used by vehicle manufacturers.

Austrian company FRONIUS is a world-leader in manufacturing chargers for vehicle batteries, inverters for solar grids and high performance welding equipment. It is active across the world, and has a strong focus on innovation in sustainable energy.

Developing new products in the energy and welding sectors since 1945

Metalworking and energy firm FRONIUS was founded by Günter Fronius in 1945 in the Austrian town of Pettenbach. Although the firm initially worked on the production of transformers, expansion quickly followed, with the firm taking a significant role in the welding market after the war. FRONIUS also continued to develop new sources of electricity and superconductors, unveiling the world's first transistor-switched battery in 1981, which reduced the size of power sources considerably. This was applied to the firm's core welding business, and allowed FRONIUS to introduce quicker, more portable welding equipment during the 1980s. The company also expanded, with a facility in Turkey and new plants in the Ukraine and Czech Republic opening in the 1990s. At the same time, the company created a sales network with offices across Europe, and the firm expanded still further - introducing solar photovoltaics and battery charging systems to its product portfolio. This led to award winning products such as the firm's Solarix solar inverter, and to the Success through Research award from Austria's Industrial Research Promotion Fund. FRONIUS continued innovating into the new millennium, with the introduction of laser welding machines, more powerful conventional welding systems and smaller solar inverters to be used in large power grids. The firm also opened its first sales facility in the USA, as the firm worked to integrate its energy experience into vehicle charging systems. This focus on sustainability extended into the development of the first carbon neutral logistics system, and to FRONIUS joining the WWF's Climate Group, a sign of its future corporate direction.

The FRONIUS product portfolio

The kinds of products manufactured by FRONIUS include:

  • Solar inverters
  • Solar energy grid monitoring equipment
  • Logistics systems
  • Arc welding units
  • Chargers for welding units
  • Laser welding technology
  • Plasma welding machine
  • Battery chargers for traction batteries
  • Battery chargers for starter batteries

FRONIUS partners with firms and governments across the world, delivering energy based solutions. Its clients include vehicle manufacturers, airlines, metalworking firms, and municipal utilities.

• HQ: Munich, Germany
  • CEO: Cem Peksaglam
  • Founded: 1848
  • www.wackerneuson.com/
     

The German firm WACKER NEUSON is based in Munich and manufactures light equipment that is mainly used in agriculture and construction. WACKER NEUSON SE has a strong focus on research, and also manufactures compact industrial vehicles.

Innovators in construction and agricultural machinery

WACKER NEUSON Corporation focuses on the manufacturing of light equipment for the construction, agriculture and land management sectors. Founded in 1848, WACKER NEUSON is based near the city of Munich in southern Germany, and employs more than 4,000 people across 40 subsidiaries around the world. The firm is a global competitor, with more than 12,000 sales outlets worldwide, and production facilities spread across three continents.

The firm operates three German factories in the towns of Reichertshofen, Pfullendorf and Korbach, as well as one in Linz, Austria. There are two plants in the USA, one in Serbia and another in Manila, the capital of the Philippines. Wherever it operates, WACKER NEUSON SE seeks to implement four principles (found on its "value wheel") which include a commitment to innovation, the quality of its products, their performance in the field and the character of the workforce. It seeks to partner closely with clients in delivering the right solution, and invests continually in product development. This focus has helped the firm become a market leader in manufacturing light equipment such as earth compressors, concrete trowels, mobile generators and pumps. Its products are widely used in outdoor work across the world due to their high quality design and reliability, as well as the high level of service and support that WACKERNEUSON seeks to provide.

WACKER NEUSON Product Portfolio

The range of light equipment manufactured by WACKER NEUSON includes:



  • Concrete trowels
  • Internal and external vibrators
  • Frequency converters
  • Vibratory rammers
  • Mobile generators
  • Cutting devices
  • Lighting
  • Pumps
  • Air dehumidifiers
  • Heaters
  • Dumpers
  • Excavators
  • Wheel loaders
  • Telehandlers

WACKER NEUSON Corporation partners with firms and public organizations in a number of sectors. These include agriculture, horticulture, land management, construction and infrastructure projects.

MEP Macchine Elettroniche Piegatrici SpA is one of the world's top manufacturers of rebar equipment and a leading expert in resistance welding technology. The company's main focus is on the provision of reliable, heavy-duty machinery to a wide customer base.

Website: mepgroup.com

About MEP SpA

The story of MEP SpA began in 1967. In that year, the company manufactured the world's first coil-fed automatic stirrup bender, which led the steel processing industry into a new era. Since that time, MEP has continued to lead the way in the field of research and development, acquiring a number of other companies along the way which trade under the MEP GROUP banner. In 1970, MEP opened its first rebar fabrication plant, while in 1988 it launched the very first automatic mesh welding plant.

The MEP GROUP now employs in excess of 300 employees in locations across the world. In addition to its main base in Reana del Rojale in Italy, MEP SpA  has facilities in Austria, Russia, Poland, France, Brazil and South Korea. A truly worldwide organisation, MEP Machines boasts sales territories in a total of 98 countries. The MEP GROUP includes under its main banner other companies such as FERROSTAFF and PROMOSTAR.

MEP Product Portfolio

Since its inception in 1967, MEP Products has produced well in excess of 10,000 industrial machines and filed over 80 patents. The company continues to invest a proportion of its sales revenue into further research and development.

The main manufacturing output of MEP SpA is focused on heavy-duty machines for the metal processing industry. These include:

  • Stirrup bending machines
  • Automatic shaping centres
  • Automatic straightening machines
  • Pre-cage assembling machines
  • Truss girder welding machines
  • Mesh welding plants

MEP Machines also produces a range of cutting equipment including the Superflex and Flexiplus models.

SCHROEDER Group is an innovative Germany engineering company with a decades long history of producing machinery for  sheet metal processing. The range starts with manual folding tools for smaller workshops and for construction sites, and extends to the very latest computerised automatic folding centres which are used in the industrial sheet metal processing industry.

A history of SCHROEDER Group 

The founder of the SCHRÖDER Group, Hans SCHROEDER, registered the company as an agricultural repair business in September 1949. Progressing to the sale of  agricultural machinery, it was in 1963 that the company began to specialise in manufacturing the machinery that made its name globally, with the first production of creasing machines. As SCHROEDER Group expanded, motorised shears were introduced and were an instant hit with the sheet-metal processing industry. A proud moment was a 1971 state-wide medal at a Munich trade fair. Further expansion followed in the 1970s and 1980s, with a landmark in 1982-86 as the first electronic components were incorporated. The company was also beginning to produce machines customised for specific clients. In 1994 came another state-wide gold medal, as SCHROEDER marketed its machinery well beyond Germany's borders. In 2008, the first fully-automatic bending centre was showcased. In 2009, SCHROEDER, now incorporating the Fasti engineering concern, celebrated its 60th birthday, with the knowledge that it had become one of the global leaders in the supply of machines for processing sheet metal with a unique portfolio of products, from the manual to highly sophisticated automatic machines. Hans SCHRÖDER Group is now in the hands of another generation of the family, and says that it still remains true to its founding principles of quality of service and close connection with customers.

SCHROEDER Product Portfolio 

  • Flaring machines 
  • Rounding machines 
  • Bending machines
  • Pressing machines
  • Cutting machines

The Italian company MERLO specializes in manufacturing telescopic handlers, forklifts and concrete mixers. It focuses on automation of its manufacturing procedures and invests heavily in research and development.

MERLO Expertise in lifting and mixing for over 100 years

MERLO SpA is an Italian firm which manufactures heavy industrial vehicles and other equipment for the mining and construction sectors. The company was founded in 1911 as an iron working concern in the small Italian town of Cuneo. But the firm really took off in the 1960s, with a new factory just outside the town and a new range of dumper trucks and concrete mixers, which were in demand during a period of rapid economic expansion. MERLO entered new sectors in the 1970s, with the launch of its range of all terrain forklift trucks, featuring advanced design features like hydrostatic transmission. This was followed by even more innovation, with the launch of an automated welding robot in 1977. The 1980s saw further expansion and new products like the MERLO's telescopic handler (which has since become its signature vehicle). These handlers became a popular choice across Europe, with their good visibility and dexterity, as well as a fine safety record. In the 90s, MERLO Group branched out into supplying agricultural producers with specialist vehicles, and launched a range of "ultra-compact" handlers as well. The firm has continued to innovate, with high-altitude handlers and its popular Multifarmer products proving a success in a wide variety of fields. MERLO SpA remains based in Cuneo, but has a worldwide sales force. It continues to set aside 8 percent of turnover to fund research and development, and to produce as much as possible in-house, while mechanizing production as much as possible to maximize efficiency.

MERLO SpA Product Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by MERLO includes:

  • Ultra-compact telescopic handlers
  • Larger telescopic handlers
  • Platform lift vehicles
  • Small mobile forklift trackers
  • Attachments for telescopic handlers
  • Motorized concrete mixers
  • Turbofarmer vehicles
  • Medium an high lifts

Products manufactured by MERLO uk are used in a large number of industries. These include construction, mining, agriculture, light and heavy industry and the energy sector. MERLO Group products are also used by emergency services and militaries.

Tool machining specialists VOLLMER have been producing sharpening machines for bandsaws, circular saws and rotary tools for over 100 years. The VOLLMER brand name is well known around the world and the group has manufacturing facilities in both Germany and China.

About VOLLMER

The history of VOLLMER Werke Maschinenfabrik GmbH stretches all the way back to 1909, when founder Heinrich Vollmer first patented the construction of saw setting and filing machines. Over the next few years, the company worked diligently on improving the precision of the process of machining saw blades.

From the very beginning, VOLLMER has always targeted perfection in the production of cutting tools and saw blades of maximum sharpness and precision. In 1952, the company developed an innovative range of sharpening machines for carbide-tipped circular saw blades. It is this very innovation and development of new technological processes which has seen VOLLMER GmbH grow into an internationally-recognised leader within its field.

Since VOLLMER America was founded in 1976, VOLLMER Group has opened facilities in a host of countries across the globe. These include bases in the United Kingdom, France, Italy, Brazil, Spain, Austria, Poland, Japan and China.

VOLLMER Machines

VOLLMER Company provides solutions for bandsaws, circular saws and rotary tools. Their high-performance, advanced machines are all produced using the latest technology.

The VOLLMER range of products carry out a number of tasks including:

Bandsaws

  • VOLLMER Sharpening
  • Profile Grinding
  • Side Grinding
  • Tensioning and Straightening
  • Stellite Tipping

Circular Saws

  • Machining hook angle
  • Machining side angle
  • Repair and measurement

Rotary Tools

  • Sharpening
  • VOLLMER Grinding

VOLLMER models are used extensively in a variety of industries such as tool production, metal processing and wood processing.

Based in Germany, JAESPA is a leading name in the production of metal bandsaws. The company manufactures both standard and custom-made bandsaw machines to suit customer requirements.

About JAESPA

First founded in 1957, JAESPA concentrated on the manufacture of metal bandsaws right from the very beginning. Over the years they have built up a reputation within the industry for producing machines of the highest quality and durability. Today, the company also produces bandsaws for use in other sectors in addition to the metal industry. A member of the German Association of Machine Tool Manufacturers, JAESPA now exports its products to across the world and works closely with partners in locations such as Holland, Belgium and the United States.

A team of more than forty people work at the main JAESPA headquarters in Spangenberg, Germany, manufacturing bandsaws of both the horizontal and vertical variety. In addition to bandsaw manufacture, the company also offers its clients material handling, in-feeding, out-feeding and measuring equipment.

JAESPA Product Portfolio

The majority of the JAESPA production output consists of vertical and horizontal bandsaw machines, consisting of a number of different types including:

  • Manual and Semi-Automatic
  • Automatic Scissor Type
  • Heavy Duty Double Column
  • Horizontal Mitre - Manual, Automatic and Semi-Automatic
  • Vertical Mitre - Manual and Semi-Automatic

    • Although most of the bandsaws produced by JAESPA are made for cutting various types of metal, they also manufacture bandsaw machines which can be used to cut other materials such as glass, ceramics, rubber, silicon and graphite.

M-FAHRZEUGBAU is based in Germany and manufactures industrial vehicles, with a focus on forklift trucks along with flat bed and specialist vehicles for different industries.

One of Europe's most experienced manufacturers of forklift trucks for industrial uses

M-FAHRZEUGBAU GmbH is a German manufacturer of forklift trucks and other materials handling equipment. The firm was founded in 1948 by engineer Rudolf Maxein, and began life as RMF, a supplier of machinery to the agricultural and construction sectors. During the 1950s, attention shifted to producing forklift trucks, and the company developed a wide range of novel attachments for use with their trucks, making them much more adaptable than their competitors. Innovations pioneered by the ancestor company of M-FAHRZEUGBAU included shovels, block clamps and snow blades, as the firm focused on manufacturing  all-terrain forklifts for demanding conditions. From the start, the company operated on an international scale, delivering vehicles to an Indonesian lead smelter in 1963. However, despite enjoying international success, since 1965 it has been based in Neuwied-Gladbach, where most production occurs.

The 1970s and 80s saw further innovations, with the firm introducing a range of compact forklift trucks,  trucks with electric motors and models with hydrostatic individual wheel drives as well. By 1988, RMF could offer a variety of industrial vehicles which included their trademark forklifts, but also flat bed trucks, cable drum transporters and specialist vehicles for foundries. RMF became M-FAHRZEUGBAU in 2012 following the financial crisis, but the merged company retained both RMF's production facilities, market position and 60 years of experience in manufacturing forklift trucks. Since the merger, the firm has consolidated its reputation for manufacturing durable, high quality vehicles, and has attracted clients in a range of sectors, from steel-making to construction and from concrete plants to glass makers. M-FAHRZEUGBAU has also continued to work closely with each client, delivering bespoke industrial solutions via consultations and customer support.

The M-FAHRZEUGBAU product portfolio

The range of industrial vehicles manufactured by M-FAHRZEUGBAU includes:

  • Compact forklift trucks for the transportation of heavy loads 
  • Flatbed industrial transportation vehicles 
  • Coil drum transporter trucks 
  • Telescopic forklift trucks
  • Trucks for use in metal foundries

M-FAHRZEUGBAU works with a diverse group of clients. Its products are suitable for glass manufacturers, steel mills, construction firms, concrete plants and energy companies. Any firm that requires the transportation of heavy materials reliably and safely could benefit from their products.

The German firm OPEL is known for both its range of personal cars and its reliable, popular collection of commercial vans. It offers vans in a variety of sizes and designs, with many choices of freight carrying arrangements.

Manufacturing vans for commercial clients for over a century

The German vehicle manufacturer Adam OPEL AG was founded in the nineteenth century, and became one of the first generation of automobile firms in the world. The firm carved out a reputation for producing high-speed racing vehicles as well as more conventional passenger cars which became identified with the expanding professional class in pre-World War One Germany. During the 1920s, OPEL was one of the first German firms to employ mass production techniques, and began working in partnership with the American firm General Motors, a link that still remains. This helped OPEL to become one of Germany and Europe's leading manufacturers of industrial and passenger vehicles in the period after the Second World War, as the firm built upon its reputation for style and speed. This now applies to its commercial vans, which are some of the fastest of their kind on the world market. These vehicles have also incorporated some of the firm's extensive research and development efforts, using new technologies such as compressed natural gas engines and extended-range electric motors. OPEL's vans have also pioneered design features designed to make them more user friendly, such as rear-hinged loading doors. This range of vans include well-known brands such as the Vivaro, which combines large freight carrying capacity and high fuel efficiency, or the larger Movano which is favoured by tradesmen and construction companies.

The OPEL product portfolio

The range of industrial and commercial vehicles manufactured by OPEL includes:

  • Panel vans 
  • Combi vans (passenger and freight) 
  • Minibuses 
  • Dropside trucks 
  • Tipper trucks 
  • Box vans 
  • Small hatchback vans

OPEL specialize in the manufacturing of vans for commercial use. Their vehicles are designed for clients who require the moving of small and medium sized loads, and would be suitable for firms in fields as diverse as construction, commercial delivery or retail.

MERCEDES-BENZ is a firm which focuses closely on manufacturing high quality, reliable, innovative vehicles, and produces a diverse range of industrial vehicles as well as their well-known collection of private cars.

World-famous manufacturers of luxury commercial, industrial and private vehicles

German firm MERCEDES-BENZ is one of the most famous names in the world of vehicle manufacturing. The firm was formed from the merger of Daimler-Motoren-Gesellschaft and Benz & Cie in 1926, at which point the famous three pointed star design was adopted as the company logo. After becoming the first manufacturer of petrol-powered automobiles, MERCEDES-BENZ rapidly acquired a reputation for producing luxury vehicles that specialised in reliability and high performance. From the start, these qualities were extended to its popular selection of commercial and industrial vehicles, which were purchased by companies across the world to deal with demanding challenges such as the movement of troops during wartime. Nowadays, aside from their iconic personal cars, the company continues to manufacture a wide range of industrial and commercial vehicles. These include a number of different models of transporter vans, personnel carriers, trucks and buses, as well as the best-selling Sprinter range of vans. Being a global brand, MERCEDES-BENZ also operates a network of manufacturing facilities across the globe, with factories manufacturing their industrial vehicles in Argentina, Brazil, Jordan, India, Mexico, Nigeria, Russia, Vietnam and the United States. The modern range of MEREDES-BENZ trucks also includes innovative features such as Predictive Powertrain Control, which helps to reduce fuel consumption, while the company has also been a pioneer in the field of self-driving vehicles.

The MERCEDES-BENZ product portfolio

MERCEDES-BENZ manufactures the following products:

  • MPV personnel carriers 
  • Sprinter vans 
  • Camper vans 
  • Actros long-distance freight trucks 
  • Concrete mixers and transporters 
  • Arocs light trucks 
  • Buses 
  • Personal cars

The vehicles manufactured by MERCEDES-BENZ are used in a wide variety of industrial and commercial contexts. Their buses are purchased by municipalities and national governments across the world, while their freight trucks are a common sight on highways on all continents.

LEITZ GmbH is a German manufacturer of machine tools with its headquarters in the city of Oberkochen, in the Baden-Württemberg region. LEITZ specialises in precision tools and tool systems for the industrial processing of wood-derived materials, solid wood as well as plastic materials.

A history of LEITZ GmbH & Co. KG 

LEITZ has always specialised in tools that process and shape wood. As LEITZ itself puts it, "Woodworking requires innovative techniques and the best tools" and the company prides itself on meeting both of these requirements in every tool that leaves its factories. The client list of LEITZ is a wide one, ranging from individual craftsman's shops working with plastic and wood processing in, for instance, timber and window manufacture or furniture making, right up to industrial enterprises which use the largest LEITZ tooling systems available which use the very latest technologies. Over the years, LEITZ GmbH has formed corporate alliances with Boehlerit of Kapfenberg, Austria which specialises in tungsten carbide and materials for cutting diamonds, as well as with Bilz of Ostfildern, Germany which is a specialist in the technology of tool clamping. These companies have combined to form the LEITZ corporate group, which employs some 4,300 people worldwide with production facilities established over the years in Europe, America and Asia, as well as numerous service and sales companies globally. LEITZ GmbH says it prides itself on the reconditioning of existing LEITZ tools, and offering a professional service to its clients. 

LEITZ GmbH & Co. KG Tools portfolio:

  • Sawing tools
  • Panel processing tools
  • Planing and profiling tools
  • Manual feed tools 
  • Routing tools
  • Drilling bits
  • Mortising tools
  • Clamping systems
  • Knives and spare parts

HOPPECKE Batterien GmbH & Co. KG is a family-owned German manufacturer of industrial batteries and power systems with headquarters in the town of Brilon in the North Rhine-Westphalia region. With a long history of making batteries for all applications, HOPPECKE says it is now the largest manufacturer of industrial chargers and batteries in European ownership and it has subsidiary offices or representatives in countries around the world, including the United States, China and India.

A history of HOPPECKE GmbH & Co. KG 

Carl Zoellner founded HOPPECKE in 1927 and from the start the focus was on what the company calls "energy storage systems" of the highest quality. The renowned German Quality Standard has always been met by all of HOPPECKE's products. The real growth of HOPPECKE began in the 1970s when it introduced its patented AquaGen recombinators, which HOPPECKE sees as a key part of the safety of industrial batteries over time. After introducing an employee profit-sharing scheme in 1973, the company expanded with a smelter to recycle lead. In 1983, with major clients Daimler Benz and Volkswagen, HOPPECKE put its first alkaline batteries into production, followed by its first LSC-lithium batteries at a facility in the town of Otzenhausen. With sales offices and battery assembly established in both Shanghai, China, and Philadelphia, US, in 1999 and 2000, fast expansion followed, and a new HOPPECKE factory in Wuhan, China was opened in 2006. Awards for HOPPECKE include a "Top 100 Innovator" accolade and HOPPECKE was named as a "German Customer Champion" in 2009. HOPPECKE's commitment to research and development has been underlined by the opening of a new technology centre in the city of Zwickau.

Product portfolio:

  • Motive power products
  • Reserve power products
  • Chargers
  • Turnkey energy solutions
  • Battery changeover systems

Since the 1930s, German firm KUPER has carved out a place as one of Europe's leading manufacturers of woodworking machinery. More recently, KUPER GmbH has also become a successful manufacturer of plastics processing and packaging equipment.

Website: kuper.de

Experts in packaging, woodworking and plastics processing

Based in the German town of Rietburg, Heinrich KUPER GmbH & Co. KG is a company that focuses on manufacturing machinery for crafts industries such as woodworking, but also offers equipment for the plastics and packaging sectors as well. While the firm has three locations in Germany, it is also an international company, with subsidiaries in Russia and Canada, which means that it can reach clients in all of the major markets of the world. KUPER was founded in 1933, but expansion really started to accelerate in the 1960s when the firm opened its research centre in Freiburg and launched innovative new machinery models like its Zig-Zag-Veneer Splicing Machine. Since then, KUPER GmbH has focused on continuing to offer high quality processing machinery, but has also invested heavily in skills, ensuring that its 220 strong workforce is equipped to provide clients with the highest quality service, both before, during and after products have been delivered.

KUPER operates in three major sectors. The main part of its operations occur in the woodworking sector, where the firm has established itself as one of the world's leading suppliers of veneer processing technology. This includes everything from veneer cutting and chopping to the firm's ground-breaking zig-zag joining system. Heinrich KUPER GmbH & Co. KG has also been leading the way in manufacturing all-in-one machining centers, which incorporate advanced automation and monitoring systems. However, KUPER operates in areas well beyond woodworking alone. The firm also has a successful plastics processing subsidiary, which specializes in dealing with materials like plexi-glass, and Heinrich KUPER GmbH also supplies automated packaging equipment as well. The company emphasises that it deals with customers from pre-production consultancy to maintenance after their products have been installed. They also work to ensure that clients can be supplied with the right used machines, if required, and allows for flexible payment options.

KUPER Machines

The range of woodworking, plastics processing and packaging products manufactured by Heinrich KUPER GmbH includes:

  • Shrink-film packaging machines 
  • Laser plastics cutting machines 
  • Plexi-glass processing centres 
  • Zig-zag veneer splicing machines 
  • Glue splicing machines 
  • Finger jointing machines 
  • Handgluers 
  • Veneer waste choppers

KUPER products are widely used by woodworking companies where precision joining is required. This may include anything from furniture manufacturers to boat builders. They also partner with plastics and packaging processors.

MASTERWOOD manufacture CNC machining centres and traditional machinery for use in the woodworking sector, and their clients stretch from door-makers to house builders.

Website: masterwood.com

Suppliers of integrated woodworking machinery across the world

The Italian woodworking firm MASTERWOOD SpA was formed in 1990 from the merger of the companies Muti and Zangheri & Boschetti. This created a new firm with expertise in both mortising and wood boring, giving MASTERWOOD a huge advantage in the European market for woodworking machinery. Since the merger, the firm has become known for its computer-controlled work benches for use with both solid wood and panels, and it has established a strong export performance with over 70 percent if MASTERWOOD's sales taking place abroad. The firm focuses on providing each client with a bespoke service, installing the right software for each individual work bench, and sells itself on its flexibility when meeting the demands of clients. MASTERWOOD products are widely used in the manufacturing of furniture, doors, window frames and stairways, and the firm offers specialist CNC machining centres for each of these business areas. This has led them into working with everything from window manufacturers in London to mass production of luxury doors for an Italian producer. The firm has also expanded abroad, and its machining centres have been installed in 120 countries. Every sale is backed up by after-sale support services, and each machine is individually registered with information about its software and purpose, which allows MASTERWOOD technicians to provide the best possible support when needed. Using network cards, the firm can even maintain machines from abroad via remote access, supplying immediate solutions as they arise. They also provide a comprehensive training service for clients, so that they can enjoy the full benefit of MASTERWOOD machinery.

MASTERWOOD Product Portfolio

The range of woodworking machinery manufactured by MASTERWOOD SpA includes:

  • CNC woodworking centres 
  • Machining centres for door assembly 
  • CNC routing and drilling centres 
  • CNC chisel mortisers 
  • Hinge-driving and routing machines 
  • Traditional lathes and mortisers 
  • Second hand MASTERWOOD machinery and spare parts 
  • Software for use with MASTERWOOD CNC machines

MASTERWOOD machines are aimed at the woodworking sector, where precision wood manipulation is a necessity. Clients may include door and window makers, furniture manufacturers and larger firms in the construction sector which carry out woodwork in-house.

The French firm MANITOU is one of Europe's most popular manufacturers of materials handling vehicles - which includes aerial platforms, telehandlers and forklift trucks. Its major area of expertise is in forklifts, both for indoor and outdoor use.

Manufacturing world-leading forklift trucks since the 1950s

MANITOU is a French company which specializes in manufacturing materials handling equipment, including forklift trucks, aerial platforms and loaders, for use in warehouses and factory environments. Along with MANITOU equipment, the firm also includes the sub-firms GEHL, MUSTANG, LOC and EDGE and employs more than 3,000 people across the world. MANITOU France was founded in 1957 by engineer Marcel Braud, who had an idea for a forklift truck that would be suitable for difficult terrain. Braud started to nurture a company of his own, drawing on his family's experience in agricultural machinery and fertilizer production. The firm then gained success by partnering with Japanese car maker Toyota to produce its range of materials handling vehicles, and moved into telescopic forklift trucks in the 1980s.

By 2004, the company had sold more than 200,000 forklifts, across a wide variety of styles and had expanded overseas with new facilities in Australia, the United States and China. Along the way, MANITOU also branched out into providing specialist training from its corporate base, and set up a network that provides spare parts to users of its products across the world. MANITOU remains firmly anchored in France, with its headquarters in the town of Ancenis, as well as production facilities in Candé and Laillé. But the firm has also built factories in Italy and the United States, to support its global presence. The firm currently markets a range of materials handling machinery, with a focus on agriculture and warehouse operations. Clients in the construction sector are catered for by the firm's aerial platforms, while MANITOU also manufactures machinery specifically for the mining and quarrying industry, as well as providing equipment for armed forces and the tourism sector.

The MANITOU product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by MANITOU includes:

  • Telehandlers
  • Rotating telehandlers
  • Masted forklift trucks
  • Aerial work platforms
  • Truck mounted forklifts
  • Pallet trucks
  • Stackers
  • Industrial tractors

The MANITOU products for sale are supplied to a wide range of clients. MANITOU equipment are suitable for customers in agriculture, construction, warehousing, quarrying, mining, the emergency services, tourism and the military.

FETRA Fechtel Transportgeräte GmbH is a German manufacturer of light transportation equipment based in the town of Borgholzhausen in the state of North Rhine-Westphalia. FETRA manufactures more than 1,000 different products aimed, the company says, at providing a solution to each and every requirement of industrial transport, always featuring first-class workmanship.

History of FETRA Fechtel Transportgeräte GmbH

Since the 1960s, FETRA has focused on what remains its core business to this day: the manufacture of aluminium, stainless steel and steel hand carts, for use in a wide variety of industries. From small beginnings in the same town where the company is based today, FETRA GmbH now offers a wide range of trolleys. Some are small office trolleys, others are much heavier pieces of machinery for moving loads of up to 24 tonnes. From the start, FETRA's philosophy was to produce machinery that is, above all, fit for purpose and this philosophy, the company says, is engineered into each and every trolley that leaves its factory to this day. The hi-tech FETRA production lines use the very latest technology to ensure the highest possible levels of quality, and this is reflected in the 10-year guarantee offered on all products. The trolleys are designed for a hard life, with scratch-resistant surfaces. FETRA products are now used all over Europe, and FETRA retains a huge stock at its on-site warehouse to ensure fast and efficient delivery. All products are made in Germany, and FETRA today is still a family-controlled company.

Fetra Equipment Portfolio:

  • Rollers and light trolleys
  • Trolleys
  • Trucks
  • Wheels
  • Lifting carts

NUSSBAUM is based in Germany, where it owns seven factories and manufactures sheet metal and hydraulics products as well as a wide range of vehicle maintenance products that are used by industrial clients.

A leading manufacturer of vehicle maintenance equipment

Otto NUSSBAUM GmbH & Co. KG is a German company which manufactures equipment for use in the automobile manufacturing and maintenance sectors. The firm was founded in 1943 by Otto NUSSBAUM as a components manufacturer, but branched out into the production of specialist vehicle lifts in 1975. The company played an important role in the introduction of new vehicle lift technologies during the 1980s, such as the UNI scissors lift, introduced in 1983. NUSSBAUM then unveiled the world's first double scissors lift in 1985, with its popular Jumbo range (selling 110,000 units by 2000). After this success, the company expanded its production facilities, opening new factories in Magdeburg and Leipzig between 1992 and 1994 alongside its older facility in Bordersweier. Further innovation followed this expansion, with the company introducing its revolutionary smart towers in 1997, which found instant favour with customers across Europe.

Moving into the sheet metals business and all-in-one solutions

In 2004, NUSSBAUM made a significant move by opening its sheet metals business, and continued to innovate, winning industry awards for its axis measuring robots. A huge new logistics centre was opened in 2007, while the company developed new products for use in the maintenance of trains and new products were added to the firm's portfolio in the areas of tyres and power lifts. By 2012, the company had consolidated a position as a leading international provider of automobile and train maintenance equipment, but had remained a family owned operation. It employs around 1,200 people at seven German factories, and operates a global distribution and support network to bring in new customers. Recent developments have focused on providing all-in-one solutions such as the Car Satellite system, which mixes car servicing and petrol/gas provision in one platform, allowing customers to achieve more efficient vehicle maintenance.

The NUSSBAUM product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by NUSSBAUM includes:

  • Automotive lifts
  • Brake and headlight testers
  • Wheel aligners
  • Wheel balancers
  • Tyre changers
  • Vehicle air conditioning units
  • Car satellite servicing platforms
  • Combi and uni car lifts
  • Truck lifts
  • Truck brake testing and wheel alignment services
  • Hydraulic industrial equipment
  • Sheet metal machines
  • Parking and displaying technology
  • Public transport systems

The products manufactured by NUSSBAUM are used by many industrial clients. Their automobile servicing technology is used to ensure that industrial vehicles such as cars, trucks and forklifts are properly maintained and set up for their tasks. The firm's hydraulics and sheet metal products are used by engineering firms for specific manufacturing tasks.

Founded and based in Germany, SKET is a leading manufacturer of machinery for the production of steel wire strands. The company is renowned for its expertise in the fields of both steel wire rope technology and cable technology.

About SKET

SKET has been involved in the production of stranding machines for well over a century. Based in the city of Magdeburg, Germany since the turn of the 20th century, SKET has a long tradition of manufacturing high-quality, technologically advanced industrial products. Although the company's main base of operations remains in Germany, SKET has a presence in 35 countries across the world and is a vital partner to the cable and wire rope industry.

SKET is continually looking to develop and advance its production processes. From their main production site, the company utilise linked CAD/CAM work stations and ensure that all processes are fully supported by computerised production, planning and control systems. The company prides itself on the high quality of its manufacturing output and the full reliability of product supply.

SKET Product Portfolio

The company's product portfolio encompasses a wide range of machines for the production of steel wire rope and cable. The range includes:

  • Tubular stranding machines
  • Double and single twist bunchers
  • Planetary stranding machines with or without back-twist
  • Special purpose machines

In addition, the SKET portfolio includes complete and innovative equipment solutions for the production of telecommunications cable, submarine cable, energy cable, low relaxation PC wire and strand and steel cord.

The German firm PEDDINGHAUS is a manufacturer of metal processing machinery including drills and saws. It has most of its manufacturing operations in the United States, although it operates across the world.

World-leading manufacturers of steel fabrication machinery

PEDDINGHAUS Corporation manufactures machinery that is used in the steel fabrication industry. The company was formed in Germany in 1903 by Paul F. Peddinghaus and initially specialized in making hand punching and shearing equipment. Mechanization soon followed, and by 1930, the company had introduced a ground-breaking range of motorized shearing and punching machinery, adding surface hardening products in 1935. The 1950s found PEDDINGHAUS expanding overseas and in 1969, the company opened a second manufacturing facility in the town of Bitburg. Innovation continued, with the introduction of precision controlled beam processing systems in the 1970s and the commencement of angle iron processing systems from 1974.

Creating an American production centre and continually innovating

Strategic acquisitions soon followed, such as the American firm Manco Manufacturing, giving PEDDINGHAUS international reach. By the 1980s, the company had begun to dominate the market for integrated steel processing cells, as well as automated steel fabrication robots which became commonly used in heavy manufacturing across the world. In the 1990s further technological innovations were seen, such as plasma punching units and the company made inroads into the Latin American market. By 2001, PEDDINGHAUS Corp had added thermal cutting to its portfolio and had added a large manufacturing space in Bradley, Illinois. During the 2000s, the company added new models of CNC machining units and high speed structural drilling machinery as well as advanced band saws. It also introduced a state of the art communications and support centre and expanded its centre in Bradley to include a research and development campus. This meant that the firm would continue to add new models and wholly new technology like the revolutionary PeddiWriter - a standalone layout marker that was introduced in 2011.

 

Website: peddinghaus.com

The PEDDINGHAUS product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by the PEDDINGHAUS company includes:

  • Drill lines
  • Plate processors
  • Angle and detail machines
  • Thermal cutting devices
  • Band saws
  • Tool division saws
  • Shot blasters
  • Material handling solutions
  • Software for PEDDINGHAUS machining centres

The machinery manufactured by PEDDINGHAUS Corporation is intended for use within the metalworking sector. Clients include construction firms, bridge and ship builders and the energy sector, where precision cutting of metals is required.

Based in the American state of Louisiana, OLYMPIAN manufacture components for the oil and gas sector, including precision engineered tubing, casings and castings. It is looking to expand internationally and into new sectors including medical applications.

A young firm that supplies the energy sector with tubing, casings and castings

OLYMPIAN is a company which manufactures specialist equipment for the oil and gas extraction and processing industries. The firm was founded in 2007 by engineering experts Kent Bonvillain and Whitney Guidry in the town of Houma, Louisiana. OLYMPIAN Machine, LLC started out with just 3 employees, but had an effective plan - to supply high quality tubing, casing and castings to the oil and gas industry, which had many operations off the coast of Louisiana. OLYMPIAN expanded rapidly as customer demand proved to be huge, and moved into a 14,000 square metre facility in the town of Terrebonne in 2008, where the company installed the latest in computer-controlled CNC machining technology in the production of its castings and tubing. By 2014, the firm was employing more than 50 people operating 24 hours per day in a 22,000 square metre manufacturing facility. Despite suffering a little due to hurricanes and the economic downturn in 2008, OLYMPIAN has proven true to its name and bounced back.

Forming strategic partnerships and weathering economic problems

A strategic partnership with metals producer Howco has made its supply chains more efficient while the company also chose to acquire fellow manufacturer Wadko Precision in 2012, which added to its portfolio, and allowed it to gain a foothold in the Texan oil and gas sector as well. Additionally, OLYMPIAN has been working to move into other sectors besides oil and gas, including coal power generation and medical applications for its casing, casting and tubing products. This is made possible by the wide number of different materials that the firm can machine, which includes aluminium, chrome, plastics and copper, as well as the many different machining capabilities that OLYMPIAN can offer - from honing and  sawing to milling and lathes. The company has also developed a core commitment to quality assurance in all of its products - a necessity when dealing with the oil and gas sector, and has installed a broad range of gages and detectors when manufacturing its components to make sure that they are fit for purpose.

The OLYMPIAN product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by OLYMPIAN includes:

  • Blast joints
  • Bull plugs
  • Couplings
  • X-over subs
  • Flow couplings
  • Nipples and pup joints
  • Test plugs
  • Mandrels
  • Seal subs
  • Upper and lower subs
  • Inserts
  • Rings
  • Collets
  • Specialist services including: stressless metal stamping, copper plating, xylan coating, dimensional inspecting, welding and hydro testing

OLYMPIAN's products are primarily used in the oil and gas industry as part of primary extraction projects such as offshore  drilling or in the transport of crude oil and gas via secure pipelines. They may also be used in refineries and power plants.

The FESTOOL Group GmbH & Co. KG in Wendlingen has developed into a renowned manufacturer of high-quality pneumatic and electric tools Made in Germany. Products by FESTOOL serve the expectations of professional users perfectly, so that the company was able to claim the international top of its rank within the 90 years of its existence.

Innovation and high quality for painters, carpenters and the automotive industry

The family enterprise Fezer & Stoll managed to enter the market after its establishment in 1925 with the first transportable chain saw and cemented its presence on the market with the first company-owned brand FESTO in 1933. Numerous innovations and more than 300 patents prove the company's passion for the needs of the craft and in 1951 FESTOOL marketed the 'Rutscher', a state-of-the-art oscillating sander, that would soon establish the brand in all specialized retail stores. FESTOOL Group strives to simplify the often difficult work of carpenters, painters and the work in the automotive industry.
