A combination of hand-held chain saw and runner allowed an important leap forward in 1964, and the same thing happened again in 1976 with the equipment of the disk-type sander with a suction device. Another highlight within the product development was the gearbox - disc-type sander ROTEX that combined three functions in one and that represented an outstanding innovation for everyone in the world in 1982. Distinctions and honors didn't take long to arrive and up until now FESTOOL could acclaim more than 80 awards. During the 1990's, FESTOOL GmbH developed the CDD 12, the shortest battery drill driver in the world and completed its SYSTAINAR-series with CT suction units providing for good orgnization and order at the work place. In 2006, the company presented a unique combination of joining machine and dowels. The DOMINO - linkage turned into a great success and in 2007 it was followed by the first FESTOOL – compound miter saw. Today, FESTOOL Group GmbH & Co. KG distributes high-quality products MADE IN GERMANY on all continents and is involved in their further development and optimization.

High-quality tools for various industries

The product range at FESTOOL Group unites handiness with a focus on precision, so that various battery driven products, manifold electric and pneumatic tools for carpenters, painters and the automotive industry are in steady demand. The product series for work place organization can be comfortably combined in order to optimize the production process. Moreover, FESTOOL GmbH offers all accessories and supplies.

FESTOOL Products

  • Battery-driven, electric and pneumatic tools
  • Industrial suction
  • Systems for workplace organization
  • Accessories and supplies
  • And other FESTOOL power tools

The firm NOVA VIT S.r.l., is based in Torino, Italy and are specialists in the manufacture of high quality air purification, filtration and ventilation systems for industrial partners. The company offers comprehensive maintenance and support services for all clients and focuses on fostering technological development.

An Italian leader in the field of air filtration and ventilation systems

NOVA V IT is an Italian firm which manufactures filtration and  ventilation systems, generally for industrial applications. The company was founded in 1968, and gained instant success, supplying factories in northern Italy, Switzerland and Germany with high quality air conditioning, extraction and filtration machinery. From the start, NOVA VIT specialized in ensuring that its technicians visited the sites of clients and worked to install equipment that completely met their needs. The company was also one of the first in Italy to adopt CAD techniques, visualizing its installations with customers and making sure that they fit in with existing machinery. It also developed a supply chain for custom made components, giving added flexibility when designing custom made filtration and air conditioning systems.

Constantly innovating and expanding into overseas markets

Another aspect of NOVA VIT's history has been its commitment to research and development. The company has been quick to adopt new technologies into its operations, such as the use of  laser cutting machines, automated plasma cutting devices and punching machines. This has helped the company to maintain a high degree of uniformity and quality control. A full support and spare parts provisioning service has also been set up, so that customers can be supported after purchasing NOVA VIT products, and the firm also offers an engineering consultancy option. The firm is still based in the city of Torino in northern Italy, but is a global company that can support clients across the world if required. Its products include fixed and mobile filters and purifiers, giving industrial operations the flexibility to tailor their production processes however they wish.

The NOVA VIT Product Portfolio

The range of products manufactured by NOVA VIT includes:

  • Centrifugal fans
  • Propeller fans
  • Oil smoke filters
  • Welding filters
  • Plasma/laser filters
  • Grinding filters
  • Wire working filters
  • Sanding filters
  • Stone working benches
  • Marble processing benches
  • Spraying booths

The products manufactured by NOVA VIT are essential for many engineering processes. Clients include automobile manufactures who require precision spray painting equipment, metal and wood working firms that need to remove dust from manufacturing settings, and public buildings such as hospitals.

The American company PASLODE specializes in manufacturing advanced fastening equipment, both cabled and cordless, with a focus on nailing machinery.

A world-wide name in the field of nailing products

PASLODE is a firm which manufactures high performance nailing machinery. Founded in 1935, the company was created by American businessman J.W. Leslie and initially focused on packaging and shipping products. The 1950s saw a huge change in the products offered by the company, with PASLODE pioneering the sale of pneumatic upholstery tackers for use in the furniture making trade. After this, the company realised the potential of pneumatic tools, and introduced its popular range of pneumatic nailers in the 1960s, which proved an instant success. Manufacturing firms recognised that these light-weight, high powered nailers could be easily used by workers resulting in more precise operations and less worker fatigue.

A corporate merger and continued product innovation

The success of PASLODE led to the firm being acquired by the Illinois Tool Works Corporation in the 1980s, and further product innovations followed. In 1986, the cordless power nailer was created, as well as cordless finish nailers in 1991. The 90s also saw pneumatic nailers being introduced that delivered greater power per pound as well as ground-breaking wood to steel coupling technologies which began to revolutionize the construction industry. PASLODE even started to develop new shapes and materials for their nails, enhancing their delivery and fastening power. The firm also introduced safety measures such as enhanced collation tape, which minimized the amount of debris flying from its nail guns and became a go-to firm for house builders and technicians across the United States and, increasingly, the rest of the world as well. With four plants spread across the United States, PASLODE is a major employer, and also operates manufacturing facilities in Australia, Malaysia, China, Korea, Denmark and Canada. This allows it to ensure that customers around the world have ready access to its fastening technology.

The PASLODE product portfolio

The range of fastening products manufactured by PASLODE includes:

  • Air nailers
  • Cordless nailers
  • Framing nailers
  • Trim and finish nailers
  • Roofing nailers
  • Metal connector nailers
  • Staplers and cap staplers
  • Fuel cells
  • Nails for use with PASLODE equipment

The products manufactured by PASLODE are generally used in the construction sector, for both commercial and residential projects. Any engineering project where metal and wood need to be fastened, or those involving mainly wood would be a suitable match for the firm's portfolio.

Oerlikon BARMAG is one of the world's leading manufacturers of spinning and texturing machines for use in the man-made fibre industry. The company's Research and Development centre in Remscheid, Germany is the largest of its kind in the world.

About BARMAG

BARMAG was founded in Barmen, Germany in 1922 by two synthetic fibre producing companies and was originally called BARMER MASCHINENFABRIK AG. BARMAG was one of the very first companies in the world to design and manufacture machines for the then brand new chemical fibre industry. Expanding rapidly, the company added yarn spinning machines, spinning pumps, button thread machines and spooling machines to its portfolio and soon found it necessary to move to larger facilities. During the fifties, BARMAG produced its very first texturing machine and began to expand into international markets.

Today, BARMAG has a major presence in countries across the world including the USA, Switzerland, Brazil, India and also China, which is one of the company's strongest export markets. Ever since its inception, BARMAG has been renowned for its innovation and technical expertise and is constantly refining its research and development processes. The company is dedicated to providing products of the highest quality and efficiency.

BARMAG Product Portfolio

In addition to the design and manufacture of spinning systems and texturing machines, BARMAG also produces related components such as

  • Winding heads
  • Pumps
  • Godets

The spinning systems manufactured by BARMAG are suitable for all fibre applications and the yarns they produce can be found in clothes, home  textiles and also in equipment such as car tires, airbags and safety belts.

BANDERA is a world leader in the manufacture of products for the packaging industry. They specialise in blown film equipment and sheet extrusion lines.

About BANDERA

Founded in Italy in 1947 by Luigi Bandera, the company expanded at a rapid rate, becoming a joint-stock operation in the fifties. It was as the sixties dawned that BANDERA began to manufacture on an industrial scale, producing a wide range of extrusion products including sheet extrusion lines, pipe extrusion lines and extrusion equipment profiles. By the eighties the company, now known by its full name of COSTRUZIONI MECCANICHE LUIGI BANDERA, was widely regarded as one of the world's leading players in blown film extrusion and sheet extrusion.

BANDERA remains a family-run business, with founder Luigi's sons, Piero and Franco, managing the company. As such, BANDERA is a customer focused business which aims to exceed expectations by fully understanding customer needs. On the production side, the mission of BANDERA is to supply technologically advanced solutions to the plastic industry at exceptional value.

BANDERA Product Portfolio

The range produced by BANDERA is focused on three main areas:

  • Blown film extrusion
  • Foil extrusion and sheet extrusion lines
  • Extrusion pipe

The blown film machines are designed to produce both single-layer and multi-layer packaging film for use in the medical and food industries. Other machines in the range manufacture plastic bags, industrial bags and agricultural film. The majority of the machines produced by BANDERA benefit from low power consumption.

Utilising state-of-the-art production methods, BANDERA is a leading manufacturer of extrusion technology. 

The company's diverse range includes:

  • Single screw extruders
  • Counter rotating extruders
  • Twin screw extruders

BANDERA is the only company in Italy with the capability to produce this technology in-house.

The company TORWEGGE is a specialty supplier for castors, wheels and conveyor technology. Based on its experience of 50 years, the products are innovative, made-to-last and conform to the highest safety requirements.

Website: torwegge.de

The history of the company TORWEGGE 

In the basement of his home Heinrich TORWEGGE founded a business for castors and wheels in 1956. Ten years later, the company already manufactured its own products and this development required expansion and relocation. The technician of the company, Horst Langenscheidt, suggested to include conveyor technology in the business activity of TORWEGGE GmbH. For this purpose a company-owned metalworking shop was built. It took until the mid 1980's for company buildings to appear and to consolidate all business activity in one place. However, this was the starting point for the continuous and healthy growth process of the company. In 1993, a subsidiary was founded in the eastern German town of Glauchau. Today, this town represents an important business for the entire region. In 2009, two more companies were founded in Slovakia as well as in the Netherlands. This development allows for the continuously growing demands of Eastern Europe and the Benelux countries to be met respectively. TORWEGGE distinguishes itself with high-quality products for favorable prices. Hence, even the years to come promise further growth for TORWEGGE GmbH & Co. KG.

TORWEGGE Production Portfolio

The range of products at TORWEGGE GmbH is divided into the following categories:

  • Wheels and castors
  • Conveyor components
  • Handling technology
  • Transport technology

This does not only include high-quality products, such as casters with ball bearings, carrier rollers and roller rails that all contributed to the company's fame, but the assortment also includes innovative and future-oriented products, including a transpallet with an integrated weight station. Commissioning is greatly simplified due to that innovation. All products can be ordered directly or through the annual catalog.

Service

The service at TORWEGGE GmbH includes individual consultation with a representative as well as respective request forms, divided into the individual categories. After receiving them, a qualified staff member will get in touch with the client.

ELUMATEC AG is a German based company, which has much expertise in producing machining centres for plastic, aluminium and steel profiles. The company's spare parts, services and products are used by small, medium and big enterprises all over the world.

Website: elumatec.de

Global Frontrunner In The Field of Profile Machining Segment

ELUMATEC's history began when Eugen Lutz started a company called Eugen Lutz in 1928. This was in Durrmenz, a place that is located in Muhlacker. The company was actually a foundry, which manufactured sand cast parts using light metals. Since then, this company has grown over the past 85 years to be one of the global frontrunners for plastic, steel and aluminium profile machining centres. With its headquarters in Muhlacker, which is near to Stuttgart in southern Germany, ELUMATEC caters to the needs of various industries like engineering, construction, automotive and furniture. The year 1930 saw the revolution in carpentry industry with the introduction of MT 1 dish grinding machine. Machining centres for aluminium and plastic profiles were introduced in 1966. The year 1984 saw the change of company name from ELU to ELUMATEC. ELUMATEC's expansion continued with the introduction of its subsidiary company, elusoft GmbH, which provided software solutions for economical and intelligent profile machining in 2001. The year 2014 saw another name change, but this time it was from mere ELUMATEC to ELUMATEC AG with AG referring to corporation in German language.

The ELUMATEC Machinery portfolio

The range of products that are produced by ELUMATEC includes:

  • Saws like miter, table, notching and glazing bead saws
  • Controller variants
  • Length stop and measuring systems
  • Corner crimpers
  • Profile machining centres
  • Cleaning or welding
  • Steel reinforcement
  • Operating and assembly equipment like rotating, horizontal assembly and tilting tables, trolleys and roller conveyors
  • Software solutions for intelligent profile machining like eluCad 

The spare parts and products that are manufactured by ELUMATEC are used by industrialists and manufacturers all over the globe. Other than spare parts and products, ELUMATEC also provides its specialist service in software solutions for its machines. Partners include assembly, window, curtain wall, automotive and furniture manufacturers. For more info and complete overview checkout their official company website in English here www.elumatec.de/en

STUDER has over 100 years of experience with precision cylindrical grinding machines. They are best-known for their software, hardware, system integration, service, and above all, quality. 

Website: studer.com

The History of STUDER

Founded in 1912, FRITZ STUDER AG has grown from a small business into an international company. At first, Fritz Studer built the first cylindrical grinding machine to be used in the company’s mechanical workshop. But once he realized the vast potential of this machine, Fritz unveiled his invention to the world and took the market by storm. It is no accident that this former mechanical workshop would develop into the industry leader that it is today. The pioneering spirit of that era can still be found in the STUDER AG product range today. STUDER develops and manufactures external and internal cylindrical grinders for work pieces that are small to medium in size. These grinders are typically used for single, small, or medium-sized productions for industries such as machine tooling, electronics, and tooling shops. STUDER AG also offers equipment that can produce precision parts for mass production, typically for the hydraulic or fuel injection industries. This equipment is capable of covering numerous complex applications with high flexibility, for both internal and external grinding applications. FRITZ STUDER AG is the industry leader for quality performance grinders with a reasonable price tag. 

STUDER Products Portfolio

  • Conventional Cylindrical Grinding
  • Universal Cylindrical Grinding
  • Production Cylindrical Grinding
  • Combination Cylindrical Grinding
  • Internal Cylindrical Grinding
  • Machine Software

KYOCERA DOCUMENT SOLUTIONS or KYOCERA for short is an Australian based company, which was formed in Sydney, Australia in 1989 for manufacturing document solutions. KYOCERA's products are broadly used in various sectors such as government, corporate, SMEs and non-profit.

Global leader in the field of document solutions

KYOCERA DOCUMENT SOLUTIONS is part of KYOCERA CORPORATION, which is based in Kyoto, Japan. The parent company was established in 1959. Over the decades, it expanded not only to earn a global name in fine ceramic making but also in various other industries including semiconductor, optics, electronics and solar energy. This spirit to grow quickly and remarkably can be seen in the history of KYOCERA DOCUMENT SOLUTIONS too. First established as KYOCERA in Sydney, Australia in the year 1989, KYOCERA DOCUMENT SOLUTIONS has grown in a matter of just over two decades to become a global leader in the field of document solutions. This is hardly surprising considering solutions like ECOSYS, which stands for Economy, Ecology and System. With the concept of better environment, durability and less cost, the very first ECOSYS cartridge free printer using patented amorphous silicon print drum made its debut into the world market in 1992. Not surprisingly, just five years after its establishment, the company was given Government Endorsed Supplier Status by the Australian government. The year 2000 saw the acquisition of Mita Corporation, a world leader in the field of copier machines. Accordingly, the name KYOCERA was changed to KYOCERA Mita during the same year. But with the integration of service, software solutions and hardware, the company's name was changed to KYOCERA DOCUMENT SOLUTIONS in April 2012. The company's headquarters is in Sydney, Australia and it is headed by David Finn.

KYOCERA's top products

  • Monochrome Printer ECOSYS LS-2100DN
  • Colour Printer ECOSYS FS-C8650DN
  • Black and White Laser Printer ECOSYS FS-9530DN 
  • Monochrome Multifunctional System TASKalfa 3510i
  • Colour Multifunctional System TASKalfa 5551ci
  • Wide Format Multifunction Devices TASKalfa 2420w

The KYOCERA product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by KYOCERA includes:

  • Monochrome or black and white printers
  • Colour printers
  • Wide format
  • Monochrome Multifunctional Products or MFPs
  • Colour Multifunctional Products or MFPs
  • Software solutions like output management, mobile and cloud
  • Consumables like toners
  • Accessories

The accessories, consumables, software solutions and products by KYOCERA are used in various environments. Partners include those involved in manufacturing, education, government, legal, health care and enterprise sectors.

GARANT is a Canadian based company, which has over 110 years of expertise in making gardening and snow removal tools. The company's parts and products are used by gardeners, establishments and households worldwide.

Global leader in the field of gardening and snow removal technology

The colourful history of GARANT started with a blacksmith named Telesphore Garant in 1895. He built a small forge in Saint-Francois, formerly a village located east of Quebec City. When demand for his garden tools grew, the need for bigger space including a warehouse became necessary. In January, 1944, the company, A.GARANT & Sons Co. Ltd. was formed. Catering to the needs of households, builders, gardeners and organisations, the company invested much energy and time in research and development, producing snow removal and gardening tools that reduced fatigue. Gardening, snow removal and building tasks became easier and faster. Aspects like quality and durability were considered trademarks of GARANT. In December, 1965, the name, A.GARANT & Sons Co. Ltd. was changed to GARANT Inc. in accordance with the company's tremendous growth. Not surprisingly, Hanson PLC, a global leader in the field of building materials bought over GARANT Inc. in 1991. As it is, Hanson PLC, a British-owned multinational company already had ownership of Ames, America's largest gardening tools producer. The biggest winter carnival in the world, Quebec Winter Carnival chose GARANT's tools as their official outdoor tools in February, 2010.

GARANT's top products

  • Weeder GDW37
  • Poly leaf rake SPFR26C
  • Garden hoe SGH65
  • Garden claw GGCW
  • Mulching fork GMF5D
  • TUBBY 26P
  • TUBBY 40BL
  • Poly wheelbarrow PS500F
  • Poly car ice scraper G10IS
  • Snowbrush G28SBMSV
  • COMBOCAR
  • TRIOCAR

The GARANT product portfolio 

The range of parts and products that are produced by GARANT includes:

  • Winter tools
  • Striking tools
  • Lawn tools
  • Carts
  • Wheelbarrows

The products that are produced by GARANT are used by gardeners, organisations, hobbyists, nursery owners and households all over the globe. GARANT's partners include wholesalers, garden centres, hardware stores, superstores, retailers and nurseries.

GILLARDON GmbH & Co. KG manufactures quality  drilling machines for industrial applications. GILLARDON products offer excellent construction and durability, using top quality materials from reputable suppliers.

Company Information

GILLARDON manufactures drilling machines for a range of industrial purposes. With factories located in Gölshausen and Gemminhem, Germany, this manufacturer offers a range of machines for industrial purposes. GILLARDON distributes its drilling range to buyers in Europe.

The History of Gillardon GmbH & Co. KG

GILLARDON was founded in 1919 to satisfy the demand for high powered drilling equipment in Germany and Europe and continue to research and develop innovative products to serve the needs of drilling companies.

Vital Statistics

GILLARDON produce radial drilling machines, column drilling machines, CNC drilling centres, jig boring machines and gang drilling machines. The company also offers apprenticeships and training to high school students in mechanics and technical studies.

Bench drills

Offers a drilling capacity of about 20mm, threading of M 16 and a short spindle MK 2. Feed is operated by hand. Bench drills offer coil power of 0.55/1.0 kW.

Heavy duty pillar drilling machines

Pillar drilling machines at 28 mm to 32 mm. They offer a maximum spindle speed of 190/4000 u / min or 750/1500 u / min.

Column drilling machines

Column drills offer a drilling capacity of about 40 mm, a spindle of 160 mm with a mechanical feed clutch hand cross. Coil power is at 1,6 / 2,9 kW.

Coordinate boring machines

  • Hi-Jig Boring Machines offer a drilling capacity of 40 mm. The drills have coil power of 1,6 / 2,9 kW.
  • Gang drilling machines
  • A variety is available at R20, R28, R32 VE and R40 VE
  • Quick-radial drilling machines
  • Quick radial drills are offered at GSR 32 and GSR 32 VE-SL with spindles of 150 mm/200mm
  • Radial drilling machines
  • GRB models at 50 to 75 GRB and steel drilling capacity of 80 to 130 mm.

DYSON, a British based company was formed in Malmesbury, UK for manufacturing vacuum cleaners, fan heaters, bladeless fans and hand dryers. DYSON's products are widely used by households and companies all over the world.

Global leader in the field of vacuum cleaner, fan heater, fan and hand dryer technology

The history of DYSON LTD. or DYSON for short began with James Dyson. Frustrated with the bad performance of his vacuum cleaner, he set about making his very own vacuum cleaner in 1978. A visit to a local sawmill gave him the idea of using the same cyclone concept for a vacuum cleaner. After an astounding 5127 prototypes and over 15 years, the new bagless vacuum cleaner, DC01 was born. This happened after James Dyson set up his own company in the town of Malmesbury in Wiltshire, UK in June 1993. Within a period of merely 18 months, DC01 took the UK by storm, gaining place as UK's biggest selling vacuum cleaner. In October 2009, DYSON revolutionised heating and cooling technology with the release of fan heaters, which had a cooling and heating system. Using Air Multiplier Technology, fan heaters without any visible blades were released into the world market. Over the years with creativity and engineering as the key, DYSON has grown to become one of the global leaders in manufacturing vacuum cleaners, fan heaters, bladeless fans and hand dryers. As of September 2014, the company's headquarters still remains in Malmesbury but with James Dyson as its chief engineer.

DYSON's top products

  • Cinetic canister vacuum cleaner DC52
  • Upright vacuum cleaner DC42
  • Digital slim handheld vacuum cleaner DC45
  • White/silver table fan AM06
  • White/silver tower fan AM07
  • White/silver pedestal fan AM08
  • Anthracite/blue fan heater hot + cool AM05
  • Hand dryer AB14
  • Cordless vacuum cleaner car + boat DC43H

DAEWOO was a major South Korean corporation and played a leading role in Korea’s national economic development. The main divisions of DAEWOO are International Trade, Project Organization, and Resource Development.

History of DAEWOO

DAEWOO International conducts business with both local and international customers. They carry a wide range of products including  metal, steel, raw steel material, non-ferrous metal, machinery, automotive components, industrial electronics, along with chemical and agro-fishery products. Additionally, DAEWOO plays a crucial role as a project organizer for overseas development projects such as railroads, power generation plants, ports, and IT facilities. DAEWOO also exports and trades industrial machines and equipment. DAEWOO has gone through many changes throughout their history. The company began in 1967 as DAEWOO Industry Co. Ltd. and focused mainly on exports. It was then renamed to DAEWOO Corporation in 1982 to reflect their devotion to international trade. In December 2000, a spin-off of DAEWOO Corporation was formed, DAEWOO International Corp., and specialized in project organization, international trade, and resource development. DAEWOO was incorporated into POSCO Group in the year 2010. 

DAEWOO Divisions

DAEWOO had about 20 different divisions under the umbrella DAEWOO Group, but today only six remain and they include:

  • Daewoo Electronics – A strong branch both internationally and in Korea
  • Daewoo Engineering & Construction – Specializing in construction
  • Daewoo International – Specializing in trading and investments
  • Daewoo Shipbuilding & Marine Engineering – Specializes in shipbuilding
  • S&T Daewoo – Specializing in small firearms manufacturing
  • Tata Daewoo – Specializing in commercial vehicles

ELECTROLUX is a Swedish multi-national company that manufactures household and professional appliances. Time after time, ELECTROLUX is ranked the second-largest appliance manufacturer in the world.

History of ELECTROLUX

Incorporated in 1901 by Sven Carlson, Lux AB produced large kerosene lamps. As competitors began to make similar kerosene lamps and electric lighting was becoming more popular, Lux needed a new product. In 1912, Lux started to manufacture electric vacuum cleaners and would eventually change its name to ELEKTROLUX in 1918, when the company merged with Svenska Elektron AB. It wasn’t until 1957 that the company would change the spelling of its name to ELECTROLUX. ELECTROLUX originates from the union of two companies. The first company was a well established manufacturer and the second company was a young business that was established by a former vacuum salesman. Originally the ELECTRLUX name was synonymous with the vacuum market, but today it manufactures all major appliances.

ATLAS COPCO manufactures a variety of construction, mining, vacuum, air compression and air treatment equipment. It aims to provide a range of sustainable solutions to improve industrial productivity.

Website: atlascopco.us

ATLAS COPCO's company history

This international company was founded in 1873, in Stockholm, Sweden by André Oscar Wallenberg J.W. Arnberg, C.G. Cervin and F. Didron. Initially focusing on railroad construction and operation products, the company radically changed direction when Wallenberg sank a great deal of capital into the business after a recession in the 1880s. Under the direction of industrialist Oscar Lamm, the company diversified its production range to include locomotives, central heating and machine tools. Through a mix of necessity and active research, Nya Atlas (as it was then named) began producing its own pneumatic tools and air compressors at the turn of the 20th century, eventually selling them commercially. The early 20th century saw Atlas developing cleaner, more reliable diesel compressors. After catching up with its competitors’ air-cooled compressor technology, ATLASCOPCO led the way in 1967 by introducing screw compressors which produced oil-free compressed air.

At the same time, the company followed industry trends by exploring the possibilities in electrically-powered tools. In this vein, ATLAS COPCO Group acquired the German toolmaker Atlas AEG Werkzeuge in 1994, two years before its highly successful Tensor S electrical nutrunner hit the market. ATLAS COPCO Corp led the way again in 1994 when it introduced speed-controlled compressors, providing major energy savings. In 2004, the group acquired Ingersoll-Rand Drilling Solutions, and in 2007 it added a road construction division after buying Dynapac.

The focus of the business

ATLAS COPCO machinery is divided into four areas of focus. These are construction, mining and rock excavation, compressors and industrial technique.

  • Air and gas compressors
  • Mining ventilation systems 
  • Vacuum pumps 
  • Mining drills and related equipment
  • Generators
  • Rock crushers and screeners 
  • Pumps 
  • Trolleys and hoists 
  • Energy recovery solutions

The specialist, American CLARK Material Handling Company is the inventor of forklifts. It used to be a supplier of autombile components, and now it is a worldwide operating company with a focus on the production and sale of different types of  forklifts and storage technology. Material handling machinery is the expertise of CLARK, as a company owner, you must be familiar with this brand. Having a CLARK machine in the warehouse is almost a must have. You may also know that buying a new CLARK forklift might be a bit out of reach money wise for most businesses. One great solution is buying a used CLARK forklift or any other material handling equipment at industrial auctions. you can get a used CLARK machine in the fraction of the price and the same reliable machine with the heights production standards. 

Website: clarkmhc.com

Clark Material Handling History

In 1903, CLARK (CMHC) was founded as a supplier of components for automobiles and in 1917 it astonished everyone with the first forklift for indoor transportation. With eight orders from different companies in 1918, this was the company's foundation for a whole individual production range. CLARK (CMHC) introduced the Truclift in 1920, which was equipped with hydraulics so it could move between two and five tonnes up and down. In 1923, the Duat (“do this, do that”), a three-wheeled hauler and it could pull 750kg was produced. This was the foundation for the first gasoline-powered forklift. Clarktor and Tructier were the precursors for the modern CLARK generation. In 1942, the first electric-operated forklift was developed, which can only undertake one shift at a time. Its production had to be postponed until 1945 because the government's requirements were a priority at this time. In the following years, CLARK Material Handling Company continued to develop their technologies and undertook some strategic acquisitions. This means that CLARK products like forklifts was able to establish itself not only in Europe, but also in Asia, Latin America and South America. Since 2004, this company has been represented by “CLARK Europe GmbH” in Europe. Their head office was in Duisburg at first, and then it moved to Mülheim an der Ruhr in 2007.

Range of Services

The first forklifts were developed over the years into intelligent industrial trucks that were modern, safe and ergonomic with various different types of engines. CLARK products range of services includes low-platform trucks, high lifters, reach trucks, electric haulers and mini devices. All these machine are being used all over the world and in big mass, so much as there is almost no warehouse or other companies in need of materials handling machinery that don't know the name CLARK. Therefore used CLARK forklifts and other used Clark material handling machinery are in high demand in the second hand industrial market. Every company or warehouse owner must consider buying used Clark machinery as a means to power up the fleet but still save money.

The success story of the company ALTENDORF

The history of Wilhelm ALTENDORF GmbH & Co. KG runs parallel to that of the sliding table saw. This machine was invented by Wilhelm Altendorf in 1906, and he used it to create his own furniture designs. In 1956, the sons of the company's founder, Kurt and Willy ALTENDORF, concentrated their production solely on the ALTENDORF sliding table saw. ALTENDORF GmbH developed themselves into a specialist and their sliding table saw led to their global success. Up until today, there are more than 130,000 ALTENDORF sliding table saws used in joineries, carpentry workshops and facilities that process wood, plastic and metal.

Production locations and world service

All sales and marketing activities are undertaken in their head office in the States. The research and development department is located in a North Rhine-Westphalian city and focuses on product development and innovation. The central starting point for all ALTENDORF services are found here. The production facilities in America are responsible for all sophisticated machinery. Cheaper machine models are produced in Qinhuangdao, China and Gaspar (Santa Catarina), Brazil. There is also a sister company in Australia, India and south Asia. The ALTENDORF sliding table saw is sold in 120 countries. The company's partners are available in over 60 countries and provide customers with competent service and specialist advice.

In 1911, the founder Carl Niepenberg, was a handwork master in metalworking industry around Solingen. The “Niepenberg & Co. AHLMANN Baumaschinen is from Kulmbach, Schleswig-Holstein, and manufactures compact swing and wheel loaders. Since 2002, AHLMANN belongs to the French construction equipment manufacturer, MECALAC S.A.

Website: ahlmann.nl/en

The history of AHLMANN Baumaschinen

The AHLMANN Carlshütte KG in Büdelsdorf started producing swing loaders in 1952. This was the beginning of AHLMANN Baumaschinen GmbH. The swing loader that was conceptualised by the company's head, Josef-Severin Ahlmann, was the first functional wheel loader in the world that could tip a load onto its side. In the 1960s, AHLMANN GmbH was the first manufacturer that produced a series of wheel loaders that were equipped with a power-driven hydrostatic drive. In 1972, the production of the swing loader was outsourced by CARLSHÜTTE KG, which is how AHLMANN Maschinenbau became the subsidiary company.

AHLMANN into MECALAC

When AHLMANN Baumaschinen merged with the company MECALAC S.A., one of the most renowned manufacturers of mobile excavators in France, in 2002, they created the organisation MECALAC AHLMANN. At the beginning of 2012, AHLMANN was renamed MECALAC. Nowadays, their product range of loaders includes five swing loaders and one telescopic swing loader. In terms of excavators, customers can choose between seven different devices: three universal excavators and four multifunctional machines.

MECALAC Product Portfolio

AHLMANN MECALAC produces and sells, under the brand name MECALAC, compact construction machines like:

  • Swing loaders
  • Wheel loaders
  • Telescopic loader
  • Mobile excavator
  • Crawler excavators
  • Rail road excavators

MECALAC is the market leader for compact mobile excavators in France, and the worldwide leader of swing loaders.

MECALAC Services

All of MECALAC's products are conceptualised to be accessible and servicable without problems. Most of their products are equipped with CAN-Bus-Technology, which supports the customer service providers. Mecalac has also developed a diagnosis tool called Mecadiag, which helps identify what needs to be serviced. Their production facilities all have a spare parts storage area, including a regular supply of components that are seldom needed, so that customers can quickly acquire any components required.

The INGERSOLL-RAND company (IR) is a conglomerate offering many different products, tools and services, some of them under different names. The headquarters of the company is located in Swords in the Irish county of Fingal although it was founded in New York.

INGERSOLL-RAND tool company  History

In 1871, the American Simon Ingersoll invented a steam-powered

hammer drill that was able to drill holes vertically. In the same year, he founded the Ingersoll Rock Drill Company in New York. One year later, the Rand & Waring Drill & Compressor Company was founded. Nine years later, it changed its name to Rand Drill Company. In 1905, the Ingersoll Rock Drill Company merged with the Rand Drill Company to form INGERSOLL RAND tools (IR). In 1912 the company invented the Jackhammer. 13 years later it developed the first diesel electric locomotive engine that was commercially successful. In 1948, INGERSOLL RAND PLC introduced the Quarrymaster, which was considered to be the first self-contained, mobile, air-powered rock drill for large-diameter blast holes. From the 1990s on, acquisitions of other companies advance the growth of INGERSOLL RAND tools. In 2002, the headquarters of the company was moved to Bermuda. Seven years later, it was moved to Swords in Ireland where it is located today. About 52,000 people work for INGERSOLL-RAND (IR).

INGERSOLL Machines Range From Air Compressors to Jackhammers

INGERSOLL RAND offers a vast range of products and services. Many of them don’t have the name of INGERSOLL RAND but of one of the many subsidiaries like Thermo King, Club Car or Trane. INGERSOLL machines products itself is best known for its air solutions, material handling products and tools. The INGERSOLL-RAND company is divided into four divisions: industrial technologies, security technologies, climate solutions and residential solutions. The most popular are their air compressors, jackhammers, impact wrench, air tools and more.

A German family firm which focuses on filtering, efficiency and waste disposal

Founded in 1962, HÖCKER POLYTECHNIK now deals with large-scale filtering products for industrial customers and public organizations where air quality is important, and contaminants must be filtered out. The technical nature of the firm's business has encouraged it to focus on the importance of innovation and education, with a significant investment in research and development to improve all of its products. HÖCKER POLYTECHNIK employs over 120 people, with a main factor in the German town of Hilter as well as wholly owned subsidiaries in Poland, Russia and Switzerland which deal with sales. While they invest heavily in manufacturing, HÖCKER POLYTECHNIK also seek to support customers throughout the purchasing process, and provide ongoing consultancy and design services while projects are rolled out. They also emphasise their commitment to efficiency (both in terms of cost and energy) as well as their financial stability (as a family owned firm). Many of their products are also associated with sustainability and efficiency, such as their biomass burning systems and programmable energy terminals. Others are intended to reduce the amount of waste produced by companies, and to limit the impact that waste disposal has on the environment.
