EBM Germany is one of the world's leading tube and pipe forming companies. Operating from a German base, it supplies piping and tubing products as well as the machinery and tools required to produce piping.

A global player in the world of piping and tubing

EBM was founded in 1987 by German industrialist Erich Büchele (who also gave his initials to the company name). The firm specializes in the manufacturing of tubing and tube-ends and is one of the few companies in that niche which operates worldwide. The firm's first factory was situated in the German town of Herbertshofen, but within a few years, EBM GmbH products had expanded across the Atlantic, opening a manufacturing facility in Spartanburg, South Carolina. Since then, the company had become a leading participant in the axial-forming sector, with its major focus on the European and American markets. It employs more than 50 workers at its headquarters in Meitingen, where it seeks to bring every aspect of the business under one roof - from manufacturing to sales, and from research and development to administration. EBM divides its operations into three areas. Firstly, it provides manufacturing solutions for clients who require formed pipes and tubes. Secondly, its service department helps to maintain existing piping and to provide spare parts as required. Finally, EBM GmbH provides tooling services to assist with maintenance of its products. The company seeks to work with its customers at all stages in the manufacturing process, and also focuses on ensuring that all products are rigorously quality-checked before delivery. EBM GmbH manufactures a range of standardized products, but also carries out bespoke work for particular clients, and offers a "one stop solution" for customers, including initial consultancy, manufacture and maintenance.

EBM GmbH Product Portfolio

EBM manufactures the following products:

  • Standardized tube or pipe forming machines
  • Customized tube or pipe forming machines
  • Tooling for their machines
  • Specialist piping products

EBM Germany works with a wide range of clients across many industrial sectors. Any firm which requires piping would be a suitable client, from food manufacturing to chemicals and vehicle operators.

The company INDEX-Werke (“Werk” is the German word for factory) is based in Esslingen am Neckar and is one of the biggest producers of CNC turning machines in the world. Sales companies are situated in Brazil, China und the United States.

The history of the company INDEX

INDEX Werke GmbH & co. Kg was founded in 1914 by Hermann Hahn in the Swabian cityCof Esslingen am Neckar. In the same year, the company started with the production of turret lathes. Within the first 40 years after the foundation, INDEX Werke sold more than 20.000 machines. In 1975 the company started to produce  multi-spindle turning machines, only a few years later the production of CNC lathes began. INDEX GmbH developed a turning and milling center that bases on a system of modular components; it was introduced in 1992. Five years later, INDEX Werke purchased the company Traub Drehmaschinen in Reichenbach an der Fils and integrated it into the group as an independent subsidiary. Today, INDEX has 6 production locations, 5 international sales companies and more than 80 branches around the world. INDEX-Werke has around 2.100 employees, Traub approximately 400.

Main products

INDEX Werke produces lathes, mostly for the automobile industry and the automobile supplying industry. Also, a bigger amount of devices is sold to machine-building and electrical engineering companies as well as to the medical and the aerospace industry. Most of the components for the machines INDEX produces are made in Germany.

Production portfolio

  • Lathes
  • CNC multi-spindle turning machines 
  • CNC turning and milling centers
  • Fixed headstock lathes 
  • Sliding headstock lathes

HINOWA S.p.A. is based in the Italian city of Nogara and manufactures a wide variety of tracked vehicles for use in fields such as construction, agriculture and horticulture, as well as many other industrial applications.

Website: hinowa.com

A leading Italian manufacturer of tracked construction equipment

HINOWA S.p.A is an Italian firm which focuses on the manufacturing of construction equipment. It was founded in the town of Nogara near Verona in 1987, where it operates a 90,000 square metre facility and employs 120 workers. The firm's range of construction products includes loaders, truck based aerial platforms, forklift trucks, undercarriages and dumpers. These vehicles were initially developed to be used in the horticultural sector, where large amounts of earth moving was required. Since its founding, HINOWA has rapidly expanded, and has dealers across the world - in countries as diverse as Australia, Hungary, the United Kingdom and Spain. However, its major focus is on the Europe region. HINOWA S.p.A. has become known across Europe for its range of dumper trucks in particular, which seek to combine stability and power. The company specializes in rubber of steel tracked varieties which are suitable for heavy duty earth moving, making them ideal for infrastructure projects or public horticultural uses. Their advanced designs are also known for their adaptability, and the firm has developed dumpers which can load into skips or other receptacles that are well above ground level. This has filled a gap in the market for high-tip tracked dumpers that are powerful and reliable.

HINOWA Product Portfolio

HINOWA S.p.A. manufactures a wide range of construction machinery, which includes:

  • Tracked aerial platforms
  • Tracked minidumpers
  • Tracked forklifts
  • Tracked mini tractors
  • Tracked undercarriages
  • Transporters
  • Tracked high-tip dumpers

The HINOWA range is particularly suited to customers in the field of construction, and the firm deals with both private and public bodies. Their machinery will be useful for any projects where earth moving or transportation of heavy materials is required.

FIAT SpA

Based in Turin, FIAT Industrial is part of the Agnelli-owned Fiat Group empire, and specializes in manufacturing high quality industrial vehicles that are used across a broad spectrum of industrial tasks.

A world-leading Italian manufacturer of industrial vehicles

FIAT INDUSTRIAL is an Italian-based multinational industrial manufacturing firm. It was formed in 2011 when the Fiat group restructured its manufacturing arms, separating their car production into a separate company. All of Fiat Group's other manufacturing operations became FIAT INDUSTRIAL. This included the truck manufacturing business Iveco, agricultural and industrial equipment manufacturer CNH Global and the boat building and land transportation operations of Fiat Powertrain. FIAT INDUSTRIAL was then merged into a larger company, CNH Industrial, in 2013. Like all of Fiat Group's concerns, the company is mostly owned by the Agnelli family, and is based in the northern Italian city of Turin. It specializes in manufacturing a wide range of industrial equipment, from power trains to trucks, and from construction machinery to agricultural tools. Because of the merger with CNH, FIAT INDUSTRIAL is a global company, with plants spread across the Americas, Europe and Asia as CNH FIAT. It operates 39 Research and Development Centres worldwide, where its machinery is developed and tested, but the firm remains centred in Europe, which is home to 59 percent of its workforce. The firm consciously seeks to extend the history of Fiat SpA, which was founded in the mid nineteenth century, and is an iconic name in the history of the automobile, as well as being a major player in agricultural vehicles. With a presence in 190 countries, FIAT SpA provides maintenance support for its products and employs more than 70,000 people across the world.

FIAT INDUSTRIAL's product portfolio

FIAT INDUSTRIAL manufactures the following equipment:

  • Buses
  • Agricultural vehicles
  • Firefighting vehicles
  • Powertrains
  • Heavy trucks
  • Excavators
  • Loaders

FIAT INDUSTRIAL is a world-leading manufacturer of vehicles for a wide range of organizations. Its major clients are industrial and agricultural companies, but it also produces a large number of vehicles that are used by public sector bodies such as firefighting trucks.

FLEXI Narrow Aisle Ltd. is located in Great Bridge, West Midlands (England) and manufactures space saving forklift truck solutions for the  warehouse and material handling industry.

The history of the company FLEXI Narrow Aisle Ltd

The company has its beginnings in Bilston in 1976. A year later its Rotareach Lateral Stacker was already featured on “Tomorrow's World”, a program on the BBC. Starting as a niche developer FLEXI gained quick renown and introduced new models almost annually until 1980. With a growing base of customers FLEXI was able to expand and open a new production site in Great Bridge, Tipton in 1987. FLEXI Generation 1 went into serial production in 1991 in order to offer clients more efficient operating cycles based on a two meter aisle capability. With its 1.8 meter aisle capability, FLEXI Generation 2 provided even more space saving capacity in 1998 and FLEXI Generation 4 topped this with a 1.75 meter stacking aisle, True Radius® turning, its capacity to reach heights beyond 10 meters and a HiVIS twin post overhead guard. The 4th generation of FLEXI forklifts is generally considered a ground breaking innovation within the industry. In 2002, FLEXI was introduced to the American and Asian markets and a production site was established in Taiwan. By 2011, FLEXI was part of the entire European market as well as the markets of South Asia, South Africa and Korea. At that point international sales made up for 50 percent of the company's turnover.

Main Products

FLEXI manufactures space saving articulated  forklift trucks for a variety of conditions. The production focuses on narrow aisle forklift trucks with loading capacities between 1350 kg to 2.5 tonnes and lift heights between 1.6 – 10.5 meters.

 

 

Production Portfolio

  • FLEXI Euro AC (For narrow aisles with narrow pallets and fast throughput)
  • FLEXI G4 AC (For quick pallet movements and safe aisle performance)
  • FLEXI HiLOAD AC (For efficient high lifts and heavy loads)
  • FLEXI HiMAX AC (For high bay warehouses with fast pallet movements)
  • FLEXI VNA AC (For very narrow aisles)
  • FLEXI GAS (For on demand operation)
  • FLEXI ECO AC (Remanufactured forklift truck with varying loading capacities)

The ALUP Kompressoren GmbH company is a German manufacturer of compressed air systems, based in the town of Köngen near Stuttgart. ALUP Kompressoren says it prides itself on a combination of technology and excellence, and ALUP has a global distribution and service network.

The history of ALUP Kompressoren GmbH

ALUP Kompressoren has a history that dates back to 1923, the year that it was founded in the town where it is still based, Köngen near Stuttgart. Originally ALUP made equipment to pump air into car tyres and this original business is still reflected in its name today. ALUP stands for Auto-LUft-Pumpen, which literally translates as "car air pumps". From these modest beginnings, ALUP branched out into making both stationary and mobile piston compressors for industrial use. Over the years ALUP Kompressor has concentrated on its specialised market and introduced innovations as technology has advanced. In 1980, ALUP introduced screw compressor technology in a range of machinery from 2,2kW to 400 kW. ALUP Compressoren says that quality and service are at the heart of what it does. ALUP has an extensive research and development facility to ensure that it retains its position as a world leader in the compressed air industry. In the 21st century, ARUP has concentrated its efforts on providing not only maximum value for its customers, but also on energy efficiency so that a ALUP compressor is as environmentally friendly as possible. With a worldwide reputation, ALUP Kompressoren draws on the heritage of its long history in the business, while always looking ahead so as to offer its clients the very latest and best products in the future.

Website: alup.com


ALUP Product Portfolio

  • Screw compressors
  • Piston compressors
  • Refrigerant dryers
  • Adsorption dryers
  • Line filters
  • Oil-water separators
  • Condensate drains

DEPO GmbH is a Germany maker of machining centers, tools and tooling systems and software aimed at the gear industry, the die and mould industry and at general engineering industries. The company is based in the small village of Marienfeld, near the city of Gütersloh in the North Rhine-Westphalia region.

A history of DEPO GmbH & Co. KG

DEPO GmbH & Co. KG was founded in 1989, by Heinz Deitert, an engineer with long experience in the die and mould machine industry. His aim was to develop a much more efficient technology for milling than was currently available, and to this end, he set up a small factory in Marienfeld. His central idea was that making ways of milling more efficient, with matching tools, meant that, for clients, there would be an increase in their productivity on their production lines. This concept led DEPO GmbH & Co. KG to early success with its products, and the company says this is because of the reliability, innovation and flexibility that DEPO prides itself on. DEPO's motto is to provide a "complete solution from one source". In 1996, DEPO Germany established its machine tool technology line and all of its products continue to be made in Germany. A key selling point remains the integration of milling with machine tools to offer maximum economy to clients. Software has now become a key part of DEPO's business, and the company's GearEngineer software calculates and illustrates three dimensional models from two dimensional data. DEPO says that both for the present and the future, service is critical for the company's continued success. Development of future products remains a key part of what DEPO does today.

DEPO GmbH Product Portfolio 

  • Vertical high performance machining centres
  • Horizontal high performance machining centres
  • Milling machines for gear production
  • Tools and tooling systems
  • Software

VOLKSWAGEN is one of the largest, most well-known automobile brands in the world. Since 1937, the firm has designed  cars and trucks that are in use across the world.

An iconic German vehicle brand

German firm VOLKSWAGEN AG (VW) is one of the world's leading automobile and industrial vehicle manufacturers, and it's commercial vehicles arm has its corporate headquarters in the city of Hannover. Founded in 1937, VW initially supplied low cost  passenger cars to the domestic German market. After the war, the firm adapted its popular car designs and started to produce VW vans for commercial transport, and by 1954 100,000 of these "transporters" had been produced. Different van models followed throughout the 1960s, and the 1970s saw VW branching out into light trucks, beginning multi-national sales operations with a Brazilian subsidiary in 1981. The firm's transporters continued to be a go-to vehicle for commercial clients, with 6 million having been sold by the mid 1980s. This success led to new departures for the company, including a fruitful collaboration with Mercedes Benz on the Sprinter range of vans. During the 2000s, VW's range of vans and trucks has continued to lead the way, with the firm receiving many industry awards along the way. VW has also introduced new technologies to lower fuel consumption, such as BlueMotion, in keeping with the firm's commitment to sustainability. New developments since 2010 have included plans to expand manufacturing into China, as well as providing bus services to the Indian market.

The VW product portfolio

The range of commercial and industrial vehicles manufactured by VW includes:

  • VW Amarok utility vehicles
  • VW Caddy light vans
  • VW California utility vehicles
  • VW Caravelle cabs
  • VW Crafter delivery vans
  • Multivans
  • Transporter delivery vans
  • Specialized refrigerated vehicles

    • The VW range is designed to be suitable for a wide variety of corporate and public sector clients. The firm's vans are used by cab firms, hospitality and tourism companies, as well as food and drink or parcel delivery companies.

KEMPER GmbH is a German company, based in the town of Stadtlohn in the Münsterland region, which specialises in the manufacture of row independent harvesting headers, and is owned by the American corporation Deere & Company. KEMPER equipment's motto is "strength through continuity" and all of its products are made in Germany on state-of-the-art production lines on a 100,000 m2 site. 

A history of Maschinenfabrik KEMPER GmbH & Co. KG 

The company that is KEMPER today was founded by Wilhelm Kemper in 1908, as an agricultural repair shop and dealership. By 1950, the company was producing its first stable manure spreaders, with its single row maize harvester, known as "The Maize Wolf" following in 1969. In 1984, Maschinenfabrik KEMPER GmbH & Co. Kg announced its four row mounted forage harvester, and two years later its "Champion" row-independent technology for forage harvesting. After a second generation of row independent headers was introduced in 1993, the "Champion" series was updated with the M 6000, featuring eight rows over six metres. A landmark came in 1997, when KEMPER was acquired by the American giant Deere & Company, best known by its brand name John Deere. While KEMPER Maschinenfabrik became part of what is the largest agricultural manufacturer in the world, production and research and development of KEMPER GmbH GmbH & Co. KG products and equipment has remained at the KEMPER Maschinenfabrik Stadtlohn plant. Further refinement of the product portfolio has included a fourth generation of row independent headers, with a nine metre working width. The company remains proud of its German heritage and KEMPER GmbH says its aim is to provide superior quality and innovative solutions to its customers in the global agricultural industry.

KEMPER GmbH Product portfolio 

  • Harvesting headers
  • Tractor-mounted choppers and equipment

The FORD Motor Company is one of the world's biggest vehicle manufacturers and for much of its long history FORD mass-produced a wide range of highly-regarded tractors, many of which are still in use around the world. FORD sold its tractor business to Fiat Agri in 1993, but its heritage lives on in the characteristic blue colour of the New Holland-branded machines. Buying a used FORD tractor can be an optimal venture, FORD is one of the most well known and reliable tractors and vehicle manufactures in the world. When purchasing a second hand tractor from FORD you know you will get a low maintenance, good condition tractor.

Website: ford.com

A history of the FORD Motor Company

Henry Ford launched his first tractor in 1907, branded Fordson, not surprising for a man who had grown up on a farm, and whose wife came from a farming family. Along with so many other innovations in vehicle mass production, the FORD Motor Company is credited with pioneering production of the very first petrol-driven tractor, which FORD called "the automobile plough". From 1917, the Fordson brand name was used on tractors and that brand continued to be used until 1964. The Fordson Model F is regarded as the first affordable tractor ever produced, available for $750. In 1928, the FORD Motor Company transferred tractor production from its headquarters in Dearborn, Michigan to Cork, Ireland and later to Dagenham in the British county of Essex. For a while, Ford tractors were produced in what was then Leningrad in the former Soviet Union. When, in 1964, the Fordson brand was abandoned, the tractors were branded simply as Fords, in both the United Kingdom and in the United States. In 1986, the FORD Motor Company bought out the agricultural manufacturer Sperry-New Holland to form Ford-New Holland, which in turn later bought out Versatile tractors. In the 1990s, FORD sold its entire tractor division to Fiat, and a few years later Fiat, abiding by the terms of the sale agreement, removed all FORD badging and now the tractors, while retaining the characteristic blue FORD colour, are sold under the New Holland brand.

Some of FORD Products 

  • Tractors
  • Passenger cars
  • Vans
  • Pick-ups

The Swedish firm NEDERMAN are world experts in air filtration and other forms of workplace protection. They manufacture a wide variety of filters, extractors and pumps that work to protect workers and the environment from industrial pollutants.

Website: nederman.com

Providing Environmental Cleaning Technology Since 1944

NEDERMAN Holding AB are world leaders in a range of environmental technologies. Their areas of expertise include air filtration, waste management, dust extraction and cleaning products, and the firm supplies customers across the world, with subsidiaries in 30 countries. NEDERMAN was founded by Philip Nederman in Sweden in 1944, and capitalized on the growing demand for air purification and filtration mechanisms in the country's industrial sector after World War Two. The firm expanded still further in 2010 by acquiring Dantherm Filtration, creating a global corporation with wide expertise in environmental services. NEDERMAN has benefited from the rising awareness of environmental issues and the need to ensure that employees and the public are protected from pollutants. It has succeeded by implementing a program for each client which stretches from research and planning the needs of customers to implementation, commissioning, training and then long-term maintenance. With this all-in-one service, the company seeks to ensure that clients enjoy the full benefit from NEDERMAN Exhuast equipment and creates the maximum environmental benefit. The company operates manufacturing facilities in North America, Sweden, Germany, Denmark, the UK, Poland, Thailand, India, China and Brazil, and has a presence on every continent. Nederman partners with clients in a wide range of industries, from  agriculture through to minerals processing, smelting and food production. It also operates a comprehensive spare parts provisioning service for existing companies.

The NEDERMAN Product Portfolio

NEDERMAN manufactures the following range of products:

  • Baghouse dust collectors 
  • Central vacuum systems 
  • Cyclone dust collectors 
  • Exhaust extractors
  • Heat exchangers 
  • Cleaning products
  • Lubrication equipment 
  • Portable industrial vacuum cleaners 
  • Dustless blasting equipment

NEDERMAN collaborates with its business customers from many different areas of the economy. Its air filtration products can be found in mining operations, mineral processing facilities, food manufacturers and even crematoriums. Any workplace where airborne pollutants are a risk would be a suitable customer.

Since its foundation in the 1930s, German firm ZARGES GmbH has become known for its sturdy, convenient and light-weight aluminium products, which extend from ladders to multi-purpose trolleys.

A famous name across the world in the aluminium sector

ZARGES is a Bavaria-based company which specializes in the manufacture of aluminium products. The firm was founded in Stuttgart in 1933 by Walther Zarges, with production focusing on lightweight aluminium ladders. In 1939, the company moved to a new location in Upper Bavaria, and grew strongly after World War II, when ZARGES GmbH became a partner of the Allied forces, servicing American bombers. But the major growth area in the 1950s was civilian storage, with ZARGES pioneering lightweight aluminium containers (which were found to be particularly useful for mountaineers). The 1970s saw the company exploring new frontiers in automation and IT, raising the productivity of its plants, and its boxes became a common sight in homes and workplaces across Germany. In 1997, ZARGES GmbH merged with the French firm Tubesca to form ZARGESTUBESCA, an aluminium producer with global reach. This also involved expansion into other markets, with a new factory opening in Hungary, and subsidiaries in India and the United States opening in 2008. Since then, the firm has continued to develop its aluminium products, which are used in everyday life by a wide range of customers, from offices to film crews.

The ZARGES product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by ZARGES includes:

  • Aluminium ladders and spare parts for ladders
  • Work platforms 
  • Industrial steps 
  • Mobile scaffold towers 
  • Fall arrester systems 
  • Shaft equipment and shaft covers 
  • Storage boxes
  • Hazardous good containers 
  • Multi-purpose trolleys

ZARGES products are used by many various clients from different sectors. Their boxes are a regular sight on film sets, while their trolleys are designed for use in the health care sector. Their ladders are used in manufacturing and construction across the world.

The German firm SCHMIDT are specialists in manufacturing reliable, heavy-duty earth moving and excavating machinery. Its product range includes conveyor belts, gravel processing equipment and excavators.

Earth moving and digging expertise since 1837

H. Aug. SCHMIDT Transportanlagen GmbH Wurzen is a German firm that manufactures heavy equipment for the mining and construction sectors. SCHMIDT was founded in 1837 by Johann Heinrich Schmidt, who designed innovative new forms of bucket elevators for mills around the town of Wurzen. The early twentieth century saw the firm diversify into other product areas, such as conveyor belts, aerial ropeways, incline lifts and storage basins, as SCHMIDT became an established presence across the European continent. The company provided the equipment needed to excavate numerous municipal sewer systems in first half of the century, and developed new dredging systems for waterways. Since then, SCHMIDT has consolidated a position as one of the world's leading manufacturers of infrastructure equipment, helping to deliver large-scale public and private projects where excavation and the transport of waste materials is required. The areas in which SCHMIDT specializes are rubber belt conveyors, gravel processing, and chain and bucket excavators that are specially constructed to be used when digging from water. These excavators are also used extensively in open cast mining operations, as well the quarrying of rocks and materials like sand. SCHMIDT has a constant focus on innovation and safety, as shown in its range of gravel processors, which include advanced features such as circular vibratory screens and centrifugal hydroseparators. This is also seen in its conveyor belt products, which can be custom built in stationary and mobile forms.

The SCHMIDT product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by SCHMIDT includes:

  • Rubber belt conveyors
  • Gravel processing machinery 
  • Bucket ladder excavators


SCHMIDT works with partners in many sectors. However, the major areas are infrastructure projects such as road building or landscaping as well as the maintenance of waterways or ports. It also has a strong presence in the mining and quarrying sectors.

RHEWA is a German company with a long history of producing and developing weighing equipment for industry at its plant in Mettmann near Düsseldorf. RHEWA says its products are conceived to offer many years of service and that its systems for weighing are used in industrial engineering, as well as the chemical, food, logistics and metal fabrication industries.

A history of RHEWA Waagenfabrik August Freudewald GmbH & Co.

RHEWA Waagenfabrik August Freudewald GmbH & Co. KG can trace its history back to 1856 when Carl-August Freudewald established a factory for the production of  balancing machines. After the First World War, already renamed RHEWA Waagenfabrik, the company began to produce sliding scales to weigh coal and cattle among others. Still family-owned, as reconstruction began after World War II, the company began to expand further, with another generation of the Freudewald family, Karl-August in charge from 1957. There was rapid progress and in 1978, RHEWA introduced its first electronic indicator, and followed up with its first verifiable indicator in 1985, as the electronic scale market grew. Yet another Freudewald generation took charge in 2001, and RHEWA continues to produce its state-of-the-art systems for weighing, using the latest electronics in every machine that leaves the factory. RHEWA's research and development division is experimenting with innovations to ensure that, combined with hi-tech production methods, this long-established German company remains at the head of its field.

Product Portfolio

  • Indicators 
  • Large displays 
  • Weighing platforms 
  • Complete scales 
  • Counting scales 
  • Hand pallet trucks
  • Weights load cells 
  • Explosion protection

The German firm HEESEMANN manufactures sanding machines to process wood, metals, stone and veneer products. The company focuses closely on innovation and efficiency, consistently applying new technology to sanding machinery.

Website: heesemann.com

Manufacturing advanced sanding machines since 1933

Karl HEESEMANN Maschinenfabrik GmbH & Co. KG are experts in manufacturing sanding machines for the edges, surfaces and profiles of materials. The company was founded by Karl HEESEMANN in 1933 when he was just 24 years old. HEESEMANN saw that there was a need for efficient belt sanding machines, but he had to wait until the late 1940s before market conditions made his designs a success. In 1951, the firm made a major leap forwards in sanding technology with is BN1 model, which was the first of its type to allow the sanding of lacquered surfaces. Advanced profile sanders followed in the 1950s, as well as automatic long-belt sanders and double belt sanders - all of which sparked a rush of exports as wood-working firms outside Germany started to realize the quality of HEESEMANN machinery. The 1960s witnessed further innovation, with the introduction of cross-sanding machines with both vertical and horizontal sanding belts, which was followed in 1972 by an electronically controlled, precision sanding centre.

Pushing forward with innovation, and delivering precision sanding

The firm continued to push the boundaries of sanding technology, achieving levels of tolerance that had not been seen before - all the time trying to increase energy efficiency as well. By 1987, HEESEMANN Maschinenfabrik had introduced a pressure beam that was electromagnetically regulated, to automatically adjust to the size of the piece being processed, while the 90s found the company redesigning its machining centres and creating ways of dealing with irregularly shaped pieces. Since 2000, the firm has continued to research new sanding technologies, bringing to market advanced laser detection methods and highly-efficient water-cooled servomotors. With this kind of innovation, HEESEMANN continues to deliver precision sanding services and easy to use, efficient machining centres for customers located across the world.

The HEESEMANN product portfolio

The range of products manufactured by HEESEMANN Maschinenfabrik includes:

  • Surface sanding machines
  • Edge sanding machines
  • 3D processing machines
  • Metal sanding machines
  • Specialist sanding machinery for concave and convex surfaces
  • Automatic sanding machining centres
  • Dust removing machines

HEESEMANN machinery, and particularly HEESEMANN sander, is used by firms that require precise materials processing. Primary clients include wood-working firms such as furniture manufacturers, but the firm also works with stone-masonry companies such as kitchen installers, as well as those who require veneer and metal sanding services.

The German Firm HERKULES is a manufacturer of heavy machining equipment, including grinders, mills and lathes, supplying clients in the metal-working and paper industries.

Manufacturing milling equipment since 1911

HERKULES Group manufactures metal-working machinery such as rolling mills, grinders and lathes. The firm was founded in 1911 by Franz Thoma near the German town of Siegen. Maschinenfabrik HERKULES immediately starting growing, quickly building a state of the art manufacturing facility. However, the firm expanded most quickly in the post-World War Two world, as the high quality workmanship demonstrated by Maschinenfabrik HERKULES became respected around the manufacturing world. By the 1980s, the company had started to purchases strategic businesses in the United States, acquiring firms with advanced control technologies within their portfolios and allowing the machinery manufactured by HERKULES to become the most advanced in its field. Along with expansion in America, the company has also opened subsidiaries in the Chinese cities of Beijing and Shanghai, as well as Tokyo, Singapore, Moscow and the Brazilian city of Vitoria.

Keeping service as close to customers as possible and updating installations

HERKULES GmbH has developed a successful philosophy which focuses on being able to provide all-encompassing solutions for the materials processing needs of clients. With its range of milling, grinding and cutting machines, HERKULES can help manufacturers to build "green field" facilities from scratch, installing the latest machining centres to ensure that their production lines are as efficient as possible. These installations are backed up by an emphasis on keeping service as close to the customer as possible. Maschinenfabrik HERKULES therefore runs a network of technical support staff who can source spare parts rapidly and provide on-site diagnosis of problems that arise with the firm's machinery. They also allow the firm to install the newest models of its drives and control systems, which they recommend should be changed every 10 to 15 years. The firm also provides specialist training for users of their machinery, making sure that all installations are used effectively.

The HERKULES product portfolio

The range of machinery manufactured by HERKULES includes:

  • Turning lathes
  • Roll grinders
  • Small, medium and heavy section mills
  • Tube mills
  • Narrow and wide strip mills
  • Plate mills
  • Aluminum foil mills
  • Paper mills
  • Roll inspection systems
  • Roll shop equipment

The machines and tools manufactured by HERKULES are used in many manufacturing settings. The firm's major client area is the steel industry, but it also has partners in the paper industry as well as non ferrous metals processing companies.

MATEC Maschinenbau GmbH is a German company based near Stuttgart which manufactures easy to use and highly adaptable  CNC machining centres for the engineering sector.

A young but successful entrant into the CNC machining market

MATEC is a German firm which manufactures advanced CNC machining centres for use in the engineering sector. Based in the town of Köngen near Stuttgart, MATEC Maschinenbau was founded in 1992 by engineer Erich Unger, who had noticed a need for user-friendly machining equipment and knew how to manufacture what customers desired. Since that point, the firm has grown to employ over 150 people at its manufacturing facility, where it produces  machining centres that are precisely geared towards the requirements of each client. A partnership with parent company BFW Ltd has also provided MATEC with full access to international markets, and clients from across the world have imported the firm's equipment in recent years. MATEC GmbH has managed to balance creativity with customer satisfaction by using a modular approach to production.

Using modular technology to allow customers to order exactly what they want

By designing its machines in modules, the company can work with clients to build exactly the right equipment for their engineering challenges. Whether they require a 5-axis lathe or rotary and swivel tables, MATEC technicians can design the right machine for their manufacturing needs. The firm is based in Germany, but is active across the world, with sales and technical support staff in the United States, Europe and Asia, as well as a dedicated team of software specialists. By focusing on software, MATEC Maschinenbau has been able to make its machining centres more user-friendly and easy to customize than those of its competitors. The firm also works closely with clients to train technicians in how to maintain their machines and use their software systems, ensuring a smooth operating experience when the machining centres have been installed. Along with new machines, MATEC GmbH also offers a "modernization" service for older devices, and will assist in retro-fitting machines with the latest technology, saving money and resources for the client.

MATEC Products

The range of machines manufactured by MATEC includes:

  • Travelling column series (HV and HVU)
  • Gantry machines
  • Swivel table machining centres
  • MATEC CNC machines
  • Retro-fitted second hand machines from older product lines

The machining centres manufactured by MATEC Maschinenbau GmbH are used in a variety of engineering contexts. Customers have included aviation companies, train builders and automobile manufacturers, but could include construction companies and electronics firms as well.

Italian company LORENZ is one of the world's leading installers of palletization systems, including conveyor belts and sorting and stacking mechanisms. The firm has a strong focus on innovation, including automation and the use of robots to improve efficiency.

Providing palletization solutions across the world, from an Italian base

The materials handling firm LORENZ PAN AG are world-leading experts in the installation and operation of palletization technologies for factories and warehouses. The firm was founded in the Italian town of Bolzano in 1982, since when it has worked on over 1,000 different palletization installations across the world while remaining a family run organization that is rooted in its home community. LORENZ has expanded since its founding, now running manufacturing plants in Bolzano, Laives and Gröden in the South Tirol region, as well as factories in Slovakia and the Austrian town of Lienz. Its core range consists of various pieces of equipment which are used in the packaging and transportation of materials.

Applying the latest in modern technology to palletization processes

The firm's palletizers sort and stack the materials to be transported on wooden pallets, while LORENZ's case conveyors link the palletization process up to other production machinery and sort different products before palletization. These basic pieces of machinery are combined with some of the many technical innovations which have made LORENZ market leaders. These include complex monitoring systems which constantly check what is being palletized and the material flows on the conveyor belts to ensure that the firm's installations are working as efficiently as possible. Quality checking systems also allow firms using LORENZ's products to ensure that their own products pass the required standards, while the installation as a whole will have been optimized to ensure that any goods are packaged as safely as possible. The company has also pioneered the use of automation systems in all of its installations, including sophisticated palletization robots to make production and distribution lines more efficient than ever.

The LORENZ product portfolio

The range of palletization products manufactured by LORENZ includes:

  • EuroPal49 palletizers
  • Compact palletizers
  • M5 and M6 layer palletizers
  • Palletization robots
  • Pallet wrapping machines
  • Specialist palletizers for freezing conditions
  • Conveyors and case handling systems
  • Pallet handling systems
  • Empty-pallet checking units

The products manufactured by LORENZ are used by industrial organizations and retailers that need to package and transport fragile materials safely and conveniently. They are suited to factories where products need to be sorted and packaged, and where quality control is a requirement.

The firm MAST EXPLORER is a leading manufacturer of forklift vehicles for indoor and outdoor applications. The firm's vehicles can be adapted for extreme weather conditions, as well as indoor materials handling challenges.

Manufacturing high quality forklift vehicles since the early 1980s

MAST EXPLORER is a Spanish and Canadian manufacturer of industrial forklift vehicles for warehouse and outdoor applications. The firm's vehicles are manufactured by Mecano Continental, which is based in Spain, and their rugged forklifts have been produced since the company was formed in 1984. MAST EXPLORER began by specializing in manufacturing vehicles for the construction sector, but quickly realized that its forklifts would have applications well beyond the building site. The firm started to produce popular models that were specifically tailored to materials handling tasks within factory and warehouse environments, and then the rights to these reliable trucks were purchased by Mecano in 1998.

Offering custom-built forklift set-ups to meet customer needs

MAST EXPLORER trucks are renowned within industry for their durability and strength, and the firm applies stringent quality control measures to ensure that all of its trucks meet these standards. The firm also invests constantly in research and development, updating the vehicles that it produces so that they correspond to the latest technology available. Another speciality of MAST EXPLORER is their focus on leasing forklift vehicles. This makes it easier for construction or industrial clients to secure the vehicles that they need, whenever they need them, without needing to invest in costly equipment. The company has also developed a wide range of accessories that can customize their vehicles, such as on-board air conditioning units and heaters (which are especially useful in the firm's Canadian heartland). Their cabins can be fully enclosed to protect operators from tough conditions, making them appropriate for outdoor challenges in the roughest weather.

The MAST EXPLORER product portfolio

The range of vehicles manufactured by MAST EXPLORER includes:

  • DL series of rough terrain forklifts
  • Micro all terrain forklifts
  • Compact all terrain forklifts
  • Medium, high and heavy-size forklifts
  • Mega forklifts of up to 4.2 metres in length
  • High end DSI forklifts
  • Spare parts and accessories for all MAST EXPLORER forklifts

The vehicles manufactured by MAST EXPLORER are used in both indoor and outdoor environments where materials handling is a priority. This could include construction, infrastructure maintenance, land management and gardening, but could also include warehousing and factory operations.

The Chinese firm LIUGONG manufactures a range of heavy vehicles that are used in mining, agriculture, factories and construction projects. Starting in 1950s China, the company is now a worldwide machinery distributor.

Website: liugong.com

Market leaders in wheel loaders and other heavy industrial vehicles

Guangxi LIUGONG Machinery Co. Ltd is a Chinese company which manufactures mining and heavy construction equipment. Founded in 1958, the firm started out manufacturing bulldozers but swiftly added wheel loaders to its range in 1966. During the late 1960s and 70s, LIUGONG rose to prominence as one of China's leading manufacturers of earth moving vehicles, helping to construct urban renewal and industrial projects across the country and manufacturing every larger variants on its excavators, bulldozers and wheel loaders. The firm added another product area in the 1990s, when it moved into road construction with its range of rollers, and opened a modern forklift truck manufacturing facility in 2002.

Expanding overseas and adding new models to the LIUGONG Construction Machinery range

LIUGONG continued to add international clients to its domestic customers, and by 2006, the firm had sold more than 20,000 wheel loaders across the world, a testimony to their strength and reliability. This placed LIUGONG at twentieth in the world-rankings of heavy machinery manufacturers, but gave the firm a strong position in the global market for wheel loaders, where one in eight new vehicles is manufactured by the company. With a growing international client-base, the firm has also opened manufacturing facilities across the world, with 24 factories which employ over 12,000 skilled technicians and 1,000 engineers. This skill base has also allowed the firm to continually innovate, adding new vehicle models and improving LIUGONG China specifications every year. Additionally, the company has developed a broad distribution and support network, with 320 dealers across the world in 130 countries as well as divisions of the company in Europe, Asia, Latin America, North America, the Middle East and Africa.

LIUGONG Machinery Portfolio

The range of heavy machinery manufactured by LIUGONG China includes:

  • Wheel loaders
  • Excavators
  • Heavy rollers
  • Motor graders
  • Bulldozers
  • Backhoe loaders
  • Truck cranes
  • Skid steer loaders
  • Forklifts
  • Concrete mixing trucks
  • Mining trucks
  • Spare parts for LIUGONG vehicles

LIUGONG 's products are used in a number of fields, from mining to construction. Their forklifts are used widely in warehouses and factories, while their heavy rollers and motor graders are suitable for road-building applications. The firm's vehicles have also been successfully used in agricultural settings.

The German firm MAN SE manufactures engines and vehicles, with a focus on trucks and buses. The firm also makes specialist engines for power plants and reactors, as well as a range of maritime and space-related products.

A world-wide vehicle and engine manufacturer with a long history

MAN SE (Maschinenfabrik Augsburg-Nürnberg) is a multinational firm which manufactures engines and vehicles such as heavy haulage trucks and boats, as well as equipment for use in industrial applications such as power plants. The company traces its origins to the foundation of an ironworking plant in the Ruhr Valley in 1758, and it started out producing metal components for projects such as horse-drawn railways. Steam engine manufacturing followed in the 1810s, and locomotives from the 1840s, as the firm opened up manufacturing plants in Nuremberg and Augsburg. During the later half of the 19th century, the firm expanded into manufacturing printing presses, refrigerators, bridges and diesel engines, as the industrial revolution moved forward at a rapid pace. MAN moved with the times, introducing innovations such as steam turbines in the 1900s and truck manufacturing after 1915.

Supplying everything from cruise liners to space rockets

By 1950, MAN was a globally known diesel engine and truck manufacturer, but the firm never specialized totally in vehicles, developing new reactor technologies for the energy sector and participating in the European space project as well. The 1980s saw the firm focus on making their diesel engines as efficient as possible, and the company carried out high profile projects such as the delivery of diesel engines to the Queen Elizabeth II cruise liner. Innovation continued elsewhere though, as MAN introduced articulated buses with continuous flat floors and the world's first ten-stage gear compressor in 1997. In 2000, MAN hit a milestone as its one-millionth vehicle left the production facility, and the firm's buses continued to win industry awards on a regular basis. Despite its long history, MAN continued to be on the cutting edge of vehicle design, seeking to introduce a new generation of trucks and buses in 2010. It also underwent organizational changes without losing its corporate character, with the Volkswagen Group taking majority control of MAN in 2012.

The MAN SE product portfolio

The range of vehicles and industrial products manufactured by MAN SE includes:

  • Heavy haulage trucks
  • On-road and off-road engines
  • Marine engines
  • Buses
  • Diesel engines for power plants
  • Compressors and expanders
  • Tubular reactor systems
  • Turbochargers

MAN SE's trucks are widely used by haulage companies and retailers, while their buses are a popular choice with municipal organizations. Their power and energy products are used in electricity generation facilities (both conventional and nuclear) while their engines are also used in maritime applications and the space sector.

MAWERA Kessel & Maschinen GmbH manufacture advanced renewable heating and electricity generation systems. Their speciality is the installation of energy efficiency biomass combustion systems for industry and domestic applications.

A leading manufacture of renewable heating systems

MAWERA Kessel & Maschinen GmbH is a German and Austrian company which specializes in manufacturing advanced heating systems for industrial and domestic applications. Founded in 1975, the company started out in the Austrian town of Wels and made a huge breakthrough by designing the world's first wood heating system that could be precisely controlled via a microprocessor. With this success, the company moved its operations to the German town of Lindau, and expanded into Eastern Europe in 1990 with the establishment of a manufacturing centre in Zwickau. During the 1990s, MAWERA was a leading installer of heating systems for renewable energy generation using techniques such as biomass, making sales across Europe, from the Czech Republic to the United Kingdom.

Innovating to improve energy efficiency and make production as clean as possible

The firm continually sought to introduce more efficient combustion systems, including trigeneration systems for the processing of waste wood. As companies and governments around Europe began to install more sustainable energy generation systems, they often turned to the technicians at MAWERA who by the 2000s had become experts in manufacturing combined heat and power and wood combustion heating and electricity generation systems. At the same time, the company has devised new ways of reducing harmful emissions such as Nitrogen Oxide from its burning systems, and has constantly worked to make their combustion chambers more energy efficient, part of the firm's deep commitment to sustainability. The company has been one of the first to offer energy generation from a wide range of biofuels, such as bark chippings, residual wood from manufacturing, wood pellets and sawdust. This has helped to build a loyal customer base of more than 5,000 organizations around the world who have installed MAWERA heating solutions.

MAWERA Kessel & Maschinen GmbH Product Portfolio

The range of heating products manufactured by MAWERA includes:

  • Combined heat and power combustion systems
  • Containerised domestic heating systems
  • Double grate underfeed heating systems
  • Flat moving grate systems
  • Low nitrogen oxide adapted heating systems

The heating technology developed by MAWERA is used by both private and public sector clients in industry and domestic contexts. The combined heat and power plants constructed by the firm provide renewable energy to homes and businesses in municipalities while containerised systems can power factories and home as well.

The German firm WAGNER Maschinen manufactures machining equipment which includes saws, grinders, lathes, presses and drills. Its products are primarily aimed at firms that require precision  metalworking.

Manufacturing machining equipment since 1966

Maschinen-WAGNER Werkzeugmaschinen GmbH is a German manufacturer of industrial machining equipment, including saws, turning centres, presses,  milling machinery and grinders. The firm was founded in 1966, and immediately began investing in staff skills as a key element of the firm's operations. The company has also been one of the most dynamic in its field at introducing "eco-dynamic" machinery. This means manufacturing industrial equipment that is as energy efficient as possible, as well as using the highest quality electrical components that the firm can source.

Providing all-in-one CNC machining solutions that are efficient and safe

Nowadays, WAGNER Maschinen operates a Europe-wide network of support staff and distributors and manufactures a wide range of machining products. These include products from the Trennjaeger company, which became a subsidiary of WAGNER, bringing a range of high quality sawing centres designed for precision metal-working in industrial applications. The company also manufactures advanced CNC machining centres which incorporate a high degree of digital control technology. With WAGNER's CNC centres, technicians can easily control all aspects of the production process, maintaining a constant cutting speed and keeping all materials on course with induction hardened bed guideways. Materials can be positioned precisely using a digital console, while a full range of features makes WAGNER's CNC machinery some of the safest on the market. Another feature of the firm's vertical and horizontal machining centres is the ability to easily switch between different tools, ensuring that they can be fully adapted to the needs of all industrial clients.

WAGNER Maschinen Product Portfolio

The range of manufacturing equipment offered by Maschinen WAGNER includes:

  • Zyklen CNC lathes
  • Inclined-bed CNC lathes
  • CNC machining centres
  • CNC milling machines
  • CNC grinding machines
  • Bench and column drilling machines
  • Presses
  • Trennjaeger Circular saws
  • Trennjaeger Band saws

The machine manufactured by WAGNER Maschinen are intended for use in the manufacturing sector, where clients need to be able to precisely drill, grind and cut metal for use in their assembly projects. Clients could include vehicle manufacturers, the energy sector or housebuilders.

Based in Germany, STAHLWILLE manufactures special purpose tools for use in the aerospace, transport, trade and energy industries.

Website: stahlwille.com

STAHLWILLE  Work Shop Tools

The company has been in existence since the mid-nineteenth century and has a long-standing reputation for producing tools of the highest quality. Founded in 1862 by Eduard Wille, STAHLWILLE initially manufactured forged steel tools. As the twentieth century dawned, the company product portfolio was already quite extensive, including specialist tools for engineering, metalworking and ship building.

Employing approximately 600 people, STAHLWILLE now boasts three separate production facilities, all based in Germany. Through an extensive network of wholly-owned subsidiaries, the STAHLWILLE GROUP exports its range of hand and special purpose tools to more than 90 countries around the world. Over the years, STAHLWILLE has fostered close relationships with leading research centres and universities from around the world, giving the company a unique insight into advanced machining technologies and production processes.

In 1990, STAHLWILLE became one of the first companies anywhere to receive EN ISO 9002 accreditation. Two years later, the STAHLWILLE Quality Assurance System was certified as DIN EN ISO 9001.

STAHLWILLE Tools Product Portfolio

STAHLWILLE manufactures specialist tools and provides innovative solutions for firms which operate within the aerospace, transport and industrial sectors. The extensive product portfolio includes among others:

  • Torque tools
  • Pipe cutters
  • Pullers
  • Screwdrivers
  • Spanners
  • Tool cabinets
  • Specialist automotive tools

All of the products within the STAHLWILLE range are manufactured exclusively in one of the three production plants based in Germany. The company places great emphasis on environmentally-friendly production processes, utilising raw materials that have been sourced locally.

The German based company GRIMME Landmaschinenfabrik GmbH & Co. KG specialises in automated potato, beet and vegetable harvesters. It has evolved from a small blacksmith shop to a multinational business and leading world manufacturer in crop technology.

GRIMME Grows From Strength To Strength 

The Grimme family, from Damme in Lower Saxony, have been involved in the manufacturing of automated machinery for harvesting root crops since 1936, after many years in the blacksmith forging trade. By 1939 they had produced 1600 harvesting machines but due to WWII production did not commence again till the early 1950s with the single row Universal potato harvester and a potato digger. Grimme continued to develop their machinery and increase sales, by the mid 60s they were employing about 150 workers. With the production of hydrostatically driven two-row self-propelled harvesters sales spread across Europe.

Today GRIMME GmbH remains located in West Germany where they are now the largest employers in the area, with over 2000 employees worldwide and are a world leader in their sector. Their employees and subsidiaries are spread across the globe where local dealers sell the harvesting machines to over 120 countries such as China, Russia, USA, UK, Ireland and Poland. Their extensive range now includes more than 150 different types of agricultural machinery: including foldable potato planters, rotary hillers, potato separators, carrot harvesters and beetbeaters. Through their international network GRIMME are able to supply top quality GRIMME original parts and servicing 24/7 to all locations by highly trained engineers and service teams. The company clearly state that their goal is to maximise technical and economic solutions for its customers and to maintain a global presence as a leader in their industry.

Summary Of GRIMME's Production Portfolio 

The accompanying list highlights some of GRIMME's diverse range of harvesting and agricultural machinery:

  • Model DR 1500 goes to market
  • LK 650 potato harvester produced
  • 1st digitally controlled machinery
  • Storage and laying machinery
  • Flagship Tectron 415 produced
  • 1st beet harvester Maxtron 620

GRIMME also manufacture separating machines, soil cultivators, destoners, toppers and a harvester range for many different vegetables, from cabbages and celery to spring onions and fennel.

History Of The Triumphant MORBIDELLI Brand 

MORBIDELLI was a motorcycle company whose bikes had many victories in world racing championships, mainly in the 1970s. The company's principle factory in Italy has now been converted into an impressive museum displaying an historically important collection of motorcycles from around the world.

The MORBIDELLI Vision and Worldwide Success 

From humble beginnings the founder of the MORBIDELLI brand, Giancarlo Morbidelli, strived to develop his small woodworking machinery factory located in Pesaro, on the east coast of Italy. With Giancarlo's hard work and entrepreneurship MORBIDELLI SCM grew into a successful business. At its height the company employed more than 300 staff. However Giancarlo's true passion was the world of motorcycle racing, with the success of his business he put his resources into building high-spec racing motorcycles. By the end of the 1960s his team were ready to compete in the Grand Prix 50cc races at the Italian championships. MORBIDELLI applied his technical and industrial knowledge to the construction of their motorbikes to great effect. Wins on the 1970s international racing circuit established the MORBIDELLI brand worldwide as an innovative and highly desirable motorcycle producer. In 1976 Giancarlo collaborated with Benelli Armi to set up a new factory to manufacture racing bikes for the wider market: they had previously only been available to the MORBIDELLI racing team drivers. The MORBIDELLI racing team continued to win many races including 4 world championships.

Early in the 1990s Giancarlo decided to sell his thriving woodworking business and concentrate solely on developing a specialised 850cc sport touring motorcycle with an eight-cylinder engine. The resulting V8 had a retail price tag of US$60, 000, entering the 2001 Guinness Book of Records as the world's most expensive motorbike. It was a triumph of cutting-edge design and extraordinary engineering, and is now a collectors bike as so few were made.

In 1999, the MORBIDELLI factory was fitted out to house Giancarlo's collection of 350 motorcycles from rare antique 1906 Moto Reves to a Ducati 851 Superbike and the famous V8. It is a fascinating museum dedicating to preserving the glorious heritage of motorcycles from around the globe and is a sheer delight for motorcyclist enthusiasts of all ages.

MORBIDELLI Machines

  • Motorcycles
  • CNC Working Centres
  • Dowel Drilling Machine
  • Continuous Drilling Machine

EKM Elektro - und Küchen-Markt GmbH is one of the leading German enterprises regarding innovative solutions in the industrial sector. For many clients from a great variety of industries, from machine engineering to small components and final assembly, this company is the perfect business partner.

A young company on the market

The EKM is a relatively young company in this industry. It was established as "EKM Maschinenbau GmbH" by the brothers Klesatschke in 1982 and just four years later they had already purchased a plant in Gerabronn, Baden-Württemberg. Another plot area and an assembling hall were added to the site of that first plant leading to wet painting possibilities from that moment on. Eleven years after that, another assembling hall was built that finally allowed for a powder coating plant. To successfully address the needs and demands of clients from all possible sectors of the industry, the company introduced the new millennium with an additional line of business in sheet shaping. Its success confirms the path of this family enterprise and at the same time it creates manifold ways for further development.

The company philosophy of EKM Elektro - und Küchen-Markt GmbH

EKM made it its business to develop specific and ideal solutions for the sophisticated ideas of its clients. Aside from experience and expertise, the company distinguishes itself with its honest and personal dealings with all business partners. The machine park is equipped with state-of-the-art brands allowing for an exceptional real net output ratio. All employees contribute to the manufacturing process with high precision work according to the developed solutions and detailed standards and targets. At the same time the employees have a consultative function. Meticulous quality management is at the heart of EKM.

A well-rounded service portfolio

EKM is able to provide an exceptional portfolio and its services include the following segments:

  • CNC technology
  • Surface technology
  • Machines for the shaping of sheet
  • Final assembly

The company is specialized in the processing of aluminum, steel, stainless steel as well as synthetic material. Powder coatings as well as classic varnishes are done directly on-site at the company. To provide high-quality anodization or zinc coating, EKM works with long-term partners. EKM does not only deal with the construction of machines and small components, it furthermore also provides for the final assembly and electrical installations.

HOKUBEMA Maschinenbau GmbH manufactures technical precision parts and components for various industries and craft trade sectors. The shape, dimension and design of these precision parts and components are customized to the individual wishes of the respective client.

HOKUBEMA and PANHANS – Machine engineering with a long tradition

For more than 50 years already, the brand PANHANS has been representing the strong German machine engineering industry. Its success is based on involved employees, experienced designers and a well-trained service team as well as the fact that only high-quality materials are used for all PANHANS products. With many internationally recognized innovations, it has been possible for the company to set a high standard in the manufacture of woodworking machines. The enterprise HOKUBEMA continues this extraordinary tradition with its own production.

Drilling machines, Band saws, Panel saws, Spindle moulders with tilting spindle, Planing machines.

Well prepared, fast and precise

Ahead of manufacture, HOKUBEMA experts from a great variety of fields are involved in the process in order to ensure the target-oriented and economic employment of machines. They analyze the required designs for the different components and deal with all necessary details regarding the manufacture. The company places great emphasis on the collection and processing of important data as provided by the respective clients. One of the mainstays of flexibility at HOKUBEMA is the company-owned tool shop, where tools, appliances, models, special components and precision elements are being manufactured. This not only provides for the best compatibility between different machines, but ensures also the adherence to schedules and deadlines.

The manufacture of components at the HOKUBEMA Maschinenbau GmbH

The following machines are employed at HOKUBEMA for the manufacture of different components:

  • CNC lathes
  • CNC machining centers
  • Planing machines
  • Gang drilling machines and radial drilling machines
  • Face grinding machine and cylindrical grinders
  • Balancing machine
  • Key seating machines

CNC-controlled measuring machines ensure the quality management. The particular final surface shape of the individual components depends on the wishes and needs of the client and the respective field of their application. HOKUBEMA offers comprehensive services for their final products, from coating and finishing to chromium plating and zinc-coating.

KÄRCHER is a leading name in modern high-tech cleaning solutions for home and professional use, and is famous for its range of pressure washers. The company has diversified into drainage and water supply solutions, and its trademark bright yellow livery is recognised all over the world.

Making cleaning a profitable concern

German innovator and entrepreneur Alfred Kärcher founded the company that bears his name in 1935 in Stuttgart-Bad Cannstatt, Germany. His plan was to develop his own products, and the inventor patented a hardening and tempering method, the 'Kärcher salt bath furnace' for use in the industrial metal and engineering sector. However, his real breakthrough was to come in 1950, when he developed his first pressure washer, the DS350 hot water steam blaster - the first of its kind in Europe. His innovative water heating technology was so advanced for its time that it is still used as the basic format for KÄRCHER steam cleaners today.

The company progresses to the international market

Today, KÄRCHER is run by the second generation of the family and is known all over the world for industrial and home cleaning products that are used in a wide variety of ways. It was in 1962 that KÄRCHER founded its French subsidiary and the move signalled its debut on the international market. Following the opening of its Brazilian plant in 1975, KÄRCHER quickly expanded to become a global concern, and is represented in 57 countries today. KÄRCHER also has 40,000 services centres in more than 190 countries and continues to lead the way in creative cleaning solutions that make deep cleaning readily available. The brand continues to excel, and some its creative successes include its unique 'Dirt Blaster' nozzle and the TACT filter cleaning system. Unique projects such as the cleaning and restoration using a blasting process of the 284 travertine columns that line St. Peter's Square in the Italian capital Rome, keep KÄRCHER in the news and ahead of the competition.

Some of the innovative products that KÄRCHER produce include :

  • Steam cleaners
  • Scrubber dryers
  • Wet and dry vacuum cleaners
  • Car washing systems
  • Sweepers

The company FORTE Sägetechnik GmbH is located in Baden-Württemberg and was able to establish itself on the European market for innovative automatic band sawing machines. FORTE is not only represented in many areas and countries, but actively seeks the immediate proximity of clients at different trade fairs.

The corporate history of FORTE Sägetechnik GmbH

Today, FORTE Sägetechnik GmbH is active all over Europe, but it is rooted in the year 1950 when a machine factory was founded. Over the years, FORTE GmbH recognized the need for an innovative band sawing technology, and hence began a pronounced specialization process. Metal in its different variations was at the center of attention in all developments. The company emphasizes research and development, and that leads to the emergence of premium machines as well as coherent and holistic solutions and concepts. Another focus is the customer service and FORTE addresses this aspect of its business with its outstanding spare parts supply. All of this contributed over the years to the secure establishment of FORTE as a specialist for automatic band sawing machines in the metal working industry. The company has locations in Italy, Switzerland, the Netherlands, Denmark, Sweden, Great Britain, Czech Republic and France.

Service focus

With the dual column band saws, FORTE GmbH implements its own high standards for innovation, quality and reliability. Extremely precise adherence to production tolerance and the application of high-quality materials contribute to the exceptional quality standards of machines that require little maintenance. The development of adequate concepts and holistic and coherent solutions are at the center of the company's attention. Sawing plants that also include cross feed magazines and components for waste management are controlled with the SPS-Siemens-Technology. It is possible to adjust these machines to the particular requirements of individual clients.

FORTE GmbH Products Portfolio

  • Dual column band saws

Entering into the electronics market at the end of World War II, Casio Computer Co., Ltd.was founded by Tadao Kashio, a fabrication engineer from Tokyo, Japan.

History of the company

Casio was founded in 1946 and originally manufactured musical instruments, cameras and mobile phones. This company also produces other products such as watches and by the late 1950s, had produced the world's first electric compact calculator. A large amount of Casio's initial capital came from the profits generated by their first invention, the Yubiwa pipe. Tadao Kashio then went into business with his younger brothers and started to develop the world's first desktop calculators. Armed with a basic working knowledge of electronics, the Casio founder continued to develop innovative products and by the 1980, he was producing a range of synthesisers and keyboards. These musical instruments gained tremendous popularity and their brand of wristwatches were also met with enormous success. In fact, Casio was one of the world's first producers of Quartz watches. Not only was Casio one of the first producers of calculator watches, but this company also broke new grounds by creating wristwatches that could display the time across multiple time zones. Watches fitted with global positioning satellite systems were also a product instigated by this company.

Products accredited to Casio

Over the last 70 years, Casio have established themselves as a global innovator of electronic products and household devices. Some of their most well known inventions are listed below.

  • Model 14-A, world's first electronic compact calculator
  • Release of 001 calculator
  • Casiotron released, watch with automatic calendar
  • Casiotone keyboard released
  • Casio synthesiser CZ101 released
  • Release of F-91W digital watch
  • World's first digital camera, QV-10
  • Release of WQV-1, first wristwatch with built in camera
  • The world's thinnest chronograph is released, less than 1cm thick
  • Casio release the Prizm, a full colour graphing calculator
